Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: wantittofeellikehome
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at this hotel. Centrally located, its perfect for business and recreation. Walking distance to most everything downtown. Downtown Dallas nightlife is active and fun. The hotel has a great view of downtown and I have to mention that parking overnight is perfectly priced. Great place for events too. Some of the same amenities as other hotels only better!

Reviews.Title: “I always come back!”
Reviews.Author: sparklyfeets
Reviews.Content: As always, this hotel delivers. Spent the weekend here with girlfriends for a milestone birthday and had a fabulous time. Awesome rooms, great hospitality, bellboys did a great job packing our vehicle (to the brim) for the ride home. I love you, Magnolia!

Reviews.Title: “The Magnolia is an exceptional bargain considering the extraordinary service and luxuriant surroundings.”
Reviews.Author: JimSAT62
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed warmly from the moment we arrived at the valet stand and were treated with extraordinary service to the end. The staff went out of their way to greet us at every turn during our stay and most even remembered our names. The room was beautifully appointed in a modern deco style. By the way we were surprised with an upgrade at no additional charge. The shuttle service was excellent by way of a luxuriously appointed black Suburban. Thank you Jason! We felt like chauffeured executives as we went to the Jimmy Buffet concert. While we did not have time for happy hour and cookie hour, I thought these were very nice touches. We did stay for a very tasty breakfast the following morning after sleeping in a comfortable and quiet corner room on the 21st floor. Check out was easy and when asked by Jackie at the front desk if there was anything else she can do for me, I jokingly replied, "Can you fold my bill in the shape of an origami pterodactyl?" We laughed and while waiting for our car outside she found us and handed me an origami pterodactyl. I think this event was emblematic of the incredible level of service and care the staff of the Magnolia takes with their guests. We will return again. This is the only place to stay in downtown Dallas in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable parking conditions!”
Reviews.Author: Kevin S
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely with nice and friendly people working there! Lots of restaurants and things to do within walking distance! The parking situation is unacceptable!!! Having to wait thirty minutes every time I wanted my car is very unprofessional...in fact they lost my car and could not find it for over two hours...I was late for my sons wedding!!! Every morning around 3 AM we were woken up to extremely loud noises of metal I-beams being dropped which lasted for about five minutes! The water pipes on our floor rattled when someone showered! One ice and cola machine for the whole building of 26 floors with 330 rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Four Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LilDebra
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel! Everything was perfect, would definitely stay there again! Great breakfast buffet with lots of choices to meet everyone taste. Bed was comfy and everybody was so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service! Friendly and knowledgeable staff.”
Reviews.Author: SweetSkyMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I always like to stay at boutique hotels and thoroughly enjoyed Magnolia. The decor was modern but soothing and relaxing and the rooms were very generous in size. However, the best part was getting to know their knowledgeable and super friendly staff. Daniel greeted us immediately at the front desk and took the time to make us feel welcome. It was clear he and the other female at the desk (wish I could remember her name!!) enjoyed their job and made it a priority to take care of their guests! Despite the bit outdated kitchen/bathroom in the suite we stayed in, everything else was impeccibly maintained and we have found our new favorite hotel in Dallas!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Great views on the upper floors.”
Reviews.Author: Mike t
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. The price was pretty good. Parking was kind of difficult to find and not free anywhere, but what can you expect for downtown Dallas. The staff was nice. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Celebrating 13yrs of Marriage on Friday The 13th!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelBrn37
Reviews.Content: As I pulled up to the Valet we were greeted with a familiar face and a smile...'Mr. Brown good to see you again sir.' The entire Staff of The Magnolia Hotel in Dallas, Tx has always treated my family & friends with kindness and respect. And I have'nt even gotten out of my vehicle yet and I already feel like a celebraty. We were helped with our bags and proceeded to the front desk to check in. Once I walk up with I.D. and CC in hand I have already been recognized and greeted again with smiles and well wishes.-(Side Note - I just recently underwent a Total Hip Replacement and The Magnolia Hotel were kind enough to allow my family members stay with My Wife As I Underwent the procedure, for a reasonable rate.) I get a few winks and 'Congratulations' from the staff because they all know we are here to celebrate our 13th Wedding Anniversary. I sent an Email to Mr. Juan T. Morales with a couple special requests that could help me make this Anniversary the best! So the entire staff knew already of what was waiting inside our room, but my Lovely Wife did not! I have been to The Magnolia Hotel several times since our 1st visit there in Dec 2009. And EVERY visit I find something greater about the Magnolia I didnt before. This time its the Food Prep Staff. The Pictured you see at the bottom of this review comes from a simple request: 'Mr. Morales, could you help me suprise my wife with a make shift Wedding Cake? Like the cake we had on our wedding day? It had 3 tiers of twinkies, zingers and cup cakes.' Well, to my amazement, his Food Prep Staff went above and beyond this simple request. The service we recieved throughout our 2 day stay at The Magnolia Hotel Dallas,Tx was courteous and kind. Always a helping hand around every corner. And I do believe the atitiude and atmosphere of the staff has rubbed off onto the patrians of the Hotel. Helping hold elevators so no one will be left behind, helping with directions and sitting around the bar or table sharing stories. This hotel makes a person feel comfortable the second he is greeted at Valet or as he walks through the doors. My many experiences here have been a bit mixed because of my job and persona but if I need to stay in Dallas over night, I will always stay at The Magnolia Hotel because its simply the best.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Dallas Magnolia was excellent! We will definitely stay there again :)”
Reviews.Author: nealmeFWT
Reviews.Content: My 2 daughters and I stayed their for 3 days and two nights - Apr 13-15 for the Lone Star Volleyball Tournament. The location was great, the complimentary breakfast, late afternoon wine/beer bar, evening milk and cookie were thoroughly enjoyed along with time to releax in their fantastic steamroom; and the staff were so accomodating begining with the valet to the front desk and many other amazing personnel on staff. Magnolia is certainly the place to stay when in Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was clean, staff extemely pleasant and our room was spacious!!!”
Reviews.Author: Susan S
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time, the hotel was fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facility run by amateurs.”
Reviews.Author: WTA48
Reviews.Content: Gave us keys to the wrong room - it was occupied and we could have stolen everything in there. The AC was stuck on high and it took too long to get it fixed, the breakfast was cold, the tables were dirty, etc. You get the idea, just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: vahanning
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 days for a conference. Loved the downtown location and the complimentary breakfast, wine, and cookie buffet. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best place to stay when in Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: London K
Reviews.Content: The staff there is amazing! From the night receptionist to the valet, everyone works with a smile on their face. Wonderful spa and steamroom!

Reviews.Title: “The Magnolia is a lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MindyK07076
Reviews.Content: I was in Dallas for business and chose the Magnolia because it was close to my destination. I was pleasantly surprised to find a delightful historic building with great amenities and a charming staff. I liked that the room had a mini fridge to keep my snacks cold, free wifi for working in the evenings and a good breakfast buffet. The bathroom was nicely appointed, the bed was comfortable and the staff was very helpful. I have only two suggestions to improve my next stay: while the room was restful, it was a bit dark, due to the dark brown walls, and the minimal amount of lighting fixtures. I would prefer a little lighter wall color and more lamps. Additionally, I had room service two evenings, and while my choices were delicious, I didn't have a large selection from which to chose. I would have liked a turkey club, or another lighter sandwich or dinner size salad. That said, I definitely will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Claire B
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Magnolia. After learning that I had just come off a long flight from Australia the girl at the front desk upgraded me to a suite and gave me a ton of information, maps etc. in fact all the staff I encountered were really helpful and friendly. They also have a shuttle which will take you anywhere within 3 miles for no cost, and come and pick you up when you call. Great service for those of us without a car. The room itself was lovely, although perhaps a little bit dark, but the bed was so comfortable, even more so than my bed at home!

Reviews.Title: “The bed was small and uncomfortable .Valet service great.”
Reviews.Author: Lori G
Reviews.Content: The bed was small, listed it as a queen but was a full size bed. The night stands were old and water damaged.I had really thought it would have been better for the kind of upscale hotel it is. The Valet staff were the best. Shuttled us to and from were we needed to go. Still charged us but it was way cheaper than the Taxi service. Loved the location.Could not seem to get the air conditioner to cool the room very well. Wish the staff would have offered us a upgrade. Not sure if I will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the heart of Dallas”
Reviews.Author: birdiedeb
Reviews.Content: The people of The Magnolia make this place a great place to stay. From Valet parking to Front Dest extremely helpful and oh so friendly. Beds are great. Suites are huge and very comfy. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “When in Dallas, stay here”
Reviews.Author: herzartwork
Reviews.Content: A very welcoming, comfortable place to be. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: King615
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Magnolia for 4 days in April. The hotel is in a great location - convenient walking distance to the Dallas Convention Center and several restaurants/bars within just a few blocks. Staff was friendly and went out of their way to ensure a great stay. My room on the 7th floor faced Commerce Street and since the bus stop is right across the street there was a lot of street noise. However, colleagues staying on higher floors didn't have that problem. The hair dryer in my room had a short in it and was difficult to use and the cabinet door on the bathroom vanity was loose on its hinges - very minor things that could be easily fixed and were not too much of a distraction. Best aspects of this hotel are its location and the staff - both are great. The Magnolia's staff truly understands the meaning of Southern hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of perks for staying at The Magnolia Dallas”
Reviews.Author: cjb11711
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Magnolia Hotel Dallas for 2 nights in March 2012. I travel frequently for business and as such, I often prefer to stay at one of the big chain hotels for the rewards points. That said, upon returning to Dallas, I would be happy to stay at The Magnolia Hotel again. The hotel is in a great neighborhood with lots of restaurants and shops, including things like a 7-11 and a CVS if you need any last minute essentials. The hotel has a nice free breakfast buffet and it offers milk and cookies at bedtime. I think it also had a complimentary evening happy hour, but I did not participate in that. There are a few other things I really liked about the hotel. The service was absolutely fantastic and every employee I encountered was super friendly. Everyone was warm and smiling and that can really go a long way when you are far from home. Another thing I Ioved was the free shuttle. The hotel has a complimentary shuttle service that will take you anywhere within a 3 mile radius of the hotel. They will even pick you up when you are finished. I took full advantage of that shuttle and made trips to a local movie theater and Target. Another thing that is worth mentioning about the hotel is the sheets. So many hotels have sheets that make a lot of noise when you are moving around at night and the sheets on the bed were so soft and quiet. That may seem like a silly thing to mention, but it really makes for a better night of sleep. I was upgraded to a suite and my room was nicely appointed. I read some of the other reviews of the hotel and I agree that the rooms were a bit on the dark side, but that was a not a big deal to me. Overall, a great stay, particularly for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - excellent restaurants just steps away”
Reviews.Author: Amy S
Reviews.Content: Excellent downtown location...loved the extra perks of continental breakfast, evening beer/wine and cookies/milk! There is also an excellent running path about two miles from the hotel. They will shuttle you there and you can run for miles! Gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Our recent trip to the Big D.”
Reviews.Author: Joanne Q
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with the staff, service, food, location, and amenities. All for an excellent price. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice, nothing fantastic. The milk and cookies were great.”
Reviews.Author: h s
Reviews.Content: Nice atmosphere, with average amenities. The complimentary wine was cheap, but the overall feel was classy.

Reviews.Title: “Great rating is well-deserved - awesome service and immaculate room!”
Reviews.Author: tjtravels37
Reviews.Content: Would definitely stay again. In great location convenient to downtown restaurants and shopping. Excellent services and perfectly clean room with trendy, updated decor and a great view from our 21st floor room. We did not use the valet parking. We had parked in public parking several blocks away to visit the Texas School book Depository, and found it was close enough to walk from there. Several blocks......but close enough for us not to hassle with moving.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Joseph M
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 days at the Magnolia in Dallas. It was close to everything I needed to get to. The amenities, the staff, the overall sense of welcome was great. I would definitiely recommend this hotel to friends going to Dallas. I travel all over the country for my job and this hotel had the friendliest, most helpful staff I have ever experienced. Also, I am giving high fives to their valet service. It was the best I have ever worked with. All in all, an excellent hotel and I highly recommend it to anyone going to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic soaking tub in the roomy shower”
Reviews.Author: Rhamack
Reviews.Content: Well appointed hotel in an historic building. The location is walking distance to some great restaurants and the free shuttle will take you anywhere you want to go in a 3 mile radius. Staff was friendly and helpful. The roomy shower with a large bathtub was a welcomed extra. Ask for a high floor number if music from the bar on the corner would bother you. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Lora H
Reviews.Content: Everything was great, the only downside was no pool and the sauna was very small.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Tiz56
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while attending an event at the Dallas performing arts center. Great location. Lots of activity. Staff was great and eager to accommodate all their guests. Cozy room, great views.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, the important things done well”
Reviews.Author: nielsmarston
Reviews.Content: We had a most lovely stay here, the rooms were more than adequate and the beds were very comfortable. The complimentary breakfast was a bit lackluster with no real healthy meals other than whole fruit, the rest was heavily carbohydrate or bain Marie based but if you were here for location and rooms then it's great. The staff were also really friendly and attentive. Would definitely return and think back most favorably.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Britishcats
Reviews.Content: In mid-March 2012 my husband needed to attend a convention in downtown Dallas. Rather than stay in the convention hotel we elected to stay at The Magnolia. This turned out to be a good decision. The Magnolia occupies the original building of what was known as Magnolia Oil that later became Mobil Oil so the old building is historic and has some quirks. The staff is what makes the Magnolia special--from the front desk to the housekeepers to the maintenance people, everyone goes out of their way to make a guest feel welcome. There were some plumbing problems with our room the first night we checked in and by 10:00 p.m. that same evening, we had been moved to a suite for the rest of our stay. Every afternoon the hotel offers free wine and beer to guests and then at 8:00 every evening, there is a cookies and milk bar as well. The free hotel shuttle service is a great perk and my husband used it every day twice a day to get from The Magnolia to his convention site. Plus this hotel is about 50 steps from the front door of the original downtown Dallas Neiman Marcus. Nice hotel and good location. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun night in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: RobandStephanie
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel. The suites are nice. Location was a big factor for us. Even though we live just 30 miles away this was a fun quick trip for a night out on the town. This hotel is located near some of the best night life in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Uptown, very nice”
Reviews.Author: Dana M
Reviews.Content: Nice view, stayed on 16th floor. Very accommodating staff, and the shuttle was a great plus! Stayed for 2 days to attend Ron White show at the Majestic Theatre. Great location if you like to visit restaurants, shops, and bars in downtown Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for downtown Dallas - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: JAS20016
Reviews.Content: For less than $200/night, this is a great deal for Dallas... not the trendiest area, but super close to Uptown and the Design District. The king bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom had plenty of room, including a stand-up shower and a separate whirlpool tub with shower head. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience!”
Reviews.Author: JCB_NRH
Reviews.Content: Celebrated 2nd anniversary. Emailed in advance requesting high floor- they upgraded us to a Signature Suite. Fantastic room - clean and very large with a great view Kevin (front desk) was friendly and professional - recommended Iron Cactus next door - great food and drinks! We WILL be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Great location”
Reviews.Author: Rogers_Mom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a 5 day mini vacation after a business trip in north Dallas. Aside from the fact that I found the rooms dark (it's just their decor), everything else was great about this hotel. They have a shuttle that will take you all around town to events and restaurants and pick you up when you're finished, which is free and fast. I was impressed with this service! They also have a great breakfast, which they call a "continental", but includes a lot more than a regular continental - hot items like eggs with cheese, biscuits, sausages, bacon and pancakes. Then there are the regular continental items, bagels, bread and buns that you can toast, as well as yogurt and fresh fruit. Coffee, juice, etc. Very good and always replenished quickly. Then there is the free wine and beer "happy hour" every day at 5pm until 6pm, and the free cookies and milk every evening from 8pm until 10pm. The staff at the desk were awesome about making dinner reservations, and booking tours for us. There was nothing that we asked them to do that they had any problem doing. What's not to like about this hotel? It's also walking distance to just about everything, so during the day we saw plenty just by walking around. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. Kudos go out to Daniel and Sandra!

Reviews.Title: “Parents' Night Out”
Reviews.Author: 081311trip
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed overnight at the Magnolia. We had tickets to a concert in Deep Ellum, and enjoyed the free shuttle service to and from the venue. This historic hotel is beautiful, and the staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Yes, the elevators are slow, but they are part of the original building. Travelers who read the hotel's website thoroughly, know what to expect. The complimentary beer and wine at the evening reception was a welcome treat after a busy day and hectic drive to the hotel. The rooms can be dark, depending on the location of the room. If you want a room with more light, choose one on the exterior of the building so the windows are not blocked by the other side of the building.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: le8751
Reviews.Content: I thought the Magnolia was lovely, especially the wine after a long day! Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business meeting”
Reviews.Author: saragirl5515
Reviews.Content: Our company held a 2 day seminar at this location. The staff were great, from the initial planning of the event to the day of the event. The hotel was beautiful and accomodating. The meeting space was nice, and break foods were perfect. Very pleased with our business experience at the Magnolia. Only thing to mention is the hotel is on an extremely busy street, however there were alot of places for our attendees to eat close to the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: AllySM
Reviews.Content: We went to the US on our honeymoon and Dallas was our first stop. The room was beautiful with great views, the staff were very helpful (they spent ages trying to help us get our phone working so we could dial Australia), the chauffers were very friendly and great for a chat. Breakfast was good. Location was great for Dallas attractions, either by walk or in the free shuttle (always good to tip though). Chris Brown, his entourage and his tour bus were even staying there when we were!

Reviews.Title: “Last time for us”
Reviews.Author: zboyz
Reviews.Content: For the first time in all my travels I had to wait nearly 4 hours for our suite to be ready. So around 730PM we get in our room and miss our 7PM dinner reservations. Not a good deal all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “Great 50th celebration!”
Reviews.Author: jnelston
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure to find such a gem in our backyard.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown Dallas hotel!”
Reviews.Author: inkydoodle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the magnolia for a wedding. I was really impressed with the historical significance of the hotel. It has preserved the uniqueness of the era but is a modern hotel with all updated technology. Very friendly and helpful staff. Over the top hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Snoopydahut
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location. Breathtaking views of downtown Dallas. Well worth the price of the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Came to town on Business”
Reviews.Author: Kim1839
Reviews.Content: Hotel very nice. Elevator was a little slow. Everyone I came in contact with had a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Hockey Night”
Reviews.Author: mgrannan
Reviews.Content: Our stay was outstanding. The hotel staff are top notch. We always stay at the Magnolia when we are in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and they did it with a smile.”
Reviews.Author: mamadowning
Reviews.Content: I was there on businesses and very homesick yet the friendly staff and beauty of the hotel made it all better.

Reviews.Title: “Dallas business trip”
Reviews.Author: Mohammed S
Reviews.Content: Awsome job by the hotel! Food was good. Breakfast was a+.stuff was super friendly .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Mary R
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel for a great price! Everyone was super SUPER friendly. The room and bathroom were absolutely gorgeous...with one downside: Not enough lighting in the room itself. With two adult women and two teenage girls sharing a room, we needed more than just the bathroom to get all fixed up to go out, and the lighting in the room made that almost impossible. But that was our only complaint and we worked around it! Will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scott A
Reviews.Content: Wonderful visit. Hotel was fantastic, from the helpful front desk staff. to the comfy room, to the milk & cookies in the evening! All at a great rate compared to the other downtown hotels!! We traveled to Dallas via Amtrak, so no car, but hotel was close to all local transportation options (bus, DART light rail & TRE). We'll definitely be at this hotel the next time we visit Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Truly outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: markeymark69
Reviews.Content: I decided to try out the Magnolia Hotel in downtown Dallas for last minute trip...and it was by far the best decision I have made in a long time. From the moment I pulled up til they pulled my car up, I had nothing but A+ service. The front desk was so cordial, business-like yet so down to Earth and personable. My suite was more like an apt than a suite. I highly recommend the signature suite! The beds were very comfy and the decore was very tastefully done. They also have good and reasonably priced room service that was incredibly fast. Next time in Dallas, I will be staying at the Magnolia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: millsgo
Reviews.Content: Everyone was very friendly and helpful. The cocktail hour was fun and the food for breakfast and dinner was great. Location is good and with police constantly patrolling downtown, we felt fairly safe. The rooms are a little rundown with cracked walls and water damaged shower. It took forever for our air conditioner to cool the room. I think the cost of parking is unreasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Beds!”
Reviews.Author: MyChrisEmily
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business trip. The beds were the most comfortable I've ever slept in! Reception was nice and friendly. Gave us tips and map on where to go with the kids! Would stay here again if I'm ever in the area. Valet was a little pricey but they do offer complimentary shuttle service to the local areas. Well worth it especially because you have to pay to park everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Review.”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Very nice lobby and pretty nice rooms (although the bathroom floor tile in our room was very cracked and in need of replacement). The complimentary breakfast and evening cocktail hour are also very nice touches. The automobile valet service and the VERY old and slow elevators, however, need LOTS of improvement. There were very long waits for automobiles to be delivered and getting on an elevator during the morning check-out period was extremely difficult. We would probably not stay at this hotel again if the valet service and the elevators were not greatly improved. Pillows on the beds were also very firm and uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding party stayed there and the experience was horrible.”
Reviews.Author: Colleen S
Reviews.Content: The hotel booked too many weddings that weekend which resulted in the hotel's inability to serve the guests. The bar and lounge area were closed to all guests so the family went to the Adolphus to visit, eat and drink. The valet was overwhelmed. It took 30 minutes to park your car and 1 1/2 hours to get your car. We had to hire taxi's to get where we needed to on time. I have stayed at this hotel before, never again.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: Ann B
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, great price, my son's wedding reception was held there and they did a superb job, Thanks to the hotel for such great hospitality and service.

Reviews.Title: “Historic hotel with modern touches...”
Reviews.Author: N C
Reviews.Content: Worked in Dallas for 6 months and stayed here every week. Great price and large suites, located close to everything. Staff is very friendly and helpful, they always accommodated our group with functions. Renovations in lobby made the hotel even more stylish. Old hotel with a great history, but had modern touches.

Reviews.Title: “We stayed 2 nights to attend our annual Ignite convention in the Dallas Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: Krum_TXBecky
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice and very clean. The decor was exceptional. However, the comforters on the bed were stiff and heavy and I would enjoyed it more if they were soft and snuggly after our long day in training. Overall, the staff was very pleasant and accomodating. However, I felt frustrated when I called from the convention center for the shuttle and the person answering was at first speaking to me in spanish and then when I said I could not speak spanish, his English was so accented I still had trouble understanding him. Other than this one time, the valet staff did a great job of getting us back and forth. The breakfast buffet was a great beginning to both our days and the warm cookies and milk a great way to end our days - yummy! This pet friendly downtown hotel had a great dogpark just adjacent to the main entrance area. This helped us so much since our little poodle is elderly and needed to stay with us. We already plan to return!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, services and amenities....Elevator EXTREMELY SLOW!”
Reviews.Author: lheggie
Reviews.Content: Hotel, room, services and amenties were great! We were there for a nationals competition and their elevator system was the slowest I've ever seen. Some guests had waited up to 15 min. Since we were on a timed schedule there were several times we had to hike up/down the stairs (thankfully were only on the 7th floor) but if you were up near 20's this could be quite frustrating. All in all I'd stay again and ask for a lower floor but hoepfully this is something they will fix soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Cookies”
Reviews.Author: cstowe12
Reviews.Content: Great service, decor, location and complimentary breakfast with a perfect end of the day treat - bed time cookies & milk.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value.”
Reviews.Author: Tammy G
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the stay. The hotel is located in downtown Dallas and convenient to our venue. The staff and service was friendly and accommodating as we had a large group and needed transportation. Breakfast was good enough, with enough choices that you can start the day. The room was nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the value”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravelBH
Reviews.Content: Hotel and staff were very nice. Rooms were great except the beds were a bit hard. Service was excellent. Great location downtown. Shuttle service took you anywhere in a 3 mile radius which was excellent for the American Airlines Center as we came for a hockey game.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Beware of what room you get!”
Reviews.Author: EZHawk
Reviews.Content: Staff great, Bar good, Valet good though very expensive (parking is more than the cost of renting the car), Food nice. Our room however was another story. While quiet with good temperature controls and a nice bed. The coffee maker and refrigerator were in the back of the closet behind your clothes (the only place it could go since there was no desk, couch, end tables) very small room. The commode was in an other "closet" so small that it made the one in my motor home looks positively spacious. Bathroom last remodeled in the 50's (I'm being generous - maybe the 20's).

Reviews.Title: “Magnolia Hotel Dallas”
Reviews.Author: chrissy2012
Reviews.Content: The hotel was renovated in 1999 from an office building into a hotel. I enjoy staying in this hotel while in Dallas. The rooms are decorated nicely, the bed is extremely comfortable the bathroom is spacious. The biggest problem with this hotel is the elevators. They are old and they get stuck a lot. They go up when you are going down for no apprearant reason. They cannot accomodate guests when the hotel is near capacity or sold out, hotel guests could wait up to 20 minutes to get a ride.

Reviews.Title: “A Small Hotel with Big Service”
Reviews.Author: Rosiegirls
Reviews.Content: We thought this was a great hotel. The rooms were large with high ceilings . The breakfast, happy hour, and cookies made this hotel very warm and inviting. The customer service was excellent and the shuttle service was a big help with getting around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe the Hype”
Reviews.Author: thenewval
Reviews.Content: I have no idea how this hotel is rated #5 in Dallas. It's a fairly decent hotel, but for the price you expect a lot more. Let's start with the good - Large rooms. Decent toiletries. Helpful front desk staff. Free breakfast, happy hour, and cookies in the evening. Guest services responded to a noise complaint quickly (the hotel was overrun by rambunctious teenage cheerleaders in town for a competition). The not-so good - Elevators are old and very slow. Rooms are very dark with minimal lighting. An empty shampoo bottle was replaced with a half full bottle, clearly a leftover from a different room. There were no towels in the gym and when I asked a staff member, she suggested I grab one from my room. When I declined, she said she'd send housekeeping to the gym with more towels, but this didn't happen within the next 20 minutes while I finished my workout.

Reviews.Title: “The Magnolia Hotel Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Lara S
Reviews.Content: One of my absolute favorite places to stay! Love love love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice weekend”
Reviews.Author: Cole S
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia is in a great location downtown, especially if you are planning to spend most of your time in that area. The valets and shuttle operator were all very courteous and helpful as were the front desk. The queen bed left a little to be desired but the suite was spacious with three closets and a large kitchen / living room area. The bar was not great, but there are plenty of places close by to have a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, especially for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Mstklt123
Reviews.Content: Luxury suite with full kitchen. Cookies and milk in the lounge. Beautiful night time views of downtown Dallas. All for a very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but lacking in some areas”
Reviews.Author: Lance_Hou
Reviews.Content: The check-in desk and valets were friendly. For breakfast, I asked one of the wait staff about more potatoes and he just gave me a puzzled look and walked off. He brought more later but it felt rude. The room seemed clean but was so dark that it was hard to tell. One of the lights in the room didn't work and the lamp looked like it had been knocked over and just put back up. Another lamp was plugged into a socket that was fried and didn't work. The breakfast was good but lacking. Bacon would be great. I wish there was someone cooking omelets for fresh eggs. The coffee at breakfast was terrible. The decaf with the cookies the night before was better. The cookies were excellent and a nice touch. When we arrived, we pulled to the side per valet instructions but no one helped us with our bags. However, another valet was kind enough to run back to our car later that night to retrieve something we needed. We liked the hotel but were disappointed/surprised in some things. We felt like the condition of the room and the overall experience could be much better with just a little more effort.

Reviews.Title: “Disorganized valet, unfriendly bartender, and uncomfortable beds.”
Reviews.Author: Ebony D
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff were phenomenal; however the bartender, valet, and beds could use some work. Great location, pristine decor, and fine dining.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Boutique without being snooty. Great views, cool rooms and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Bryan A
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, Boutique without being snooty. Great views, cool rooms and friendly staff. Room service was priced fair. Breakfast buffet could have used some fruit/healthier items. Great vibe in a wonderfully historic building. Great location for those looking to explore the downtown area. Great access to public transportation and nightlife. Rooms are clean and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: LJKemp
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Dallas. Great atmosphere and a good location! First rate hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, bad internet”
Reviews.Author: jlf0192
Reviews.Content: The hotel, reception, cookies, and work out center were all awesome. The staff was amazing and very friendly. However the wireless internet was terrible so dont plan to do any work in your room

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: adrienne r
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently for 6 nights - loved it! Staff are super friendly and courteous and the hotel is centrally located. The Valet car that is available made life very easy and much safer for a woman travelling alone! Gym is compact and adequate with a super efficient steam room and plenty of towels. I really like it and will definately be back with business. Great job all around. Visit Peter at the Victoria Salon if you need to get your hair done - they are located in the Adolphus Hotel next door. He's great!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved my room”
Reviews.Author: angievileikis
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at the Magnolia. Excellent value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth R
Reviews.Content: My room had an interesting layout with large closets and big windows looking down on an extremely beautiful building next door. The staff was friendly and professional. I would definitely stay there again should I visit Dallas. The original Neiman Marcus is just around the corner and is worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Attended a wedding and reception at the Magnolia Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jim S
Reviews.Content: The people at the front desk were very pleasant and helpful. One of them even called us by name. Nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service and great history in the building. A true treasure in Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: ateam3mom
Reviews.Content: The staff of this hotel make the experience wonderful in every way. The extras with breakfast, happy hour and cookies and milk are wonderful. The value was incredible. The hotel has a lot of charm with history of the building. Be sure to ask the staff for a tour. The rooms were clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in the heart of Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Wendi75001
Reviews.Content: We held our wedding at the Magnolia on 2/11/12 and ultimately booked some rooms for our wedding party and guests. The staff at the hotel went out of their way for our entire room block, and were super friendly. We have to give special props to Perry at the front desk who was super sweet and accommodating the entire stay. Suites come complete with kitchens and all necessary appliances, which are great for lengthy stays to save money as dining out in Dallas can definitely add up. Great location off the DART rail, to get anywhere downtown in a timely manner

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in an unattractive part of Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Irish2002
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with good little features such as an evening cookies reception and a car to drop off guests locally. We were there on business - the location in downtown Dallas was a little off-putting to out-of-towners and we certainly weren't venturing too far from the hotel on foot in the evening. There is a complimentary cocktail hour but we only went once and the barman had such a bad attitude that I am not sure it could be considered a plus for the hotel. Good friendly valet service and rooms nicely appointed. No room safe though which really irks me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingVirgo
Reviews.Content: We had 5 nights at The Magnolia Dallas which is in a central downtown location and fabulous value. We booked a double Queen room and were upgraded to a one bedroom suite which was much appreciated as we were travelling with our teenage son. We had stayed in Magnolia Denver the year before (which we loved) and Magnolia Dallas certainly lived up to expectations. Great service, clean room, helpful concierge, 'value' breakfast....highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice extra touches at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Salsasharp
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and large. Staff was very nice. Loved the free happy hour and milk and cookies in the evenings. Gym was very nice. Only negatives were that the bed comfort was average and the colors were a very drab gray. Otherwise, we had a nice visit.

Reviews.Title: “Sharing memoriable times.”
Reviews.Author: vmoody
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable accommodations, and in a great location. There is shopping and restaurants within walking distance. A great place to get away and unwind.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Overall”
Reviews.Author: Shannon P
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, friendly staff and comfy bed. Would definitely stay here again. Wasn't super pleased with the party that was in the lobby until 2am, but we were on the 26th floor so we couldn't hear anything.

Reviews.Title: “Dallas, TX Best Kept Hotel Secret”
Reviews.Author: mclarry001
Reviews.Content: Thank you so much for the level service I received as I didn't expect to be treated with such style and grace in your sophisticated establishment. We plan to return as we are local Dallas residents. I rented the suite which resembled a large apartment and was stocked with everything you could imagine. All the appliances in the suite were in tip top shape and the ambience was so amazing. From check-in to check-out,the front desk staff, room service, and valet services were a 10 in service. I'm sure to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “If you like ghetto rap music until 2am”
Reviews.Author: JH12345_12
Reviews.Content: This was honestly the worst hotel experience that I have ever had and I can only encourage potential guests to avoid this property. We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in February and everything was ok for the first day; however, when we got home Saturday nights, the hotel had thrown an urban rap party for Mardi Gras which encompassed the entire lobby, lounge, bar and restaurant area on all three floors. The rap music was literally so loud that it hurt your ears to even walk through the lobby and I had to scream at the front desk host to get my room key fixed. I asked him when the party was over and he had to hold up his fingers to tell me 2am because it was too loud at the front desk to even speak. Fellow travelers told me that they could hear every word of the music on the 10th floor until 2am. The irony of the whole thing is that the hotel guest were not going to the party, it was local ghetto warriors that came to invade the hotel by the HUNDREDS. The hotel reportedly made $8,000 by hosting the party, which shows a COMPLETE LACK OF RESPECT FOR ITS GUESTS that it would allow something so disturbing to occur until all hours of the night. Honestly, words cannot describe the scene that was taking place and I have no desire to ever travel to this property again. Why the management would think that it is acceptable to allow this to happen until 2am and keep all of its paying guest awake all night in their rooms is utterly beyond me. I hope that they go out of business, which won't be hard if they keep this stuff going. There were also 6 armed guards in the lobby for the party - generally when this is necessary, you shouldn't be staying at hotel. I am surprised there wasn't a stabbing or shooting given the crowd. As a side note, I am from Atlanta and this was even a shock to me. AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ALL COSTS. We moved to the Marriott city center the next morning which is quite nice and the staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: mgpier95
Reviews.Content: very clean, nice staff and close to the federal bldg down the street. also very close to alot of different resturants. Only complaint is the elevators are so antiquated that I got scared that I would get stuck in them every time I got in them. Never did though.

Reviews.Title: “There are bound to be better choices in downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Austinowl
Reviews.Content: 1 elevator -- 26 floors -- unacceptable. 20 minutes plus for our friends to get their car from valet. Did you hire a funeral director to decorate the room? Rarely does one see such a grouping of tan, brown and olive drab. Perhaps light switches where you could reach them would be a good idea. 14 years of college between us and we couldn't manage just the bedside lamp on. Is only one person allowed to read in bed? The toilet ran on. 1 bartender 40 or so guests. That is a bad formula. There are choices -- there is no reason to choose your property. Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is very friendly; the rooms are very clean andcomfoetable”
Reviews.Author: mGm006
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay. The staff was friendly and helpful. I stayed in a very nice, roomy suite. Ir is a great place to stay for business

Reviews.Title: “Last minute stay at Magnolia in Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: dno1970
Reviews.Content: Valet parking. No other choice. Dallas must think it's San Francisco or NYC. My only complaint.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Lake Saint Louis, Missouri, United States
Reviews.Title: “Magnolia Hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Mary S
Reviews.Content: Overall nice hotel with friendly staff. Love the nightly milk and cookies as well as the happy hour. Only complaint was my room. I was on the forth floor with a view of their airconditioner and roof, the cable on my TV didn't work ... which the promptly fixed, and the blinds on my windows were messed up. I had to spend twenty minutes untangling the cords on them to lower the blinds. Nothing was a big deal but with all the hotels that I can choose from it make a difference when I need to decide where to stay next time I'm in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Had an awesome stay.”
Reviews.Author: lvillanlisa
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a queen sized suite. It was awesome! There was a full sized kitchen and very spacious bathroom. We opted to bypass the valet parking and park down the street in the City Park parking garage which was located about one block away. Cookies in the evening were really fresh and delicious. We didn't get to attend the manager's reception in the evening. It was a great stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: UofIx3
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for a conference. The conference center is about a five to ten minute walk away, so it was very convenient. The staff were always friendly whenever assistance was needed and rarely did you walk by a staff person who didn't look up and say hello. We had a suite that was very nice. It worked well because my wife and I were both participating at the conference, but had very different schedules on some days and were able to get ready to go in the morning without distubring the other one. The suite had a kitchen, including a full-sized fridge, but we didn't use it. Wireless was free in our room which we liked. There were some issues with the signal coming and going, but rarely did the signal completely disappear, it was typically a matter of re-connecting. Hotel had the standard hang-up-the-towel and it won't be washed deal, but I didn't see the same option for the bed sheets and there were no recycling bins in the room or anywhere on the floors, including the lobby. I finally just dropped off the paper and plastic bottles at the registration desk; seems kind of silly in this day and age to not provide recycling options, in the lobby, at the very least. Second floor has a bar and offered free breakfast, but I never used it, so I can't comment on its quality. Did enjoy the free cookies and milk that was offered in the late afternoon/early evenings. The only thing that I specifically remember is how the TVs were such a pain to use. The remotes didn't really work well in either the bedroom or the sitting room. Not surprisngly, the TVs started on the pay-per-view screen, but we often had a bear of a time actually getting past that screen, to watch normal cable television. The default audio level was also ear-splittingly loud. I paid a reasonable conference rate, but would never pay the normal rate noted on the sign on the door. I realize that rate is often the maximum that can be charged, but I can't imagine paying anywhere near that much.

Reviews.Title: “Would not reommend”
Reviews.Author: Marb84
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for four nights and I couldn't wait to get out of it. There was no atmosphere or buzz around the place. The rooms were dark and painted in dull dreary colours and the furnishings had no hint of colour either. I was on a very high floor and you would never see any other guests around the corridors. To be honest it was really creepy and eerie. I also found the receptionists unhelpful. When I asked how to get to the big shopping centre I was told I would have to get a taxi which would be expensive, when in fact two streets over I could get the train for a few dollars that would take me there. I only found out this by accident while chatting to a chauffeur outside the hotel. There isn't much to do in Dallas unless you have a car. On my experience I would not recommend it to anyone the photos are very deceiving.

Reviews.Title: “Room not very clean & elevators are extremely loud.”
Reviews.Author: okc5262
Reviews.Content: The room was average, dark, not very clean, (hair on the bathroom floor), and the housekeeping service was minimal. No extra toilet paper, didn't leave clean drinking glasses, bed not made one day. Yes, the elevator situation is terible! Believe the other reviews. Breakfast was good, valet very friendly & helpful, but the room, well, bleh. Also, my e-mail got hacked while on their free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but really can't recommend to others”
Reviews.Author: Luv2g0lf
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this hotel. To start with some positives, the rates were very reasonable and the location was great, very convenient to the downtown sights including the convention center and Dealey Plaza. Also, the included breakfast was pretty good, usually eggs, pancakes, breakfast meats along with oatmeal, other cereals and breads. The nightly reception was nice as well with two free drinks included. Now for the problems ... Reading other reviews, the hotel evidently has been renovated but it still has a very "tired" look to it. The elevators shook and were very noisy and a few of my colleagues got "trapped" at various times on the elevator trying to navigate to their rooms. The room which was a suite included a full kitchen. However, it was very dark and pretty depressing to come back to at the end of each day. I had almost every light on and it was still quite dark. One of my colleagues commented (and I agreed) that he was definitely ready to check out after staying there a few days. Finally, my room was very noisy as it faced downtown. In fairness, my colleagues did not have this problem so it has to do with where the room is located. Each night I was awakened by either revelers in the streets along with honking horns (cars lined up trying to navigate downtown at 2:00 a.m.) or garbage trucks (I think) banging and clanging very early in the morning. I can say that I would not return to this hotel on my next trip to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in quiet area but a quick taxi ride to the center of town.”
Reviews.Author: bd3Melbourne
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a lovely building and worth exploring. I liked being in a quiet area but still easy to get a taxi and be in the hear of the action in 5 minutes!

Reviews.Title: “I'd pick another hotel”
Reviews.Author: rabble
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the Magnolia Hotel and would never return. The hotel is very old, but they have done a good job in restoring the common areas and to some extent the rooms. However, as everyone in my group complained, the heating system in the rooms is very old and very loud. To the point that when I was making a call from the room someone asked me if I was outside because it sounded like a truck was driving by. Needless to say, if you are staying at the Magnolia during cool weather get a set of ear plugs. There are some positives about the hotel. The breakfast buffet is very good and the hotel staff from the front desk to the valets are all very friendly and helpful (although charging me $50 to check out at 12 instead of 11 is really nickle and diming me). But for me, if I canâ€™t get a good night sleep, Iâ€™d rather stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrFugazy
Reviews.Content: This is a very pleasant hotel which appears to be a converted office building. It is stylishly decorated and there is a very nice feel in the lobby and second floor, where drinks are served in the evenings. Our rooms were good value for the price; breakfast and evening drinks were included in the price. Our room was quite dark, as it was not on the street side of the building but faced an alleyway; our daughter's room facing the street was much brighter. Staff were very friendly and helpful, and the hotel ran a free shuttle service within about three miles around the hotel. All in all, very pleasant and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic architecture, mediocre hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HaveSuitcaseWillTrvl
Reviews.Content: Room 1905 is spacious, but is located next to the elevator machinery, so is noisy ALL the time. The furnishings are modern, in jewel tones, which combined with poor lighting makes the whole hotel dark. The complimentary breakfast is much better than most hotels and always includes hot dishes. The fitness center is small but serviceable. There is also complimentary wi-fi in all rooms. The hotel is near restaurants and a CVS pharmacy, which is convenient. I was attending a conference which is held in Dallas every few years and I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Positive experience here!”
Reviews.Author: Taffeta
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Magnolia for 4 nights recently while attending a professional conference. The first thing I noticed was the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff -- valets, bell staff, front desk staff, everybody. This was one of the most positive experiences I've had with hotel staff in a long time. It was good to know that they had a free shuttle van for rides within 3 miles of the hotel. I used this a few times and had good experiences each time. The room was good -- it was one of their smaller rooms, but was much larger for one person than most rooms have been at conferences I've attended. There were two large beds, and the bathroom was down a short hallway that was within the room... so it felt more spacious because of that. There was not much seating in the room. There was one desk with a chair, and otherwise the only seating was on the beds. The room had a flat screen TV, hooked to cable. But it was not digital cable, so the pictures were not in HD and were very slightly blurry. Still, this didn't bother me very much. Everything worked well in the room, with a couple of exceptions. I see another review saying the blinds didn't work on one window. Mine worked, but they had seen better days and didn't really close completely. But I was on a high enough floor that I was above the roof of the Adolphus Hotel, the very ornate building next door. So nobody could really see into the room, and there was a shade to close over the blind, and that really kept out the light. Speaking of the Adolphus, looking at the upper level of that building out the window was a highlight every morning. It's very ornate, and i was getting a view that not many could see. The one downfall of my room in the Magnolia was the carpeting. It had been cleaned, but it had seen better days. It was stained, but clean. The room as a whole had a dark decor, so that made the lighting seem inadequate. Except for the carpeting, though, I thought the room was overall in good condition. The hotel also has computers where you can print a boarding pass for free (although they charge a steep fee for other uses of the computer). The free breakfast was appreciated. I found the food to be middling to good -- not excellent, but certainly not terrible. And there are a great variety of choices for breakfast. I did like the breakfast sausage links. I would recommend the Magnolia Hotel. It's easy to find -- just look for the red Pegasus on the roof (a landmark of Dallas).

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelChic
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay! Rooms are huge, with big garden tubs! Staff is very accommodating. They have all the little things... you sometimes forget! You can walk to many restaurants and clubs. The room service is outstanding! And for those that come in, past late room service hours... The desk has the number for Pandas chinese! A life saver!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel Accomadations”
Reviews.Author: William G
Reviews.Content: Helpful expierenced staff that were cordial in all aspects of their jobs. Excellent rooms that were comfortable and well lighted. Great selection at breakfast. Just a few short minutes from Love Field.

Reviews.Title: “Not nearly as nice as expected”
Reviews.Author: E M
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia was a perfectly so-so hotel experience, so I was surprised by how much other reviewers raved about it. There is a cool fireplace/lounge on the 2nd floor that we loved, and our room was quiet and sunny. Our room was spacious and had a nice view, but most of the blinds didn't work properly, and one set of them did not open at all. The bathroom was lovely, but had TONS of cobwebs in the window. I was given incorrect information by the front desk when asking if their on-site Starbucks was open (they said no, I trekked out for coffee, upon coming back I noticed that their Starbucks was in fact open). The guys in valet were quick to offer strong recommendations for lunch, and when we returned after checking one out to get our car and go elsewhere, he made jokes about how indecisive women are. Apparently because we didn't like his recommendation. Lastly, we requested non-down pillows. They turned out to be absolutely unusable they were so giantic and uncomfortable. We asked for different non-down pillows the next night, which were exactly as huge and uncomfortable. Our last night we accepted defeat and just slept pillow-free.

Reviews.Title: “Back in Time”
Reviews.Author: Linda R
Reviews.Content: From the hardwood floors to the wardrobe for your clothes, the elgance of a time gone by is recaptured in the Magnolia Hotel in Dallas. I always look for unique local hotels when travelling and the Magnolia did not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Terri1129
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in uptown, so it was a bit out of my comfort zone that I decided to stay downtown for my friend's birthday weekend. I was not disappointed! The Magnolia was reasonably priced (through Expedia) and our room was clean and comfortable. The beds, linens and towels were soft and comfortable. They have a car service that will take you within a 3 mile radius, so getting to uptown was no problem. The bonus was the fun restaurants and dance clubs downtown that I had never discovered. These were within walking distance. Another bonus is the complimentary breakfast. This is not your ordinary breakfast, there was a large buffet set up on the 2nd floor with hot and cold items, as well as a made to order omelette station for an extra $6.95. The breakfast area is cozy, has a fireplace and pool table, and overlooks the awesome downtown architecture. Stay here next time you do Big D! You won't be disappointed! We weren't.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Dorrie533
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Magnolia Hotel in downtown Dallas in early January. We found the staff very friendly and accomodating. Good value for the money. The only downside was no formal restaurant on the premises, but there were several good restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort at a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ariana283
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, clean and very comfortable rooms. The staff was very friendly and willing to go above and beyond. The shuttle service that is complimentary within 3 miles left quite a bit to be desired, with the drivers not knowledgable about the area they served nor very fast moving. If you are taking a shuttle, be prepared to wait and know how to get where you are going. Otherwise, the hotel was really great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in downtown Dallas - and much less expensive then our usual stay - The W. Way more benefits too!!”
Reviews.Author: Nrowder
Reviews.Content: We stay in Dallas 2-3 weekends a year to go to Mavericks games. We usually stay at the W because it is so convenient. This year we tried the Magnolia after reading the great reviews. I have to say, it was much less expensive, was just as nice, and we got much more for our money. They have free breakfast which is really good (no "continental breakfast bs"), free happy hour from 5:30-6:30, and free cookies in the evening. I saved about $200 by staying here and not at the W, and thats not counting breakfast savings. I recommend the Magnolia, we will probably stay there many more times in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: klnoreen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Magnolia several times and will stay again when in the area. The staff are consistently pleasant and helpful. The beds and pillows are very comfortable and my room was extremely dark and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: myyaya
Reviews.Content: The rooms here were very clean, the bath was bigger than the usual and the curtains kept the room quite dark. Our room was on the 21st floor but we could still hear traffic and nearby construction. The hotel has a free shuttle which will take you anywhere in a three mile radius and pick you up which is great but certainly expect to wait about 10-15 minutes for the shuttle to become available and do not expect to be picked up on time. The check in staff were very chirpy and insisted we should ask for anything we needed but when we attempted to get dinner we were ignored for 15 minutes, so we left opting for room service instead. We were told our room service wait would be 25 minutes but had to call after 45 minutes only to be told our wait was another hour! An 18% gratuity is automatically charged. We requested a late check out but were told it would cost $50. Breakfast was free but quite average and apparent there are free cookies but we didn't attend for that.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: lubdo
Reviews.Content: I spent the weekend there at a friends wedding. The staff is pleasant and very helpful, with every question we had about the area restaurants and sites. A very accommadating hotel. We were able to decorate the 2nd floor where the reception was, and all the staff were helpful, the reception was beautiful, food was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “In town for wedding and reception!”
Reviews.Author: Buzz F
Reviews.Content: Everything was good and some great, was just puzzled by some of the employees and their unfriendly demeanor. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “1 night tsay”
Reviews.Author: gorgeousFortWorthTx
Reviews.Content: service was average for the cost. Valet parking was expensive. did not know about the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a downtown retreat!”
Reviews.Author: Staylor25
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect, hotel is classy and beautiful, service is great, rooms are spacious and clean, and the lobby is comfortable. The reception is a plus. The cookies at bedtime were delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Convention”
Reviews.Author: Karen K
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend attending a conference at the Convention Center. The Magnolia is only a few blocks a way, and complimentary shuttle (nice, leather-heated seat SUV) transported us to and from the Convention. All of the staff were wide awake and friendly to greet us at 6:45 am and take us directly to Conference. Check-In was easy, Bar/Lounge was contemporary and inviting and everyone was friendly and helpful. Room was a bit noisy, as it is in the West End, Dallas. Bright lights from Reunion Tower and other Mid-Rises- but window coverings are sufficient. Comfortable beds, not great, but good, and clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELCHICK48
Reviews.Content: We were only in the hotel for less than 24 hours on our way back the UK from Mexico. What can I say? We enjoyed everything this hotel had to offer. Glass of wine before we went out for the evening, cookie and a coffee when we returned. Delicious and plentiful breakfast. We even had a ride over to the West Village area in the morning. We were told we could ring for a lift back to the hotel, but this wasn't necessary. We rode the free trolley bus back to Dallas Museum of Art, had a quick look at the Museum and coffee in their outdoor cafe, and then walked the short distance maybe ten blocks back to the hotel. We were extended every courtesy at this hotel including a late check out. Rooms were comfortable, free wi-fi worked well. All the staff we encountered were helpful polite and seemed willing to please despite there being a conference on so the hotel was very busy. We saw all the JFK related sites which are just a short walk away from the hotel and grabbed a few bargains in Neiman Marcus. Perfect 24 hours in a lovely city. I would definitely come again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ShareTheWorld
Reviews.Content: Friendly and knowledgeable staff. Very clean hotel with lots to offer. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: texasbordelon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with some girlfriends and we had a fantastic weekend. The wait to check in was nonexistent, the valet service was prompt, the breakfast was outstanding (love the crunchy bacon!) and the room was comfortable. The hotel is in a great location: walking distance to Neiman Marcus, and right next to a neat plaza that was filled with Christmas lights. There was also a great Mexican food place next door that has out-of-this-world margaritas! This is by far my favorite place to stay in Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth it. Best value in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: ergibbs
Reviews.Content: Vey helpful staff, wonderful rooms, right in the heart of downtown & close to many nice restaurants. 2 thumbs up

Reviews.Title: “AVOID AT ALL COSTS”
Reviews.Author: m0handas
Reviews.Content: Reserved Suite months in advance ,no Beds was given Rollaway Bed, Restaurant had ONE repeat ONE waiter, meal took >2.5 hours. ONLY one elevator was Functional. Guests from the 23rd floor had to use the stairs going down. Another guest a ( Lady) her shower did not work. Bills were wrong ( Extra Charges ) that were contested & Removed for Several Guests. This was a Trip to DSC convention. SEVERAL guests had the same unplesant Experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: originalsix
Reviews.Content: Bonus! We were able to use a TripAdvisor $20 food/drink coupon for the Magnolia to offset the $25 valet parking fee. The rooms are well sized, and the shower has enough room to swing a dead cat. A couple of the elevators were out of use, so waiting for one elevator was a bit lengthy as everyone was checking out on Sunday, as was the wait for the valet to retrieve cars. However, with free breakfast (french toast, potatoes, cereal, oatmeal, coffee, juice) , no complaints here. A Starbucks is conveniently located next door, and there is free Wifi in the rooms. Location is great, only about a mile from the American Airlines Center to see a Stars or Mavs game. Valet was very pleasant, even with the rush. We will likely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - great location.”
Reviews.Author: Kathie S
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay. Especially enjoy the included breakfast, cocktail hour, and evening cookies. Within easy walking distance to convention center and restaurants. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Safari Club visit”
Reviews.Author: jemmert
Reviews.Content: Excellent value and service. Comfort and service always tops

Reviews.Title: “Great staff...Tara!, old and dated hotel, great decor, awesome food.”
Reviews.Author: bubblesrn07
Reviews.Content: The building from outside looked promising. Walking in, the decor was beautiful. I was very optimistic. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. Then, things starting going sour when we got on the elevator. It was very old. It started shaking when we were inside. I wasnt even sure if were going to make it to the 26th floor. When we got to our floor, the carpet was dirty. There was an unsettling smell. We got to our room and the decor, furniture needs updating. Half the bathroom was updated the other half was dated. I liked the soaking tub. That is were i took showers. It's actually pretty nice. The floor is textured so dont slip. Its clean. I couldnt really sleep at night because of the funny smell in the room. We ordered room service. The tenderloin steak, mushrooms, roasted potatoes are excellent! The free breakfast in the morning is also wonderful. The food does make up for the room. The front desk staff, Tara is FANTASTIC! She went above and beyond to help get the things i need throughout the day to make my stay more comfortable. Housekeeping is wonderful is well. Parking is right across the street. Read the sign before you park. It closes and you cant get your car out when it closes. Better to valet your car.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shuttle is excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Yaivon35
Reviews.Content: Stayed for my birthday spa weekend and had a great time. The shuttle conveniently transported us to dinner and the spa. Our only issue was that I did not get the room I booked. It was embarrassing having 6 ladies I a suite with two beds and having roll sways brought in. Management was apologetic but could do nothing else to resolve the issue. We ended up cancelling the 2nd night.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown location”
Reviews.Author: ZomB1
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for one night but found the service to be very good and our room was wonderful. It was very large with a high ceiling adding to the spaciousness. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: LongTallTechsan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I love the Magnolia. The downtown location is handy, the rooms are well maintained and up to date, and the service is impeccable. With the free breakfast (not a continental cereal breakfast, but a real breakfast), a free drink at happy hour, and free milk and warm cookies you can't beat it for value. We have stayed at most of the nice hotels in Dallas and have picked the Magnolia as our favorite. Recommended highly.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: reid41999
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia Hotel in Dallas is a great hotel. Ideally located downtown, great character and excellent service. Loved the nightly milk and cookies. Room was very comfortable with excellent pillows. I usually find the pillows in hotels way too soft, but at the Magnolia they were just right. The breakfast buffet was excellent, great selection of breakfast items. Really enjoyed my stay at the Magnolia and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Trip for Bowl Game”
Reviews.Author: Jonesy027
Reviews.Content: I went to the Magnolia for the TicketCity Bowl and had excellent service. All were professional and he valet service was excellent. The only thing I was unaware of there was their exercise room.

Reviews.Title: “Retro cool”
Reviews.Author: Rlines
Reviews.Content: Very interesting hotel. Rooms are very nice. Tall ceilings. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bronwyn a
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic hotel and the ideal downtown location. The hotel was family friendly and the staff were just brilliant. The hotel has a shuttle that will transport you anywhere within a 3 - 4 mile radius - ideal for visiting American Airlines Centre, downtown restaurants and historic sites including JFK. The hotel however is well situated to walk to most downtown sites and venues. The happy hour and cookie treats in the evening are a very nice touch. The breakfast was good and we had dinner there one night and the meals were very nice. The room was clean and tidy and well presented and the hotel generally very neat and tidy. The front of house staff were so friendly and helpful. The hotel rate was extremely good considering the location and services offered. We were visiting Dallas from Australia and would stay here again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Most Comfortable Hotel I've Ever Stayed In.”
Reviews.Author: YankeeLovinTexan
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia is a beautiful hotel with lots of extras that makes it the most pleasant hotel I've ever stayed with in the US. The bed and pillows are amazing. The staff is quick, friendly, and eager to serve. The complimentary breakfast is extensive and delicious. There is also a free cocktail happy hour and complimentary cookies and milk before bedtime. The rooms are spacious and modern. I highly recommend the Magnolia. Other members of our group stayed with the Adolphus, and wished they booked us at the Magnolia.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Cheer4wp
Reviews.Content: This hotel had very friendly and knowledgeable staff, clean and comfortable rooms and a wonderful breakfast buffet. Make sure to call for reservations becuase I was able to get a better deal than anything I found online.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderfully refurbished historic hotel in the heart of downtown at a good price. Take the option to self-park.”
Reviews.Author: hut153
Reviews.Content: A wonderfully refurbished historic hotel in the heart of downtown at a good price. But take the option to self-park.

Reviews.Title: “The room was fantastic and the location was even better.”
Reviews.Author: Danny S
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. It is one of the best locations you can ask for in downtown dallas. It is walking distance to everything....They even have a free shuttle that takes you anywhere within three miles. They have all the bases covered and the suite was even better. This thing had a full kitchen and full size fridge.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: CtelleNash
Reviews.Content: This place seemed bigger (lobby ,etc.) in the pictures than it really is. I liked the different style but when you take away the experience of not staying at a cookie cutter hotel, this place is just ok. The staff is very nice and accommodating, however a few other things overshadow this place. For the evening reception the bartender was very rude. He would not acknowledge that we were standing there and wouldn't look at us when we did ask questions. There were only 3 drink choices for the reception (2 of them wine) and the beer (which is what we all got) was warm. We then went to ask the bartender if there was a full restaurant and he asked, "Where?" - as if he didn't know - and when I said "in this building I guess" he said "yeah we have menus right over here" (I don't understand why he asked me where when he already knew). The waitress was very nice, however, and even wished us a good night when we abandoned our drinks and decided not to order from the restaurant there. We didn't go to the cookies and milk (but I heard they ran out of cups) and breakfast was just OK and items ran out very fast with the number of guests there and we'd have to wait to get more. Finally, the elevators need updating (some of them work funny) and most importantly they are loud if you get a room where you can hear them going up and down all night. Also, our room was right above the common area outside the hotel, and although we were on the 9th floor there was one very loud group out there in the middle of the night, and later there was another "incident" where 3 guys were screaming at each other for at least 30 minutes. I was very curious as to why the hotel did not call an officer or otherwise stop that madness from disturbing guests as I'm sure if I heard them from inside my room on the 9th floor, someone else had to too. I also turned on our heat but didn't notice it working at all, and another guest in our party didn't have any of the $3.00 bottled water in his room to consume and when he called the desk they were apparently out and couldn't restock (and the vending machines only had soda). At any rate, there were obviously good things and bad things about this hotel. However, (aside from the bartender) staff was again nice and willing to help if you came to them. The shuttle service and valet are also good. I'm just not sure if the lack of little details that you expect, or the noise and poor value of our reception experience will make me feel comfortable enough to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Bossy432
Reviews.Content: Great stay! Wonderful room, friendly staff, great receptions, hint feel, fabulous experience!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Janice Z
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel...third stay in less than a year. The front desk staff is friendly and our room was perfect. Love the free breakfast and cocktail hour. The hotel is close to many downtown attractions and offers a free shuttle within 3 miles. Love the history and architecture of the building!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: globetrekr
Reviews.Content: The people at the front desk were really friendly. I had asked if my room had a view of the city. The desk clerk didn't know if my room did but a few minutes after I entered my room, I got a call from the front desk saying there's a better, bigger room on a higher floor with a great view!
