Talk about great service! The elevators are old and rattle a bit but that's part of the charm of staying at an older hotel. They're not exactly fast so if you're staying on the higher floors, it takes a tad faster to make it down to the first floor. The rooms are a bit dark. Many lamps are in the room but even after turning on all the lamps, the room could be brighter. My one complaint are about the pillows. They're lumpy and aren't soft enough. Otherwise the wine and beer at happy hour are a great bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: colette s
Reviews.Content: Very nice modern hotel.....very clean and a great location downtown. The valet and shuttle staff were very helpful. Beds were very comfy....Would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “la concha - san juan puerto rico”
Reviews.Author: taylorstrip
Reviews.Content: Springbreak trip....hotel lobby was super fun and funky. The pool and beach were inviting and we had great weather. But most of all --- we were able to enjoy the island too. We went to old town easily. We did the bio bay --- facinating. We loved the lively night life in the bar area. The restaurant in the shell was a treat and the food was delish! I would so stay again. We reserved the new tower ---however upon arrival they had no room for us in the new section....disappointed in that at first --but our room had an amazing view and was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a nice, older hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dunf5576
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick and easy as the receptionists were very helpful. Check-out was already taken care of before departure. The room was well kept, however the bathroom must have been over looked when it was cleaned. Great value on the suite, would definitely stay with them again if need be.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: nysy
Reviews.Content: Great stay for 2 nights. Between the free drinks, cookies and milk, large continental breakfast, it has so many extra touches. We took advantage of the free shuttle to get around during NYE which was a life-saver. The heat didn't work but we weren't around too much to complain or move (which isn't typical of me). It was a warm weekend in Dallas. Would definitely come back and let them know if the heat doesn't work again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, liked the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: astronomer-at-large
Reviews.Content: Good location in downtown Dallas, with several restaurants within walking distance. Free drink in the evenings (rather basic quality wine, but you get what you pay for). Fairly good free breakfast. Free wifi in rooms. Quite a good room, comfortable and reasonably large. Main criticism is expensive valet parking. We found a car park within a block which was a bit cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Patty H
Reviews.Content: Great Staff, comfy bed's and linens, hot cookies at bedtime, full bkfst in the a.m. and again...Great Staff!

Reviews.Title: “A few observations on the Magnolia”
Reviews.Author: TravelerAl
Reviews.Content: -Free breakfast is ample, but not elegant -Free fresh-baked cookies and milk, tea, or coffee from 8 to 10 pm and free drink (house wine or draft beer) during happy hour are nice touches -Free shuttle runs to locations within a 3-mile radius, only until 10 pm. No pre-booking; show up downstairs or call from away location when ready to return. Tip of $5 is suggested by a bill of that denomination left in the tray to the driver's right. Drivers were friendly, helpful. -No printed guide in room to hotel services ; available only on channel 48 on TV -Tolerant bartenders: loud, obscene rant by one customer during happy hour was allowed to go on for several minutes. Server apologized to other customers. -Room lighting could be improved -Good location if visiting downtown museums -Special rate obtained via TripAdvisor website was good value

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous, friendly hotel. Beautiful, small and service-oriented!”
Reviews.Author: TuTerri
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here three times, and each time found the Magnolia to have a well-trained, friendly staff. The cocktail hour is really fun; the lounge is very nice. Rooms are unique and lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Small room in this okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: petitprince2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double room for one night and the room was small. The bed covers have a stale smell, I don't think they wash them very often. The mattress is saggy and the hallway carpet is worn out and dirty. The waiters at breakfast were a bit rude and spoke very little english. It it not all bad as the location of the hotel is perfect, the building is historic and the lobby and the bar are very elegant. Also there is a nice fitness centre. However, for what we paid (US $160) we probably should have gotten a better room.

Reviews.Title: “Historic yet neuvo. Clean, friendly, great location in downtown.”
Reviews.Author: Sam N
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay in Dallas for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: pyutachok
Reviews.Content: We stayed a night at the Magnolia. I got an incredible rate on a suite and it far exceeded our expectations. The hotel is beautiful inside and out and the rooms were no exception. The employees at valet were wonderful. They carried our bags all the way into our rooms. And they offered their shuttle service free of charge. We were taken to dinner, then picked up there and taken to the American Airlines Center for a game. Then picked up there and brought back to hotel. I'm not one to brag about service unless it's exceptional- and every staff member we came across showed excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel....”
Reviews.Author: rudyruru
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magnolia on December 27th. This was a one night getaway for myself and my wife. We are from Dallas and have stayed here before. Great place for a getaway of just a day or up to several. Most rooms come with full kitchen, so if you are in from out of town you can cook meals. If interested in going out there are several choices - bars/clubs, food....etc......all within walking distance. I recommend the City Tavern.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here in Downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: missybikes
Reviews.Content: I love the Magnolia. This was my 4th visit on Dec 26, 2011. The desk clerks are always wonderful: Friendly, helpful and courteous. The rooms are nice and the bathrooms are usually just perfect. I love the historic yet modern feel of the hotel. This time I had a great reflection of the "Flying horse" from my 26th floor window. Anyway, If I ever have an excuse to stay downtown, it's going to be here, the rates are fantastic, too and there are good restaurants within walking distance. I love the free wine and beer bar, the free buffet breakfast and the free milk (coffee) and cookies! What's not to love?

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great service, affordable luxury.”
Reviews.Author: Deborah W
Reviews.Content: Affordable downtown location -- we got upgraded to a suite, which was large, quiet and comfortable. The full kitchen is great because you can bring leftovers "home"! Very friendly staff. Big closet, fast FREE WiFi. Great free breakfast if you get up early. And this was during Christmas, when things could have been crazy. A few minor things: the queen bed is small, neither remote control worked (though they replaced them within 30 minutes), they ran out of cookies one night (oh no!), and we asked for a high floor but only got the eighth. All in all, a nearly perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magnolia during Christmas, and rented 2 suites for our family. The suites were full-size, with a complete kitchen, separate living room, separate bedroom and entry area. They offer special rates during certain times of the year, and this was one of those times. The rate included (per guest, per night) a full American Breakfast Buffet, social hour (choice of wine or beer, 2 per guest), "Milk and Cookies" before bedtime and free WiFi. The suites were wonderful, beds very comfortable and the hotel staff friendly, helpful and extremely gracious. Fantastic hotel and accommodations for the money! We stay there every time we travel to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Christmas”
Reviews.Author: rtd86
Reviews.Content: My son and I had a wonderful stay this Chistmas. When we checked into the hotel, Sophia was very courteous and considerate; she insured that we were abreast of everything--breakfast, happy hour... Thank you Sophia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: NavyBuck
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at The Magnolia Hotel for 5 days and every day was awesome. I was in town for the Navy vs SMU and Dallas vs Buffalo games and I could not have picked a better hotel. The reception desk personnel were very helpful and friendly. The ambiance of the entire hotel was remarkable. The room I stayed in was considerably bigger than I thought it would be, which was a great thing. It was very nicely laid out, comfortable, and also had a great ambiance. The location nicely positioned in downtown Dallas, close to great restaurants, bars and clubs. The only "slight" negative I would say is the sound proofing could be a little better because I could hear quite a bit of noise from the streets at night. It wasn't bad enough to disrupt my sleep or disrupt my stay. The evening complimentary beer and wine was nice, the milk and cookies were a great touch. I have never had free evening milk and cookies, so I thought that was pretty awesome. The breakfast was outstanding too. I thought the complimentary breakfast would be a typical continental breakfast, but it was a well laid out full selection of breakfast goods!! I highly recommend this hotel to anyone venturing to downtown Dallas. I will definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “They've slipped.”
Reviews.Author: TurkeyTrotFinisher
Reviews.Content: Used to love, love, love this hotel. We stayed there annually and told everyone how great it was. This year, their reservation service was unhelpful and unresponsive. We also notice that the vaunted "cookie reception" is skimpier every year. A few years ago, it included tiny brownies and four different kinds of cookies plus regular milk, low-fat milk and chocolate milk. This year, they were down to two kinds of cookies and regular milk. Period. And the entire setup was cleared from the lounge roughly an hour before the time it was scheduled to end! The rooms as always are quite dark. Fine for sleeping or watching TV, not so great for reading, writing, etc. - you know, the normal "business traveler" activities. When everything else was great, we overlooked this. Now that the rest of the experience seems to have slipped, it's actually pretty annoying.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Magnolia!”
Reviews.Author: Dedec1abc
Reviews.Content: Super fab! We love the great service and especially the COOKIES!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff and spacious rooms! Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Nneer
Reviews.Content: Great location! Our friends loved this place as well as we did and we will all definitely be back! Big walk-in closet with a robe, nice kitchen and high ceilings.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, superb service!”
Reviews.Author: Chewb1zz
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay, service was excellent. The staff went out of their way to ensure we were comfortable and happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a lot of character.”
Reviews.Author: eilerman5000
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in the last few months. The second visit was just as enjoyable as the first. Great Staff, amentities, lounge, room, and breakfast. Location is great as well, plenty of places to eat, easy access to all highways, access to public transportation, and hotel has a great shuttle service too. The rooms are nice the suites are very nice. I also recommend staying on the higher floors, the noise from the streets (city service vehcicles) can be rather noisy in the morning. Looking forward to my next stay in two months. Hope this helps. Bryan

Reviews.Title: “Best location in downtown Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: bafromet
Reviews.Content: In the middle of everything and you will not beat the value!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for our 10 year anniversary.”
Reviews.Author: KStephens1977
Reviews.Content: The stay was really good overall and I loved the layout of the room. The shuttles were a wonderful surprise. I have never stayed in an exceptionally clean room and this was still not as clean as it could be but not bad. There was still hair on the bathroom floor that was not mine the carpet around the wall was dusty you could actually see it and our toilet started leaking and when maintenance came to clean they didn't send anyone to get the wet towels from us trying to keep the water under control and no it didnt need a plunger! it was leaking out of the handle on the tank. This was our 10 year anniversary and overall it was great. Those were small issues in my mind. I am sure it is difficult to clean as many rooms as you have and get it spotless. Overall I would give it a 9 or 10. Great job.

Reviews.Title: “A place you want to stay”
Reviews.Author: myalchemy
Reviews.Content: Great service and nice rooms. Everything is great, but do not expect too much from breakfast. The evening reception is great. This is one of the better places to stay in Denver.

Reviews.Title: “'At Home- Comfortable, Friendly, Amazing!'”
Reviews.Author: Tabetha S
Reviews.Content: In all of my travels, I have never stayed anywhere that I have felt as 'At Home' as the Magnolia! The atmoshphere, staffing and rooms were excellent. Each time I walked into the suite, I didn't feel like I was walking into yet another hotel room where I was 'living out of a suitcase.' Instead, I felt as though I was walking into a home-away-from-home. And the evening complimentary cocktail reception and nightly milk and cookies were just the right addition to the whole experience to truly make me feel like a 'Guest' and not just an 'occupant' as so many other cookie-cutter hotels do!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: LaurLaur29
Reviews.Content: Overall we were very happy with our stay at the Magnolia Dallas this past weekend. The staff was very friendly & helpful. The complimentary breakfast was more than we expected. We thought it was going to be more like a continental breakfast but we were pleasantly surprised when it was hot food too. Although we were not able to take advantage of the evening cocktail parties, we were all very impressed with the idea & the cookies were delicious! Also, we really appreciated the use of the free shuttle when going anywhere within 3 mile of the hotel. You don't often find an establishment that offers so many "freebies" to their customers. The only complaint I have is the lighting in the room is a little poor. A few more lamps or stronger bulbs would help. I would recommend The Magnolia to anyone staying in the Dallas area

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: NickTheGreekTampa
Reviews.Content: We found the Magnolia hotel through Tripadvisor, and were very happy with the choice. We got a suite, which was as large as a 1 bedroom apartment, with a full kitchen for $89 a night. On top of that, the price included a full breakfast buffet, happy hour drinks, and milk & cookies at night! The location is in the historic district and was convenient to anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Derek G
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a number of times. Of all of the hotels we could and have stayed at in Dallas, we keep coming back to this one. Amazing staff and stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, wonderful staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Demetria J
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the front desk personnel were very hospitable. The suite was like home away from home....When visiting Dallas I will ALWAYS stay here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Always enjoy!”
Reviews.Author: 1World2TravelOn
Reviews.Content: I have to travel to Dallas occasionally on business. My office is in downtown Dallas. The Magnolia Hotel is a great hotel that is very close to my office, the tram, and the rest that Dallas has to offer. It is one block from the original Neiman Marcus store. Check in is always easy and the staff is very friendly. The rooms are extremely spacious and nicely decorated. Rooms on higher floors give you better views of the city. This hotel has great amenities that make the stay even better. Full breakfast in the morning is wonderful. I can't believe the selection they provide. From 5:30 to 6:30 they provide a beer and wine happy hour. You are only allowed two glasses of either wine or beer, but that is more than enough for me. The wine is always very good. They only offer one kind of beer though, so you may be unhappy. Then from 8:00 to 10:00 they provide milk and fresh baked cookies before bed. They are wonderful. The fitness center is very large with new, up to date equipment and a hot tub to relax in. Now for the down side. They is a very minor item, but when you are there for business, it can be a problem. The hotel seems to have problems with it's wireless Internet provider. The last time I was there, last year, I had no wireless the whole week I was there. This time, I checked in on Sunday and there was no Internet access. But when I returned from the office on Monday afternoon, it was working. Then on Thursday they had problems again. It can be frustrating, but this time everything worked out OK. I enjoy the historical character of the hotel, the spacioius well appointed rooms, and the amenities this hotel provides.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel-Poor Staff”
Reviews.Author: endless_summer1966
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had planned a "stay 'cation" after the Thanksgiving holiday to recharge. We had accomodated family and company for an entire week. We have both stayed all over the world and this was the worst experience either of us ever had with a hotel. Hardly the relaxing and rejuvinating stay we had hoped for. We started our check in at 3:30pm, Saturday, 12/03/2011. I had reserved a suite so we would have a kitchen and we brought our own food so we could stay in for the evening and just relax and enjoy the boutique hotel atmosphere. The toilet in the first room we were sent to overflowed, ended up soaking my socks and shoes. We were told to stay there and maintenance would come up. I told the front desk it was worse than a maintenance call because the entire bathroom floor was flooded and seeping into the carpet outside the bathroom door. I turned the water valve off myself so it wouldn't continue to get worse. When we got back to the lobby we were told there were no other suites ready at the time and if we could please wait a few minutes another room would be ready. After 30 minutes and no notice, I walked back to the desk and were told there were no suites available but I could go look at 2 different rooms and could chose between the two. We chose one room and went back down to be told that room had been pre booked and was not available. We said fine, let us have the 2nd room we were sent to. We had not spent much time other than looking at the room, but it seemed OK. When we got to this queen parlor room, we realized it was very hot and when we turned the AC on to cool it off, it didn't seem to be working. We also discovered there were only 3 small lamps in the bedroom and there was no light whatsoever in the area contianing a desk and the small refrigerator. We called the front desk and were told to come back down. We asked for someone to just meet us at the new room so we wouldn't be burdened with moving our luggage yet again up and down the stairs and elevators. No one ever showed up after 25 minutes so I called the front desk yet again. I was put on hold for another five minutes. I hung up and called back. The front desk girl ran the key up to the 13th floor herself because the person she asked to do it disappeared and never returned. It was 5:35pm when we finally got into this final room # 1326. The room was in fairly good condition if you overlooked the fact the wooden blinds didn't function properly. By the way, being in the hallway on floor 13 so long waiting for admittance into our room, we noticed broken glass in front of the housekeeping door and it remained there our entire stay...... The front desk person told us she would speak to the manager to see if he would approve reducing charges. We waited 3 hours and didn't hear anything. We went to the front desk around 8:30pm where we discovered her telling the manager about it and he said he would not charge us for the room. We thought we were not going to have any other issues, but the morning of 12/04/11 we found the room charge still on the bill left under the door. This presented a problem because the shift change occurred and we had to re explain our whole ordeal to the new manager on duty, who did remove the room charge, but added the valet parking charge. When we tried to get our car from valet it was cold and raining and it took more than 25 minutes for that to occur. There was only one man who was truly trying to make the valet parking go smoothly and was directing his crew which seemed to be very uncooperative with him. Sadly, I didn't get his name - he should be rewarded for his patience and efforts. I am a reasonable person and realize things go wrong, but it didn't seem that anyone truly cared that we were so inconvenienced. Just wanted you to be aware. Training might be in order to improve and learn about how to better accomodate during unnusual circumstances. The Dallas Magnolia is a very unique and interesting boutique hotel. Too bad we weren't left with the warmth its employees should impart on their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Magnolia overextends itself”
Reviews.Author: Billy T
Reviews.Content: Rented two queen suites for a Saturday night. Hotel was full to capacity Friday night and hosting two holiday parties Saturday night. This is fine and good, but the Magnolia did not staff up properly to handle the busy-ness. Tried to check into my rooms at 3 PM and was denied. Finally got into one room at 4:30 and the other at 5:30. That simply is not acceptable when the published check-in time is 3 PM. The keys didn't work for one room. The suites were nice enough, but I must admit I was a bit disappointed with the stay. Oh, and checking out they tried to charge me a $25 parking free even though I didn't have a car. When I told the lady at the front desk, she didn't believe me and was reluctant to refund the charge. She called the valet and was surprised when he confirmed what I said, that I didn't have a car there.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: austinfrost
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Magnolia Hotels in Dallas and Houston several times. If you get on their mailing list and wait for the specials you cannot beat the value: $99/night or $129 for a suite with free happy hour and breakfast. The Dallas hotel has a really cool outdoor hot tub and the design of the hotel in general is hip but still maintains honor to its historic roots. We had some internet trouble but they did their best to trouble-shoot and even offered to upgrade our room to compensate. Its not a 5 star but its really nice!!

Reviews.Title: “Boys going to see the 'Boys”
Reviews.Author: GolfBazza
Reviews.Content: Friend and I spent 5 days in Dallas over Thanksgiving in order to see Dallas Cowboys for the first time in a regular season game at the amazing Cowboys Stadium. Needed a decent hotel for the stay and after reading a number of reviews chose the Magnolia based on - positive feedback, location, FREE WiFi, FREE breakfast, FREE cookies and milk - oh and cost! We were not disappointed! Had a room on 20th floor with 2 queen size beds. Very comfortable. Check in was easy. Valet parking was no problem. Shuttle cars useful. Breakfast was fine. Service was great. Room was ideal. John (or Jaaaaaaaaaannnnnn) on the bar was a blast. Pool table by bar was a nice bonus. And the lifts....they were fine!! There is a sign on some of them explaining they are not being replaced as they are a feature of the old building and as long as they are safe who cares!!! Only once did we have a few minutes of waiting and that was around the busy breakfast period. Chill out! If you are going to Dallas to do the Thanksgiving Day Turkey Trot and need a base - stay here! We ended up joining in the fun without any idea it was going on - just 2 blocks away! As soon as you understand the road and traffic signs it is ideal for getting to other parts of Dallas/Texas - only 5 mins for American Airlines Centre (Center!), 20 mins to Galleria mall, about 25 mins to Cowboys Stadium, 35 mins to DFW airport, 30 mins to McKinney, 25 mins to Mesquite for Rodeo...basically quite central! Loved it, would return at the drop of a cowboy hat....

Reviews.Title: “Magnolia is super cozy!”
Reviews.Author: TerrellTravel3
Reviews.Content: If you are staying downtown the Magnolia is a great location for business or leisure. The breakfast has a wide variety of choices. The cookies and milk in the evening are great for winding down for the evening. Bonus are the super soft robes!

Reviews.Title: “dec 2011”
Reviews.Author: SladeF
Reviews.Content: great trip, clean room great upgrade when i reserved the room. room wasn't ready until after 5 so we had to cancel a trip to the Dallas Museum of Art. Great location; easy access

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: MaryMItt
Reviews.Content: Great room. Great service. Great location at Christmas time. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great potential, terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: Grant J
Reviews.Content: Great prices, locations, amenities. Here's the thing, I'm not a negative person, and I stayed here once before and had one of the best expriences and ranted and raved about it. However, my last stay here really changed my mind about this place. Terrible customer service from tricking you to take "upgrades with bigger rooms and a better view " that are actually "downgrades" with broken toilets, no heat, and a view of the rockbeded roof. In addition, they have flashy Suburbans that they use in their shuttle system (free transportation around a certain radius of Downtown Dallas) but if it isn't "far enough", or they have other people waiting, they'll lie and tell you that "the shuttles are down" when in reality, there's one in the driveway, and another pulling in (literally as they speak those words) My first experience was a 4.5 out 5, and my last experience was a 1 out of 5, so I rounded out with a 2 (poor)

Reviews.Title: “Great place for fun”
Reviews.Author: Rkbullard
Reviews.Content: The place to spend the weekend. Service is top notch. Rooms are wonderfully furnished.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Downtown Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: CJCarlson13
Reviews.Content: Our family stays here (we're local!) every year for the Children's Christmas parade. The hotel staff is very friendly and accommodating. The hotel itself is extremely nice and clean! Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Room was great but everything else was horrible: the staff, the elevator, the valets. I do not recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy B
Reviews.Content: The room was great and if that was the only factor, I would always recommend The Magnolia. Unfortunately, rooms are not the only element when it comes to hotels and we were unimpressed when it came to the rest. 1) During check-in, the gentleman at the counter clearly thought answering phones was more important than the customers standing right in front of him. 2) the elevator system is an absolute joke. Out of 7 elevators only 3 0r 4 of them work? Consider having half of them go only to top floors (14-26) and half going to lower level floors (2-13). If you can't afford having all elevators running, cut back on the cookies, drinks and other gimmicks and get your house in order. Just a suggestion. 3) I don't valet. This hotel is not very accommodating for that. I know valet is very "Dallas", but there are a lot of us who like to self-park and not having that option is annoying. Even if that was an option, there's not place to reasonably drop off bags, etc. before self parking. 4) A positive, we were there to attend a wedding reception in the Pegasus Room. Didn't like walking across the street in the cold, pouring down rain, but once we were over there, it was a great venue with great catering and excellent service. But again... the parking was a pain. Again, the room was great but the things listed above make me wish we had stayed elsewhere and will prohibit us from staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Denise S
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful! I will definately return when I am in Dallas! The staff was so friendly and the extras were a nice touch! Must stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A great, cozy, friendly hotel with the best downtown location.”
Reviews.Author: Texastrahan
Reviews.Content: Our family stays here every year for the Dallas Christmas parade. We love the reception in the afternoon, Santa in the lobby, cookies before bed, and then breakfast in the morning. This hotel could not have a better downtown location!

Reviews.Title: “An unbelievable deal, great, great find!”
Reviews.Author: dshabes
Reviews.Content: Great room, great extras (free wifi, breakfast, drinks at happy hour)- an easy must stay, no questions asked. Nothing I could find wrong with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in downtown Dallas for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Bill P
Reviews.Content: Great service and a buliding of old history. Had a problem with the room and it was fixed quickly. And the remodled Mobil building has an old history that I remember when I was a kid as the tallest building in Dallas at the time. And there was plenty to do in downtown Dallas, shopping, resturants, parks and plenty of musems.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: Marco B
Reviews.Content: I went there during the PV fair SPI 2011 and the company booked the hotel for me. It is downtown Dallas and the place is very comfortable. Rooms are large, coosy, you have cable tv and iron. Breakfast is also good and they have a bar where you can play pools. It is a business hotel, so it is a bit on the expensive side.

Reviews.Title: “Magnolia is our fave!”
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, cool decor in a historic building. The staff is very friendly, helpful and attentive without being smarmy. The cookies and milk happy hour is a hit with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: cryswag
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a night on our second year anniversary and I have to say I'm very impressed. The staff are amazing, very thoughtful and helping. I requested a room in a higher floor and we were given a corner suite in the 23 floor with an amazing view. The elevators are very fast, never had to wait even two minutes to get them. Very clean and very tasteful rooms. Their jacuzzi in the spa is amazing- especially in the winter months. I wills definately come back again

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and spacious”
Reviews.Author: Kadoria I
Reviews.Content: My suite was very spacious, comfy, and the staff was super friendly. Also, I got my suite for a great price considering the downtown location, and it was a stone's throw from m restaurant and the nightlife.The only down sides are the valet can be pretty slow, the hall on the way to my room had stuff on the floor that could easily have been vacuumed, and although I asked for wi-fi, I could not use it because I was asked for a coupon code. No one issued me any coupon or told me I needed this to use the web.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden treasure”
Reviews.Author: Debra C
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a hidden treasure in downtown. I was impressed with the suite, it was like our own high-rise apartment and the full kitchen was a very nice surprise. We were on the 24th floor and the views from the suite were magnificent. We just stayed for Thanksgiving and it was peaceful and tranquil. The breakfast buffet was great, great food. I would definitely stay again. I'm a diva and I was very comfortable. Definitely money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed in Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: Johnmartin214
Reviews.Content: Suite was huge! Loved the full kitchen, where I cooked my girlfriends wonderful birthday dinner. Felt like if it was our own apartment downtown, Awesome view. Even though we didn't take advantages of the hotels free amenities It was money well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Clean affordable hotel in the middle of downtown”
Reviews.Author: Dustin100
Reviews.Content: Went for an anniversary trip. Couldn't have been a better deal. Clean rooms and huge. Nice service as well.

Reviews.Title: “Magnolia Hotel, Dallas”
Reviews.Author: 7barb
Reviews.Content: Easy to find right off I-35 and commerce. very comfortable queen sized beds. love chocolate chip and oatmeal cookies and milk - even still there if you don't check in until late. great hot tub and everything you need is already in the shower there - don't need to walk back up to your room wet. the internet connection was slow on laptop. Valet Parking a bit expensive. great view of a very old building with gargoyles from the room we were in. Great Sunday brunch - not sure if that is the same every day but the food and choices were great. Love this place.

Reviews.Title: “We really enjoyed our stay at the Magnolia Hotel in Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: Angus M
Reviews.Content: Aussie Couple from Miami, Gold Coast in Australia Having never been in Dallas before, my wife and I were extremely pleased with our stay at the Magnolia Hotel. Room was very clean and well appointed, view of the city excellent and location just ideal for sightseeing ventures. It was made all the better by the help, guidance and assistance offered to us by the afternoon/evening receptionist, ANGELA. She went out of her way to ensure that our stay in Dallas was enjoyable. Congratulations Magnolia - you will get our booking again next time we are in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at The Magnolia. Perfect location and great accommodations. Staff is always very friendly.”
Reviews.Author: PattyWoodTx
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and great accommodations. Staff is always very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “This Magnolia is a bit stale. 3 Stars on a good day.”
Reviews.Author: Lulu_Pow
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for the Magnolia. The lobby is unique and kind of swanky without feeling pretentious. The Magnolia seems to be a deal, in a good area downtown until you hit the traffic it takes 30 minutes to make the turn to get around the block to the hotel, to get in line to the valet. However, check-in was fast, but things deteriorated quickly when we're told there are only Queen suites left (apparently the weddings have overtaken the entire hotel. More below). But we figure, okay, a Queen suite will be okay instead of a King, right.... WRONG. We go up to find our Queen suite is actually a rather dark, odd two-room affair with a bed that is in reality closer to a full-size. For adults this is ridiculous. I spent most of both nights falling out of the bed along with the pillows. The rooms were so dark I thought I was in an "off the strip" Vegas special. With the blinds open and all the lights on it was still so dark I wondered what they were hiding. The bathroom was a big, but nothing special. We had a kitchen. We didn't need or want one. We had a living room, didn't need or want one. Okay, onto the other amenities. This isn't a posh modern hotel. It is an old office building that has been converted. And it's not charming. It's just OLD and dark. We quickly discovered the Magnolia turns into WEDDING CENTRAL on the weekend. Several wedding parties had taken over the entire lobby, bar and parking area. Lovely. They swarmed the lobby and sprawled everywhere to take photos. The bar is packed. This beautiful hotel has turned into Disneyland complete with crying babies, whining kids and young women in what I can only call club wear (which apparently now passes for wedding attire). Sweet. Cheap entertainment! You'll be happy you have it -- because you're gonna need it while you wait for the VALET aka the waiting area from hell where they say they are getting your car (or hopefully find it eventually) or maybe get you a taxi (see more below). The Magnolia Promised several "free" goodies like cocktail hour, breakfast buffet. and milk & cookies at bedtime. However.... we had problems with all of them ... or and a bit more. What did NOT WORK: 1) Free cocktail hour: We went down, but the bar was so jam packed we could not get through in any direction. We gave up and left. Not a table open, not even a chair (again due to the wedding(s)? Really shouldn't the wedding parties cocktail/bar be separate from regular hotel customers? So much for that freebie. Next! 2) The breakfast area was so full we stood up to eat for the first few minutes. Classy. I felt like I was at any resort area hotel with a kiddie attraction (aka Disney World) -- you come down for breakfast and it's packed with the families and kids are everywhere, like locusts. They will eat ANYTHING that doesn't eat them first. The eggs were cold and had an odd texture (almost like powdered or something... very odd). There was no meat on the buffet. The potatos were cold and greasy. It was toast-your-own bread. No where to sit. So stand, hold your juice & balance your plate and eat. Charming. Am I at the Motel 6? Within a few minutes, before we could even get a cup of coffee the entire "buffet" was broken down and wheeled away. Who closes breakfast at 10 a.m. on a weekend? I wondered again if this disasterous mob scene was due to the multiple weddings. Should everyone in the hotel be punished because of the wedding parties? Thanks Magnolia Hotel for this fine freebie. 3) The noise was horrendous. I was kept awake until after 2 a.m. on both nights. Motorcycles, horns, cabs, yelling -- it was insanity. We were on the 22nd floor and it was AWFUL. I might as well have slept out on the street. 4) Super slow elevators. Oh and be prepared. The wedding parties don't mind cramming in on top of you to the point of knocking you down. Oh and you're welcome. Just move the ___ out of their way already. 5) Valet system was a nightmare in general. We paid $24.00/ & used our car ONCE. When we came down to get a taxi on our second night, the valet area was a disaster zone. We waited and waited and waited ---- and we were PAYING them $24 a day for this service? They even stick a note in with your bill on check out day instructing you NOT to call for your car. That's right -- you are paying for the service and they are now asking you not to use it. So at check out time you get to go down and wait in line (yes, like security at the airport but even MORE disorganized). A less than stellar ending to our stay. What?! And I'm paying for this "service"? This pushed what a been an annoyance on previous occasions to a point of no return. 6) Top covering on bed was like burlap. Really cheap, really tacky. As we say in Texas, "Tacky McTack Tack." 7) No luggage rack. 8) One bathroom for two people 9) Small vanity in bathroom (so small that I laid a towel on the floor and used that to lay things on). Crazy, huh? 10) Full size mirror in the bedroom but so dark I still couldn't see to check my clothes before leaving. Put the full size mirror in the bathroom if that's the only place where there is ANY lighting. The good: 1) Night #1 the valet staff was wonderful. I think we caught them just before the mass of wedding guests arrived and left. We came down to get a cab & the valet staff offered to take us in the hotel's SUV. 2) Front desk staff was courteous, friendly, helpful. Professional. Sharp. 3) The hotel lobby was beautiful, clean, well-kept; unique architecture. 4) The bed was comfortable (though small). Silky sheets, super-light comforter. Plenty of pillows. This is probably a different hotel during the week. I can't recommend it on the weekend though. The $24/day for valet is a joke. The cocktail hour and breakfast is also a joke. I even tried writing the management of the Magnolia. They care so little they have not responded at all. Apparently, they only care about booking weddings. We won't go back. Yes, The Magnolia was a good deal, but price isn't everything. We paid the price for going cheap. Can't recommend it. We'll pay the extra $ next time and avoid the noise, Wedding Central and the rest of the mess.

Reviews.Title: “Love my new weekend spot”
Reviews.Author: iknowwhatisnice
Reviews.Content: I have lived in Dallas all my life. I have worked downtown for over 11 years. I have never considered getting a hotel downtown. Out of ALL of the hotels I have stayed in ( I am over 35 years old) this spot is now my new number one. I stayed her November 18th weekend. From the time I checked in, I received nothing but the best. Jaclyn at the front desk was wonderful. Almost to wonderful, but in a good way. Very friendly and professional. When she found out this was my first visit, she added a inch more friendliness. (not that she needed to) Loved her.. When I stepped in the room I loved the decor. I had a corner room so I had a window view of different scenery.(do they think there were enough windows in one room. 6 or 7 total including bathroom..either way loved it)..The bartender was wonderful and the breakfast staff was wonderful. Oh let me back up.... Cookies? Milk? For me? Loved it! Its the smallest things that makes a big difference. Loved it so much I have two reservation already lined up.

Reviews.Title: “great deal in downtown dallas”
Reviews.Author: geromeacf
Reviews.Content: the Magnolia hotel has a superb location, close to historical places and the financial district, even to move within the zone walking, eliminating the need of cabs or rentals. The rooms are high quality, and the price is quite afordable.

Reviews.Title: “More than just a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dpruitt2
Reviews.Content: Thx. Magnolia Hotel (Dallas)...you made our 1st Anniversary experience monumental. Between the host/hostess, valet and all its staff...the hospitality they displayed was flawless. We didn't have to lift a finger for anything. Affordable, family oriented, historic, in a premium location in Downtown Dallas..."WOW" we're sold for life. "Good-Bye" to all you over rated/priced hotels and "Hello" to our home away from home...MAGNOLIA your the best. :-)

Reviews.Title: “A great way to stay in Dallas, surrounded by everything.”
Reviews.Author: Coolblue1ar
Reviews.Content: ...It was awasome and had all you could need right by the hotel. The breakfast buffet was awesome

Reviews.Title: “The hotel has antique charm with all the modern luxaries.”
Reviews.Author: Lari21
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel is located in the heart of downtown that is undergoing changes for the better. It is centrally located to many area attractions and within walking distance to many museums and parks. The elevators are original to the building, which add to the antique charm. Be patient though- sometimes they are speedy, sometimes slow, and sometimes they take you up when you mean to go down, and vise versa. You just have to learn to appreciate them for what they are and smile about it. The cookies and milk are a bonus!

Reviews.Title: “I love the Magnolia!”
Reviews.Author: Alex A
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia is very nice, lots of perks (free drinks, cookies, breakfast, etc) and the staff is wonderful. The suites are HUGE. Rooms are very clean, spacious and comfortable. It's a treat to stay here :)

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE LOVE THIS HOTEL!!! This is my favorite get away.”
Reviews.Author: Shaterria D
Reviews.Content: Hotel is every classy, and works well for personal and business. The rooms are very spacy with city views. love the cookie bar and the wonderful hot free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Jon R
Reviews.Content: Hotel is centrally located. Mid-size boutique-like feel. Could use some cosmetic upgrading but the rooms are super clean and large, the service in the lounge and the front desk staff were terrific. Room service prices reasonable and delievry of very good food was timely.

Reviews.Title: “Great every time!”
Reviews.Author: airborne2201
Reviews.Content: They have done such a great job transforming this historic skyscraper into a modern hotel with great service. This is the 4th time I have booked a stay with them and it was great as always. The deals they have are at affordable prices, the valet parking and hotel shuttle works great for getting around town. The breakfast in the morning starts any day off right, the evening reception is unmatched anywhere around, a great time to "wine down" after a day of events just before dinner. Then the night is really complete with milk and cookies right before bed. The suites offer tons of room and everything you need to relax. Every time I stay in Dallas I continue to pick this hotel, fun every visit!

Reviews.Title: “Liked it”
Reviews.Author: Felipe1906
Reviews.Content: Well maintained hotel in downtown Dallas. Rooms were clean and spacy. Hotel staff was very friendly and effective. There is a decent contiental breakfast for free. The Magnolia Hotel offers real value for money. Liked the histroic building, sensitivly refurbished, so they were able to preserve the classy style of the early 19hrds.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & service!”
Reviews.Author: Dtiger19
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel if your staying in Downtown Dallas! Has nice amenities & excellent decor!

Reviews.Title: “First Class, Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: Mary E
Reviews.Content: We were here for five days for a wedding that took place at the Magnolia. The hotel is modern and classy; yet at the same time warm and inviting. The staff is superb from the valet to the front desk to housekeeping to catering. Allison, in central reservations, was especially helpful to the wedding guests and as a result, many more people will be back to stay at the Magnolia. We have traveled extensively in business and are quite particular. We could not find a fault with the Magnolia Hotel! Our room was exceptionally clean and modern with a super comfortable bed and first class amenities. The hotel included a fullly-complete and fabulous buffet breakfast. The complimentary happy hour in the evening is a fun meeting place. And to top it off, homemade cookies and milk (coffee & tea too) to end the night! It doesn't get better than that! We would highly recommend the Magolia to others. We will gladly be back on future visits to Dallas. BTW, the wedding was great in their historic ballroom across the street. The wedding dinner was amazing and delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel! Awesome staff! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Reed B
Reviews.Content: Upgrade to a suite and you will love it! Definitely worth the few extra dollars. Note that if you have a car, be forewarned that you have to use the valet and be patient for your car to arrive. Call at least 15 minutes before you need it. The valet staff is great but there is no parking on site and it takes them forever to run 2 blocks to get your car and then to drive 4-6 blocks to get it to you at hotel from all the one way streets in downtown Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: BobQuortrup
Reviews.Content: We have been to this location twice before and this visit, just as the previous stays, did not dissapoint. Our suite was appointed nicely. Had a working kitchen that was well equipped and clean. The bathroom had double sinks and had a modern feel. The front desk staff was very friendly and accomodating. Did not participate in the evening happy hour, but the breakfast was quite the spread with eggs, bacon, french toast, cereal, coffee, juices, all kinds of breads and much more. Will definitely use this location for future weekend getaways.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tanvi a
Reviews.Content: Everything was great! My best friend & boyfriend (now my fiance!) had planned a suprise for my birthday and the hotel staff was very accomdating (: They let Jen check in and decorate the room, Janet (pretty blonde lady, might have the wrong name) was very sweet and so was the rest of the hotel staff. We requested to stay on one of the top floors, and the view from our room (2207) was GORGEOUS! We enjoyed a nice view of downtown Dallas at night and waking up to watch the sunrise over Dallas. The milk & cookies were a great touch (: The breakfast buffet definitely exceed our expectations; we weren't expecting such a great selection.We did have to wait a few mins to get the car back from valet, but since it was a Sat night and alot of traffic, it was expected. The valet staff was very friendly, especially Ray. Our stay was great, and I'm so glad we picked Magnolia to spend my birthday weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in Downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Welshjetset
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Magnolia for 2 nights a few weeks ago. The location is fantastic, right in the centre of Downtown Dallas and within walking distance of the main tourist attractions....Sixth Floor Museum, Grassy Knoll, Reunion Tower etc. The rooms were spacious, clean and well equipped. The complimentary breakfast and wi-fi were great and we particularly loved the free milk and cookies buffet every evening. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. I also recommend the Iron Cactus for dinner/drinks as it's only a 2 min walk from the hotel....the food (mexican) and margaritas are great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel + Great Staff = Happy Guest!”
Reviews.Author: rosebudc
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to others. Every staff member I encountered was friendly, professional and very helpful. The free shuttle was very convenient and available most of the time. My room was quiet, clean and spacious and the wifi worked great. The bed was comfy and there were plenty of pillows both soft and firm. My only complaint was that my room was quite dark with hardly any lamps. The location is good being very close to a small grocery store, a CVS Pharmacy and a 7-Eleven for all your basic necessities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Old equals charming (but also some maintenance challenges). And parking is way too expensive...”
Reviews.Author: TexanGod
Reviews.Content: Overall the stay was good. The hotel staff was friendly, the breakfast was good and the cookies were a nice touch. The gym is nicely equipped and the Sauna in the dressing room was a pleasant surprise. Just a few things bothered: 1. The heating did not work well in the room - this became a problem only at the early morning hours as the night was not too cold. 2. Constant sound of water running in the toilet - didn't really bother us as the suite was well isolated for noise but the water waste is a shame. 3. There was only one bathrobe in the room. (Really minor issue, noted here to just to demonstrate good response by the staff). I notified the front desk and a 2nd robe was delivered quickly. A notice to maintenance was opened for items 1 and 2. Warnings to fellow travelers: 1. $30 for parking per night ($24 + tax + gratuity...) - way too high in my opinion 2. Starbucks next door closes at 6PM on Friday and 2PM on Sat-Sun. Ridiculous hours. 3. Checkout at 11AM, 12PM at the latest (stay past noon you will be charged $50 for late checkout) Recommendations: 1. Free Beer/Wine/Soft drinks in evening reception 5:30-6:30PM 2. Warm cookies 8-10PM 3. Look on their web site for specials. We got a suite at half price - maybe that's why we got just one robe :) I would consider visiting again in the future, and will look for another parking option

Reviews.Title: “Book a room here!! Great experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Bookum2012
Reviews.Content: Aaaaaaamazing, a few rooms need kitchen and bathroom updating but bed was so sleeper friendly.. Ps elevators are like rocketships :)!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Dannytac
Reviews.Content: Just spent a weekend here and was very pleased. Located right next to a Starbucks. Hotel offers free shuttle service, complimentary happy hour beer and wine and milk and cookies. Staff is very friendly. Property is well kept. Rooms are nice as well. Location is 10 minutes from American Airlines Center. 30 minutes from the Cowboys games. 10 minute walk to JFK museum. It's a good place to stay when in Dallas. Has a fitness center. Small hot tub. Flat screen TVs. Spacious suites. Bar. Computers to use. Free wifi. Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed ourselves very much. Overall great experience and would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Becky P
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed ourselves very much. Valet parking for $24 per night is a little excessive. We racked up almost additional $100 from it. Breakfast, happy hour, and cookies were a nice treat daily although we missed happy hour and cookies during most of our stay as we were out of the hotel exploring the town. The sound on the TVs were off as some channels were louder than others making it hard to listen and flip between channels. The faucet in the bath tub was a little loose. I felt like one of us would break it if we weren't too careful. Our room keys all stopped working on Sunday night which was a little annoying as we had to go back downstairs and get new ones. Overall great experience and would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Downtown Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: tim a
Reviews.Content: Great Historical Hotel in Downtown Dallas. The hotel rooms are large and quite, free WIFII, and has a happy hour. It has everything that I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Third stay at this wonderful boutique hotel..great location with restaurants within walking distance. Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: italybound
Reviews.Content: rooms are sleekly decorated, comfy beds and linens. quiet! great location as well..hats off to the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and comfortable! The people were friendly and excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Amber S
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay with The Magnolia. The room was comfortable, clean, and spacious. I had a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Business trip for two nights at the Magnolia”
Reviews.Author: CoolAZMom
Reviews.Content: Given major construction in the street just outside that continued until 11 p.m., I did not have the most pleasant stay at the Magnolia, although surely the hotel can't be faulted for that. Whereas the staff is quite gracious, this hotel is old and a bit dirty, The baseboards and carpet in my queen bed room were actually fairly grimy. Still, the bed was comfortable, the linens were clean, the towels were plush, and the shampoo/conditioner/lotion/body wash high quality. I also liked the mini-fridge in the room. I did not take advantage of the breakfast, happy hour and late night cookies & milk that were included in the room charge, but some of my traveling companions did and provided thumbs up feedback. The fitness room was rather pathetic and the ancient elevators are creepy.

Reviews.Title: “Had the best 4 days at the Magnolia Dallas with service and treatment by all staff”
Reviews.Author: lync16
Reviews.Content: Have just spent 4 days at the Magnolia in Dallas and was blown away by the complimentary breakfast, happy hour and milk and cookies. The staff and service were excellent as well as the hotel shuttle service which we used several times. We did however have to walk up 10 flights of stairs one night when the elevators were down but we made fun of the climb by laughing all the way!! Highly recommended - Other hotels could take a leaf out of your book! Wish there was a Magnolia Hotel in Australia!

Reviews.Title: “Free milk and cookies!”
Reviews.Author: PinkPinkPinkSydney
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights here in October this year, great hotel, good breakfast buffet, and free milk and cookies in the evenings! Receptionists were friendly and efficient Rooms were very clean and there was free wifi Good location Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Flawless Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelTea_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful, modern and well run. Our stay was flawless down to the last detail. I even left one of my favorite tops behind and when I realized this I called but I never expected to see it again. I was pleasantly surprised when it showed up on my door step a couple days later. It really shows when an establishment is so well run that they are able to take care of the little things that generally fall through the cracks. I would return to this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Betsy C
Reviews.Content: Thank you, Magnolia Hotel staff for a very nice stay. LOOOOOVE the complimentary foods and drinks, it was difficult to stop to eat on a busy business trip. Best feature by far to be able to grab breakfast, a drink AND cookies at bedtime. Didn't use fitness amenities, can't comment on that. Elevators are not as bad as some reviews say but once I rode one up just to make sure I was on it when it started going down. Not a deal killer. (I think if the elevators bother you, I can guess you are probably a negative person in general!). Thank you. *****

Reviews.Title: “New favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: F1nsup
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, location, staff. Beautifully decorated

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Lori B
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room, quiet, clean, the cookies and milk in the evening is such a great touch; breakfast is excellent - the stay is well worth the money and location is great. As in any major city, parking is expensive and eats way at the value you get in room price and breakfast. I'll stay again but will make sure to cab it in.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Donna C
Reviews.Content: We had a very peaceful, relaxing stay. The hospitality was great, and I would love to stay again. The best part of my room was the view from the 24th floor, it was breathtaking, and the tub it was big enough for both of us.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of little things went wrong”
Reviews.Author: George P
Reviews.Content: Got here an thought the lobby and decor was warm and comfortable. Enjoyed the theme. The breakfast was good and the happy hour a nice touch. The staff was curtious but from high hopes my impression did nothing but go down hill. The elevators were slow or under repair all the time. When they stopped at the floor the lights didn't tell you which way they were going and people were asking up or down? Door key didn't work so went back to the lobby and they told me to pull the door shut and try again. That seemed to work.I was on the 11th floor and wanted Ice. Looked around and called the lobby to find the ice machine for the hotel was on the 3ed floor. With a slow elevator I am glad I took the ice bucket so it wouldn't melt. There was a strange noise that woke me up all night like the room above me flushed the toilet all night long. I left a wake up call the first night and they didn't call me. So the second night I called back to confirm the call and the lady said she circled it. No call and I overslept an hour. The exercise room was strange and poorly laid out which is ok as most hotels put the health club in corners but the equipment was old. No water and no towels. I would have liked to like the hotel but i won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “OMG Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: joerangerfan
Reviews.Content: Great stay. They upgraded our stay to a suite. Valet and staff was nice and courteous. Will definitely stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carol2322
Reviews.Content: This hotel is chic and has a great downtown location just a few blocks away from the DART station. Our room was large with a huge jacuzzi tub and it had the most comfortable beds! The breakfast was really great, too. The valet service was fast and easy. I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: Saberhunt
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia Hotel Dallas is an above average hotel, worthy of your stay! The hotel is clean, modern (with a historic charm) and in a great location for those wanting a downtown location. We had two rooms for two nights in mid October 2011 and really enjoyed our stay! Both rooms were on "the historic floor" which is located on the 24th floor of the hotel. All rooms are "historic" on this level but the "historic" touches vary from room to room within this level. Certainly request to be assigned a room on this floor: unique historic touches, great views from the high floor, less street noise, etc...Magnolia Hotels keep the historic element throughout the hotel, including the elevators. The elevators have a plaque in each car describing why they kept the original elevators, which are a bit creaky and a bit slow but so worth the extra charm! This is a hotel I would reccomend and stay at in the future, not too pricey - you get a superior hotel for the rate! Friendly staff, comfortable beds, delicious breakfast included.....excellent choice for any family/group!

Reviews.Title: “Best service ever”
Reviews.Author: Runnin26
Reviews.Content: I travel about 20-30 weeks a year but have never experienced such customer focus. Literally, from the time I gave the valet my keys until I checked out, everyone was awesome. The staff went the extra mile to make our stay the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: Kim B
Reviews.Content: Very clean and the service was great. The room rates were well below expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a great value”
Reviews.Author: Tedd B
Reviews.Content: Well appointed room, nice ensuite. Very very comfortable stay. Loved the retro music!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, first class amenities, clean, good value”
Reviews.Author: PhillyGuy88
Reviews.Content: The hotel provides has a wonderful eclectic feel and first rate amenities at a good value price. Modern and very clean and at a price that does not include unnecessary pricey luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Better than the reviews”
Reviews.Author: barbieCoffsHarbour
Reviews.Content: My sister and I travelled to USA in September and spent 2 nights at The Magnolia Hotel onroute to Kansas City..I chose it from the reviews on TripAdvisor and am glad to report that it was even better to stay at than the reviews! The room was very spacious and quiet***which was something we really appreciated after a 15 hour flight from Sydney. The beds were extremely firm and very, very comfy..and there was a nice big bath to soothe tired travelling muscles in. Staff were a little uninformed, but then again, they did find our accents difficult to understand and we had a few extra adventures finding shops etc due to their lack of directions or knowledge, so that wasn't really a drama. The Magnolia isn't close to many shops so we did a little walking, and the area is very safe to walk around and easy to negotiate the streets - no mad running across the street like in Asia!! Breakfast was varied and part of the room price - very nice - there was lots of talk about the free happy hour and milk and cookies by other reviewers, but we weren't interested in either of those, so have no opinion on them - we did get many a thermos of boiling water sent up by room service though for our herbal teabags - our drink of choice...the room service was very prompt every time, day or night. All in all, this was a great hotel and I highly recommend it to anyway with a night or two to spend in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Cellis84
Reviews.Content: Loved staying in the Magnolia Dallas. Check in was a breeze. The bed was extremely comfortable and the linens were so lovely and soft. My husband and I looked forward to milk and cookies every night! What a treat! If we ever return to Dallas would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel . . . you will be disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: beachy
Reviews.Content: We checked into this property due to the convience of the convention center and were quite disappointed with our stay. The rooms are absolutely cave-like, paint is peeling off the walls, and bathrooms are antiquated. Rooms are very small, you must take the elevator to get ice, and lighting in rooms is terrible. Smoke smell was so strong that we had to leave after the second day - and we had a non-smoking room. A/C is so loud and squeeky that you can hardly sleep. Elevators are so slow and breakfast is a joke!! The only high point was they offered a car service that delivered us to the door of the convention (and anywhere in a few mile radius of the hotel). By the time you tip the driver, about the price of a cab ride, however. We had him take us right over to th Joule, where you will be as satisified as we were on our third night!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with Character”
Reviews.Author: Tengak
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the downtown business district. The building itself is old with the red Pegasus neon sign on top, linking it to the Magnolia Petroleum Company in its hey days. Although renovated it exudes a dark aura. The colour scheme of the room also did not help with its grey walls, dark carpet & wooden louvres on the windows. However, the front desk was helpful and efficient. The same can be said of the staff at the buffet breakfast. This complimentary meal is available to all guests in The Lounge on the mezzanine floor. You get sausages, bacon, porridge, toast etc., fresh fruits, juices, tea and coffee. Completely self service so just grab your stuff and grab a table or share one with others. Eggs are served by a chef at an adjacent station, but a charge of around $6 is levied. Anyway the free stuff is more than enough for a good breakfast. From 5:30 pm to 6:30 pm, you can get a free drink at the bar in The Lounge. Then from 8 to 10 pm there's hot milk & cookies. These complimentary services are quite unique. The lifts were not modern and fast. We were there at the Labor Day weekend, with lots of guests wanting to go down in the morning, making getting into a lift an interminable wait. Lifts after lifts were full. In our room the airconditioner outlet was facing directly our beds. As a result the blast of air was hitting my face/head full on, which became unpleasant after awhile. However, there was a major heatwave in Dallas then and it would be just as uncomfortable to turn the airconditioning off. We just had to tolerate the oft interrupted sleep. The hotel is quite close to the Neiman Marcus store and about 3 blocks away from the Akard Station if you need to use the DART rail system. We found that was quite a convenient way to get around Dallas or further afield. There was also the complimentary hotel shuttle which you can use to get to other downtown areas. If you're looking for somewhere else to eat there are restaurants behind the hotel in the next street (Main Street).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: cgrant2708
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. Clean, welcoming, elegant. The staff were amazing. We asked at the front desk for advice on how to get to the west end for the TX OU festivities. As we started walking towards it, the man who had been at the front desk chased us down in the street to tell us that he just found out that the event was supposed to end earlier than he had thought. It was very kind of him to leave his post and find us in the busy street. The staff were also fabulous about ensuring our safe transportation to the Texas state fair on the craziest day of the year, as well as driving us to uptown later that night. Overall, the hotel is great, but the staff go above and beyond to make sure the experience is fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlaskaFirstTime
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a well restored old high rise building. The original carvings and ceiling fresco in the elevator lobby have been well restored. Don't know the history of the building, but it appears it may have been an office building for the old Mobil Oil company, with the flying red horse logo on the elevators and lighted sculpture on the roof. Front desk staff was extremely helpful., both prior to the stay when I called with questions and once I arrived. I had requested a room that was on the 7th floor or lower via the internet reservation. The request was honored and I was assigned a 5th floor room. The front desk provided a coupon for a complimentary appetizer at a restaurant near by when I asked for directions. Possibly because it was Sunday night and it helped send business to the near by restaurant, but no matter the motivation, it was a welcome extra.The room was decorated in the sophisticated style of New York or LA. Dark rich colors, indirect lighting. Luxurious feeling. Do not expect the suburbia style room with fluorescent over head lights and large windows. You are in a high rise in a downtown area. Comfortable beds. The elevator issue mentioned in other reviews did not pose a problem. My stay was on a Sunday night when the facility did not have a large number of guests. I would image if the hotel was full, like during a football weekend at the Cotton Bowl, the elevators would probably be slow. The valet parking was convenient and by calling from my room prior to going downstairs and checking out, the car was ready when I got there. Again, if the hotel was busy, it may be another issue. Taxes are high on both the room and the valet parking service. Not a fault of the hotel, but it does increase your per night rate significantly. The location has a disadvantage of being in downtown Dallas for a leisure stay. Very few restaurants are open in downtown Dallas on Sunday night. I was please with my stay and would stay here again if I wanted to be in Downtown Dallas, TX.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as it used to be”
Reviews.Author: Meg M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magnolia for the 5th time for the UT/OU game weekend. This year for the first time, they required all payment upfront and it was nonrefundable, even though we made the reservation in June for an October weekend. The rate was way too high for the rather small, worn room that we got--about $850+ for two nights. The breakfast and afternoon reception are nice, but the hotel seems a little past its prime and definitely not worth $400+ a night. On Friday night, there was a very loud band that we could hear clearly in our room even though we were on the 16th floor.

Reviews.Title: “This is a unique hotel with great service, amenities and convenience to business in the downtown Dallas area.”
Reviews.Author: David J
Reviews.Content: The location of this facility is very convenient to the downtown Dalls business district. The staff was friendly, and the quality of the famility was well above average. I enjoyed my stay and will book again when I return to Dallas for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “I live in Dallas and proud of The Magnolia”
Reviews.Author: EbethDallas
Reviews.Content: I live in Dallas but stayed at the Magnolia as a small treat with my husband as we attended a reception nearby. Having lived in Dallas all my life, it was so fun to experience Dallas from a different perspective, as a visitor. Honestly, I love the impression the Magnolia gives of my city. The Magnolia has a historic feel but has been renovated with all kinds of modern comfort and decor. The price, location and accommodations were all excellent. If you are going to be in Dallas, I strongly recommend renting a car as that is the best way to navigate the city. The cost for parking is $24 for come and go valet or $12 for a one-time park. You have other options of where to stay that are new and right in the middle of action but I prefer staying somewhere just a few miles away for a better night's rest. The complimentary brunch on Sunday is exceptional, especially considering it is complimentary. There are some nicer restaurants nearby but if you want something more casual or more options, there are plenty of options within a few miles. You can use the 3 mile radius hotel shuttle or take a short drive to the Deep Ellum area for the Twisted Root or Cafe Brazil (kind of grungy in a good way part of Dallas). You can also go to McKinney Ave. where there are a variety of restaurants and pubs (The Gingerman has an unbelievable amount of beers on tap in a great old wooden house). If you want some higher end shopping and more food options, go north on 75 to the North Park Mall area. For more nightlife- bars, clubs and indie music concerts, look up Lower Greenville. For events, you are seconds away from the American Airlines Center and surrounding area. For biking/walking, head to the Katy Trail or White Rock Lake. All of these things are within 10 miles of the Magnolia. Having been downtown countless times, it was nice staying in a room on a higher floor and seeing the ornate work on the tops of the buildings I've only seen from street level. If I ever had a reason to get away again, this would be my choice. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “extra special treats”
Reviews.Author: Midlsistr
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a decent size. the rooms are up to date in a very historic building. But you still have to remember this is and old hotel. They added bonuses were the complimentary wifi, the breakfast, the managers hour, and the cookies and milk hour betweens 8:00 pm -10:00, These are all a wonderful treat as oppose to hotels that nickel and dime you. You can get a rate that includes valet parking as they become available. Over all a very nice hotel

Reviews.Title: “Epic fail - had a terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: BKVIV
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel at 330 pm, which was 24 hours after leaving my home in Melbourne Australia. Was told I couldn't check in because the system was down. 3 hours later was able to check in, but couldn't get into my room because the access card was coded invorrectly. Had to go back down to reception to be recoded. When I got into the room the hot water wasn't working....grh.... Other problems were the WiFi constantly went down, couldn't make calls from my room because the phone was broken - sat,yed for 4 days but was never fixed. Called down to Valet to organize for car to be brought out, but no one was there...WTF. no doubt I had a combination of bad luck, but with so many other hotels on offer I suggest best to chose another one.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, good location.”
Reviews.Author: rjintx
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (kids, 14 & 10) stayed at The Magnolia for three nights while attending the State Fair. The location was good, not too far away and easy access to the freeway with plenty of restaurant options nearby. The staff was very friendly and helpful! The hotel was in good shape and clean. We took advantage of the complimentary breakfast as well as the paid omelet station and both were good. Not the best we had ever had, but no complaints. The kids really enjoyed the complimentary cookies and milk in the evening, of course. Valet parking was $22/night which, compared to other major cities, is a pretty good price. Of course self parking would be nice and I'm sure you could probably self park in a nearby garage but we didn't look in to that since we were unfamiliar with the area. Would possibly look at that if staying there in the future. I believe the valet uses a nearby garage anyway. Our room was well appointed and clean. The beds were pretty comfortable, a little on the firm side. A/C worked well but was loud, you could definitely tell when it was running but it wasn't a bothersome noise. This is an older building so you can hear the inner workings such as plumbing, etc. Again, nothing bothersome to us. I had read that the higher floors are quieter and had requested a higher floor at check in which I could have got but opted for the larger room on the 6th floor that was also offered. In hindsight, I would have stuck with the higher floor. Road noise on the 6th floor was bothersome, especially when someone playing loud bass was stopped at the intersection at 2am and it rattled the windows enough to jar me out of a dead sleep. Go with a higher floor! The large garden tub in the bathroom was nice and I liked having drawers in the vanity especially since there really wasn't a convenient place to hang my toiletry bag. The lighting in the bathroom was sufficient as well, always a concern when putting on makeup. Overall, for the price we paid, location, and amenities, I thought this hotel was an excellent value. I would certainly consider staying there again if I return to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and Comfy”
Reviews.Author: TXRach
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great! The hotel is very clean and well decorated--it really makes you feel like you are somewhere special. It still has an old charm about it, since it's an old building, but the decor is fresh and modern. Our room was very comfortable. The shower was nice and hot and the bed was awesome! The complementary breakfast was above and beyond your average hotel fare. We also used the car service (available within a 3 mile radius) to take us to dinner. The driver was very friendly and courteous, as was all the other staff we encountered during our stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel to couples and even families needing a place to stay in downtown Dallas. (We saw plenty of families with children, and they have a milk and cookies reception in the evening--perfect for kiddos!)

Reviews.Title: “Saved the day!”
Reviews.Author: Anna K
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel. Beautiful building and great location. The staff was so kind and helpful. When the shuttle bus to take guests to the wedding we were attending didn't come, the staff put us in hotel cars and got us to the wedding just in time. Thanks so much!!

Reviews.Title: “Expectations of a Luxury Hotel Not Met”
Reviews.Author: Jaclyn B
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very excited to celebrate our first wedding anniversary at this hotel as this was the first time for either of us to stay in a luxury hotel. I will say that the hotel itself was very nice and well kept, however, the service we received and our room were below our expectations. Several days in advance, I requested that upon arrival for there to be sparkling cider in our room. Once we arrived, it wasn't in our room and I had to call guest services to get room service to deliver it. We were charged the full amount and not even issued an apology. Additionally, there was a giant crack in our tub that was causing water damage below and around the tub itself and made us unable to take a bath, which is very aggravating when you are spending a romantic weekend away (especially since one of the main reasons we selected this hotel was for the garden sized tub). Furthermore, the breakfast was decent, but not what I expected from a luxury boutique hotel, as it was a very limited in selection. Lastly, the valet service was so backed up on Sunday morning when we checked out that we had to wait 20 minutes to get our car to leave and were unable to call in advance (they weren't accepting phone calls). Overall, I anticipated a smoother, worry-free experience and instead was unimpressed with the overall "value" of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Central and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Steve P
