Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel early after travelling by Greyhound. We were able to walk to the hotel from the bus station and even though we arrived by midday, the receptionist kindly gave us our room and we were able to explore Downtown Dallas. Our warm and considerate welcome flowed through to every aspect of our stay. The room was most comfortable, the breakfast more than adequate and the staff polite and attentive. To add to the hotels hospitality was the offer of two free drinks in the early evening. The position of the Magnolia was an added bonus. We were only a 15 minute walk to Dealey Plaza , the Tourist Information Centre and the historical and entertainment district. The metro was only a couple of blocks away. We were there for two days, next time we will stay longer. The elevators are real fun!

Reviews.Title: “Magical getaway”
Reviews.Author: Kellie R
Reviews.Content: So far, the Magnolia is winning "Best Dallas Hotel" in my book. My husband and I (Dallas residents) stayed here for our anniversary this year and it proved to be the romantic, stress-free getaway we were hoping for. Check-in was swift and easy. Hotel staff were pleasant and helpful, quickly accommodating our special requests. We were able to upgrade to a suite for just a little extra cost than a regular room. I had read some reviews stating that the elevators were painfully slow, but I did not find this to be the case. The Magnolia has impressive historical significance, yet it's updated and modern. Our suite was so beautiful and calm-inducing that I took mental notes, hoping to recreate the look and feel of the design at home. Spacious room, comfy bed, room temperature (we were able to control) nice and cool. I loved the soft robe and bought one to take home. It's just not a vacation without room service, and room service at the Magnolia is top-notch. The cheese plate and jalapeno-bacon grilled cheese we ordered were delicious, arrived quickly, and just the right temperature. I admit I was suspicious of the complimentary cocktail hour and bedtime cookies and milk, wary that the Magnolia may offer these things as a way to apologize for the areas in which it lags. Happily, everything about the hotel surpassed my expectations, so the cocktails and cookies were just added perks. The location of the hotel itself is fantastic. It's situated within walking distance of a peaceful courtyard, Margarita Ranch, Walt Garrison Rodeo Bar, and the Dallas Fish Market, making a night out on the town possible with very little planning or effort. Of course, it's right in the heart of downtown so anything else you could want to do during your stay (art, performances, Dallas World Aquarium, etc.) is also easily accessible. I've stayed at many hotels that were more expensive but not nearly as wonderful as the Magnolia. It's a great value without sacrificing quality. Perfect little escape in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Charming city center hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leigh H
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel - great central location, good value, but more to the point exuding charm; the building and architecture, the service (inclusive happy hour, cookies, breakfast and wifi) and the friendly and helpful staff, particularly Jaclyn on the Front Desk. Would certainty recommend this and go back.

Reviews.Title: “Astounding”
Reviews.Author: Ferny R
Reviews.Content: While I was not able to spend too much time in the Hotel, it really was a great place to stay. Staff was very friendly, breakfast was the best I've had, at a hotel, and the views were awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service will use again”
Reviews.Author: JanaShaw
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my stay there. From arrival the valet/ concerige staff to the front desk were wonderful. Anything I needed was very prompt and friendly. Room was very modern and clean. Loved the soak tub and Ihome BED WAS AMAZING! Will use them again

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: Mar H
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent time and plan on returning and telling my freinds about you all as well.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: daneagle
Reviews.Content: great hotel, daniel treated me like a king whenever i entered the lobby

Reviews.Title: “wow! Great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Teddy R
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia made me and my girlfriend felt like we were VIP's. The staff really went out of there way to help us. We had a sight visit for our wedding coming and Jessica Smith was so helpfull and answered all of our questions. They're even pet friendly and allowed us to bring on 4 legged friend Brodie with us.( for a small fee) Thank you!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accomodations and location.”
Reviews.Author: Joanne B
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at this hotel. I wish we could have stayed long enough to enjoy the happy hour, cookies and milk as well as breakfast. The beds were comfy, the bathroom huge, the view nice. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Lots of character, huge rooms, central location”
Reviews.Author: Jeremy A
Reviews.Content: We booked a queen suite on short notice and were pleasantly surprised at how large and cozy it was. Front desk could've been more helpful on some basic questions, but the hotel has lots of character and is pretty cool.

Reviews.Title: “Take it or leave it attitude”
Reviews.Author: Bzilonis
Reviews.Content: I booked a queen suite, and upon arrival I was given a room that barely fit the bed. Hotel manager didn't even have the courtesy to advise me. Attitude of hotel was too bad we don't have any more suites. Don't care you booked it in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: FlyMom10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel in late August. Took cab from DFW airport($50) and Carlos was waiting at the door with a smile to take our bags. We checked in around noon (2pm listed) and Carlos was waiting and took bags and showed us the room and amenities. Our room was a suite on a high floor and exceeded our expectations. 3 rooms.. Bedroom had closet with full ironing board with starch, flatscreen tv, and the best black out shades over blinds. batgoffered wonderful soaps and the hallway had a full size painting. The living area that a long couch, flatscreen, work area, coffee table. Oh, and all tge lights had plugIns.. I love that!!! Our kitchen was full size kitchen just like an apartment. Utensils, pots and pans, and even a single cup coffee maker. Breakfast was hot eggs, a meat and French toast or other treats. They also had breads, yogurts, and fresh fruit... The best and every morning complimentary! There is also a happy hour with two free drinks(they do need a snack- nuts or pretzels) hot cookies and milk from 8 to 10 and they were yummy.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: nimokui
Reviews.Content: One heck of a business trip. Could not sleep most of last night. Spent a lot of time scratching. By morning I had marks/ swellings all over my body and went to talk to the receptionist. She seemed like she did not Know what to do and tried to blame me for the problem. Contacted the manager and they switched my room. They were very apologetic, will not charge me for the emtire stay of the trip annd offered for me to go to the hospital. Have pictures of black things all over on the matress. Needless to stay will never be back here again. Will have to inform the corprate booking agent of the incident

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice for us”
Reviews.Author: travelingpeople24
Reviews.Content: We were in Dallas for a wedding in which rooms had been arranged for at the Magnolia. The hotel itself is a beautiful piece of Dallas history and overall the staff did a tremendous job. The breakfast buffet was very good and if that wasn't enough food for somebody, an omelet bar was available for an additional $4.95. However, we had one wash rag in our room and when calling for extra, we were brought towels but no wash rags. Also, our room faced an outdoor bar, complete with DJ, that was very loud. We would probably not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was simply amazing as it always is!”
Reviews.Author: tiffsha01
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and will remain a customer no complaints and I love the extra's. I love that you are able to order room service without paying an arm and a leg. The staff is amazing, the room are beautiful the valet service is one of a kind. I could keep going on an on but just stay and you will see for youself. Amazing

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was amazing.”
Reviews.Author: Kewpaloop
Reviews.Content: When booking ask for suite 2458! Historic room on the 24th floor. Makes you feel like a celebrity with a room so high and so large! Views and beds were amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Magnolia Hotel Stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: SVaughn1
Reviews.Content: Overall the stay was very good; very courteous staff and pleasant surroundings. The architecture of the building is very cool and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. I particularly liked the high ceilings of the room -- although I was barely in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel With Personality - Just Be Sure It Matches Yours!”
Reviews.Author: GibsonCRG
Reviews.Content: The TripAdvisor reviews we read were generally spot-on: this is a great property, with attentive staff and service, and (to us) some pretty darned attractive pricing. Our only sore spot was the street noise, which kept us from getting a great night's sleep. We arrived just after 3:00 PM on a holiday-weekend Saturday for an overnight stay. Valet experience was great and they accommodated our request to keep the car close at hand as we were departing again within the hour. The front desk staff was helpful, and got us into our room (a "Queen Suite") quickly. At that time of day, it's a quiet and serene property. Our suite was delightful, and on a high floor (21st floor). It comes with a small kitchen, a nice bathroom, and a main sitting area in addition to the bedroom. It smelled pleasant and clean, and it's a corner room so we had a number of pleasant views of downtown Dallas. Some Things We Really Liked About Our Stay: - The valet experience was truly wonderful that first night and they handled our special request for quick access without complaint; to make matters more challenging for them, I forgot to leave my keys, but they were very nice about it. Later in the weekend, though, they aren't kidding about giving them 10-15 minutes lead time, so plan for that. - Free WiFi! I can't believe every place doesn't offer this, but it's worth mentioning those that do. - The size and shape of the tub make showering a truly pleasant and spacious experience; it's enough beyond the typical experience to make mention of. Things We Weren't So Happy About: - The Street Noise! Even 21 floors up, the other reviewers aren't kidding about the street noise. People, cars, sirens, mystery noises - it keeps going well into the wee hours. I would wish for some double-paned glass, or some other sound insulation trick. Light sleepers, beware. - Lighting in the bathroom was not really sufficient for my lady to be happy applying her makeup. Not enough light, the placement of the lights is poor, and the color tones were weird. - There's no business-type desk area, so nowhere is there a place to put your computer that's at a comfortable operating height. Things Just Worth Mentioning: - When we arrived back from a show around 11:30 PM, the door is locked and you need a key to get in. - Also at 11:30 PM, the crowd around the hotel is definitely a young, hip scene. We didn't feel unwelcome, there were just a surprising number of folks crowding in and around the lobby and sidewalk areas. Summing up, this is a nice property, it definitely has personality, and the staff deserves a thumbs up all around. That said, the "personality" is distinct, and might not be to everyone's liking. This is not your generic business hotel - it's a property with a style all its own, and I think it's worth experiencing (especially with its attractive price point), but if I was traveling on business, I will probably look to a different property for my next stay. That being said, I still give this hotel a strong rating - so long as you know what you're getting!

Reviews.Title: “Love the hospitality and the service. Very comfortable room and breakfast when you awake in the morning.”
Reviews.Author: PJeanL5754
Reviews.Content: We love to stay at the Magnolia. We love the breakfast and the cookies waiting when we get back in the evenings. The shuttle service is great if you want to venture out on the town at night.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay, just as good as the first.”
Reviews.Author: AdamCU
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay. The room was clean and the service was very friendly. My wife especially appreciates the free cookies and milk! The bed was very comfortable and while we didn't have the absolute best view from the 22nd floor looking west, we did have a spectacular sunrise when the sun shone off the buildings downtown. We didn't have any ice machines on our floor, but room service was there within a couple of minutes with a bucket of ice for us. We didn't notice any other noise on our floor even though the hotel was very busy that weekend. This was our second stay at the Magnolia and it was just as great as the first. If you are a government employee, be sure to make your reservation through the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, and Comfortable minus the screams and noises outside at 2 a.m from the bar crowds!”
Reviews.Author: hharmon
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with all the perks. We stayed on the side closest to the front of hotel on the 9th floor. From about 2 am -3 am I heard loud screams and hollaring from outside after the bars closed down. I know this is out of the hotels control, so many want to get a room no facing the street to miss these noises and enjoy the comfy beds and get some sleep! :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Downtown Hotel Experience!”
Reviews.Author: kate m
Reviews.Content: Art Deco Stylish Historic hotel. Greeted us with sincerity. We told them it was our daughter's birthday. She was 7. They hand delivered a signed card + balloons to our room, made an origiami crane and did a magic trick for her! We had milk and cookies that night in the lobby. The hot tub was broken and they were really apologetic about it. We were on the 26th floor which was fantastic! The views of the city were great. Room was big/clean. The mini fridge was too mini. The TV felt the same way. The bath products smelled expensive and I took all of the them! The breakfast was good! I would definitely recommend this hotel. We will be back. It is also close to the original Neiman Marcus which is cool too.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it should have been”
Reviews.Author: Tripp F
Reviews.Content: Dark rooms. Poor outlet planning. Confused staff...was the whirlpool being repaired or was it done? (never got an answer). Corporate rate higher than regular online rate. Room service order wrong...though what I got was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price.”
Reviews.Author: Louisiana80
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the weekend for the LSU vs Oregon game and was glad I decided to switch to this hotel. From the moment we walked in we were excited for our stay. Nice charm to this "older" hotel and we enjoyed the old look of the elevator banks. Stayed in a queen suite, which was plenty big enough for my wife and I. The only thing we would change would be for them to have king beds in them. All the staff was courtesy and very helpful. The location was great as well, in the heart of downtown near many restaurants. They did offer many other services but we only used the valet and the Wifi. The valet service was nice and we usually did not have to wait very long for our vehicle. The Wifi was easy to use and was speedy compared to some other hotels Wifi I have used before. Overall, it was a great experience and would recommend this hotel if someone is looking for a hotel in downtown Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel with charm”
Reviews.Author: eilerman5000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located in downtown Dallas. Easy access to highways and restraunts. Hotel staff was friendly and very helpful. The evening social in the lounge was cool, spacious and great staff. Ths shuttle service was great too. Complimentary breakfast was much better than I am use to at Marroitt chains. Rooms are nice and suite was spacious with good views.

Reviews.Title: “cool building”
Reviews.Author: vaycay3000
Reviews.Content: Not a bad place to stay. It was a very unique building, easy in and out, comfy, updated and nice. Had adjoining rooms to another room one of our family members was staying in with a kitchenette and sitting area. Not bad for the $!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with good location in downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Explore_Beach
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite (good size bedroom with great closet, good sized living room, and a kitchenette) for two nights. The staff (reception, valet,..) were very helpful and friendly. We had a problem with high pitch noise in our roomâ€™s air conditioning system that was fixed immediately after speaking with the hotel reception desk. The valet was courteous and great. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with large rooms and fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: ssreviewtoday
Reviews.Content: Have never stayed at The Magnolia Hotel but will definitely return. The customer service was exceptional from start to finish. They also offered complimentary drinks, cookies and milk and full breakfast in the morning. Rooms are large, ours had a full kitchen, large bathroom, and separate bedroom with walkin closet. We were there on an extremely busy weekend and you would have never known because they had so many employees working that we never had to wait for anything, such as bell service or velet.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and for a good price”
Reviews.Author: HeatherA811
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice. We loved the evening reception and cookie bar. We'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, we will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Southernlady101
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel: clean, friendly, convenient, and reasonably price!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Magnolia Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosie313
Reviews.Content: Every staff person I encountered was courteous. The evening reception was well attended by all, however, the staff counts how many times you've had a free cocktail like it's coming out of their pockets. Location was perfectly situated in the heart of Downtown Dallas and within walking distance to events planned during my stay. Neiman Marcus is but a stones throw away from Magnolia's doors. My suite was clean, and the bathroom and kitchen were updated. I really felt like I was at home at the Magnolia. Two thumbs up! Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “SO BEAUTIFUL! VERY CLEAN & SUPER FRIENDLY!!”
Reviews.Author: MEME-LA-09
Reviews.Content: The hotel is sooo beautiful. We splurged for the suite which was worth every penny & more!! up on the 23rd floor, beautiful view that made us feel like we were in a swanky NY loft. Very clean and had a full kitchen!! Clean, nicely decorated, layout of the hotel. There is NO pool though. Very nice gym, with great views, makes you want to work out & never leave, lol. All of the staff was sooo nice! They even provided us with a driver for local drop off's (for a charge) we felt so fancy getting dropped off in a nice SUV rather than a dirty cab. Very nice touch!!! The dining area & bar are really nice, the free breakfast is ummm what you would expect for free! The bagels & cream cheese were good though! french toast, ugh, not so much. Whatever you do, DO NOT order take out from the chinese restaurant they recommend =l it was expensive ($60 for 2 fried rice & kung pao chick & broc/beef, 4 things!) and it gave me food poisoning for a full day of my vacation! The staff at the front desk, valet & bar were so nice :) They always recognized us & seemed happy to see us, and help us with anything we needed. I did not have a full length mirror in my room (such a bummer!) but when I called to ask about that, they apologized & had one set up in our room within 20 mins!!! I wasn't expecting that, and it was great! I highly recommend this hotel & I will stay at a Magnolia each & every chance I get!!!! I got the Four Seasons treatment for Holiday Inn prices!! You cant beat that.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Diane T
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, great location and rooms. Comfy beds...would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: terryk&mikeb
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia is a wonderful hotel, a contemporary hotel located in a building from the 1920's. It is fun and hip, and walking distance to many restaurants. The staff are delightful. The room could be a bit brighter, but it was not a major problem. A bit noisy when the clubs close and people return to the hotel late at night. For what we paid, the value was outstanding. We would stay here again when next in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, good value!”
Reviews.Author: Caryn M
Reviews.Content: Great staff - very friendly - and very quiet rooms make for a really nice stay. Free wifi - a bonus given this type of hotel usually tries to charge for it. Our company doesn't pay for inroom wifi so I end up having to pay for it myself at the nicer hotels... which kinda burns when you know that less expensive hotels (e.g., Courtyard, Drury Inn) offer it free. Very nice rooms. My only nitpicky items were that the pillows were a little dense and there was only one mirror, with no natural light near it. (Not an issue for guys, of course.) Would have loved a second mirror, even better to have a full length mirror, near a window. Otherwise, outstanding experience - I'd go again and would also recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Allways enjoy and will be back”
Reviews.Author: capnmarshall
Reviews.Content: Checked in late but still gave me the show rate,staff was outstanding

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our room!”
Reviews.Author: Lydia P
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! Excellent Location, nearby to shopping, great restaurants and entertainment sites. The evening reception was a pleasant break in our day.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: sue0317
Reviews.Content: Great value with the Keeping Dallas under $100 promotion!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, chic and affordably delightful for our one night stay...”
Reviews.Author: DFWAsh
Reviews.Content: Booking over the phone was a breeze. The reception with free drinks in the lobby was an awesome way to be greeted and we were surprised to find the free shuttle service by valet within 3-miles of the hotel, which we put to use. Great room, with modern decor in an older, architecturally interesting building, which breaks up the monotony that hotels can become. Breakfast was deelish, too.

Reviews.Title: “The staff were so supportive and helpful during our meeting. I would recommend this hotel for anyone!”
Reviews.Author: Sydney M
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel overall, however, I would really recommend for persons hosting a small meeting event. The staff were flexible and accomodating. There were not a lot of food choices in walking distance, but the overall experience was very pleasing!

Reviews.Title: “The service is Five Star!”
Reviews.Author: bekaharetz
Reviews.Content: The rooms are as comfortable as The Ritz and the staff is magnificant! Updated decor and quiet! This will be our new home away from home. We come to Dallas once a month to visit our daughter and grandkids, this is by far our favorite in Downtown now.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT STAY”
Reviews.Author: baadgill
Reviews.Content: I was there for a convention last year. I simply can't express how convenient it was to stay there. Shopping next door. Walking distance to some of the finest restaurants. Great service. Nice and clean rooms. Would return

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Newlywed_7
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia is a modern, business-oriented hotel in downtown Dallas, TX. It's in a great location downtown and is within walking distance of many restaurants and the JFK Museum. The room was small, but had everything you need: average bed with plenty of pillows, LCD TV, desk, oversized shower in a large bathroom. As far as amenities go, the hotel has a complementary breakfast and free milk & warm cookies available before bed every night! There is also a nice bar area located on the second floor with lots of seating. And there is a Starbucks on the first floor. There are a few computers you can use but you must pay per use. The wi-fi was a little spotty in my room. There is a decent workout room and a tiny (2 person) hot tub available for the entire hotel; no pool. The worst part of the hotel was that there is no parking onsite (the lot is a few blocks over and in a run down neighborhood) and the valet is run separately from the hotel. Most annoying was that the valet would not allow you to schedule a pick up time for your car on Sunday morning, instead saying to come down when you want the car and they'll have it within 15 minutes. That's a waste of my 15 minutes. That being said, I don't know what the parking situation is for the rest of the hotels in downtown Dallas. The hotel itself is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, sophisticated--perfect in all details”
Reviews.Author: Lyle B
Reviews.Content: Couldn't recommend more highly. Great historic building--friendly, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and exceptional quality for an urban downtown location.”
Reviews.Author: ilisko
Reviews.Content: Perfect combination of historic nostalgia, modern convenience, great service, and ample amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Girls Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Gina H
Reviews.Content: Amazing time! The wine reception was phenomenal. The milk and cookies made me smile. And the Valet boys Adam and Mario were amazing! A great experience all the way around. Rooms were great but the individualized service is what was amazing

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic hotel with outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: 081311trip
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about this hotel. The staff was so friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time to stay and love it.”
Reviews.Author: AmandaBLoet
Reviews.Content: The rooms are beautiful. I enjoyed the vallet parking and the room service was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Dennis C
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel located in a historic building. Itâ€™s very close to shopping and attractions. The hotel is near West End and right next to Neiman Marcus. The cocktail receptions and the cookies and milk are nice treats!

Reviews.Title: “A suite deal --kind of like a residence inn with extra (v)room!!”
Reviews.Author: ziltron
Reviews.Content: the hotel magnolia is nice. it's not as nice as my house but it's nicer than a residence inn. for 3 days I stayed in a 2 bedroom suite equivalent. A regular queen bed suite plus a 2 bedroom suite. The 2 bedrooms shared the common area. A full functional kitchen was present. the kitchen was nice. the service was excellent. the food was very okay ..like a pretty good wannabe frou frou restaurant you know? the restaurant and room service hours were somewhat limited. room service ended at 11 pm. Still better than the residence inn which has no room service. the hotel was very close to lots of good restaurants. I thought the hotel's location was excellent. overall I think the hotel is an excellent blend of value , class and comfortableness(not a word but you know what I mean). BTW ... the 2 bedroom suite was nearly 1000 square feet. I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Older downtown hotel building with lots of character, kept in great shape with modern comforts.”
Reviews.Author: BCIcan
Reviews.Content: Granted, I stayed at the government discounted rate, but considering how nice the hotel was, it was a steal! From the nightly happy hour (really happy when its free!) to the friendly staff and good hot breakfasts along with a really comfortable room, this was an excellent stay. When I return to Dallas, I'm not looking anywhere besides the Magnolia. I definitely recommend trying the Iron Cactus restaurant next door also.

Reviews.Title: “This was better than expected!!”
Reviews.Author: MKINPINK
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and courteous. If you needed something they found it for you.

Reviews.Title: “It was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Tammy M
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days/4 nights at the Magnolia Hotel in Dallas and I have nothing bad to say! The driver was ready and waiting when we arrived in Dallas and took us right to the hotel. The front desk service was fantastic and so helpful. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable!! Housekeeping kept my room clean and was always prompt with requests. The food service was great, the cocktail hour was lovely and the milk and cookies at night made me feel like a kid again! The entire staff was friendly and I will most certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: captain1965
Reviews.Content: The staff provided a friendly atmosphere that was a great example of southern hospitality. The room was clean and provided a spectacular view of beautiful downtown Dallas. This hotel is a part of the history of Dallas and is one of the best ways to experience and enjoy this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, great for a Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: Uclagrad92
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my 3 day stay. The food from room service and the breakfast buffet was excellent. The cookies at night were a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Registration was quick & easy, Staff very helpful & friendly, Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: granny05
Reviews.Content: From the valet, front desk, just hotel staff in general, was very polite and ready to do whatever they could to help make you welcomed. My room had a great view & bed very comfortable. My grand children(and husband) loved the cookies & milk,never had this at other hotels. Nice touch. We were here for a wedding, missed the evening activities.

Reviews.Title: “11 Years and the Dallas Magnolia still ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: randilincoln
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is OVER THE TOP! The Magnolia ROCKS DALLAS! Happy hour and cookies and milk at bedtime...doesn't get any better...EXCEPT for the awesome staff! They listen, care and make it RIGHT! Thanks Magnolia! :-)

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely return. The milk & cookies are wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: LeslieLilie
Reviews.Content: Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Loved this hotel. Because it is a historic building, the elevators do not run quickly. It may test your patience. For me it was worth the slight inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “THe Best”
Reviews.Author: elitefleetrox
Reviews.Content: They we awesome..the valet service was amazing.. they made sure we got where we needed to go.. No lines or waiting.. we were on time for everything. and they provided water with the heat...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodations and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: AKlett
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. The staff was friendly and accommodating and the room was very clean and comfortable. I'd definitely stay here again when visiting Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff, Warm Cookies before you say good night and comfortable rooms at an affordable price. Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: gaetana1229
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel & we will definitely book again when in the Dallas area.

Reviews.Title: “BRAVO! Incredible Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: mypinklink
Reviews.Content: Incredible customer service! Will definately be back! Bravo to the entire staff!

Reviews.Title: “Someone is always there to help you but no one is In your way...love the staff!”
Reviews.Author: cocobi
Reviews.Content: Great beds, fantastic breakfast each morning, perfect place to stay. I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home, with the most courteous and gracious of staff.”
Reviews.Author: LAMagoo
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to the Convention Center, a block away from the Urban Market, around the block from a terrific Mexican Restaurant. All this with breakfast buffet to boot!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle3818
Reviews.Content: My stay was EXCELLENT; the amenities offered were GREAT (Clean rm, the most comfortable bed ever! A great breakfast is included with hotel rate (so free!) and the free shuttle service was a very convenient and valuable free service offered (you never had to wait more than 5 minutes for the shuttle to/from the convention ctr). The hotel was within walking distance (several blocks) to the convention ctr and centrally located to restaurants and some shopping. The staff and overall general services were AWESOME! I'll be back for sure! Michelle B. - Central Coast, CA

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise in this overflow hotel for a conference I attended!”
Reviews.Author: alcrowder
Reviews.Content: This was an overflow hotel selection for a recent conference I attended and a very pleasant surprise. Very user friendly and staff is so accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “This is our 5th stay here and we love it!”
Reviews.Author: Mybestfriend33051
Reviews.Content: We look forward each year to the annual Seminar with Mary Kay. We love, love, love this hotel. They treat us like queens and the staff is amazing. Thank you for making each and every stay memorable. We will return!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Dallas with the best staff I have ever encountered..”
Reviews.Author: hunebee13
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, and very well maintained. The staff is the best I have ever encountered. Reservations, check in, valet, drivers, waitress, bar tender, Service staff... were always friendly and ready to assist in any way they could. They served a hot and healthy breakfast with wonderful choices. The cookies and coffee hour was fun and so appreciated after a long day... I look forward to visiting this hotel again when in Dallas.. If I could give it 10 stars it would get 10...

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: mamonacella
Reviews.Content: - friendly & professional staff; gorgeous, clean & comfortable hotel; amazing breakfast buffet. LOVEIT

Reviews.Title: “Mary Kay Seminar 2011”
Reviews.Author: gidget568
Reviews.Content: A short walking distance from the convention center. The bed was very comfortable and the staff very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Personalized, Terrific Service - Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: stilltraveling1000
Reviews.Content: This is a great property of the Magnolia group hotels. I was very impressed with their individualized service, attention to detail and a great sense of esthetics. The front desk accommodates and the personnel remember your name and previous requests. This up-scale niche hotel will not treat you as a number! Also, super comfortable bed and HVAC. An amazing plate of fresh fruit. Impressive bathroom. Good suggestions for restaurants. I love the fact they have car service (by the hotel) to any place within a 3 mile radius. Hard to find anything to be improved! Whether you are coming for business or a romantic weekend, this hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Historic Hotel Downtown”
Reviews.Author: roamingraider
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Magnolia a few times over the years while on business. It is very nice and the staff has been nothing but super friendly. Our last trip we took our 2 year old son with us and stayed in one of the one bedroom suites. We got an excellent deal on one of the discounted websites (not sure if I can say the name). We arrived after the complimentary cookies and the nice lady at the front desk went to the back and got our son a cookie. We enjoyed our stay here very much. Only drawback is you almost have to valet and that runs about $20 a night.

Reviews.Title: “My Home A Way From Home”
Reviews.Author: FeliciaRenee
Reviews.Content: Great location, Near shopping centers such as Neiman Marcus, near the Dallas convention Center, near restaurants and a pharmacy. Friendly staff, A breakfast buffet that will start your day on the good foot! The Valet staff will bend over backwards for you and will go above and beyond the call of duty for you. You are greeted with warmth and made to feel at home. The rooms are clean. The beds are comfortable. The price is affordable. All that and then some. I highly recommend the Magnolia!

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay at the Dallas location and we absolutely love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cyntbush
Reviews.Content: Great location, service and rates. The suites are 5 amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service all around!”
Reviews.Author: SandraC61010
Reviews.Content: They are masters at handling large company goups with ease. We always stay here during our Mary Kay Seminar (convention) every year - of which there are 5 different groups. They handle the whole hotel emptying and refilling on the same day without a hitch, and we are always greeted by friendly, helpful service...especially the Valet guys...treat us like queens...from the moment we pull up until we depart (including friendly, efficient shuttle service to/from the convention center). Special shout out to Dustin (Valet) who went above and beyond the call of duty to fix the gear shift button in my car the day we left. We went to grab a bite to eat and returned to it fixed and were on our way home! Thanks again Dustin!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed and great rooms.”
Reviews.Author: lynnjlawson
Reviews.Content: Thank you to the staff for bringing me cookies to my room. I enjoyed the large quiet room and blinds on the window let me sleep late. Very pretty hotel. Valet was a bit slow.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: jadelbosque
Reviews.Content: stayed for more than a month and most of the staff was great. Only issue was the A/C throughout the hotel was always very, very cold. The room A/C also

Reviews.Title: “perfect location and yummy cookies!”
Reviews.Author: JennyJonesCox
Reviews.Content: we had a great time and we will be back and stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: KarenBonura
Reviews.Content: I love that this hotel is within walking distance to the convention center. With the free breakfast and cookies, it makes staying so pleasant and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back next year!”
Reviews.Author: buffie47
Reviews.Content: Outstanding and friendly service! .

Reviews.Title: “I loved it !! Can't wait to come back.”
Reviews.Author: HildaRiveraAsencio
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at The Magnolia! The customer service is excellent. The rooms and suites are immaculate clean and very comfortable. The valet service is great! I got everything I was expecting and much more! I will stay at The Magnolia on my next visit to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and adequate. Lounge food was great. Cookie and milk bar an added treat!”
Reviews.Author: natpat81
Reviews.Content: Definitely more of a business trip hotel. Nothing for the little ones. Even with the tv channels, not much for kids. No pool. Breakfast buffet was decent. Happy hour with complimentary drinks and nightly cookie and milk bar were great! Great downtown location with a short walk to the convention center. Beds were comfy. Had issues with the internet. But overall, I'd probably stay again, if I didn't have my 22 month old with me.

Reviews.Title: “A phenomenal hotel and staff to be around!”
Reviews.Author: sandyfritz
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed 8 years in staying in this hotel each summer and it is exceptional in every way: staff, food, rooms, valet, courtesy and friendliness galore - a must for everyone that comes to Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic three days/nights!!!”
Reviews.Author: LokiRoswell
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia is easy to find and easily accessible to major highways. Breakfast is included and above par. Staff was friendly, ready and eager to be of assistance. Rooms are large, clean, with full mirror, and the shower was one of the best I've experienced when traveling! We have been staying at the Dallas Magnolia every Summer for several years and have never had a negative moment.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, overall great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GinaShetzer
Reviews.Content: Overall, good experience. Popular hotel, close to a lot in Dallas, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Free beer...and a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: taqueeney
Reviews.Content: Yes, free beer, well thats at happy hour in the evening. Its a very nice touch for all the guests to come together in the bar and receive some refreshing beverages. Dallas was extremely hot when we stayed and this was a very nice way to wind into the evening (for a limited time of course). Breakfast was also included and was limited but adequate. This hotel appeared to be at its busiest around breakfast and was sometimes difficult to find a table, however no one appeared concerned with sharing. Fruit, juice, scones (biscuits in the US), gravy, bacon, and sausages. The room we stayed in was pleasant and spacious. This is a hotel to enjoy and not be in too much of a rush, the elevators will make sure you take your time. The decor and the elevators are all very old that provides a lovely charm to the property and you can put yourself make in the day when it would have been a different hustle and bustle with elevator operators etc. There are limited restaurants in this area, however there is a nice Texmex sports bar 1 street away that you can access through the valet parking area. In addition there are several other small quant bars and the locals are very happy to have a chat which is nice. Dallas was nice for a stopover, but for more than a few days I think you would want to see more of Texas as tourism seems to be a less important industry to Dallas city at the current time. JFK musesum/ 6th Floor museum is an excellent and close building to the Magnolia incl the train station. If your game, take a little stroll with some of the conspiracy theorists that will certainly help understand more of the evidence from a non-governmental perspective. HOT TIP! Book the taxi from the sport with the Magnolia. The trip costs approx $60 for a really nice ride. This is cheaper than the small dodgy taxi, and much more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “intensely appealing!”
Reviews.Author: parisoohlala1
Reviews.Content: Immaculately clean - beautiful! I stayed here with my husband for a wedding weekend in Dallas - I would totally recommend it. They even handed out happy hour vouchers/drink tickets when we checked in. Classy hotel. Loved the decor - and the room was staged very nicely. Felt like a creative room, not just a box hotel. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: kackabelly
Reviews.Content: Magnola is a homely atmosphere jus keep listening to your guest needs and you will stay on top

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: MarthaScott
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia Hotel Dallas is a cozy boutique hotel. The only draw back is not having a full service restaurant. It worked well for us since our lunch was provided at our event.

Reviews.Title: “Truly an accommodating hotel from the service personnel and cleaning personnel to the front desk. All amazing!”
Reviews.Author: CBaker2006
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It was wonderful! I cannot wait to come back and stay here! I went to Dallas for Mary Kay Seminar and I couldn't complain at all!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good ambience, amenities - excellent.”
Reviews.Author: golddust100
Reviews.Content: We will definately be back as soon as possible The staff were efficient and friendly, loved the foyer, the colors evoked a feeling of warmth and welcome. Great amenities! The valet service was very streamlined and the staff in that area were great!

Reviews.Title: “hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: marykaymary
Reviews.Content: Other than a room not being ready when we arrived, the Magnolia is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Dallas hotel & will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: twankle
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia Hotel was the hotel used for all the guest attending a friend's wedding in the city. Since we had a tight wedding schedule, I wasn't able to use all the services the hotel provided. Breakfast was fine, but get there early (unlike what I did) because the food will get cold. It is within walking distance to many bars/clubs (Plush was awesome!), a few good restaurants (Sol IrlandÃ©s), CVS, 7 11 & a few other places. The shuttle provided was very helpful in getting to the wedding since the venue which was only about 5mins away. The staff was very friendly & helpful. The rooms were a good size with a nice bathroom. Overall I had a great experience. I'll definitely look into staying at the Magnolia Hotel whenever I come back to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “BEST hotel I've stayed at in Convention Ctr area”
Reviews.Author: MIMI510
Reviews.Content: The rooms were all we needed them to be. For four women it was bit crowded but being on business there spent very little time in the room. The service overall was fabulous, WONDERFUL daily full breakfast (not coffee and pastries). I heard the evening reception was good but I never made it. Cookies and milk at night---what a nice touch! The valet desk was our most frequently used service and I cannlt say enough about how helpful they were getting us to our destination daily.....

Reviews.Title: “Magnolia Dallas - Truly an exceptional experience - I have stayed there almost every month for the past 5 years!”
Reviews.Author: swelch1184
Reviews.Content: An amazing value for the money - A boutique hotel with exceptional swagger. While in Dallaas I stay no where else.

Reviews.Title: “Milk and cookies”
Reviews.Author: Dedec1abc
Reviews.Content: Traveling with children can be difficult. Magnolia Hotel Dallas helped sooth weary travelers after a long day. The milk and cookies were a highlight for the whole family.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and the shuttle was wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: JennaMorrow
Reviews.Content: Hotel was lovely, bed was very comfortable, shower was very big, free cookies and breakfast were delicious. And the shuttle did a great job of getting us where we needed to go.

Reviews.Title: “Homecoming not Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: KJAtchity
Reviews.Content: Definitely recommend--best location for nearby restaurants--good variety.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay, nice people”
Reviews.Author: TrishTravels009
Reviews.Content: Very helpful front desk staff, and thorough housekeeping staff. If you have business downtown, good location.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelingLady88
Reviews.Content: Pleasently surprised. I usually stay at the "chain" hotels but thought I would try this one. You won't be disappointed in the property or the service. Excellent and accomodating staff.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed, Nice "extras"... can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: lclayto2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a last minute trip this summer, and was very impressed! Our room was clean and the bed was comfy. The only complaint was that the room was a tad dark and I would have liked an extra light, but our friends' room was on the other side of the building, and they had no issue with lighting. We were very impressed with the extras the hotel provided. Between a complimentary drink when we arrived between 5:30&6:30, and an amazing continental breakfast, they have me hooked. Usually when I go to a hotel breakfast, I expect some donuts, cereals, not-so-great eggs, etc. Well, this breakfast was closer to a full-on brunch than the typical hotel breakfast. They had fresh bacon, fresh eggs, good (not cheap) french toast, fresh oatmeal.... it was more of a buffet than a breakfast imo, and I was glad I made it up in time! Anyway I would definitely recommend this hotel if you're visiting downtown Dallas. Great for couples, or a quick weekend away. I would recommend parking across the street though... there is a Neimann Marcus parking garage... instead of using the valet. The garage is cheaper (I think) and you don't need to wait 20 minutees for the valet to get your car when you're ready to go. We did the valet, and next time I'll be parking in the garage.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend anyone booking a hotel any where Magnolia has a location book here.”
Reviews.Author: nataya33
Reviews.Content: The hotel offers a clean, safe and friendly environment. They offer a beer and wine reception as well as a cookie reception for a midnight treat. Everyone is so nice and always willing to help. I love this hotel and plan to stay at the one in Nebraska in May.

Reviews.Title: “Great and grand hotel. Terrific location. The breakfast, reception and cookies and milk were nice amenities.”
Reviews.Author: RonRossi
Reviews.Content: My assistant chose the hotel for me on a two day business trip to Dallas. It was not the usual corporate chain business hotel. The hotel itself is a Grand. The many amenities were perfect. Down to starch to spray your shirts when touching up. Internet was free (an annoyance when added as an upcharge). Milk and cookies were waiting in the lounge after I checked in. I saw there was a receipting every night and breakfast, The staff was very attentive. The doorman read my mind that I was looking for a cab and offerred the hotel car as an alternative. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Room disapointed with key service.”
Reviews.Author: TexasRP
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice and the staff was very friendly. The key system was not working on our visit and had to contact the front desk to send a staff member to open our room on arrival and as well as every time we exited the room. After dinner we once again had to contact the staff to open our room. The room was very nice and comfortable. The bathroom was very clean and large. The view was also great, just disapointed with the key service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a lot of character”
Reviews.Author: AussiegirlLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magnolia hotel Dallas as the last stop on our USA honeymoon (travelled from Australia). The hotel is lovely with a lot of character. We were booked into a queen suite and the room was great - large room, oversized tub in the bathroom etc. The staff were very friendly and helpful, providing recommendations for dining and drinking options, shopping and local attractions. The evening reception and night time cookies and milk were an added treat. It was the perfect end to our honeymoon and I would definitely stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend staying at the Magnolia to anyone/truly a five-star hotel!”
Reviews.Author: donnasabbia
Reviews.Content: I felt like royalty. The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful. The room ,ammenties, and location were outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Great Second Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: tisdell
Reviews.Content: We got married at the Magnolia two years ago and have made it an annual stay to celebrate our anniversary. The hotel couldn't be any better, and the staff sent us champagne and chocolate covered strawberries to celebrate our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Nice touches for Downtown quick stop”
Reviews.Author: pad1102
Reviews.Content: Easy in and out access in downtown Dallas. Valet's on hand to take our car and luggage, quick check in. We had a problem with the door lock and one phone call and 10 minutes later we were in a lovely room on the same floor. Complimentary evening drinks, milk and cookies made my husband very happy. I liked the roomy bathroom. We had a great view of 4th of July fireworks from 18th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Milk and cookies are always a good treat”
Reviews.Author: Jewelty
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Close to all of the great sites in and around downtown Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “For a quick stay prior to leaving town for a honeymoon, it met our needs perfectly”
Reviews.Author: hilld3
Reviews.Content: We left our wedding reception and needed a place prior to leaving for our honeymoon. I loved the people, the vibe and the decor. The only drawback was the less than stellar breakfast buffet quality. It was okay but not great. I like my breakfasts so this may not be a big deal for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is nice. The valet parking is a pain and expensive. The beds are comfortable. The hot tub was out of service.”
Reviews.Author: tcorley
Reviews.Content: The breakfast is taken up early so get there early. No pool that is a bad thing with children. The cookies and milk at night is nice.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH THE MONEY”
Reviews.Author: Tsumatt
Reviews.Content: Horrible experience. The rooms are cramped & the shades were broken, so we woke up to the sun beating down on our faces. The room was fairly clean, but as far as the beds go, they were not that comfortable at all. I would definitely recommend a Sheraton if comfort is what you desire. The Magnloia is just too pricy and you're paying for the name & the history, not the quality.

Reviews.Title: “We'll definitely stay there again!!!”
Reviews.Author: LoveMyKids2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magnolia for a June wedding. The rehearsal, rehearsal dinner, and wedding and reception were all downtown, so we were within walking, shuttle or taxi distance of everything we did the entire weekend. The rooms were comfortable, all of the staff was helpful and friendly, and all of the little amenities the Magnolia treats its guests to made us feel right at home.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: degler2004
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at The Magnolia many times and have enjoyed it each time. Upon arrival this time we were asked by the friendly employee if we would like to upgrade for an additional $25 to a suite. We accepted and were then asked if we had a preference of a high floor or lower floor. We chose the high floor and were very pleased. Our room had a full kitchen and living area along with many windows looking over Big D. The bed was comfy, bathroom was nice and roomy, air seemed a little warm even turned down however it is Texas and June and lots of windows. We were unable to take advantage of the evening reception, milk and cookies, or breakfast just due to not having enough time. Valet was quick to retrieve our car only thing was both times we needed to park we had to go find the valet. Overall Excellence!

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: D0r0thyD
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful 3-night weekend stay at the Magnolia. A gorgeous building (the elevator lobby is stunning), comfortable bed, with professional, friendly and accommodating staff (special thanks to the front desk attendant who mailed a postcard for me when I was too rushed to find a mailbox on my last day!). Breakfast was plentiful and fresh. Reviews reporting slow elevators seem to be exaggerated. The free wireless internet was rarely slow (less than 10% of the time). Lots of shopping and eating nearby; a perfect location to visit JFK sites. The local shuttle offered by the Magnolia was very useful for this, and also provided a round-trip to Deep Ellum for some local flavor. I saw all kinds of people at the Magnolia â€“ businesspeople, families, singles, groups, couples on a romantic weekend â€“ and it seemed to work for all of them. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room and an excellent value!!!”
Reviews.Author: Clarksvilleman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a family wedding. The room was very comfortable and an excellent value for a downtown hotel. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We'll Be Back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LadyCBigE
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip; therefore, our stay was short but VERY enjoyable. The Magnolia is truly a hotel that we will return to when we have more time.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel i've ever been to”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyLovett
Reviews.Content: I travel often to California, Houston and Dallas and this is the best, overall experience i've ever gotten at a hotel. Alll staff was very courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Most wonderful experience I have had in over 20 years of business travel”
Reviews.Author: squeeky52
Reviews.Content: Customer Service here is OVER THE TOP! From the minute you enter the hotel parking and unloading area to the time you leave at the end of your stay, you will experience pampering, caring, professional staff that truly care. Be sure to check out the happy hour at the end of your day, exceptional food and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facility and great complimentary services!”
Reviews.Author: culturegirl247
Reviews.Content: Beautiful facility with nice size rooms. My room had 6 windows, allowing me to enjoy natural daylight--something I rarely get in most hotel rooms! Great complimentary services like free drinks during happy hour every night, breakfast that exceeded my expectations for "continental" (they served eggs, potatoes, french toast, cereals, fresh fruit, and beverages) and free valet service to nearby destinations (museums, coliseum, restaurants, train station, etc.) Made my first visit to Dallas a very nice experience!

Reviews.Title: “Not the same upscale hotel it used to be.”
Reviews.Author: Nella1029
Reviews.Content: There was a large event in the lounge area taking place when my husband I were staying here for a wedding we went to in downtown Dallas. The event was so loud and disruptive, with security attending to some sort of situation. I've stayed at this hotel before over the course of 5 years and it was always peaceful and upscale. Not the case this time. Along with the fact the hotel keys weren't working and they had to have maintenance meet us at our room to let us in everytime. Not a pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Simple the Best Stay in Downtown Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelBrn37
Reviews.Content: Very close to great Sushi! Was recomended Fusion's Japanese Sushi Bar and it was the best SUSHI I have had since I was stationed in Okinawa! The Magnolia Staff go out of there way to take care of you and treat you with respect from the minute you drive up to valet to the moment you check out.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelcityguy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice! Despite the Mav's winning and the noise outside my room (I was on the 20th floor), the hotel is quiet and comfortable. The breakfast, wine reception, and cookies and milk in the evening are nice touches that make traveling away from home easier. The bed is very comfortable, the shower/bath very nice and large, and the coffee etc in the room was also a very nice amenity. The staff is responsive and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel I've stayed at, many good complimentary amenities.”
Reviews.Author: KaraPhillips
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great, the best were comfortable, the rooms were spacious. They have free breakfast, free cocktails in the evening, and at night free cookies and milk. There is also a complimentary shuttle service within a mile in downtown Dallas as well as complimentary internet. I loved this hotel and will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great architecture and wonderful service. Bar area is great too!”
Reviews.Author: Reppert
Reviews.Content: Building architecture is amazing and the hotel is in a great part of downtown. "The Club" on the second floor is really nice and even has a billiards room.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place.”
Reviews.Author: SarahH8389
Reviews.Content: The people were very friendly and the hotel was immaculate. Had some issues with the bath tub but overall. FANTASTIC!

Reviews.Title: “It's the little things that make it great”
Reviews.Author: leighthal82
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a wedding. I had a one bedroom suite that was very spacious, more like an apartment! (the corner rooms are the best!) The suite has a full kitchen, spacious bathrooms, and separate bedroom and living area. All of my friends came back to our suite after the wedding and we had room for at least 10-15 people comfortably and because it's a full kitchen with a bar you can entertain easily. They even provide you with a blender in the room. This is a historic hotel in the middle of downtown Dallas within walking distance to many sights, restaurants and bars. There are fun little perks like a complimentary happy hour, a late night cookie bar and free taxi service within a 3 mi radius of the hotel. The cleaning service was prompt and always willing to come back if we were still "waking up" from the night before. They even wash your dishes for you. I have very few complaints. The few cons I have are that the elevators can be slow when the hotel is busy even though they have like 7 of them. I was also disappointed that there was not pool, they do have an outdoor "spa tub" that is connected to the fitness center. While the fitness center is almost membership quality, the spa has room for like 3 people and left a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the cozy,friendly atmosphere.The employees make you feel special and welcome.”
Reviews.Author: tmach41
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice,the beds extremely comfy.GREAT LOCATION TOO!! We walked everywhere downtown. The hotel is a landmark so it's very interesting to look at all the details.Ofcourse all the added freebies are a great addition! Happy hour,breakfast,cookies&milk... No other hotel gives you anything for free anymore,on top of GREAT customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: crump_11
Reviews.Content: Went to the A Kon 2011, stayed here. Very friendly staff, no bedbugs in our room. Nice free breakfast buffet. Enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “a first class experience and close to everything in downtown Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: LJH53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magnolia with family to attend a wedding and had a great experience. Will definitely choose this hotel again when we are in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel clean and beautiful. Staff very helpful and friendly. Receptions are a nice bonus and wonderful way to end day.”
Reviews.Author: DJones6779
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and beautiful. The staff were very helpful, friendly and polite. The evening reception is a wonderful way to wind down after a hectic day at work and the milk and cookies is a great way to end your day. The room was very clean and setup wonderfully for comfort. The internet was very easy to access and use and FREE, which is great. I will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: munich1968
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our room and the overall experience was great.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay! Would stay again anytime!”
Reviews.Author: aiello88
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel! Great room, right downtown. Close to major attractions. Would stay anytime.

Reviews.Title: “A Tradition to Make!”
Reviews.Author: SJCOKC
Reviews.Content: This downtown hotel is exactly what is advertised. A beautiful, unique, boutique place to rest, relax and still be in the middle of the Arts, Fine dining and Excellent shopping. Don't pass this one up for a few dollars "saved" because the experience is worth much more!! The staff is friendly, and professional. The extras of cookies and milk at night,, an aperitif before dinner out and the breakfast the morning after are all anyone could wish. Each time we stay gets better and better. Try it, you'll love it!! SC

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was chic, comfortable and the friendliest hotel staff I've ever come in contact with!”
Reviews.Author: itskayz
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia hotel is fabulous! I am very particular about my hotels (I have high expectations for sure) and this hotel really made my trip! The staff was SO friendly. They even remembered my name at the front desk. The hotel vibe was young and trendy, kind of like a SF boutique hotel, and we got upgraded to a room with a full kitchen! The work out room was the nicest I've ever seen...I mean spa nice...and the free cocktails and cookies at night were a fun bonus. Can't go wrong staying here! They totally do it RIGHT. :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel in Downtown Dallas, TX”
Reviews.Author: seanwall
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Magnolia Hotel, Dallas. A boutique hotel, conveniently located in downtown Dallas, Texas. The hotel has retained a lot of original building yet has a very modern feel as well. The room was very comfortable and clean. The buffet breakfast had a good selection of breakfast items to choose from. The evening reception was a nice way to finish off a day of sightseeing, as was the Milk and Cookies buffet later in the evening. The hotel is in walking distance to the major sightseeing of Dealey Plaza, the Sixth Floor Museum and the Grassy Knoll. The West End district is also close by where you can find many restaurants and bars. I would definitely stay at the Magnolia Hotel, Dallas again.

Reviews.Title: “We have found our hotel "home" in Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: jmpmrm
Reviews.Content: I can't think of anything but praise for this hotel. The location is perfect for our needs - and easy to get to, which is saying a lot when trying to get around in Dallas! The staff was very nice and helpful - clean rooms, comfy beds! We have tried many hotels in Dallas with disappointing results - not Magnolia - we need look no further for our home away from home in Dallas. The room also had a small fridge which was much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful building, comfy beds.”
Reviews.Author: MFillingame
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful building, comfy beds. The staff was polite and willing to help but at bit rattled at check-in time. We arrived at 3:00ish and had to wait an hour and a half for our room to be ready.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful welcome to Dallas TX!”
Reviews.Author: jackieWV
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in walking distance (several blocks) of the attractions in Dallas TX. If you don't want to walk, they will shuttle you just about anywhere near. There are places to eat a wonderful meal very close. You can eat steak and buffalo within a block! This hotel is comfortable. But most of all the service is out of this world. The employees here are a PERFECT example of the friendliness of Texas!

Reviews.Title: “First weekend of marriage!”
Reviews.Author: stephylu
Reviews.Content: After getting married we wanted a hotel to stay in that was close to home. We chose the Magnolia for the added bonuses they offer complimentary. They offer free breakfast, free cocktail hour in the evening, and a free cookie bar before bed. We actually only had time to try the breakfast, but it was delicious. Upon arriving to the hotel we informed the front desk that we had just been married, and they immediately upgraded our room to the bigger suite. That was a nice touch and was very appreciated. Our room was the size of a small apartment and was perfect for the weekend. We were starving and ordered room service. The pizza was overpriced, but very tasty. The bed was comfortable, but not firm at all (we prefer a firm bed). Everyone was nice, but my only other complaint was something the hotel does not have much control over. While waiting for our car, I was approached by two homeless people (within five minutes of each other) begging me for money. At the time my husband had ran back inside, so being a young 20s women by herself, it didn't exactly make me feel safe. However, we were in the middle of downtown and what else is there to be expected. There are a ton of restaurants, bars, and clubs within walking distance. Overall, we would return and enjoyed the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Dallas Gem”
Reviews.Author: nrcharles5625
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Having had negative experiences with other hotel chains in Dallas, I was wary about staying somewhere knew. But I definitely will be staying here again. Loved the complimentary alcoholic beverages (nice touch for those of us over 21) and the cookie and milk reception was great. The milk wasn't that delicious, but that's only a minor detail. The room was gorgeous, and the bathroom was fantastic. Loved the big tub (unusual for any hotel) and the floor was beautiful. The front desk staff were incredibly helpful and directed us to the Iron Cactus restaurant which is so conveniently located. There are great bars and restaurants in walking distance which is helpful when you're planning on drinking alcohol and not wanting to pay for a cab. There's also great shopping close by. LOVED IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Magnolia Hotel Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: jrmartinez
Reviews.Content: This was a great experience for our family. The staff was very courteous and the hotel amenities were as advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a memorable hotel on every level...would definitely recommend a stay!”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkietxgrl
Reviews.Content: For those of you who travel for a living like myself and spend every week in a hotel...this is definitely one you will remember! They have the food, the ambiance and the service...you will want to stay here and come back!

Reviews.Title: “My business trip was pleasurable!”
Reviews.Author: Cbynum531
Reviews.Content: The staff took care of me all day! I LOVED the complimentary breakfast, happy hour after work and complimentary milk and cookies before bed. I will definitely stay there on my next visit to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “The complimentary hot breakfast and wine reception were wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: debbiedvic
Reviews.Content: The service here is without a doubt worthy of the five star rating and I would come back just based on that. However, when I stepped inside my room I immediately felt disappointed, as did my companions. The room was pretty drab and needed fresh paint. The decor attempted to be modern but fell short and just seemed plain and not elegant or luxurious at all. Once you leave your room, though, the hotel itself is beautiful. I would definitely stay again, and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Must stay - beautiful, comfortable, TONS of amenities & friendly/helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: knarte
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying here - I live only 20 or so miles away and have been looking for an excuse to stay here again. My first stay was for a friend's wedding. This time I had a conference to attend in Dallas and called and booked with ease. The stay was as good if not better than my first stay. Friendly, helpful staff, comfortable, clean, beautiful rooms and hotel. I love the beer/wine as well as the cookie receptions (all complimentary)!! As well as the tasty breakfast (also complimentary). It is close to downtown as well as uptown and the valet attendants are exceptional! If you're in town I wouldn't hesitate to book here - I am already looking forward to the next opportunity to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at the Magnolia!!!”
Reviews.Author: GPgirlDallas
Reviews.Content: The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The room was magnificent. It's within walking distance to great restaurants. The valet is the best! Will definitely return. It's a jewel in the heart of downtown Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Historic Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BBreton
Reviews.Content: A really nice boutique hotel which is located right the heart of the Dallas Historic district. The rooms are very well appointed while the prices remain reasonable. I strongly recommend if you need to stay downtown Dallas. Great staff also. Finally, we held a conference there and the overall service/package was quite good. The food was also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: NurseAnn84
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Magnolia and each stay just gets better and better~ All the staff I encountered were awesome! The bedtime milk and cookie buffet is a perfect end to the day!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing exceptional about this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Gera_toronto
Reviews.Content: Don't trust the front desk agents if you want them to book a shuttle for you. Almost missed my flight because I trusted them. Of course, they never called the shuttle company. :-( Breakfast is very unhealthy and rich.

Reviews.Title: “Great City Hotel - Attentive and fiendly staff, nice rooms and surrounded by alot of nice restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: CEWalk
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Magnolia several times and have never had a bad experience. The staff is always friendly and goes out of their way to make you feel welcome. And the location is great. Close to many different types of restuarants and the free car service will take you to places that are not in walking distance. The free buffet breakfast, free wine and beer happy hour and 8:00 pm milk and cookies are a welcome treat especially when traveling on business. In addition to the niceness of the hotel itself and the staff, the service is great. From the free car service to the maintenance service when, on rare occasions, something needs attention, the Magnolia is #1. When it was pouring rain, I was picked up from the office where I was working in Dallas within 5 minutes of calling the hotel. When one of the TVs in my room wouldn't connect to the main menu, maintenance was at my door less than 90 seconds and had it fixed in under 10 minutes. I would recommend the Magnolia to anyone who needs to stay in the area, whether traveling for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jushorsnround
Reviews.Content: room very nice comfortable bed and linens were so soft. great experiance the higher the room the better the view easy to get to nice places in the downtown area look forward to the next time i stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and homey”
Reviews.Author: Heat38her
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia Dallas is my most favorite hotel yet! The art deco is charming and the personal service is impeccable. The room I stayed in had a nice hallway to the bedroom that made it feel homey. The bathroom has a large garden tub. Not to mention, the amenities such as milk and cookies in the evening and free breakfast were delightful. I highly recommend this place anytime you're in uptown Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful building, excellent valet service, but not everything I expected.”
Reviews.Author: Shannon210
Reviews.Content: Lovely historic building. Valet service was worth the $22/night. Ceiling above tub leaked water from room above us. Front desk staff wouldn't put us in the room they said they would an hour earlier--my brother and his family were put in that room when they arrived a few hours later. Milk was warm at breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews don't lie!”
Reviews.Author: BenjaminWife
Reviews.Content: I don't need to go into detail about the hotel, as everyone already has, but this was by far one of the very best hotel experiences I have EVER had and truly wish there was a Magnolia in every town we stayed in. If you are going to stay in Dallas for business or pleasure, you will not regret staying here! It is the best!

Reviews.Title: “The prive was great and the serive was even better!!! Location was exceptional to everything!”
Reviews.Author: RosaNathan
Reviews.Content: Ask for a room on the notheast side of the building. We were in room 807 and the room had windows on three sides and no neighboring rooms. We did not have any noise from the other rooms. The location from the airport and all other places we were visiting wasn't far. The super shuttle form the airport was $18 each compared to $55 in a cab and the trip time in the shutlle was 35 minutes with one other stop.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fajitagirl
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was very nice, rooms very clean and comfortable. Attending wedding and most guests stayed here, there were plenty of areas to meet and mingle in the hotel. Only con, rooms right by the elevators can hear them during the night, if you are a light sleeper, ask for a room away from the elevators I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “this is an exelent and friendly hotel, exelent servicesland fair prices.”
Reviews.Author: Gladysviker
Reviews.Content: the front rooms have exelent view to the city and the suits have a full kitchen kitchen specially when traveling with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Easy & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: JenniferJMarshall
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my visit. Valet service was friendly and prompt. Hotel is easily accessible from major highways. The included happy hour, cookies & milk and breakfast were more than I anticipated. Hotel was clean, staff was nice and they went out of their way to be friendly. From the hotel you are right near several fun bars & restaurants. We went to Iron Cactus & sat outside and had a great time. 6th Floor Museum is just a few blocks away, and generally the hotel is in a great location. Only negatives - AC was noisy and wish they'd put wedding parties on separate floors from regular guests. We had noisey neighbors from 2am - 4am that kept waking us up.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to gather!”
Reviews.Author: Suza421
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great modern feel to it. The second floor is where it happens at the Dallas Magnolia. There is plenty of casual seating to sit with friends and family and talk. The Iron Cactus is practically right next door, so we dined there and came back to the hotel with friends and were able to have a fantastic time. The guys ordered some shots and the bar had several types of beer on tap and wine. No Mojito's tho! The free breakfast is nice, but don't expect too much for free. The eggs, bagels, orange juice and coffee were my faves. The elevators were a little out of wack so that was frustrating at times when we were in a hurry, but not horrible. Oh! Also, free shuttle service within 2-3 miles in the downtown area was a super plus for us. Great value in our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “A sweet suite”
Reviews.Author: DumDumBoy
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia was a perfect location for the first part of our Texas adventure. Three wonderful nights. Staff were efficient. The Happy-Hour (5.30pm-6.30pm) is a lovely touch: two free drinks (wine, beer or a soft drink). Our suite was spacious and very clean, big kitchen and lovely views on two sides. The hotel's position puts you moments from the Book Depository (for JFK conspiracy fans, like me!) and the historic district (for some wonderful bovine dining!).

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in great location with super friendly staff....”
Reviews.Author: phyett
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised on finding my usual hotel fully booked to discover the Magnolia - located in a truely traditional and elegant old high-rise building deep in down-town Dallas. Vaery friendly welcome and service......quiet and peaceful......a lovely small park adjoining ansome real relatively car free streets to walk in away from the frenetic freeways that so spoil American cities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Btemps
Reviews.Content: Had a relaxing weekend stay at the Magnolia Hotel! The Room, the service, the breakfast everything top-notch!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but a few complaints.”
Reviews.Author: TinyMightyKatie
