Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a recent weekend trip to Dallas to celebrate his birthday. Parking is a a bit of a hassle--we ended up parking at the city garage about a block away. Otherwise, valet parking is $22 a night. Check in was quick, and the lobby is beautifully redesigned. The rooms themselves are quite spacious, with nice (if a little dark) decor, large bathrooms, and great views out of the many windows of downtown Dallas. Alas, as we discovered that night, they're also single pane. We could hear everything going on down on the street, and a very loud train blasted through around 1 in the morning. Be advised--you'll probably need earplugs. The location is great for walking around downtown Dallas--we went to the aquarium and saw the JFK memorial and museum all without having to drive and find parking, so that was a definite plus. Ditto on the complimentary wine/beer/soda reception in the early evening, and bedtime milk and cookies. Continental breakfast was a little lacking, however. If you expect any kind of protein, you'll have to pay more to go through the omelet station--otherwise, it's reheated waffles, toast, muffins, etc. All in all, we enjoyed our stay, but improvements could (and should!) be made!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: t3kids
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, rooms were nice bed was comfortable, close to everything we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: msmith0410
Reviews.Content: The entire staff was very friendly and helpful. The second floor restaurant/bar/reception area was perfect to meet with family and friends and relax. Great atmosphere and close to shopping, food, and the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding valet service!”
Reviews.Author: Joseph2004
Reviews.Content: Never a problem with valet parking or luggage assistance. They were quick and extremely courteous. We really enjoyed the look and feel of the room. We stayed on the 24th floor where it still has the warm feeling with wooden walls and the decor was great. Don't set high expectations on the complimentary breakfast, unless you prefer just cereal. I was extremely disappointed with cold waffles, syrup container was empty, and there was not any breakfast meats available.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price!”
Reviews.Author: hotelspoiled
Reviews.Content: I had read all the good reviews but had not stayed before. My 11 year-old and I were in town with a few other moms and daughters for a cheer competition at the convention center. The girls loved the cookie bar, and the moms loved the lounge! Great service, large, cozy rooms, and a warm, friendly, attentive staff. The clientele was also very nice. I'm extremely picky and am a self-described hotel snob, so trust me and stay at The Magnolia the next time you are in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing--i dont "get' the great reviews”
Reviews.Author: calinurse
Reviews.Content: To say i was disappointed (based on the numerous 5 star recs on TA) is an understatement. The hotel is average in nearly every way. One young woman, Tory, was very friendly and helpful. A man on Sunday afternoon was quite helpful about the route to Dealy Plaza. Other front desk staff were fine, but nothing above what one should expect. Most were pleasant, but not of the outstanding level that some reviews implied. True and typical Texan friendliness--which I find nearly everywhere in the state--was not that evident here. Some staff were worse than average. The man at the breakfast buffet Monday morning was just plain rude, when i asked where i could put the used plates (it was a self-service place, after all). I called a "guest service" person to ask where there was an ice machine. She curtly told me to go up to the 25th floor. I get in the elevator--NO 25th floor on the panel. Thinking i might have heard wrong,I got out on 26th floor(where the hall carpet was filthy, as if a vacuum cleaner had unloaded excess dirt and dust in a pile) No ice. I returned, empty ice buck in hand, to my room on 21st fl. Call guest service lady again. She replied, impatiently,that i have to go to the one elevator (of 4 or so) that goes to 25th floor, and look on the side of the elevator door to call the one for the 25th floor. That would have been nice to know in the first place. We checked in on a Saturday. Sunday morning, friend had run 13 miles in the weekend's half-marathon (the source of many hotel guests) . He returned, achey and exhausted, at 1:30 pm, just wanting to nap. Room not refreshed or made up, so i called guest service and ask if room can be made up, so friend can nap without being awoken by housekeeper. Two more calls later, after two more hours...finally housekeeper shows up, at 4:30 pm! When i asked guest services guy why it was so late , he said, "We had a lot of people checking out." OK--but what about people who were paying for an additional night--don't we get to have clean rooms by afternoon ? Scary elevators mentioned elsewhere on TA--yes, quite unpredictable Each elevator has a metal plaque warning of this--forewarned is forearmed-- in a cute humourous way. However, the signs were scratched up, lending an air not of historic charm, but just plain old. That was my sense of the entire hotel. Historic charm was less in evidence than drab and dull. Hallway and room were dark--could barely read or see even with all desktop lamps turned on. (There are no ceiling lights.) Only the shower had a bright light (in a glass wall recess) . Colors of room--yellow and brown. A room can be basic, but at least "inviting" enough to enjoy just kicking back and wtaching TV,etc. This room was so drab and dreary, i didnt want to spend any extra time in it. There was one bathrobe in a two- bed room. (They must figure the second person can do without one) No folding luggage rack--so had to open suitcase on one of few surfaces--the desk--making it unusable for other purposes. On the plus side, beds were comfortable, and breakfast itself was very good, with scrambled egg and cheese dish, plus oatmeal, and bagels, etc. And people at the evening liquor reception were having a blast!! The lounge on the second floor was lovely. Perhaps "free" liquor explains the positive memories and high ratings. Also, do not use the valet parking. There are public lots within a block or two--much cheaper. Across the street, the one for "Nieman-Marcus " was officially about $10/24 hours--and both Sunday and early Monday morning, had free exiting. Upon return home, i rec'd a survey email from Magnolia askeing that i give them top scores so they can be #1 on Tripadvisor!!! Maybe that explains a number of once-only, one sentence, reviews here. At least in my experience, the glowing reviews are not deserved, unless the free alcohol is a big draw for a prospective guest.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff, very clean and excellent food”
Reviews.Author: petmadness
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms on the 20th floor which had excellent views out. Rooms were a good size and staff couldn't be more helpful for taxi's etc. Good location for walking to some of the main attractions and eating out. Internet access was good speed and no issues with download. Lifts are slow but building is old and this adds to the character of the hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with great amenities”
Reviews.Author: gallygrad
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very impressive. The room was very large and so was the bathroom. I am actually typing this review in the room right now. I stayed on the 21st floor and in a corner room and the Internet connection the speedtest shows a 8.5mbps download speed meaning very quick for hotel internet access. I was able to watch youtube videos on it with no hiccups. The meeting rooms were great and well appointed. I liked the breakfast buffet as well as the two drink frees during their happy hour at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dark rooms, slow elevators”
Reviews.Author: NorfolkJL
Reviews.Content: The room was brown, brown, and darker brown. The elevators were so slow that people staying on level 6 and lower usually walked down. The ice machine was in the laundry room on the 25th floor. After the first trip up there, I decided warm drinks were ok. The breakfast buffet was mediocre. The internet service was so bad that I could not even get to my yahoo mail account. Good things: towels and bathrobe were of superiod quality; personal supplies were also of higher quality than many like-priced hotels. The evening cookies are a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH IT!!”
Reviews.Author: ErinLJ11
Reviews.Content: Mildewed and rusted tub, nonoperational blinds, noisy, broken/missing amenities in room. Will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great stay at the Magnolia”
Reviews.Author: Hope4lee
Reviews.Content: I normally stay at Magnolia with my husband. This time I went with a group of friends. We had a beautiful room again. The service was up to par as usual. The accommodations by the valet were incredible. They brought our whole group, about 17, to and from Ghost Bar in impeccable timing. I love that we only had to pay a very minimum rate for our room, which is in the heart of Dallas, less than 5 minutes to Uptown, Greenville, West End, etc. and right by the incredible Iron Cactus - great brunch and mexican dinner! Definitely recommend anyone to stay at Magnolia. However, they do lack a pool which is disappointing in any hotel. They have a "spa" which is a hot tub that doesn't work and a fitness center but it is not up to par. I didn't mind but if you are looking for those extras I would not recommend Magnolia.

Reviews.Title: “The Magnolia is a great value...nice rooms and good perks!”
Reviews.Author: candace3603
Reviews.Content: Many hotels include breakfast, but the Magnolia exceeds this perk....a nice happy hour and cookies and milk at bedtime. The price is also right! If you enjoy walking or running, there is a wonderful trail, the Katy Trail about 2 miles away...well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in convenient downtown location.”
Reviews.Author: PaulinLandofLincoln
Reviews.Content: Guest rooms are furnished nicely and are very comfortable. The staff is helpful and courteous. Morning breakfast buffet was very tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: LDurben
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay - the hotel is in a great location if your visiting Dallas to see some of the historical/cultural sights, i.e. Dealey Plaza, Dallas Aquarium, etc. Rooms were very comfortable and the amenities were great for families with children (we have a 7 year old) - hot breakfast buffet, cocktails in the evening and cookies and milk before bedtime. Staff was very attentive and helpful and the free wi-fi worked great for us. We stayed on a weekend so it was very busy but staff worked extra hard (especially the valet staff) to help us whenever we had a request or needed our car.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff was very friendly, especially Raymond the valet!”
Reviews.Author: wellslego
Reviews.Content: Great restaurants close by, affordable rates and spacious rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and beautiful historic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Cyfer
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to the convention center, public transportation, restaurants. Staff are nice and helpful. And very easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “A great restoration. A historical feel with modern amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Schleimerlaw
Reviews.Content: A great restoration of a classic Dallas hotel. A historical feel with modern amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service with the added touch!”
Reviews.Author: Tlh09
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lovely historical feeling with super staff and the added touch of a welcome reception, free shuttle within the dowtown area and spacious rooms.

Reviews.Title: “The valet service was incredible!”
Reviews.Author: Wolfslayer11
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a few days whIle my children were on spring break. The valet director Jose is truly an asset to the hotel. He was knowledgable, curteous and extremely helpful during our entire stay. He would always call us by our last name and made us feel as though we were the only guests in the hotel even though there were other things going on. We also enjoyed the milk and cookies at night.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: aps_march
Reviews.Content: I came with high expectations but was disappointed. My disappointment started with the check-in. After waiting in line for 15 min and various people cutting in the line, I finally checked in. The room was spacious and nicely decorated. But the place was falling apart: the door did not lock unless slammed; the bed sheets looked a bit dirty; the blinders did not open and so on. Both mornings, the hot water was not hot. The internet service was crappy. I could keep going on., but in summary, I believe the hotel is not worth the money and do not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a quick getaway”
Reviews.Author: rks0003
Reviews.Content: Historic hotel with modern updates. My wife and I stay here upon occasion for a nearby getaway. There are great places to explore within walking distance. Nice and quiet rooms to relax in as well as a nice workout facility with a semi-outside spa tub!! We will continue to return as this is the best value for a Dallas hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I beleive they're living up to their words 'It feels good here'. I felt.”
Reviews.Author: SenthilT
Reviews.Content: I'm fond of their hot cookies. espc the ones with chocolate chips. Good Service, well equipped kitchen, varities in break-fast. Over all, i recommend Magnolia for a comfrortable and peaceful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience...”
Reviews.Author: mgrannan
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia is a must stay location in Downtown Dallas. Great location and history. The staff in outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay - I would return again.”
Reviews.Author: travels2much0
Reviews.Content: All in all, I really liked the Magnolia Hotel. The location is amazing, everything we wanted to do was within 3 miles of the hotel. The room was clean, the bed was soft, and the pillow didn't make me wake up with a crick in my neck...which I totally appreciate. I've read other reviews about the elevators being scary... I didn't find the elevators scary at all, but that could be because I was expecting the worst, but really they were okay...so don't be afraid to ride the elevator. The wine reception hour was not what I was expecting, it was a small table set up in the lobby with 2 large ice buckets and 2 guys pouring basic drinks - I ended up pouring mine out. Some reviews imply that you get mulitple drinks, that is not the case - you get one drink coupon...but still, that is one more drink coupon than you get at most other hotels so I'm not complaining, I'm jus' sayin'. =) We were out getting our party on so I can not speak for the milk and cookie hour, but how can anybody go wrong with milk and cookies? Ha. The free "expanded" continental breakfast left me wanting for more, but that could've been from the hangover?!? They did have an omelet station that you could pay $6.00 more per person to have, but we decided to skip that station and just eat what was included. What was included? Breakfast potatoes, Chicken spicy nachos (weird!), Bran cereal, Oatmeal, Bagels, and Toast. They ran out of Orange juice so I was bummed about that, but no huge biggy. I was pleasantly surprised with the Valet service. They were rockin, seriously!! We checked in, called down for our bags, and within 5 minutes our bags were in our room. We left for a night out on the town and we had the hotel car take us to our first order of business, dinner. We didn't have to wait for the car, it was available so we took advantage of it and didn't have to take a taxi, it was nice surprise. We finished dinner late so the car wasn't available to pick us up but we happened across a limo service that we had drive us around for the rest of our night. We checked out this morning at 10:30a and when we went to the valet desk to hand in our ticket (we weren't allowed to call down for the car since it was Sunday?) we only waited about 7 minutes for our car. I had no problems with the valet service at all. My husband and I had a very good stay, we will return if ever we need a hotel in Dallas just for the night.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was very nice and the hotel is centrally located to so much. lots of restaurants, musuems, aquarium and shops”
Reviews.Author: traveler4700
Reviews.Content: The price was great and we got free parking!! Just need to ask. The hotel is centrally located. Shopping, resturants, aquarium, musuems and lots of fun things to do! Will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unreliable reservations, unaccommodating management”
Reviews.Author: ItravelaLotuKnow
Reviews.Content: I made reservations 5 months in advance for a week-long business trip, had to be within walking distance of the Dallas Convention Center. The Magnolia sounded great from the reviews posted here. Three days before my arrival, the Magnolia emailed me to say that they could not accommodate me for the first 3 nights, and had placed me in an alternate hotel 15 miles away in Duncanville. Yes, 15 miles!! I responded to their email saying that was too far away, and wanted them to find something much closer. I called the hotel manager and left voicemail -- no response. I contacted the sales manager, who said she would forward the issue to management. The next day I received another email from Magnolia in which they cancelled my entire stay!! Note that I had never requested cancellation, they apparently decided this was the best way to deal with the issue. I've NEVER been treated this way by any hotel in the US. If you overbook, you find your customers equal or better accommodations nearby, not 15 miles away. I called other hotels within a few blocks and confirmed that they had rooms available, but at a higher price, so the Magnolia management obviously made a choice here. My advice: make your reservations elsewhere, or you will be scrambling at the last minute.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for sometimes..”
Reviews.Author: crystalangel1822
Reviews.Content: Good- The location is great and its right next door to the Iron cactus and other good restraunts..the view is nice if you stay on the 23-26 floor. Bad- make sure you take your luggage up with you, I had a bad experience but I must say they are handling that issue better than i expected. Good- They do give out complimentary cocktails and cookies, that was a plus. The restraunt in the hotel is not good, better to go eat out. Be prepared to pay 22 a night for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: sarahjane014
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lively enough on the weekends if you're headed out on the town (and has a great location!) and calm enough during the day/weekdays for relaxation. Free shuttle within 3 miles of the hotel and their valet service was VERY helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Todd at the front desk makes it all happen.”
Reviews.Author: leigh987
Reviews.Content: Very knowledgable. Very helpful. He could probably do a better job of planning your weekend than you could. Just ask. Hats off Todd. Great weekend. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Never disappointed”
Reviews.Author: RoyDavid
Reviews.Content: I stayed here three times in the past 4 months and each time, it is convenient, clean and friendly. Ammenities are more than I can take advantage of in a one day trip. I espcially like the suite rooms with a great feelilng of home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “The Magnolia is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Mrspenser
Reviews.Content: I would and will stay there again and again in no small part due to the fantasic service we got from Tory at check-in and throughout the stay. The rooms are outstanding and the lobby and club areas are excellent... And then there's the breakfast, happy hour and late night cookie bar... A terrific stay.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel itself is very nice, but PLEASE allow yourself an average of 20 mins to get your car in the valet.”
Reviews.Author: crp57
Reviews.Content: This is an historic landmark in downtown Dallas, but if you choose to stay here, be sure to allow yourself an average of 20 mins to retreive you car from the valet. On Sunday, your wait maybe between 45 & 60 mins. The wifi is free and very good, but if you need to use "their" PC's and printer, take your credit card so you can pay the insane charges for them. I felt like I was in a foreign country. I stay all over the US and I have not seen these kind of charges in years.

Reviews.Title: “I'm a huge fan of boutique hotels.”
Reviews.Author: SLA_AUSTX
Reviews.Content: I'm a huge fan of boutique hotels and have stayed at many, and can pleasantly say that my stay this weekend was no different then what Iâ€™ve come to expect of boutique hotels. The location was perfectly located in the heart of downtown, with tons of dining and entertainment options within walking distance of the hotel. Each of the team members I had the pleasure of having contact with were extremely hospitable and very accommodating. Our suite room was lovely, comfortably decorated, and well maintained. The complimentary evening beer & wine, late night cookies & milk, and American Breakfast were an unexpected treat. I very much enjoyed my stay and will look forward to the next opportunity I have to return to the Magnolia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: dbt54
Reviews.Content: Location is fun. Elevators are VERY slow. Rooms are VERY small. That was easy to overlook. The parking is AWFUL. It took over 30 minutes to just bring our car around when it was asked for. Apparently the parking is done several blocks away and if you are attempting to get your car when others are as well............. good luck........ The parking situation alone will have us looking elsewhere to stay for our next trip to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and elegant !”
Reviews.Author: mnv09
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at a corporate suite of this hotel for over an year now and it has provided us exceptional service , except for some hitches here and there which are obvious when you are staying for this long. Pros- Comfortable , secure, friendly, safe, helpful and instant room service for anything. Cons- Laundry is the main issue, dryers are not that good enough, machines look old and they are not efficient since I get huge loads of laundry all the times. Besides, elevators are shaky and scary but till date, safe enough! All in all best stay possible with all amenities :) Worth trying!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic hotel with great views and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: nikkilepori
Reviews.Content: Definitely recommend this hotel. I've stayed here multiple times. The staff is great and I really enjoy the free drinks at happy hour, the free cookie buffet in the evening, and the amazing spread of the free breakfast each morning. GREAT VALUE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bkfst Buffet lacking, otherwise great stay”
Reviews.Author: Bandera321
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia has everything going for it - location, beautiful property, exemplary service and staff. And then they changed the breakfast buffet. During my most recent stay on a weekend, the offerings were oatmeal, biscuits, toast, cereal and yogurt. And some fruit. Before then, the buffet featured a few kinds of eggs, bacon, sausage...much more extensive. Pretty disappointing. Breakfast aside, this hotel is a gem. All praises and many thanks to the staff for "going the extra mile" to be gracious and helpful. Wonderful, vibrant and safe location.

Reviews.Title: “Total Greatness”
Reviews.Author: Kkfrank
Reviews.Content: The Hotel moved me I nicer suite for my Birthday! We had a great time. My only complaint would be to tell us about service fees for room service. Paid to much for a Hamburger and pizza.44.00 was total with fees. But other than that we loved our suite!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chunkstopher
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great. Love the fact that when I called down for my bags they were their in less than 5 minuets and I was on the 23rd floor. Every employee was friendly the room was clean. The only thing is the elevators are old and for some people seeing a 13th floor button may scare them :). I have stayed at 5 star hotels through 0 star hole in the wall motels and by far this is defiantly a 4 star hotel. If i need a hotel in downtown Dallas I would put them on my list of places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but elevators and room keys not working.”
Reviews.Author: LRV60
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was wonderful, but the hotel keys kept not working, and the elevators are slow and erratic -- we ran the 26 floors more than once to get keys replaced. The rooms were a little outdated but pleasant and clean and the beds were comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Very convient to everything!”
Reviews.Author: jbsrunner7
Reviews.Content: Loved the location. Everyone was very helpful, and friendly. Can't wait to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, staff. A very comfortable stay. Would go back again.”
Reviews.Author: harris101
Reviews.Content: Great stay. Would stay there again! Had a room on the 23rd floor with probably the best view of Dallas. Our floor was totally quiet, which was a surprise since we were staying in a hotel full of cheerleaders. The staff was absolutely the best. I had a problem with our bathroom sink. I called the front desk for assistance and they sent someone within 5 minutes. Again... I was on the 23rd floor. If I have the opportunity to visit Dallas again, there is no question I would stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: missyals
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel to attend a event at the convention center. The location was great - the only thing great. I certainly do not mind paying more for better service but that is not what we got when we stayed here. The free breakfast consisted of potatoes and oatmeal one morning and some type of tortilla mixture and oatmeal the other morning. They did offer eggs or omlettes however for an additional $5.95. I have never stayed at a hotel that did not include scrambled eggs as a staple for the breakfast buffet. The rooms needed some elbow grease and the furniture some fixing. The high speed interest was extremely slow at best. They only provide valet parking for $22 a day - wow!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasent hotel”
Reviews.Author: on7
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through tripadvisor and the great reviews definitely do justice to this pleasant hotel. Staff proved to be efficient and willing to help with all our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,nice staff,happy hours with wine and bear and fresh baked cookies were awesome !”
Reviews.Author: marinalauder
Reviews.Content: Great location,nice staff!American breakfast was great! Happy hours with free wine and bear testing were memorable! Fresh baked cookies with milk every evening was a very nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: mickeymz
Reviews.Content: Room was very spacious. Great staff. The lobby had the subtle scent of the fresh flowers. Evening reception was very nice. Breakfast during the week was nice the weekend left something to be desired.Omelet station with a additional up charge on weekend mornings.Would stay again next time in Dallas

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL NIGHT AT THE MAGNOLIA!!!”
Reviews.Author: MegNTX
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Magnolia with 2 other couples this past Saturday night for a little getaway without the kids!! When you first arrive and pull up to the valet stand you are immediately greeted by the friendly staff. Valet was $22 for overnight but well worth it when you aren't familiar with Downtown Dallas, you are also allowed unlimited in and out privileges. The lobby was beautiful and everyone at the front desk was very nice and got us up to our room in no time. Also, when I booked my room I requested a high level and they had us on the 26th floor. The view was awesome!! We had to upgrade our room to the King Accessible because that was all that was available. I was awesome! Another one of the couples that where there with us had a deluxe room with a queen and their room seemed very small but they were pleased with it. The other couple also had the same queen room and theirs was much bigger so I don't know why that is. We were told that they had a free shuttle service within 3 miles of the hotel and we were going to Fair Park and they said that was within area. Awesome, right? Well the only problem was that we would need to be picked back up at about 1am. Their free shuttle service closed at 10pm. My husband and brother-in-law talked to the guys at the shuttle desk and somehow we ended up with a private shuttle, or should i say our own private GMC Yukon, that was on call for us the entire night. We were given his cell phone number to call him when we were ready to be picked. So we call him to come get us from Fair Park and he said to give him 20 minutes but he was there in more like 10 minutes. So after that we asked him to take us a another bar somewhere close. He said he would be back to get us at 2 when the bar closed and sure enough he was waiting on us when we came out!! So then after a long night of having fun with friends we were hungry so we asked James, our driver, if he knew somewhere closer to the hotel to eat at. And of course he did! He took us to Cafe Brazil and it was AMAZING! When we were ready to go he was waiting! So our experience with transportation service at the hotel was beyond 5 stars. Our driver was James and we would highly recommend him to everyone. Only a few things that were a disappointment but everything else was so great that's why I still gave 5 stars! Complaint #1: for me the beds were very uncomfortable but I'm also use to my TempurCloud so any bed would be hard to even compare. Complaint #2: someone from the staff was beating on our door at 8:30am!! We even had the Do Not Disturb on the door!!! If I had not of had such a wonderful night the night before, I would have been throwing a fit! I know it wasn't that early but when you NEVER get to sleep in due to work schedules and kids, not to mention getting to bed at 4:30am, it can really ruin your day. Especially when check out isn't until 11, which we planned on sleeping until then!! Overall, great experience, will definitely be returning, and recommend this hotel to everyone we know!!! Thanks Magnolia and James for an awesome night out!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind not showering and indifferent to surly front desk service, this is the place for you.”
Reviews.Author: beentheredonethat97
Reviews.Content: Rented two rooms for 3 days each. Verbally requested that the rooms be in proximity to each other when I reserved a month+ in advance. They put us 3 floors apart which broke up our family. Upon check in and a plea for rooms on the same floor, got the attitude that "we're full...it's the way it is, deal with it". Two of three days, we had no hot water in the morning and went to important events not looking or felling our best. Rooms were nice and quiet, though.

Reviews.Title: “Room Was Okay, but overall customer serivce was great.”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel0975
Reviews.Content: MY CONS..... Stayed here with my husband and son, the room had an old smell to it..I even had plug-ins, wipes, and disinfectant spray and the smell would not go away. The shower also didnt work no pressure just a stream. lol, The room was extremely small, The keys would work after about 5 tries at a time. I think for me it was just old and out dated...But that old closed up attick smell was horrible. Oh and the pigeons and crows are everywhere. I felt like I was in an alfred hitchcock film. My goodness! MY PROS..... Now the customer service was great!, Staff was nice, Valet guys were great! The location was great!, The bed was Comfy. The valet to me was worth it, you can come and go as you please and not have to fight traffic looking for parking all for $22.00 per night. I didnt mind that. I loved all the different lounging/sitting options in the hotel. It was a very cozy feel. I wish the hotel room's atmosphere was as comfy as the lounge areas. The receptions was cool, the free cookies and milk, as well as the free spirits at 530 was a nice touch. The breakfast wasnt bad, but the omlette station had a fee, I didnt mind that either. I like the restaraunt nect door, The Iron Cactus, good food, There is a breakfast place within walking distance that has good food at a cheap price. We rented a car and drove around dallas so we were not just limited to the downtown area. For the most part I would recommend this hotel. I personally wouldnt stay there again, now if I absolutelly had to because the overall custer service was great that was worth it. The aquarium is near by, that was great.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok!”
Reviews.Author: whocaresAmarillo
Reviews.Content: Complimentary breakfast was a "bust". Blinds in room did not work. View out window was pretty gross..pigeons and their roosting spot (18th floor)

Reviews.Title: “This hotel's shuttle service let us ride around town for free.”
Reviews.Author: bhays23
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a bachelor party this weekend. I have to say I was very pleased with what I saw. They had a few free social get togethers like free cookies and milk, free beer and wine, free breakfast. We didn't make it to any of them, but it was a nice touch. The rooms were clean, and many were shaped a little differently from one another, so between the three of our rooms each one had a little bit of its own character. Valet let you in and out for $22/night. I'm used to no valet for $20/night without in and out privelages so this was a treat that I was not expecting. What stole the show, was while we were trying to get a cab, one of the valet workers came up to us and told us they had a complimentary shuttle service. It took us to the bar 5 miles away for free, and when we were ready to leave, we just called them up and they came back to pick us up. Great Service.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: doubleosix
Reviews.Content: Awesome Hotel in a great location. Very close to the DART and many restaurants. Friendly service! Free Breakfast ,Evening drinks, Late night Cookies & milk. The queen suite was VERY well worth the extra $$

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with an excellent vibe and loads of personal touches.”
Reviews.Author: MarkWebs
Reviews.Content: venue is perfect for business travel. Hotel staff are attentive, fun and personable. Close proximity to great food.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Do-Over”
Reviews.Author: lannyr
Reviews.Content: First of all this review is long overdue. The first time I tried to leave it was too soon after my first review and by the time it was eligible I had lost track. Long story short--no hotel stay is perfect . It just so happened that on my first visit a month or so before several things occurred that by themselves were not significant but all at once made for a disappointing stay. My first review reflected that. Well, people, I'll tell you that they read these reviews at the Magnolia and the response from the manager was immediate. He wrote to express regret over our experience and to assure us corrective measures had been taken. His invitation to give them another shot was so sincere we went back about a month later. This time everything was as it should have been. No hotel stay is perfect but this one came close.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in downtown dallas”
Reviews.Author: tabithaballardcc
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel in down town dallas is great location to everywhere...local bars and the art district. They have great amenities including a complimentary bar hour and a milk and cookies before bed hour. They also have a free breakfast buffet in the morning. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The upscale feel of other high dollar hotels without the upscale attitude or price.”
Reviews.Author: Concreteoasis
Reviews.Content: We couldn't believe the room we were given. Huge with a kitchen at half the price of other (boutique) hotels. Really handy with the kid. Nice valet and hotel staff. We enjoyed the cookies and breakfast. This is our new hotel for all our Dallas trips. We can stay twice as long compared to other downtown hotels. The service is top with no attitude. A very clean hotel as well. We were already planning our next stay on the drive home. The best. Thanks Magnolia staff!

Reviews.Title: “The experience at the Magnolia Hotel in Dallas was more than my husband or I could have hoped for.”
Reviews.Author: Liquorchick
Reviews.Content: Due to a reservation error at another hotel, the Magnolia was able to provide us with not only a room for the night, but the best experience my husband and I have could have ever expected on such short notice. The staff was incredible especially the reservationist who able to make a reservation for us. The Valet attendants were friendly and very curtious.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: dlg0625
Reviews.Content: I had a long travel day and had to be up at the crack of dawn for a meeting. Check in was smooth. The room was clean and cozy. Room service valet was polite and accommodating. I slept like a baby! The meeting facilities were professional and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Magnolia hotel is gem in the hotel industry.”
Reviews.Author: Renzo89
Reviews.Content: Stay at the magnolia for super bowl weekend. Was expecting chaos but the service was outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “The Magnolia Hotel in Dallas delivers a unique lodging experience; unique in all the RIGHT ways.”
Reviews.Author: USARailTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia Hotel in Dallas is something everyone should experience at least once. The art-deco design of the building alone is immeadiately pleasing to the senses. The nuances of the rooms only add to the ambiance. Downtown Dallas still needs to wake-up and grasp its role as a true 'downtown' but when it does the Magnolia will be ready.

Reviews.Title: “Good to stay in Magnolia hotel”
Reviews.Author: k1shore
Reviews.Content: Good to stay in Magnolia hotel Good to stay in Magnolia hotel

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 32904Piel
Reviews.Content: All in all, this was a great hotel. The rooms were large compared to most hotels that I've been in, and the beds were very comfortable. It was also very clean and modern throughout the hotel. The people were very friendly, service was great/prompt, and the free cocktails, cookies and breakfast were also a very nice touch! Suggestions for improvement: Although the fitness room was nice, it was very hot which made working out uncomfortable. Some of the equipment was also noisy and needed to be upgraded or fixed. In addition, although the noise level on the INSIDE of the hotel was well insulated and controlled, the rooms needed better insulation from OUTSIDE noise (rain, street traffic, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: dezz777
Reviews.Content: Great all around. Fun for families or a quick romatic getaway. I will come back for sure. I will reffer friends as well. Staff know the meaning of customer service. The room was clean. staff were friendly. food was great.

Reviews.Title: “What else could i ask for”
Reviews.Author: trotamundo69
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, free internet and breakfast, across the street from the client. Perfect hotel for Business but i guess will have been nice for pleasure as well. The exercise room could use a rowing machine, but it has the basics to keep you fit. Definitely will stay in this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Valet was rude, rooms were outdated, but the hotel staff was nice and the hotel is very close to numerous amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Derek6733
Reviews.Content: THe staff was very nice and the hotel was located to numerous restaurants, clubs, and very clode to cultural items such as museums. We did not take advantage of the cookie buffet or the breakfast but it smelled great! The rooms are out dated and due to construciton in the area, sleeping in is out of the question.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and great breakfast buffet.”
Reviews.Author: david494
Reviews.Content: Great downtown hotel convenient to where I was working and close to many excellent restaurants -- no car needed, which is a plus for me. The complimentary breakfast buffet was outstanding -- standard options, but very very well done. The elevators are a bit funky in that they seemed to have missed the the general upgrade of the hotel. Elevators had some odd noises and a few odd movements, but they always got me to and from the 22nd floor.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is wonderful, the hotel is old and not especially clean.”
Reviews.Author: 503traveler
Reviews.Content: We didn't really enjoy this hotel, although the staff was friendly and helpful. Due to our first room not being very clean, we moved to another room which was better. The elevators are kind of creepy. I have learned I am not a fan of older hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but coat stolen out of room.”
Reviews.Author: drmbcox
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is nice and clean -- the food was good at breakfast, and things seemed to work efficiently. Nice views of downtown from our 16th floor room. Wish the housekeeping staff could "find" my coat -- it (with certainty) was left in the coat closet but somehow has disappeared. Too bad -- otherwise was a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Night on the Town.”
Reviews.Author: Moose1195
Reviews.Content: Ideally located and in a lovely, remodeled building from early 20th Century, the Magnolia is a great boutique in Dallas. We would (and do) recommend it to friends and associates who are traveling to Dallas on business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel! Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: SteviLoren
Reviews.Content: Fabulous downtown hotel! The breakfast is DELISH! The comp cocktails are a nice touch! My fav was the complimentary cookie buffet & milk! Our room was bigger than I expected. I stayed with 3 other girlfriends and we had plenty of room to get ready and not feel like we were on top of each other!! Large bathtub was nice! I never take baths in a hotel but I had to, it was just TOO FABULOUS not to! It was my birthday weekend and the manager sent up complimentary champagne & chocolate covered strawberries! The work out facility is VERY nice if that is important to you! I loved it! I would def stay again! Valet is $22 so that is kinda pricy but totally worth it because of all the extras in my opinion!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the center of Downtown”
Reviews.Author: pski765
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in a great location. It's truly an historical landmark. I've read on anothers review that the elevators were old, well what do you expect with an landmark building? They are old, but that's what makes it unique, and we never waited for more than 1 minute for any of the 5 elevators they have. The valet are extremely nice, and they will drive you for free anywhere within a 3 mile radius...a great plus! Right in the center of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was extremely helpful. Value was awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Jennivine
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded at the last minute-- very helpful and nice. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet as well. We will defintely come back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jdk403
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Magnolia several times a year and always enjoy the stay..from staff to rooms to amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel. Incredibly wonderful service.”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoFencingmom
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the amenities and service. The room was adequate. Perhaps a little dark, but otherwise fine. The beds are extremely comfortable and clean. The service staff at the Magnolia are absolutely wonderful. Everyone is quick to want to help in anyway they can. The valet service is perfection in motion! The breakfast buffet, evening cocktails, and cookies and milk time were all great. The second floor club was beautiful and cozy all at the same time! The exercise and steam rooms were very nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: breegg
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel....Loved the Chocolate Milk and Cookies......also enjoyed the Great Breakfast buffet....I do love this place

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: lavokan
Reviews.Content: I thought the breakfast buffet and happy hour would be worth the extra price of this hotel. It wasn't. The room was very dated. The breakfast was poor. The happy hour was just some cheap wine - not even any pretzels to go with it. And it was noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Very good boutique hotel in downtown Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: ScottyOTC
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in downtown Dallas. Breakfast buffet was mediocre, but still satisfactory. They offer inexpensive upgrades via email, which turned out to be a great value. I had a 23rd floor corner suite and the view was amazing, the room was quite spacious. Staff was great, very friendly and accommodating. Suites are spacious and have pleasant decor. The valet parking is overpriced. I'm sure on busy days you may have quite a wait for the valet if you don't call ahead. There is a parking garage close by that offers much better rates but at the sacrifice of convenience. I'd probably opt to use said garage on future visits unless the weather is lame.

Reviews.Title: “nice size, good location, easy in and out”
Reviews.Author: kkhill87
Reviews.Content: Ask for a room away from Commerce. It isn't the Adolphus, but it is easier and not so many doormen and bothersome people wanting tips!

Reviews.Title: “Cookies & Milk”
Reviews.Author: trmass
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, clean rooms. Who wouldn't like milk & cookies in the evening. Ok when cold hot chocolate would be good. Staff is nice & helpful Have recommended to friend who did stay here also. Street noises can be a little loud in lower rooms, higher is a little better.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the cookie and milk buffet, evening reception and comfy beds.”
Reviews.Author: JAC803
Reviews.Content: We found everything delightful. We did hear some others mention the street noise, but on the 8th floor, with blinds and shades drawn, we heard nothing at all. The cookie buffet and evening reception provided a great place to visit with friends. Breakfast was varied and plenty of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is beautiful & everyone is friendly, however they always seem to overbook the rooms. What good is a reservation?”
Reviews.Author: lisa30183
Reviews.Content: I have reserved rooms here 3 years in a row, however 2 of the 3 years the rooms reserved were not availiable. They did work very hard to make other arrangements for us, however why did I bother making a reservation? I would recommend this hotel, however not if there is a convention or event going on in town.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly good stay.”
Reviews.Author: photomanster
Reviews.Content: Good location for activities we had planned. Room was fairly small. Venetian blinds didn't work. It took 15 minutes to get our car from valet parking, which is the only option. The breakfast was ok, but certainly not outstanding. The valet staff were very friendly and courteous. It is in a historic Dallas building, formerly the Magnolia Oil Company, with the flying red horse on top.

Reviews.Title: “Our entire staff stayed here for a convention and it was a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: cindylou2011
Reviews.Content: There is a great breakfast buffet and a wine reception in the evening. The downtown location is wonderful and the kitchens in the suites are a great advantage for a few day's stay. We truly enjoyed our visit and the only improvement I would suggest is more lighting in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in the convention area”
Reviews.Author: judy5088
Reviews.Content: welcome reception and breakfast are much appreciated and we always have shuttle at the door for our Dental convention, so the valet parking works for us. It is a little tricky to find the spot to stop for check in but this has always been true of downtown hotels. The valet guys are great, they watch and guide you out of the busy curbside pick-up. Would recommend and stay here again, this was second time for me... very roomy and an excellent redo of the Mobile Oil offices.

Reviews.Title: “Great Historical Hotel”
Reviews.Author: taxman25
Reviews.Content: Valet is excellent; service is supreme. Great downtown location with walking or short drive access to fine restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and room was nice but the elevators could be quicker.”
Reviews.Author: motleybabe
Reviews.Content: The hotel was busy and the elevators were super slow. But that is the only complaint I could come up with. The hotel is nice and the location is fantastic. Although we didn't get to take advantage, we liked the reception, milk and cookies and breakfast offerings.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Reception”
Reviews.Author: JWilliamson76
Reviews.Content: In town for family wedding; great reception at the hotel and nice room.

Reviews.Title: “The Magnolia is a grand hotel in the tradition set years ago.”
Reviews.Author: DebbyLong
Reviews.Content: The staff is helpful and responded to concerns. The room was beautiful, comfortable and well appointed. The food was excellent . We loved the cookie breaks at night,. We were with family members and were attending a wedding of one in Dallas. The hotel provided us a solid base from which to come and go as we needed to over a 3 day celebration. Can't beat that!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but a little disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: ypd1169
Reviews.Content: Beautiful historic hotel with great location. Rooms and bed were not as comfortable as most 4-star hotels. Valet left our car parked on the street, unlocked witht he key inside for a lengthy time.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: M8342
Reviews.Content: The stay was very nice, the rooms are big and the staff is wonderfully pleasant. I stayed here with my sister on a girls weekend and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “The complimentary things they offer is unbeatable!!”
Reviews.Author: orijinolz
Reviews.Content: I was here for the weekend from thursday - sunday and i enjoyed my stay although my room was a bit small everything else made my stay enjoyable! They offered complimentary breakfast buffet from 6am-9am during the weekdays and 7am-10am during the weekends. Which is great time for almost anyone to wake up for unlike other places where they offer continental breakfast from 6-7am where the hours are pretty unreasonable. Complimentary evening reception, 2 free complimentary drinks of wines and spirits 530pm-630pm Complimentary cookie buffet 830pm-10pm amazing soft oatmeal raisin cookies with milk! Complimentary shuttle service within 3 miles of the hotel, was able to get to many places around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Be Prepared”
Reviews.Author: weddingsergeant
Reviews.Content: No mini bar in queen suites, so take snacks. Only snack vending machine in the hotel (located on the 25th floor) not in working order & a block walk to 7-11 in freezing mist at 2 a.m. is no fun! Sunday morning checkout requires a lengthy wait at the curb for car to be brought around by valet service--no call ahead allowed. If street noises are bothersome and cause sleep issues, ask for an upper floor high above the traffic. Check your bill. We were charged for two days of valet parking, although we only stayed one night. All that being said, it is a beautiful, historic hotel with a great deal of charm and character, and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kss1328
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two evenings in a suite with a connecting queen room. My family with two young children and my parents were with me. It was the perfect set up for us. The suite was large, clean, comfortable and had everything we needed. The only area that I'd change would be the bed pillows - they were very hard and high, making it uncomfortable for sleeping. The front desk, valets, bellmen, etc. were very friendly and helpful. They also have a complimentary shuttle for downtown within two miles of the hotel. My child (and the rest of us) loved the cookies and milk at night. Room service was awesome! Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful inviting comfortable room, professional staff, went beyond expectations.”
Reviews.Author: mnedrmz74
Reviews.Content: All of our requests were taken care of without question. Our Check-in and Check-out were efficient and professional. The room was perfect, extremely comfortable bed, ideal bathroom, and gorgeous view.

Reviews.Title: “Post-holiday Pampering with Pegasus”
Reviews.Author: ProfAlpert
Reviews.Content: The hotel was art deco exquisite! The breakfast was friendly and tasty. The comfortable suite was private with a panaramic view of Dallas. The cookies and milk goodnight buffet gave us a warm cozy friendly feeling! We immensely enjoyed our post-holiday pampering with Pegasus!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a well-publicized hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexanTraveler079
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the fantastic location, right in the heart of downtown, to a short valet line. The rooms on first glance looked great - nice decor, comfy beds. Things seemed to go downhill from there... It took three phone calls and 45 minutes for our bags to arrive at our room (they won't let you carry them up yourself because the elevators are small and slow). The bathroom was dirty upon arrival, and on our second day, the hallways were littered with empty beer cans. You're warned when you check in to call down to the valet for your car 15 minutes before you need it, except Saturdays and Sundays when they require that you wait in line outside (40 degree temperatures) for your vehicle, which is parked off-site. While the complimentary breakfast is nice, seating was inadequate for the number of individuals present. Couches and coffee tables tend to be the only available options. I can't speak to the other hospitality events (cocktails and cookies) as we did not attend these. Overall, I was disappointed by a hotel which advertises itself as a "friendly and helpful boutique hotel". The service was poor and when brought to the attention of the front desk, little was done to rectify the situation other than removing the valet charges from our bill.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Bautabing
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I've been in and with excellent service through out the stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel downtown without the $200-$250 price tag.”
Reviews.Author: RichOwens
Reviews.Content: Would definitely stay here again. Little details taken care of would take this hotel from great to stellar...

Reviews.Title: “Good, but could be better.”
Reviews.Author: ndidi67
Reviews.Content: I expected more from a hotel of that caliber. You have to pay 22 bucks for overnight valet, but right around the corner there is overnight parking for 8 bucks. They need to inform their guests about their parking options. The only reason I was aware was because I did my research before. At no time was I told that I would be charged 22 dollars to park overnight at the hotel by the valet or the front desk. I booked two suites for me and a friend. I requested that they be on high floors and in close proximity. My friend was on the 8th floor and I was on the 23rd. In the bedroom, only 3 of the 4 windows had blinds and one set was warped. Besides these little hiccups, the staff was nice, courteous and I had a great time. The room was nice, the valet service was excellent and I would not mind staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous old hotel with great extras”
Reviews.Author: kfr
Reviews.Content: A nicely renovated old hotel in downtown Dallas. The free beer/wine in the evening, milk and cookies at night and morning breakfast is a nice touch. Front desk people and valet parking staff were very friendly. There is no hotel restaurant but there are plenty nearby. Nice bathroom in our room (a wide tub). The big windows and high ceiling in our room made it nice and bright.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: abarneah
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in the Magnolia while visiting Dallas and had a pleasant stay with good value for our money. The hotel is nicely designed with large rooms and a very good bed. The staff was friendly and we were very positively surprised by the free shuttle service (3 mile radius) offered - which is important in a city like Dallas. The only improvement point was the complimentary breakfast buffet, which was a bit dull.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful building w/ great service and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: BayFamTexas
Reviews.Content: We initially booked a suite w/ one queen and when I requested a room high up w/ views, they gave us a corner room w/ 2 queens on the top floor w/ amazing views of Dallas. The building is incredible and the staff was very friendly and helpful w/ advice of places to go. We were on the 24th floor which, as I understand, has been kept more historic and less renovated than the other floors. As such, our room was more like a chic urban loft than a posh hotel room, which we thought was cool. Tall ceilings and huge windows w/ 2 foot deep window wells and original wood grates and panels gave the suite great historic charm. The separate kitchen had all the appliances and while dated, very useful. The bedroom was large w/ very comfortable beds and great black-out curtains. The living room had original wood flooring which was creaky but cool and with the modern furniture made it feel like a hip urban loft. The kids especially enjoyed the free soft drinks in the club room at 6pm and we all really liked the cookies at 10pm. The location is in the heart of downtown w/ easy access to many great things in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Our preferred "downtown" hotel.”
Reviews.Author: donna56760
Reviews.Content: We always have a very good experience when we stay at the Magnolia. It is our preferred "downtown" hotel. We like to stay here when we visit our son who lives downtown. It is convenient to his apt. and hotel offers nice amenities like the wine reception, cookies and milk, and the breakfast buffet. Employees are happy, helpful, and interested in making guests comfortable. We have recommended this hotel to friends many times.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; very friendly and professional staff.”
Reviews.Author: Erin_Baltimore
Reviews.Content: Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Loved the convenience to downtown shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a great location, comfort, a helpful staff, and a neat building, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Melz50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay here over the Christmas holiday since there was little room at the inn (family's house); we just decided to take some "us" time while doing the holiday visit. We're so glad we did since our stay at the Magnolia was excellent! First off, I did my research and found an excellent rate online for several nights stay (more than 3). That discount more than outweighed the price of the valet (yep, 22 dollars!), so we didn't feel too bad about that charge. Yes, that's pricey, but if you don't want to walk in the cold and rain AND the valet service is very good to excellent (it is), it's worth it. We did have to wait once for our car, but, hey, it's the holidays--lots of hustling and bustling going on out there. The room was lovely (a single queen on a high floor with lovely views from six (!) windows) and very clean. We had the standard room and had plenty of room. We slept well and enjoyed just relaxing in our room. Room service was prompt and tasty when we needed an evening snack (be aware of the gratuity that's mandatory!). The breakfasts were slightly varied each day. Starbucks is right off of the lobby if you need high test coffee. Cocktail hour was nice (limited to beer and wine), and the cookie bar was yummy. Both were held on the second floor area which was spacious and well appointed. It might've been nice if there had been an actual restaurant on the premises, but then again, there are AMAZING eateries surrounding the hotel, so an in house place is not needed. The only real 'con' is internet service. I found it to be sloooow at times, but it was adequate. We're planning on returning to the Magnolia in Dallas for another visit when we want to do some more exploring downtown or want to attend an event. It's a lovely, relaxing stay, and we love that this company is reviving old historic buildings in this way.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with exceptional service during the Christmas weekend.”
Reviews.Author: Connie12323
Reviews.Content: The only negative was slow internet the first night we were there. Went down to the club room on the 2nd floor and internet service was much improved. Nice breakfast, attentive staff, beautiful room. Took advantage of a weekend special including a low rate and free parking. Couldn't be happier with the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: PatUNH1980
Reviews.Content: We had a very good stay at this hotel. The included breakfast was excellent, as was the complimentary in-town shuttle service provided by the hotel. The room was nice, but felt random in terms of the finishings. We lucked out with a large corner room, but saw others that were not as spacious. The bar also had very odd hours, which I was strange for a city hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay with family!”
Reviews.Author: khearn68
Reviews.Content: Anytime we are in the area we will stay at the Magnolia! It is a beautiful property that is staffed with excellent people! Can't wait until we stay again! Cookies are awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Magnolia takes great care of their customers!”
Reviews.Author: krpalich
Reviews.Content: We had a great time, the hotel and staff were wonderful. We had a leak form the room above, maintenance came quick. We were moved to another room immediately and received a free nights stay. It was inconvenient to move, but we understand accidents do happen, and we were well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TexasMrsTex
Reviews.Content: I held our company Christmas party at the Magnolia. It was beautiful. The catering department did a wonderful job, and the staff was very nice. We stayed at the hotel overnight and the complementary breakfast the next morning was wonderful too. The building is old but they have done a fantastic job to maintain it and keep it look elegant. All around fantastic Landmark Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best place possible downtown”
Reviews.Author: bafromet
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to share with you all that have not tried the Magnolia....in the words of Nike - Do It! I am from E.Texas and when my wife and I come to Dallas to get away we always stay at the Magnolia. Centrally located, great restaraunts all around, night life with in walking distance (next door!) and an excellent (substitute free here) breakfast buffet that puts this deal over the top. Seriously the thing that makes this the nut? The cost - hands down the best value possible....get the suite room 1914 and enjoy the view!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay in Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: Ricklz
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Excellent quality, all the amenities one needs, nice large rooms, great view, and fantastic location! Great stay, whether for work or personal, I would stay here again anytime, and highly recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Patient”
Reviews.Author: Pyung
Reviews.Content: The employees were kind and patient. The design of the rooms were simple and nice also.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for Downtown”
Reviews.Author: missybikes
Reviews.Content: Lots of perks (drinks, cookies, breakfast!) and friendly faces-good work out equipment and happy staff make up for the somewhat sparse though nicely modern room and shabby bath floor mat. Counter in Bath pretty small for party preparations and no mirror over desk, but great beds and pillows and, best of all ...QUIET, yet near everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, beautiful historic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: annashoe
Reviews.Content: The little pluses make this my go-to hotel whenever I'm in downtown Dallas. Complimentary wine or beer in the evening, milk and cookies, very good breakfast and the complimentary shuttle service is something I use every time. The staff is friendly, efficient, and knowledgeable. The hotel is a mix of modern convenience (great wifi) and restored historic details (the elevators are really cool). Delicious room service too! This time I was on the 26th floor and we didn't have a desk in the room for me to work at (even while I play I have to be in touch with the office) but that was the only detail, and in the past I have had a desk in the room there. A lot of boutique hotels focus on the look and not the total package - this one gets it right.

Reviews.Title: “What a Disappointment and Management Unresponsive”
Reviews.Author: Texas12320
Reviews.Content: Terrible experience. We booked 11 rooms and requested double queens. Most of us were booked into single queens. It took over 1 hour for the front desk to get my sister with her 4 young grandchildren into the 3 rooms she had reserved. A family of 4 finally got into a room with one bed, a rollaway, and one had to sleep on the couch. Some of our double rooms remained a single and had a rollaway bed. So, if we had 4 in that room, the kids had to double up or sleep on the floor. The ice machine did not work on the 25th floor so you had to go to the basement. While I was there, I called and asked to speak to Jude...the Mgr on duty. He never called me back....at least he did not leave a message. I called Juan Morales on Monday at 1pm, the General Manager, and left a detailed message of my unpleasant experience. It is Friday and I have still not heard from him. The hotel is beautiful and for the most part comfortable; but the Reservations, Management, and Front Desk are horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DennisTh
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy staying at the Magnolia Hotel when I'm in Dallas. The hotel has a warmth and history that makes for a great stay. The rooms are much larger than a normal hotel, and are furnished extremely well.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL, GREAT LOCATION, CAN'T BE BEAT.”
Reviews.Author: leonard40t
Reviews.Content: Great room, Suite #510. Friendly Service. Accomodating staff. Super Location. Can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel. Awesome location and views. Very friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: NRBlaylock
Reviews.Content: Everything was great, the service was a little better than average, so was the food. The rooms were awesome. The view couldn't be beat stay in any room ending in 07 to get a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to find and the cookies are delicious at night!”
Reviews.Author: millszone
Reviews.Content: The noise level from the street kept me waking up during the night. The room was very small. Service was very good though. Great place to stay for the dining around the hotel and close to convention center. The staff will shuttle you there as well. Not a place for vacation stay though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Fun Time”
Reviews.Author: mimi10435
Reviews.Content: Our suite was very comfortable and large. We love the location because we were there for the Christmas parade and could see all the parade preparations from our windows. We like the "kid friendly" atmosphere of the hotel and lovely Christmas decorations. The slow elevators are the only negative thing we encountered during our stay. This is our third year at the hotel/parade and are looking forward to next year.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tkirksey617
Reviews.Content: We cannot say enough about the pleasantry of your hotel. Your staff and the accommodations exceeded all of our expectations. We will definitely be returning. Thank you for remembering the importance of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: charliemMcgregorTx
Reviews.Content: The downtown Dallas location is easy to locate , THE VALEY PARKING WAS A PLUS.All of the employees were very helpful and friendly. The complimentary breakfast was excellent.We enjoyed our stay,hope to see you soon.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdnile
Reviews.Content: Had a really nice stay here. Great location to watch the Christmas Parade. Great food, great location.

Reviews.Title: “The historic location only added to the charm!”
Reviews.Author: kjcparis
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, The historic charm of the building was great. It is the building with the red pegasus. Great service and lots of amenities, from the happy hour, the milk and cookie bar at night and the American breakfast in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Quick service from valet and check in/out but average overall”
Reviews.Author: ok2eme
Reviews.Content: The beds would have been wonderful if they had normal sized pillow. They were oversized to the extreme you could not lay your head on one and be comfortable unless watching TV. Not any smaller ones for sleeping. Door keys were hard to use and sometimes did not work. Ice Machine was down in the only vending area (27th floor) for entire stay. We were there for company Christmas party. The party staff and layout for the area were very nice and worked out great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel - you will not be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: wstrauss818
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and amenities. The room was very comfortable. The night services and breakfast buffet cannot be beat. We traveled with an infant and young child and we all had a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “pleased”
Reviews.Author: hopeless025
Reviews.Content: this hotel is very cozy and clean...centrally located to drug stores and different style restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, poor thermostat.”
Reviews.Author: FACHE
Reviews.Content: great value, great room, great bed, very poor thermostat, funny smell in the lobby and elevator. great business center, great cookies at 8pm.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, I wouldn't recommend the historical floor.”
Reviews.Author: iehotelstayer
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful!!! They were quick to assist and friendly. I like historical hotels, so I thought the historic 24th floor would be nice, but it was lacking. The room seemed dingy and not very unique.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What We Needed”
Reviews.Author: KristyW_79
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Magnolia while breaking up our return trip across the USA in Dallas. We were very happy with the room and the hotel itself. We had two queen beds - which were quite comfortable. Our only (small) quibble was that we couldn't turn off the fan in the bathroom. Everything was clean and it was pretty much what you would expect from a good hotel. The staff in the hotel were helpful at every turn, giving us maps, directions and any information we needed. They were generous with their "happy hour" drinks (full glasses). Breakfast was delicious. The hotel itself was close to everything we wanted to do. We could walk to Pioneer Plaza, the JFK memorial, the 6th Floor Museum and many other attractions we would have loved to see but simply didn't have time. I would recommend the Magnolia to anyone visiting Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Franklmac
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Magnolia while we are in Dallas, both when I'm on business and when we are in town to see friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and we had 75 rooms blocked a wedding.”
Reviews.Author: Sandy_G
Reviews.Content: Very friendly. Very Good Value. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. Valet was very nice and helpful. Our only problem was transport didn't know where the wedding venue was on several occasions and got lost. This was the only problem we encountered the whole 10 days. Overall excellent stay! Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Htownmama
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, comfy beds, high count sheets! Spectacular views of the city! Centrally located to all the DFW events. Nightly reception and cookie event. This place will not disappoint!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value.”
Reviews.Author: mward16
Reviews.Content: Great location and great value. Room service was not convient and microwave in the room was not clean but overall great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rest easy. You've chosen the right hotel!”
Reviews.Author: conciergeben
Reviews.Content: As a chef concierge in mainstream boutique hotels for 10 years, I know EXACTLY what to look for when it comes to deals, scams, short-cuts, laziness and outstanding service in regard to mainstream hotels. And the main question people need to ask when writing an HONEST review is simply, "Did I get what I paid for?" If I'm paying top-dollar in a hotel, was the service I received worth the money I paid...? Many times, people will write a bad review based on a SINGLE incident that may not have gone the way they wanted. And most of the time, it's something that policy doesn't allow or something simple that could have been avoided with better preparation by the guest. I'm telling you, the staff at Hotel Magnolia "gets" it. They understand the process and they anticipate guest's needs better than any hotel I've ever stayed at! My girlfriend and I were staying for the Cowboys v. Saints game on Thanksgiving and booked blindly, based mostly on reviews and word-of-mouth. When we checked in, the valet was on our car before we could blink. Then, when we checked in we were offered an upgrade without even asking for one. And trust me, most front desk staff are either too lazy to re-block a room or don't care enough to offer. And I don't normally give employee names when I write a review, but Sophia is one of the sharpest front desk employees they have working for them. Example: Their hot tub was under construction during our stay (which makes sense, if you're going to do maintenance, do it on a holiday when occupancy is low). Of course, this was one of the features that helped us make our decision about which hotel to stay at. Without a second thought she asked us whether we preferred champagne or wine. She not only sent it up immediately, she also added chocolate covered strawberries and bubble bath for us as an added surprise. Very impressive reaction and service considering she had just found out about the hot tub minutes before we did. Exactly the way I would have handled the situation myself! "What can we offer to you in lieu of an amenity we have deprived you of...?" It makes me smile that they think that way. After the strawberries, I hopped in the shower and LORD! They have the most PERFECT shower heads in existence! I wanted to stay in for the rest of the trip! They offered a complimentary beer and wine reception and a complimentary set up of cookies and milk at night. Then, complimentary breakfast in the morning! Valet time was as expected, about 10-15 minutes. Service was excellent in that department as well. I fully plan on making a return trip to Dallas JUST to stay in this hotel again! I'm sure I can make up SOME excuse to come to Dalls...

Reviews.Title: “Very attractive, all you'd expect.”
Reviews.Author: TurkeyTrotFinisher
Reviews.Content: Beautiful oversized rooms with very pleasing neutral colors in a snazzy yet serene contemporary style. Suites are especially nice - full kitchen, large desk/table, nice seating area. Very comfortable beds. Fun "cookies and milk" buffet every night. Front desk staff is always pleasant and helpful. We've stayed here repeatedly over 6 - 7 years and it's always wonderful. They maintain the hotel meticulously - you just don't see the nicks and scrapes that even nice hotels will sometimes have in corridors, baths, etc. The only quibble I can come up with is that the water in the shower wasn't all that hot - but it's a minor quibble and wouldn't keep us from staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “love the hotel”
Reviews.Author: hhnash
Reviews.Content: We live in Richardson, but had a wedding to attend and decided to treat ourselves to a nigth out, instead of driving home. Could not have made a better choice. Our stay, although short, was wonderful. Will recommend the hotel to others. It is right down the block from Neiman's and across the courtyard from Iron Cactus. Close to the longhorn bronzes, West End, Thanksgiving Square, and everything else! Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing! Beautiful hotel, incredible service; pampering every minute. More amenities than any other hotel.”
Reviews.Author: cherokeechick
Reviews.Content: This is the BEST downtown hotel we have ever stayed in. Immaculate, comfortable rooms, fabulous food and drinks, more amenitites than anywhere else,absolutely beautiful atmosphere. Great location and the best service anywhere. Fantastic value as well. If you like classic downtown hotels, you MUST experience the Magnolia in Dalla.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding”
Reviews.Author: destinati0n
Reviews.Content: Wonderful time at the Magnolia. About 40 guest choose the Magnolia as the hotel of 1st choice. The wedding was simply beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome !!!”
Reviews.Author: carterbigb67
Reviews.Content: Superb hotel that deserves all the accolades that comes its way ! I live in Dallas, and the moment I stepped in the Magnolia I thought I was in another state...that's the mindset you feel with this hotel. I felt like I was on vacation !!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: cunderw
Reviews.Content: Fantasic! They up-graded us for FREE from a regular room to suite. Will definitely recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “I stayed overnight at the Magnolia and the incredible hotel environment melted away the stress of my 6am-6pm day job.”
Reviews.Author: RRGlowka
Reviews.Content: My new favorite hotel. I stayed overnight at the Magnolia and the incredible hotel environment melted away the stress of my 6am-6pm day job. It is located in the heart of the new urban Dallas area with close restaurants, drugstores, etc., but everything you would need was located in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Magnolia hotel in Dallas - great find!”
Reviews.Author: LASG
Reviews.Content: A gem of a hotel in the heart of downtown Dallas. Great room, beautiful view, wonderful complementary amenities - happy hour, cookie buffet, breakfast and in-room internet. Room size was fantastic - felt like an apartment. A very pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Special Experience and a Great Value”
Reviews.Author: LauraS071
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much. The drink tickets, milk and cookie bar, and breakfast make the Magnolia stand out among the other hotels. The staff went above and beyond with a genuine smile on their face. A unique experience that we would love to do all over again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel stay....highly recommed it!”
Reviews.Author: adettra
Reviews.Content: This was probably the most delightful stay we have ever had at a hotel. We spent two nights here, two adults and two children.
