The staff was most helpful, from recommending where to get great BBQ to offering to have their driver take us there and back! The breakfast buffet was outstanding, and the milk and cookies reception in the evening fabulous as well. The kids loved their Shirley Temples at the free happy hour. The room was comfortable and roomy enough for our party of four. The bath amenities were top notch and we loved the humorous signs in the elevators explaining that their older elevators were sometimes fast and sometimes slow. With a central, downtown location that canâ€™t be beat, I highly recommend the Magnolia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with friendly and helpful staff--especially valet staff”
Reviews.Author: Janet098
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely and was in close proximity to my business appointments. The breakfast buffet was wonderful and convenient. I had a great deal of luggage to deal with due to my business dealings, and the valet staff helped me manage that very well. Also, we used the shuttle service, and this was essential to getting to my business appointment on time and with all of my stuff. I would definitely recommend the Magnolia!

Reviews.Title: “The Magnolia House is a classy place, good service and amenities.”
Reviews.Author: tjsmiles_10
Reviews.Content: Great Breakfast Buffet, Cocktail hour, and evening cookie treat. Valet/shullte service was convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - We would recommend this hotel for it's beauty and friendliness of staff.”
Reviews.Author: Greg067
Reviews.Content: The location was very convenient for seeing the sights of Dallas. The shuttle service was great when we were pressed for time and unable to walk to our destination. The room was unique and offered a nice view of Dallas. We enjoyed the drinks, cookies and breakfast offered in the Club room. Free internet connection would have been helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Some staff members need customer service training”
Reviews.Author: banmar
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and location. The staff wasn't very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Night”
Reviews.Author: junebug0605
Reviews.Content: Husband and I stayed one night here while we were in Dallas. Great hotel, great location. Walked to the Iron Cactus for dinner. Neiman Marcus is a block away. Every night they offer free drinks and milk and cookies and also breakfast in the morning. The bar set up is great. Lots of seating and very comfy. We stayed in a suite. Plenty of room. Small kitchen dining and living area. Great hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “amazing first time stay at Magnolia and will again”
Reviews.Author: italybound
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel to travelers wanting a hip downtown Dallas experience..close to Dallas Venues, restaurants, pubs..excellent facility and staff. easily accessible from freeway...nice rooms, comfy beds, garden tub, and large walk in shower. leisure or business, definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little perks for a reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: dawnjohn75
Reviews.Content: Stayed a Friday and Saturday night. This is a historic building but made very modern. Breakfast each morning (free), free drinks at 5:30-6:30 and milk and cookies at night...very nice. I don't know if I would come with kids as it's not really that kind of hotel. The concierge/valet guys were awesome...especially Dan. They have a complimentary shuttle for close areas and is better than a cab ride. You can walk to several restaurants, CVS, etc. and West End isn't more than 5-10 minutes by car. My only complaint was the hard, and I mean hard, pillows. We felt very at home here and would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are fine and cookies are good.”
Reviews.Author: KCCowboy
Reviews.Content: Friendly and courteous staff. Great location. Check out the courtesy cars. They will take you to downtown locations and will do so with pleasure! Be sure to leave a tip....it's not expected, but it's deserved.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is courteous, competent and cheerful.”
Reviews.Author: javiho
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel, comfortable and for my purpose( attending the opera) suitable. I wish you would have special opera rates. Javier Honda

Reviews.Title: “The Magnolia in November - The facility is very nice, but the best part is the friendly, responsive staff.”
Reviews.Author: ltt5
Reviews.Content: Again, the best part about the hotel is the friendly helpful staff. The club room staff make me feel welcome and taken care of. The front desk and parking staffs are very good too. Combined with a comfortable convenient facility, I always enjoy staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Magnolia!”
Reviews.Author: amandaj27
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a great time at the Magnolia hotel. We had a cozy room with a very comfortable bed and loved the oval soaking tub. We will definitely be back and recommend to friends!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely worth it!!”
Reviews.Author: cc69ridr
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, beds were SUPER comfortable, bathtub was huge, and staff was super kind, friendly and courteous. Kids LOVED the cookie bar. Adults LOVED the reception in the evenings. Breakfast buffet was also AWESOME! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, felt like a VIP.”
Reviews.Author: deerslyr1
Reviews.Content: Had an awesome stay was treated with dignity and respect. The staff was not only friendly, but extremely helpful as well. I'll reccomend thsi hotel to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, need to work out kinks with valet.”
Reviews.Author: mikey32_22
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, nice location. Elevators are slow, but they are the originals, and this is a historic building. But the valet has no excuse. Its expensive, you dont have an option to avoid it, and they require too much notice to get your car out for the price.

Reviews.Title: “The customer service was great!!!”
Reviews.Author: errolhughes5
Reviews.Content: My room was a little small but the customer service made up for it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Magnolia Hotel in Dallas is the only place we stay when we are in Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: sonyaj68
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia Hotel in Dallas will not disappoint! The cost is excellent considering the location, the luxury and the service.

Reviews.Title: “The Magnolia always has great service and a cozy bed!”
Reviews.Author: MrsRobinson985
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love staying at the Magnolia. Everyone is treated like royalty by the friendly staff and the rooms are always fun and cozy. Breakfast is available until 10:30, which is great! That extra 30 minutes allows me to make it! The milk and cookies at night are delicious - and the atmosphere of the hotel is ideal for just relaxing with a nice drink from the bar. Since the Magnolia is located in the old Mobil building - it's neat to see all the Pegasus in unexpected places - gives it an eclectic vibe. We definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and deals. Valet service needs to improve.”
Reviews.Author: ExComm
Reviews.Content: Everything is great about the hotel with the exception of the valet service. Also, very very loud throughout the night if you are on a low floor.

Reviews.Title: “Dallas skyline....”
Reviews.Author: JACANDROB
Reviews.Content: trendy and convenient to sporting events, shopping, and nightlife...

Reviews.Title: “One of most comfortable beds in which I've ever slept; charming, relaxing decor; helpful staff; loved bldg history.”
Reviews.Author: bbb6708tsb
Reviews.Content: The room was so comfortable and cozy that I did not want to leave to attend my conference. I was always glad to enter my room and collapse on the bed. The bathtub was great. An oval shape and not so deep--great for soaking. I did not see a concierge but it was not a problem because the front desk and valet staff were all knowledgeable and helpful. If you are attending a conference at the Conference Center, valet will drive you (anywhere within a 3-mile radius). Be sure to let them know ahead of time. I didn't think about it the first day and both vans were out and not due to return for 20-30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good Area”
Reviews.Author: cmor13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a bachelorette party, had a suite and adjoining room. Lots of space and was clean. I enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “close to the American Airlines Center”
Reviews.Author: gee0408
Reviews.Content: The room had 6 windows and therefore, 6 mini blinds to close with one broke and light that shined in my room all night on my bed. I was on 4th floor so the noise from the street was loud and I was awakened at 230 am of loud drunks getting out of the bar below on the streets yelling etc. The room was clean and nice. Not real fancy as it is an old building. Service was friendly and helpful. Close walking distance to alot of restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: google32070
Reviews.Content: I was in Dallas for a family wedding. The Magnolia Hotel was chosen for the guests to stay at . The bride and groom made an excellent choice! I needed a handicap accessible room which met my needs very well. Overall, I was quite impressed with the service of the staff, the amenities were inviting and our group room rate was FANTASTIC for being in a big downtown city!! One suggestion: more lighting in the guest rooms. There were plenty of lamps, but higher watts needed in them. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone for any occasion!

Reviews.Title: “Overall A Great Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: kscdancer
Reviews.Content: I will only express the 'problems', if you will, I had with our stay. There were only two elevators working, I think out of six. The hotel did have signs up by the elevators stating that the guests should plan for additional wait time due to the number of people staying at the hotel because of events. Were not able to use the hotel shuttle to our restaurant like we were informed. The front desk told us to let the valet desk know we needed a shuttle 15-20 minutes beforehand. When we did so, the valet worker (not extremely nice) pretty much told us that that would not happen, as due to the large number of guests, another available shuttle would not be ready until ATLEAST 25 minutes, which would, of course, make us late for our reservations. We had to drive ourselves. Thank goodness for GPS. The valet desk DID, however, pull our car around for us quickly. Others: Happy hour was nice. Very friendly bartender. Great house wine selection.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back for a "stay-cation" anytime!”
Reviews.Author: nhkellogg
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight to attend a wedding in town. Beautiful hotel! Love the historic nature of it! Location is great - nestled right in the heart of historic downtown and close to the arts district. Breakfast buffet was very good! We really had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Grand and traditional feel with polished contemporary amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Marjorie513
Reviews.Content: This is a grand traditional building with tailored handsome decor. The reception staff were very helpful - went out of their way to find me a source for frozen yogurt when I happened to ask about if. . The Club Room is a VERY easy place when you are a solo traveler, as it includes comfortable chairs and love seats with small tables, easy areas to work when you don't feel like staying in your room. I especially appreciate free wireless. The free breakfast was terrific, beautifully set out, and easy to access when you are on a tight morning time schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel: well run with a pleasant staff.”
Reviews.Author: artistgonebad
Reviews.Content: This is a belated post. I thought I left a review shortly after my stay last April, but I must have not saved it. But it was a nice stay and I felt it is worth noting my thoughts a few months after my stay. The front desk staff was always nice and quite helpful. I arrived the day before my conference began and they made several excellent suggestions on places to visit and dine. Housekeeping was also staffed by friendly people and the room was immaculate - one of the cleanest hotel rooms I've stayed in a long time. The room itself was also quite nice. I lucked out and was given a room that must have been an executive's office back when this was an office building: the room is a small wing from the main building, thus giving me three walls of windows. As such, the room was very bright and also very quiet. As others have noted, the breakfast is quite good. Likewise the coffee & cookies in the evening is a very nice touch. There were two drawbacks to my stay. the first is the elevators. Again, others have criticized the hotel for the slow elevators and unfortunately the criticism is deserved. The second one isn't related to the hotel, it's a regional thing: there is no coffee on weekends in Dallas. I don't know why this is the case, but every coffee shop in the city shuts down on (early) Friday afternoon. To a coffee addict like me that is beyond a cruel joke. At least the Magnolia offered an in-room coffee maker to get me through the ordeal...

Reviews.Title: “Easy, comfortable, relaxing, hassle-free”
Reviews.Author: lc12775
Reviews.Content: I travelled here for a business trip by myself. The ammenities were great, my room was awesome, transportation to and from airport was perfect. I was very pleased all the way around.

Reviews.Title: “Slow elevators and miserable car valet service.”
Reviews.Author: jimpat01
Reviews.Content: OK location for down town events, but you are forced to valet park. Our first time trying to retrieve our car took 45 minutes. Hotel was full for weddings and sporting events, but 45 minutes to get a car is just not acceptable. For big events, bring on more staff. On Saturday morning, it took 20 minutes to get an elevator down from the 17th floor, because only two banks of 5 were in service. We ended up just adding 90 minutes to our wedding schedule just to make sure we could be places on time. On Sunday morning, only two people working the car valet desk. This time they could not find our keys. We had dropped off around 11 PM the night before which was a busy time, and the valet handed me what turned out to be the parking slip from my keys which he had ripped off. Next morning, no keys. With a line of people starting to que up for cars behind me, I ended up searching their board for my keys and then walking two block to their parking garage and literally walking the floors to find where they had parked my car. Fortunately they found my keys in a corner of the valet desk where they had been tossed the night before. Time to get my car on a Sunday morning? A much improved 25 minutes. We also got panhandled right outside their front door on Saturday morning. Not on the street, but in their interior entry courtyard. So much for security. On the other hand, they were all very polite and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “oh my! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: softsheets
Reviews.Content: trendy, comfy, great service, comfortable beds. THIS is THE place to stay! Will come back!

Reviews.Title: “It was grrrrreat!”
Reviews.Author: BooRadleyandScout
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff were super friendly and helpful. The room was gorgeous and the view was amazing. The food was also very yummy. The design and style of the hotel was impeccable the building was built in the 20s and has s wonderful deco feel with a modern update. the being said a lot of people complain about the elevators but I though they worked just fine for an old building. And seriously if you are staying the on 20th something floor there will be many stops on the way to the lobby no matter what building/hotel you are in. It was great and the next time I'm in downtown Dallas I will be staying there.

Reviews.Title: “I found a comfortable oasis at the end of a hectic day!”
Reviews.Author: swiard
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel with the many comforting amenities in the middle of a large city provided a place to unwind at the end of the day with the evening reception, room service that provided a delicious meal when I didn't want to go out and "milk and homemade cookies" before bed that was so cozy before bed. The hotel was next to Neiman Marcus that filled the entire city block next door. I had lunch one day at a little neighborhood italian bistro with some great pasta and a salad. All in all, it was a great stay at the Magnolia and whenever I am in Dallas, I want to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Misses the Mark”
Reviews.Author: landers_joshua
Reviews.Content: Not quite there yet. Needs better management or better personnel insuring that the guests are treated equally, friendly, and that all things paid for are seen through. Whether it be the type of room, or type of add on packages. The Hotel itself was great, we loved the location, the look, and the feel.

Reviews.Title: “nice retreat after a hectic business day”
Reviews.Author: ssatripper
Reviews.Content: The service and accomodations are always excellent. Stay quite often for business and look forward to each stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: BitsyIllinois
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a good value. The room was clean and modern and provided free wifi. We enjoyed the free two drink happy hour every evening and the free hot breakfast buffet was wonderful. They also provide free cookies and milk from 8 - 10pm, but we did not partake in that activity. The only problems are that the elevators are slow and it is hard to find ice. The desk staff had to keep answering phones while they were trying to check people in/out, which slowed down the process. There were several excellent restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “great get away”
Reviews.Author: josh49
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, service was fantastic and the breakfast was incredible. Can't say enough good about the Magnolia. My wife and I stayed there for our anniversary and had an amazing time! The only issue I would have was the elevators...you need to give them a few minutes extra going up or down.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest hotel/staff, paid 1/2 bill with cash, and charged the full amount to the Credit card”
Reviews.Author: Devend
Reviews.Content: Buyer be ware. Had a bachlor party there. Collected funds from attendees, Paid for 1/2 of the bill in cash, and put 1/2 on my credit card. The front desk pocketed the cash, and charged cash amount on the credit card a month later.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- Elevators Need Work”
Reviews.Author: AFTJD
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with wonderful amenities (breakfast buffet, seemingly unlimited free drinks during evening reception, milk & cookies), but the elevators consistently caused problems-- a pity given everything else was so great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent services provided.”
Reviews.Author: daniel_seatonsr
Reviews.Content: I had other choices that would have been more convenient to the conference that brought me to Dallas. But, the services provided by the Magnolia Hotel (i.e. cookies & milk, afternoon drinks, great excercise room, great continental breakfast) could not be touched by the other hotels that were used for the conference. Also, having arrived 3 hours before check in presented no problem for the hotel; they placed me in a room immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Celebrating 1 Year Anniversary at The Magnolia”
Reviews.Author: yobethany
Reviews.Content: We held our wedding reception in the 2nd Floor Lounge at The Magnolia one year ago, and returned to celebrate our one-year anniversary last weekend. The staff was incredible. They gave us our wedding night suite and sent up chocolate covered strawberries and champagne. We were blown away by how accommodating and friendly they were. They made our wedding reception perfect, and this was perfect as well. They have amazing specials; sign up for the email and you will get news of free parking, free upgrades, etc. The special this past weekend was $119/night, including free valet, the standard complimentary cocktail hour (house wine and draft beer), cookies and milk, and complimentary buffet breakfast. We LOVE The Magnolia!! We will always stay here when we need a place in downtown Dallas; no need to go anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Yum-O”
Reviews.Author: Earlene_10
Reviews.Content: This place was delicious! Great breakfast to start off the day! Not one of those crummy continentals either! We are talking best biscuits and gravy, tons of eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, etc. And the milk/cookies treat was the perfect ending to our first day. The location is great... within walking distance to just about anything in the downtown area. And the sleeping is wonderful too! The bed was perfectly comfy, the room was dark and quiet, even though we were in the downtown area, right off Commerce St.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: geniebake
Reviews.Content: although it is an older hotel, it is very trendy with its updates. Location/price for quality is great plus you get so many little extras for free. The staff was incredibly helpful. I was 7 months pregnant during my stay, slept great and when i got hungry at 2am, the staff knew several delivery services (had menus available) plus directions to places within a couple blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Magnolia Hotel - A Downtown Dallas Best Values!”
Reviews.Author: epptech
Reviews.Content: Just left the Magnolia Hotel yesterday and I didn't want to leave! This historic boutique hotel had just the right blend of historic charm combined with modern amenities. From the yummy buffet breakfast available - no - crusty donuts and stale coffee here - to the comfy bed with plush over-sized pillows, I had to keep reminding myself that I was there for business and not pleasure. The hotel staff was friendly and informative, always available and the hotel shuttle was so comfortable - immaculate with careful, informative drivers. Although my schedule didn't allow me to avail myself of them, there was also a complimentary evening reception and the free cookies and milk at bedtime - ok, I admit that's the reason I booked the Magnolia in the first place. :) Fabulous stay, I can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: jek006
Reviews.Content: They were very helpful and even gave me a special Labor Day price that included FREE drinks, cookies and milk and a great breakfast buffet!! Could it get any better?

Reviews.Title: “This hotel exceeded my expectations! It was lovely with a good environment.”
Reviews.Author: carese_dean
Reviews.Content: The hotel is historic with a quiet and romantic vibe. I would go here with someone close- friend or otherwise. The bathtub was perfect! The complimentary buffet and cookie treat at night are nice. The location is conveniently downtown with pleasures not far away... Enjoy I did!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Weekend”
Reviews.Author: cwsa5
Reviews.Content: Great weekend. Only a couple of things wrong. Mold was on air conditioning vent, however, the room was very clean and never smelled moldy. Black out shades were on one window and not the other therefore letting light in too early in the morning. We get up early anyway so, none of it ruined a nice relaxing weekend and the staff was super friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Sophisticated”
Reviews.Author: jrub630
Reviews.Content: Anytime I stay in downtown Dallas, Magnolia is my #1 choice. The location is great---near restaurants and nightlife. The rooms are very cozy, roomy, and clean. The suites have a downtown condo feel and great views. The evening reception and breakfast are great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ben_123032
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and comfortable; everyone was extremely friendly; Wife and I enjoyed the evening reception and the kids loved the milk and cookies before bedtime; breakfast was pretty much what I expected - good, not great. Valet parking is a little steep ($22/night) but overall a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: LeviK
Reviews.Content: He had a wonderful experience. The hotel was clean and the staff was helpful. The day we arrived they were filming a TV show and my 2 year old was a little loud for the director but the hotel staff didn't mind and made us feel welcome. Hollywood is not my problem. Parking was a little expensive but convenient. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the BEST Hotel Stay in Dallas! Magnolia Dallas should set the bar for other hotels!”
Reviews.Author: Amberdt7
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia Hotel is absolutely the BEST stay in Dallas and honestly one of the best experiences I have ever had with a hotel. Michelle, in reservations worked out an error made when I booked online, effortlessly! She called me back within minutes to solve my issue, upgrading my reservation and apologizing for the error, when I believe I made the mistake. The rooms were immaculate, the beds were heavenly, and the decor was modern and trendy. The hotel was breathtaking! The effort to restore original 1920's architecture while renovating to urban chic was architecturally exquisite! The staff was the most caring and friendly of any hotel or business I have been a customer of. Totally refreshing! The hotel chef, Michael, greeted our group and gave us a tour and history of some of the highlights of the hotel. The valet service manager, Dean, and James, met all of our transportation needs throughout the evening and treated us like royalty! We had not had the pleasure of attending the reception, experience the milk and cookies or partake in the breakfast buffet; but I am certain these would have been fabulous, as well. I travel regularly for business all over the US, but am based in the Dallas area. I will always book my business guests to stay at the Dallas Magnolia Hotel. It was SUPERB!

Reviews.Title: “BEST staff and stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: KayliS
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Magnolia for a wild and crazy bachelorette party weekend in Dallas. From the moment we arrived at the Magnolia, we were treated like royalty. The staff bent over backward and treated us like queens. James, the shuttle driver, was sweet and courteous, and kept us safe and entertained while we painted the town. Michael, the chef, gave us girls a personal tour of the hotel and even opened the hot tub for us to soak our dancing feet at 3 a.m. and John from the restaurant brought us pizza. We were forever grateful!! It must be a requirement to be good looking and sweet to work at this hotel! â˜º The rooms were historic and charming, a great value with fabulous views of the city (The Dallas ball was right outside of our window.) The rooms were spacious, almost like a classy loft apartment, and the bathrooms were big and cleanâ€¦(two showers in our room made getting 8 girls ready a breeze.) It also is close to great dining options (try the Iron Cactus right next door!) Overall, we had a fantastic experience and would definitely recommend it to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: izit19
Reviews.Content: we had a great stay. love this hotel. we live in dallas and just needed a night away.

Reviews.Title: “The Magnolia Is A Must If You Stay In Dallas! You Will Not Regret It!”
Reviews.Author: Propilot2k4
Reviews.Content: I Highly Recommend The Magnolia Hotel. I'm a pilot and stay in Hotels all over. The Magnolia is definitely at the top of the list of places to stay. My fiancÃ© booked a room at the Magnolia Hotel for my birthday. She called the hotel and got a GREAT rate. My fiancÃ© also asked if they had some kind of package that she could get for my birthday. Unfortunately, they did not... or so we thought. We arrived at the hotel, checked our car in valet, walked to the front desk and was welcomed with a warm smile from Valerie. All of the hotel staff was friendly, smiling, and very courteous. When we got to the room we walked in and on the dining room table was an ice bucket with complimentary Champaign and a covered dish of chocolate covered strawberries. We were both so surprised. The room we got was fantastic.... it was like a small apartment. It had a small dining room, living room, full size kitchen. large bath, and moderate size bedroom. We also had a great view of the city. I can't say enough good things about our experience at this hotel. It helped to make my 40th birthday perfect. Thank You Magnolia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: mgrannan
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia Dallas is our favorite place to stay in Dallas. Wonderful price and perfect location for downtown activities. The enitre staff is outstanding at every level. They really go the extra mile to make it a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “All about service”
Reviews.Author: KsquaredAustin_TX
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Magnolia Hotel over Labor Day weekend and they really cater to you. The valets were fast and helpful, suggesting evening activities when I mentioned that I hadn't made set plans that night, and finding my keys quickly and with a smile when I left my valet ticket in the car. The desk made sure we had everything we needed and were satisfied during check in and check out. The room I stayed in faced the other half of the building, so there was no view, but it was cozy and the bathroom was luxurious. It was easy to walk to restaurants, landmarks, and the aquarium from the hotel, and except for the check out rush, the elevators were quick.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat! Loved it, loved it, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: emilysatx
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia hotel did not disappoint! Everyone was very helpful and friendly. We were a little nervous because we didn't know what to expect but as soon as we drove up to valet...we were treated like royalty. All staff had a smile on their face and there was nothing we could have asked for that wasn't already delivered. The bedtime treats were awesome and it was so comfy to enjoy. Our room was excellent and the shower was over the top in relaxing. Thank you to everyone at the Magnolia for treating us so well and making us feel safe and comfortable. I will stay again! Ps. The bed was very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Magnolia - How sweet it is.”
Reviews.Author: ak5668
Reviews.Content: Certainly qa great find for the business traveler, with little touches that make it feel more personal. I am tired of the cold anonymity of so many hotels for business types that make you feel like a robot served by other robots. Nothing a little southern hospitality can't cure!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: OdieShu
Reviews.Content: Lovely and historic building. I've always stayed in suites, and they are spacious and well appointed. Lots of windows with terrific city views. Several great restaurants and clubs in walking distance. The amenities ( happy hour and breakfast included) make this hotel a fabulous value. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “You will not be dissappointed!”
Reviews.Author: aldrete99
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. I've stayed at many hotels and when I saw the great deal here, I thought it was a trick. They exceeded my expectations and the little gestures of breakfast, cookies at night... it was perfect. Friendly, professional and they genuinely care about their guests. I want to go back to Dallas just so I can stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect accomodations”
Reviews.Author: katdarcy
Reviews.Content: Large comfy and quiet rooms, friendly and helpful staff, very well maintained and clean in both public and private spaces, nice happy hour, free breakfast, and evening cookies. Very convenient location also and reasonably priced. I can highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: JennM61874
Reviews.Content: The Dallas Magnolia hands down was the best hotel in downtown Dallas. Superb staff and service. The complementary benefits they provide all their guests our absolutely wonderful and all other hotels should pay attention and take note on how to provide exceptional guest service. The staff was great. I don't know how they did it, but they managed to keep their cool during 105 degree days while juggling the needs of a wedding party, high school reunion and the guests staying there for our highly attended conference that weekend. Although they had their hands full, I witnessed them having to deal with all sorts of personalities and they remained courteous and very friendly to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: labmomma
Reviews.Content: Beautiful older hotel, beautifully maintained. Quiet and conveniently located downtown. Gracious and helpful staff. Great price and free valet parking. Would definitely stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely LOVE the Magnolia”
Reviews.Author: Monigreen_821
Reviews.Content: I always enjo my stay at the Magnolia and whenever I'm looking for an in-town weekend getaway, it's my hotel of choice. I most recently celebrated by 30th birthday here with friends. The suite was spacious, hip and within walking distance to Dallas nightlife. The breakfast buffet was one of the best I've had and the cookies and milk are a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Bright Sunrise Mornings & Cool Peaceful Nights”
Reviews.Author: 420Bayou
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, the valet service opened my car door, greeted me with a smile, retrieved my bags from the car, and delivered them to my room. The check-in was done in less than 5 minutes. The room was clean, decorated with nice colors, and the cool atmosphere was great. The bathroom was clean and the towels and amenities were laid out nicely. The daily evening reception was a nice time to relax with co-workers and take the edge of the days activities. The daily night time cookies and milk was a good way to end the evening before bedtime. The bedroom was so comfortable that I had to receive a wake-up call every morning from the front desk. Thanks for allowing me to wake up every morning to a bright sunrise and sleeping cool peaceful nights! Valerie Hines

Reviews.Title: “When do I get to go back!!! I loved this Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dirtgirl2
Reviews.Content: If you get a room that ends in 07 you will not believe the view. The higher the floor the better. My Brother was in the 15th floor and I on the 23rd...I went to sleep each night with a view of wonderful buildings from the windows on the left, center and right sided of my room. I building with a huge clock and blue neon wrapped spire was front and center. How wonderful to peak open my eyes and see what time it was off the huge clock. The room decor was perfect and the Garden tub in the spacious bath a nice surprise. The Hotel itself was very nicely staffed with energetic warm and friendly people. This Hotel really stands out as special!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: seaski42
Reviews.Content: This was our third weekend stay at Magnolia and we will return. I'm always amazed at how large the rooms are. They warn you about slow elevators but we found them to be much better than most older hotels. The evening reception with two free drinks and hot breakfast buffet make the hotel an excellent value. I hate paying for valet parking but they have run several specials lately with free valet. If you like well-maintained, charming vintage hotels in a downtown setting, I would highly recommend trying the Magnolia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 00FRED
Reviews.Content: Would stay there again. Close to the Dart rail system. Was just a quick ride to Lovefield. Was easy to get in and out of Dallas for business. Many locations around hotel for fine dining, The doorman ride to airport was a hundred percent better than the taxi service.Next time I'm in Dallas for business or fun I;ll be staying at the Magnolia Hotel. Rooms were clean and up to date.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: klmktravel22
Reviews.Content: The staff was super friendly & helpful. I loved their free cookie reception in the evening. Also, they had a free shuttle service that would drop you off and pick you up for free within a certain distance from the hotel. The room was spacious & beautiful & so was the rest of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We were very well cared for!”
Reviews.Author: sandyparker525
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have had any better experience at a hotel. The Magnolia goes above and beyond to take exceptional care of their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, like a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTrav2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very comfortable, clean, ideally located for the business I had to do, and caters to the guests very well. I do appreciated all the special touches they offer to make the stay more relaxing--Hot/Cold Breakfast, Wine and Beer reception, Fresh Bedtime Cookies. My room had the feel of a loft apartment, which made it quite interesting. I enjoyed my stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Southern Gem”
Reviews.Author: USCGamecocks
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia is a beautiful, clean, and outstanding hotel. The staff members are helpful and friendly. The valet team is outstanding...professional and courteous. The atmosphere is pleasant. My room was always clean and linen restocked, however, I never the room attendant. The evening reception is great, but the cookies & milk are outstanding a pleasant surprise. It is a family hotel. The hotel is conveniently located near the West End, Starbucks, and Neiman Marcus. I will definitely stay at the Magnolia in the future. Only suggestion: limit one elevator and particular rooms to pet lovers. Everyone does not love dogs/cats and should not be subjected to pet owners that do not control their pets.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hospitality and very helpful!”
Reviews.Author: NC_Gal911
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and secure hotel in downtown Dallas. I would love to stay here if I travel back to Dallas for business again. Close to shopping (Nieman Marcus) and other areas as well as restaurants. Shuttle service provided by hotel was extremely helpful and courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Texangs
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. When I first arrived, we had a small dispute over my using my personal credit/debit card for incidentals. The manager came out, worked it out to my satisfaction, gave us an upgrade on our room. The staff was great, even the men providing the shuttle to the host hotel for the conference. Sometimes I didn't tip, and that did not affect how kind and courteous they were. The breakfast buffet is wonderful - with real food, not just sweet rolls and great coffee. I hope to have the opportunity to stay at the Magnolia again!!

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: Ann33388
Reviews.Content: I stay at the magnolia every time I am in Dallas. Staff, rooms and amenities are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: bittlebug1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Very convenient. Nice staff. Great rooms!

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL EMPLOYEES! RUDE and DISRESPECTFUL! I would NEVER stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Veryunhappyguest27
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely however, the employees are extremely rude and very unprofessional. I have stayed at many 5 star resorts and hotels and this by far was the WORST experience than I have ever had! When I walked to the front desk, the girl behind the counter RUDELY informed me that I handed her my debit card instead of a credit card. I told her that was how I was paying. Is being wealthy in your bank account an issue these days??? So, she smirked and ran my card. When she gave me the amount I was unclear on the charges so I asked her where the additional $100 came into play? She RUDELY asked "Did you park valet?" I said "Yes" She said "Well it is $22 a day. If you don't want to park Valet you can always go get your car and park it yourself! This is DALLAS!" As if I was from some small town out in the middle of no where and as if I were some PEASANT. I think my jaw dropped! I said NO that is ok, I was just asking for you to clarify. She smirked again and handed me my key and she then asked me... "IS THAT EVERYTHING?" As if I WAS BOTHERING HER!!! I said no and took the keys and she just stood there! She didn't say "Enjoy your stay at the Magnolia....or... If there is anything else please let me know!" NOTHING. NOT EVEN A SMILE! The room was fine. Clean. HOWEVER, I was woken up at 6 in the morning by my smoke alarm BEEPING non stop. So I called down and they sent someone to look at it. The guy said... Well it is broken. I have to go get another one. And he removed it from the ceiling and DID NOT RETURN! I went to my event.... I was sitting at the table and 3 of my friends who were also staying at the hotel said the SAME THING happened to them with the front desk girl! So I wasn't imagining things! I stayed another night since I didn't feel like driving back tired.... ordered room service which was very good! Then did the express check out so I DID NOT have to meet up with Ms. Nasty Pants again! As I was leaving .... low and behold there she stood at the front desk in all her glory.... SMIRKING AT ME! I just walked to valet... I was entirely too tired to go to the front and speak with a manager. I just didn't have it in me. As I was standing at valet. I was approached by the Valet gentleman and I handed him another place's valet ticket... they were both blue so I could clearly see that happening. WELL he didn't think it was an obvious reason for a mistake. He handed it back and said "THIS is NOT the Magnolia's!" I said " Oh I'm sorry about that" and began looking through my purse for their ticket. He TURNED HIS BACK to me and said to another employee standing there. " I have NO IDEA what that WAS ABOUT!" I just HAD to respond! I was NOT HAPPY at this point! I said " Well clearly I must have Valet'd somewhere else!" He looked at me and just WALKED AWAY! I stood there .... jaw dropped on the ground! Another employee saw my reaction and walked over to me and said Ma'am do you have your ticket. I said I am looking for it. He said well what kind of car do you have? I said "I drive an Infiniti" He said "Oh I know which car that is" I looked at the board of keys and said "My key is on # blah blah blah" .... as he handed my key to another valet man... the other employee who so RUDELY turned his BACK earlier walked over and started to YELL at the gentleman helping me! He told him to go stand somewhere else.... and they began bickering right in front of ME!!! As if I were NOT A GUEST at their hotel! I again felt like saying IS THIS REALLY HAPPENING???? I will NEVER EVER EVER stay at this hotel again. I will not recommend it to any of my friends or family memebers. The room was decent. But I would stay at another DECENT hotel before I gave my business to this place!

Reviews.Title: “Always a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: JGD111
Reviews.Content: I stay there every time. Always a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “We had an AWESOME time!”
Reviews.Author: GinaZ96
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome time during our stay. From the valet attendants to the front counter to cooks to shuttle service- Everyone was very nice and polite. Didn't matter if it was 3 in the afternoon or 3 in the morning (which it really was) Everyone was Awesome. I am from a small community. So small we do not have a city limits. I was very nervous about taking a taxi, that feeling was put aside once Valet offered us the hotel shuttle service to get to and from our destination. We have already recommended the Magnolia to our family and friends. We WILL be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay in Dallas at the Magnolia”
Reviews.Author: SharonAPolson
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time to stay at the Magnola and it was fabulous. Your staff is so friendly and it's a joy to be a guest there. Having the shuttle to the convention center this year made it perfect. The rooms are lovely and will stay in the suite again next year. Thanks again for making my Mary Kay Seminar a wonderful memory. See you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home, the most welcoming atmosphere!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LoloB_10
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia is always a fabulous place to stay! The staff treats us like royalty, the breakfast and cookies at night are awesome and you can't beat the location!!!

Reviews.Title: “Family comfort and Continental style”
Reviews.Author: renolauro
Reviews.Content: The Dallas Magnolia is a classic hotel with modern continental style and homey amenities. The beds were divine. The three year old loved the milk and cookies bar in the evening. The American Breakfast buffet was delicious. The location is perfectly situated at the heart of the new Dallas. we wished we stayed there a month.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel.....has everything you would want!”
Reviews.Author: Jerry1128
Reviews.Content: This was the 2nd time I have stayed at the Magnolia and plan to stay there again next yr. when I attend Mary Kay Seminar. The staff & valets are so friendly, and the shuttle service from the hotel to the convention center was great!! The breakfast buffet is fantastic....everything you could ask for! Love the complimentary cookies & coffee in the evening, and it was great having boxed dinners since we usually had to be somewhere in the evening and really didn't have alot of time. Would highly recommend the Magnolia to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mickey074
Reviews.Content: After traveling to Mary Kay Seminar for 25 years this was the most relaxing trip. I hestiated booking at the hotel because of going back and forth to the convention center. The shuttle service was so convient for us. We didn't have long lines to wait. Also, the drivers were so professional and couteous. We loved all the extra amenties the hotel provided for us that actually helped us to reduce our expenses. We definitely plan to stay mnext year.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service”
Reviews.Author: RitaRudisill
Reviews.Content: This was the first time that I stayed at the Magnolia and it was AWESOME! My business associates told me that it was a great hotel, and they were not exaggerating! I enjoyed the room - the bed was SO comfy, and the decor was elegant. Housekeeping staff was very accommodating and our room was spotless. The breakfast buffet was great and gave me the perfect start for the day - extra KUDOS for having Activia! Cookies at night was an extra bonus. Talk about the GREAT service from the shuttle staff!!! They always came quickly when called and were so friendly and concerned for my safety. I would recommend this hotel with it's staff to everyone! Thank you so very much for making me welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wassonjackie0
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there for 2 different times when attending our annual Mary Kay seminar. Nice & reasonable. A++++++ for the buffet breakfast, everything you could possibly want to eat!

Reviews.Title: “The Magnolia is like a home away from home....Friendliest courteous staff in the whole world. Excellent Breakfast & more”
Reviews.Author: patskincare
Reviews.Content: Wow the staff are so friendly and kind. The breakfast buffet Wow! unbelievable. The evening happy hour and special meals where awesome........and the Cookies before bedtime a wonderful touch. Your valet staff are the best with prompt efficient and friendly service. I cannot think of one negative thing to say about the Dallas Magnolia. It is always a treat and a pleasant stay coming to Dallas and staying at the Magnolia. I know I will be taken care of and looked after and feel cared for.

Reviews.Title: “The staff provided 'Golden Rule' service.”
Reviews.Author: ms_freckles
Reviews.Content: I stayed there during Mary Kay convention, and the entire staff was amazing. I wouldn't think twice about staying there again. The only problem the first day was the wait for the elevators during conference "rush hour". The hotel, however, assigned staff to man the elevators on following days, thus fixing the problem.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed My Stay”
Reviews.Author: CarrieB123
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia Hotel provided me with everything that I needed during my stay. The staff was friendly, accomodating, and helpful. I would return to the Magnolia just for the staff alone. Other than that, my bed was very comfortable and I enjoyed the breakfast each morning, the complimentary beverages in the afternoon and the coffee, milk and cookies each evening. Even though the hotel was full of guests, my room was quiet and peaceful. It was within walking distance to the Convention center and when I didn't want to walk the staff quickly took care of my traveling needs.

Reviews.Title: “elegant”
Reviews.Author: TammyParker
Reviews.Content: The beds were amazing. Bathtubs were huge and relaxing. Shuttles and staff were amazing. loved it :)

Reviews.Title: “Comfy, cozy gem in a surprisingly quiet hotel in downtown Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: jcmother
Reviews.Content: I LoVE this hotel and my group stays here each summer for a business conference. The free breakfast is wonderful...eggs, meats, potatoes, pastries, cereal, fruit...all delicious. This hotel blocks out the bustle of downtown activity, but is an easy walk to the convention center. Rooms are great, and I especially love the suites with full kitchens. A gem!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible food, quaint room, pleasant staff, very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: fbrattain
Reviews.Content: Very accomodating staff, shuttle service, breakfast buffet (free), cookies and milk at night. Rooms are so cozy. Love all the little things that make this hotel so great!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!! Over the top in service, amenities, cleanliness and food!”
Reviews.Author: kyblue1
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel was filled with a lot of Mary Kay women attending Seminar, the staff was helpful, friendly and cooperative. There are not enough words to explain what a great hotel the Magnolia is. The decor is quitely elegant, the rooms are spacious, quiet and very well decorated! What an experience. The Magnolia is definitely at the top of the list for next year!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!! Would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: tlm2007
Reviews.Content: We went up for my sister's wedding and the hotel was amazing and the staff was helpful! The weekend we went there was also a Mary Kay seminar and every hotel in downtown Dallas was booked, so therefore they were very busy, however this did not affect the staff's help. They were on top of everything. The valet /bell boys made our stay wonderful! THey worked their butts off to have our car at the front on time and our luggage where it was suppost to be on time. THese guys are amazing! One of them even carried wedding gifts/bags on both of his arms up 15 flights of stairs because the wait for the elevator was so long due to the Mary Kay seminar! He was amazing and I cannot wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “crowded”
Reviews.Author: susan10706
Reviews.Content: Check in took a long time even though I was the second person in line. Only one person was working the desk and my reservation was messed up when they finally got it pulled up. While at the hotel, the elevators were continually out of order. It would take up to 20 minutes to get an elevator. The breakfast buffet and nightly reception were very crowded and it was difficult to find somewhere to sit. Had stand arond one evening as no seawts were available. I must say the nightly cookies and milk were great. Valet parking was very inconvenient and it took an exceptionally long time to get your car. The complimentary shuttle was fully booked every evening so did not realy get to venture out.

Reviews.Title: “The Magnolia has AMAZING beds and the shuttle service is second to none!”
Reviews.Author: bellabarrie
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Dallas and it was awesome! The Magnolia staff was friendly and helpful. The shuttle service was out of this world--they went above and beyond to take care of us. Even when there were 50 Mary Kay women lined up trying to get to our conference, the shuttle staff were polite, calm, effecient, and kept us laughing. They were great. The beds were exquisite and I loved the bedding. As mentioned by a few others, the smallest little issue was the elevators being slow. Other than that, our stay was perfect (and even the elevators were not a huge deal). I will definitely stay again when I come to Dallas and will recommend it to everyone I know! Thank you for a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “The Magnolia is my favorite Hotel with BEST Service in downtown Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: queenketi
Reviews.Content: I totally appreciate the staff and full services at the Magnolia. The breakfast, evening reception, and cookies are ALL icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, friendly staff, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: jokerris
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia was wonderful. Our first trip there. The free breakfast, cookie bar and drink were such a nice touch. Even though there were hundreds of us staying there that needed to get over to the convention center, they did a great job transporting all of us. Would definintely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I love the amenities of this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mksherry
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very service oriented. The rooms are clean & very nice and comfortable. The amenities of the full breakfast buffet, the evening free drinks & milk and cookies at bedtime are a fabulous bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Over the top in convenience and comfort!”
Reviews.Author: jeanniesmithmkay
Reviews.Content: Our Mary Kay group had a wonderful, comfortable and convenient stay at your hotel. We loved the complimentary shuttle service and breakfast buffet every day! The staff was the best I have ever experienced in my 30 years of travelling with Mary Kay. We will return again next year for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome weekend at the Magnolia”
Reviews.Author: lkendrick
Reviews.Content: The room was great...nice and big. It had everything we needed. The hotel is in a great location. You can walk around and enjoy all the restaurants and bars. The hotel breakfast was great and the cocktail hour was good. We didn't get the cookies and milk, but we heard they were good. We look forward to relaxing there again real soon. Great price for a wonderful room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place-comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: rofann
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Old historic building but very modern decor and wonderful bathrooms. The beds are comfortable and the rooms cozy and quiet. The staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The best stay I have had in Dallas in years!”
Reviews.Author: Got2bmk
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with my stay at the Magnolia, they staff was amazing, friendly and helpful. The service couldn't have been better. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The only teeny tiny little thing- the elevators with the volume of people all on the same time schedule for the convention were slow and busy times. Except for that, it would be hard to improve upon the stay. Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms but CROWDED elevator”
Reviews.Author: mlred99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magnolia Hotel as part of a wedding group. The group rate we paid was pretty reasonable ($120) for the space. The rooms were very nice and everything was clean and quiet. All you can ask for in a hotel. We had a drink in the hotel bar and though service was a bit slow it was pleasant. The included breakfast was also very solid - eggs and sausage and all the trimmings. Our big complaint is that we CONSTANTLY had to wait for the elevators. Probably since we were all either going to the wedding or coming back from the wedding at the same time as 100 other people, but it was very frustrating. We also had to wait forever on the valet for our cars. My fiance tried to call ahead and try to get our car and the valet guy told him " you'll have to come down here and wait" and then hung up on us. So.. we walked down and waited on our car for about 20 minutes which was frustrating but I guess we were leaving at 11 am which was the popular check out time. All in all a good stay but seems like modes of transport at the Magnolia need some updating! Overall it was a good hotel in

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - very friendly!”
Reviews.Author: MKGirl-GoingMyWay
Reviews.Content: Everybody was so very nice. Loved the breakfast buffet and the evening reception. Rooms were clean, bed very comfortable, the garden tub was nice! I was so busy I didn't miss that they don't have a pool. My only regret is that I didn't have time to get to the milk and cookies buffet!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the atmosphere, Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: destinati0n
Reviews.Content: Our son and his bride have selected the Magnolia as their reception location on November 20, 2010. My husband and I enjoyed staying at the Magnolia prior to the wedding so we could be confident that our guest for the wedding would be comfortable and taken care of in the best way possible. Our stay was comfortable. I loved the suite with a full kitchen. The Magnolia is a great place to gather family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: lurany
Reviews.Content: The service was wonderful. Everyone was so nice and the breakfast buffet was great. Looking forward to my next stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: barboinma
Reviews.Content: My room was clean with plenty of linens. The staff was very courteous and ready to assist. I did utilize the breakfast buffet both days I was staying there & the food was plentiful and well attended. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I could have slept forever!”
Reviews.Author: ejrsteffen
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Dallas, TX such a great experience staying in the Magnolia Hotel. The service was excellent! It was always clean and my bed was so comfortable I felt like at home. Any question or problem that I had was answered or solved immediately! I would defiently stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: kathy198415
Reviews.Content: Employees went out of their way to help in any way we needed. Great cookies! Valet servicce was always ready to shuttle us and have our cars ready for us when we needed them. The chef did a wonderful job preparing especially for our group.

Reviews.Title: “YOU WENT THE EXTRA MILE”
Reviews.Author: JHfromHouston
Reviews.Content: The staff had great smiles and the hotel service was excellent. They went the extra mile to make our stay as friendly and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for price and location”
Reviews.Author: Eagle1957
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel - within walking distance of the convention center and many restaurants. The valet service was excellent!! The little extra's - like the free hot breakfast, evening happy hour and evening cookie reception make it a great hotel to stay at for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great breakfast, but slow, slow, slow”
Reviews.Author: FamilyandBuzTravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel asthetics were beautiful, the room was nice (although not enough drawer space), the FULL BREAKFAST is fantastic, and the valet team was AWESOME (they made great recommendations, and would take you nearly where ever you needed/wanted to go). And because all of our meeting activites were at the Convention Center, the location was very good. But the front dest staff was standoff-ish, the elevators were slow, and the exta food service they instituted for our group was slower than slow. It's a great place for you solo, but maybe not for the larger groups and more business minded. There weren't adequate meeting or banquet rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed My Stay”
Reviews.Author: parkergurl
Reviews.Content: Location was great, room was nice, clean and comfortable, the hotel overall appearance was very lovely! Enjoyed cocktail hour, breakfast and the cookies and milk! One down fall â€¦â€¦THE ELEVATOR SERVICE! We were there during a Mary Kay convention and getting an elevator was almost impossible! Still I would stay there again ï�Š

Reviews.Title: “Has potential but doesn't execute on the basics.”
Reviews.Author: dgy010
Reviews.Content: Pro's - good location, nice decor, clean rooms, cookies and milk at night, coctail hour, friendly valet. Con's - had to take the stairs every morning (7 flights) because the elevators took too long. When I say took too long, after a 20 minute wait, there were still guests trying to get down. This occurs at peak morning hours and peak after work hours. Restaurant was just ok.

Reviews.Title: “good for business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: LarryBell
Reviews.Content: I had business in Dallas and also brought my family. The facilities and kindness of the staff made my business easier and my family enjoyed the accomodations and location while getting a taqste of Dallas . We will come back again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic weekend!”
Reviews.Author: mjdowns
Reviews.Content: We, family and friends were there for my son's wedding.The reception was held there. Everything was excellent! No complaints at all! Recommend it highly as a place for wedding reception!

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay. The employees are so sweet.”
Reviews.Author: amauck
Reviews.Content: Everyone was helpful and so nice. They helped us with everything. Food, Directions,Fun for our kids. The list goes on and on. You really feel like you are the only guest and they are all working for you. We had a very nice stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth my dime”
Reviews.Author: emendoza914
Reviews.Content: beautiful; location, location, location; superior service

Reviews.Title: “Great service and great location.”
Reviews.Author: Faye-Hicks
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent. Concierge, valet and shuttle services were outstanding. The room was clean and the bed and linens were nice. The location of the hotel was the best part. Everything was within reasonable walking distance even in the July heat. One evening it was raining and the shuttle took us to dinner. The complimentary breakfast was tasty and there was a nice selection to choose from. Complimentary coctails and milk and cookies were also a nice touch, along with the Starbucks in the lobby. My husband and I will visit this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, modern quiet rooms, will definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Kid74
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for $109 a night for a wedding and thought it was an amazing value. Modern room with nice high end appointments, high ceilings, modern lighting, marble counter tops, comfy beds. It's right next door to the much more expensive Adolphus, but I thought those rooms did not compare. Would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service”
Reviews.Author: Hermy56833
Reviews.Content: Primary hotel for family wedding and cannot say anything negative concerning trip. Front desk was exceptional in knowledge of guest expectations and how to accomodate them. Rooms and suites are clean, arranged well with excellent bedding and quiet. I travel extensively and have never had more conscientious valet service...Those guys are tremendous and accomodating to every wish. Thank you Magnolia, we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location, service”
Reviews.Author: SuzfromTex
Reviews.Content: Beautiful historic hotel in downtown Dallas. Our experience was good in every aspect - we had 2 rooms and six people in our party. Service was excellent - everyone was friendly, helpful, and showed classic Texas hospitality. Valet parking was no problem - yes - we phoned before we went downstairs - but we never waited more than 5 minutes. The valet staff helped with directions and tips for traffic and parking. Loved the evening reception and cookies and milk buffet. Very nice sitting area to enjoy these and the breakfast buffet. Rooms are spacious - bathrooms are large. I was worried about elevators based on some of the reviews - they were fast and timely. No problems. This is a great value - highly recommend. If I return to Dallas - I'll stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great View... Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jpetralia
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia just might have taken the Palomar as my favorite hotel in Dallas. The guest rooms are very luxurious: leather(ette?) sofa, kitchenette, two HD televisions (one in living area and one in bedroom) and VERY comfortable beds, pillows and linens. The free beer and white Happy Hour in the lobby and bar every evening was also a lot of fun. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: MAnderson78726
Reviews.Content: Convenient downtown location (although downtown Dallas is less than vibrant on weekends). Best value in the city. Old-world class but modern design and features.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for celebrating Mom's birthday!”
Reviews.Author: FitMomma
Reviews.Content: My brothers and I took our mom to Dallas to celebrate her 70th birthday. Since Mom visits Dallas several times a year, we looked for a hotel and activities that might be unique for her. The Hotel Magnolia was the perfect find! The decor is funky but elegant. The rooms are large and comfortable. And the staff is friendly and willing to go above and beyond for its guests. For example, when I booked our rooms, I asked the front desk if they had anything special they could do for my mom given that it was her birthday. They offered to send a birthday cake to the room, but we already had expansive dinner plans, so, instead, they offered to have balloons waiting in the room when we checked in. I didn't really expect that they'd follow through on that offer, but when we walked in our room, the birthday balloons were there and brought a huge smile to my mom's face!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel & Great Prices!”
Reviews.Author: cinderstuff
Reviews.Content: Checked other hotels in the area (downtown) where we needed to stay, it's more reasonable even with the Valet Parking (no choice). Very clean, well kept, lots of staff. Breakfast has lots of choices from cereal to different types of eggs. My husband really enjoyed the complimentary beer in late afternoon, he shared our tickets with a friend who was also in town. I LOVED the choice of cookies and milk in the evening. Also, out the back entrance is a sweet little park where you can sit & watch the birds or people watch. A CVS drug store if close plus lots of places to eat. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Dallas. Our friend stayed there at least one week each month for the past year, because of business. That says it all. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “I expected betterâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: mw_flipit
Reviews.Content: In our room, there was mold growing in the bathroom and one of the window fixtures did not work. Also, there were several holes in the ceiling by the window. At check out, the woman working did not make me feel as though I was welcomed back and the valet was more interested in the bacheloret party than assisting my husband and I. I was EXTREAMLY disappointed in this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service, wonderful breakfast buffet and great location made for a fantastic stay.”
Reviews.Author: davellano
Reviews.Content: Magnolia's charming setting and customer service provided great respite for weary convention attendees. We were able to begin the day at the breakfast buffet and close the day at the evening's milk and cookie buffet, which provided a friendly, uncompromising atmosphere for me. The rooms were spacious and quiet, which was important as I shared the room with another female colleague. It was also very convenient to the convention center. I would like to bring my family back to Dallas and stay at the Magnolia again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night at the Magnolia Dallas to celebrate our anniversary/birthday. Most of our free time was spent shopping. I got an e-mail from the Magnolia announcing a weekend package in June that included free valet parking, wine and strawberries, and an upgrade to a suite, all for only $150. I thought it was a great deal. I had never stayed at the Magnolia, but I had heard many good things. The valets were fast and friendly. Check in was quick and easy, since I booked online. We were on the 20th floor, but the elevators were quick, and we were never waiting for one. The room was clean and well appointed. It was also huge. It was about 600 square feet. It was modern, but warm. The paintings on the wall had their own lights. It was a nice touch. The hotel itself retains a lot of the original architecture from 1910, but the lobby, lounge, and rooms are all up to date. The bed was very comfortable, with plenty of pillows and blankets. The wine and strawberries were waiting for us when we got back from dinner. They were quite good. The atmosphere of the lounge was nice. Very subdued. We didn't attend the reception, but we did enjoy the late night cookie buffet. The only complaint I can come up with is the breakfast buffet. While there was a good selection, the pancakes were kind of rubbery, the bacon was thin and not very flavorful, the cereal choices were limited to regular corn flakes or Cheerios; nothing sweet. My wife said the seasoned potatoes were good, as well as the scrambled eggs. The best breakfast I've had at a hotel was at the Kimpton. It was on our honeymoon, and they brought it to our room. We ordered off a menu, though, so I don't think there's a comparison. Anyway, I would definitely stay here again, but I would probably go out for breakfast. Oh, and I wish they had a pool, but not much they can do about that given their location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with special amenities”
Reviews.Author: BrigH
Reviews.Content: When I travel for races (this time a 1/2 marathon) I'm careful to find a room that is quiet and within walking distance to good restaurants. The Magnolia fulfilled each of these requirements. It's housed in an art-deco type building downtown. The rooms are modern and comfortable. They're large for what I'm used to. The bed was comfortable and I slept well. There are clubs and bars nearby but I was not disturbed by noise inside or outside the hotel. Each night there is a free happy hour and cookies & milk. The area where these were held was comfortable and we sat for awhile to enjoy our snack. There are dining options available nearby as well as a Starbucks atttached to the hotel. I would stay here again and have already booked the same chain in Denver for another trip.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: blonde1658
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff, beautiful rooms and great service. Expensive parking though...

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: CADreamin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Magnolia while attending a wedding in the Dallas area. The staff was friendly, our room quite clean, the happy hour very nice (yes, it's only beer and wine ... which is what most hotels have during a 'happy hour'), and the breakfast quite acceptable. Yes, the elevators had an odd smell; however, I attribute it more to the humid climate and the fact they are probably not air-conditioned ... and we didn't find them all that slow. The biggest downside was that, like most hotels in large cities, the only parking at the hotel was valet parking ($24/day + tips). Another oddity ... housekeeping was quite discreet. The rooms in our party weren't made up until after 4:00 pm. if they were made up at all.

Reviews.Title: “MY FAVORITE HOTEL IN DALLAS”
Reviews.Author: AckermanLa
Reviews.Content: Our room was amazing. We had a full kitchen and living room, walk in closet and a great view. We also received chocolate covered strawberries with champagne as a free treat! The free receptions are such fun. It makes staying at the hotel even more enjoyable! In the morning this hotel has the best breakfast buffet too! Can't go wrong! I love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The best Dallas hotel I have stayed in...ever!”
Reviews.Author: Pammywhammycats
Reviews.Content: 2nd time we have stayed in this wonderful hotel! The location is great, the suite was gorgeous and comfortable...we love the nostalgia of the building...the facade is not too shabby either :) the valet guys are very helpful and the breakfast buffet was great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Effort but Terrible”
Reviews.Author: karolina90
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be a sad little place. The staff were very kind and really tried to please us. That was essentially the only positive spot we found here. The place was absolutely filthy. Apart from the front lobby, it looked like nobody had vacuumed since the place was first built. The elevators have a nauseating scent too. In the club room, which is a nice idea, there are dead flies along the windowsills. Another story - the rooms. The first room we were put in had some sort of insect infestation. Absolutely disgusting. When we requested that they switch our room, they did enthusiastically. There were no obvious bug infestations in the new room, but it was still dirty. The bedding was also filthy. Bleach would be my strongest suggestion. Overall, it was dirty and cleanliness is my biggest criteria for a hotel room. The service was kind though, and the location was nice. It was in a central downtown area so it was close to a couple restaurants and pretty buildings. I just wish it was better taken care of. It has a lot of potential with the interior look, which is a refurbished heritage building. It just needs some TLC. Right now though, I would never stay there again and certainly would not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “magnificient”
Reviews.Author: pattiGE2
Reviews.Content: An Absolute fabulous hotel. The fact that the company took a hystorical bank building and turned it into a hotel was wonderful enough, but they left the integrity of the building from the architecture to the pictures of the Pegasus. The management and staff were wonderful. I had a suite that had a comfy bed, a wonderful kitchen, and nice sitting area. Our view was of a magnificient church and downtown square. The valet parking was a little steep $22.00, but at least I didn't have to worry about finding a place to park on my own. I left some clothes in my car and the valet retreived them without any negativity. I have traveled all over the world, and this was the best hotel experience I've ever received. Would stay here again without any regrets. MAGNIFICIENT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite place in Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: SanAntonioBright
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Magnolia. Great location for the convention center. Shuttle was great as well as the valet parking. We walked out the back door over to the Tower Club one night for awesome dinner. Nice neighborhood & felt safe to walk. Breakfast was as good as you would pay for at a nice brunch. Cookies & Milk was a fun and yummy nighttime treat. I loved the decor of the suite. It was a welcome change from most hotels I have stayed in. I will find an excuse to go back to Dallas just to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Busy Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Pebblebrook
Reviews.Content: Was attending my nephew's wedding and was very busy the entire stay. The valet service was exceptional. The hotel was lovely and service excellent. Location in downtown Dallas is close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel except for elevators”
Reviews.Author: Perx4me
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a good location. The rooms are nice with big bathrooms and the bed was very comfortable. The free breakfast is excellent as well as the free cocktail hour although they give you 2 coupons per person per night for drinks but only let you redeem the coupons from 5:30 to 6:30. Since they're coupons they should let you use them anytime the bar is open. Valet service is good, although pricey, $22 a night. My one and only major complaint is the same one as everybody else......the elevators are way too slow during the peak period in the morning. It took me 25 minutes to get from floor 11 to the lobby. They are old but there are 5 of them so I don't see why this problem can't be fixed. During other times of the day there is no problem with them. This is the only reason I gave them 4 stars instead of 5. We attended a wedding at the hotel in the Pegasus ballroom which was nice except for the temperature. It was June and it was 95 degrees and very humid outside and they should have had the temperature set lower in the ballroom, it was a little too warm in there especially when you started dancing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: ToddHuse
Reviews.Content: We had very enjoyable stay. We were able to quickly arrive at our conference each morning. We were allowed to leave our vehicle securely parked, even after we checked out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, friendly and polite staff, good amenities, average sleep”
Reviews.Author: Bits2of8
Reviews.Content: The valets were very helpful, when asked, in telling us that there was other parking than the $22/day valet parking two blocks down the street in the City Park garage. Later, we saw one run down the street to retrieve a car, leading us to believe that the valet parking is actually located in that garage, where if you don't mind walking two blocks, it costs $8/day during the week and $2/day weekends. Once parked, you might not need your car again during your stay as this hotel is in an excellent location for downtown Dallas activities with several restaurants behind it on Main. The architects kept charming aspects of the historic building such as wide, cherry wood paneling in the lobby. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The shower was excellent, located in a large tub, and had hot water available whenever I wanted it. The beds were very firm with thick pillows, which may be good for some, but we did not sleep well on them. The maid service neglected to leave us our coffee service the second day, but we were too tired to call about it. If we had, I'm sure they would have sent supplies up. Overall, it was a pleasant hotel for a reasonable value in a convenient place.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: carolann43
Reviews.Content: I loved my weekend at the Magnolia Hotel in Dallas! I had a suite on a corner of the 20th floor with a great view. The suite was spacious & beautiful, and the bed was so comfortable - I had a difficult time getting up in the mornings. Food & staff were great. Will definitely stay there again and recommend it to others

Reviews.Title: “Great place and great location”
Reviews.Author: TinyAvenger
Reviews.Content: This was an historic place to stay and it has been beautifully renovated. The staff was very friendly and helpful. All questions were answered without hesitation.....they are very familiar with the area. The location is excellent with mass transit available or walking is no problem.......Neiman Marcus is just down the street!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: car4808
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay, getaway weekend for us and friends. Great value. Staff all helpful and knowledgeable, good breakfasts and cocktail hours, great location. We'll come back for another getaway weekend and use it/recommend it as well for business travel.
