Reviews.Title: “Wish you had a location in downtown Ft. Worth for the next Republican Party of Texas convention.”
Reviews.Author: pattischade
Reviews.Content: Terrific hotel and excellent valet staff. Room was beautifully appointed, elegant and relaxing. Best kept secret in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience in a long time!”
Reviews.Author: TexasLiberty
Reviews.Content: Lots of history in the Magnolia Hotel in Dallas. Those familiar with Mobil Oil Comapny recognize the flying Pegasus landmark. All the charm of an historic building, all the comfort of a first-class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super, Wonderful and Comfy and I would go again. Can't wait !!”
Reviews.Author: jveronicayork
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. The staff is very friendly. The breakfast was good. I want to go back. I really enjoyed the time there and wish I could just stay there more often.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great service and excellent location. Great value for the money.”
Reviews.Author: gkw_10
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, pretty historic and the staff are really friendly and cater to your really well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel -- top quality service, ideal location, friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: ProudDad58024
Reviews.Content: I recommend the Magnolia Dallas to anyone visiting the downtown Dallas area. The staff is friendly and helpful. Service is excellent. And the concierge and valet services are exceptional. Evening receptions and milk and cookies are a very nice touch. I will stay at Magnolia Dallas every time I visit the downtown Dallas area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chgoguy4ltr
Reviews.Content: I was met coming out of my cab by an extremely friendly valet who took my bag and walked with me to the counter, having pleasant conversation all the way. The desk clerks were excellent in providing me directions to the location of the conference I was attending, in addition to explaining all the amenities of the hotel. My room was great, and I truly enjoyed my two night stay. The gentleman from Columbia who drove me to the airport in the hotel shuttle was also extremely professional.. I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, friendly staff, close to area attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Becky6395
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, will definitely stay here again when in Dallas. It's close to area attractions and convenient to get to. The staff was very friendly and the cookies and milk each night were awesome!! Our room was clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Andi5678
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous find in Dallas! They automatically upgraded our reservation to a suite for no charge, which was a pleasant surprise! It was also amazing to have free drinks in the lounge, free cookie buffet at night and a FABULOUS Breakfast buffet that held nothing back! My husband and I chose this hotel for our wedding night last year, and we continue to come back for the great atmosphere, friendly service, and charm that the Magnolia offers.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT AS ALWAYS!!”
Reviews.Author: MicheleRhodeIsland
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Magnolia - Dallas several times and it it always excellent. On this trip I had to be moved from my original room due to a small leak in the fire sprinkler system in my room. The staff was extremely helpful and moved me right away. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place overall, would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: C-RFerguson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the magnolia when we went to watch the cowboys play the raiders for thanksgiving. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The suite was very spacious and comfy, the only complaint tho was when i wanted to take a bath at around 4 am there was no hot water, they said they turn it off at night?! It took 2 phone calls and 2 room visits to finally have hot water for a bath, by then i wasnt too happy. But other than that it was great and also if nightlife is your thing there are plenty of fun bars/restaurants within walking distance so that is a definite plus!

Reviews.Title: “Dont walk run AWAY”
Reviews.Author: shaunwow
Reviews.Content: Ok at first glance to place dont look to bad. But when you get in and book your hotel you find rude service from some of the people behind the counter way over priced parking for them to take care of your car making you park several blocks away in an unsafe public parking lot where there is no one watching your personal belongings. Now lets talk about your room they give you two free cupons for drinks but that all depends on what they have they couldint even provide a person with a simple beer. Ok now you get up to your room you walk in and see a few different thing like a bottle of water that you would think would be free after paying for this place but oh NO it cost 3 dollars for something that you can walk three and a half blocks down to the 7Eleven and get for a dollar thirtynine. They tell you that they have free cookies and milk until 10 but nope they ovously dont know how to make an good amount becasue yeah there were none when we got here. All I have to say is that this place could use alot of people to quit coming to it for the simple reason they need to be made aware that they are here for US not them selfs.

Reviews.Title: “Such a joy.....”
Reviews.Author: Shayna73
Reviews.Content: The staff is very helpful, everything you could possibly need is within a few blocks. The breakfast buffet is a time and money saver, the cookies are always fresh and the happy hour is a great social time. i stay here whenevr I'm in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great time for the Cubs in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: RougeSeven
Reviews.Content: Great trip and great hotel. In town with family for the Cubs vs. Rangers. Hotel close to 6th Floor Museum (Kennedy Assassination). Not a ton within walking distance (only complaint).

Reviews.Title: “Great location and extras - highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: aus_cole
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magnolia Dallas for a wedding. The hotel provided great common areas where we could gather with other family and friends. The breakfast buffet was wonderful and abundant. The evening reception and late night cookies and milk really set this hotel apart from others. The building is old but it is well-maintained. This is downtown Dallas, so street noise (sirens) can be an issue but I did not have any trouble staying asleep (and I am a light sleeper). Customer service was exceptional - especially from the valets/bellhops/shuttle drivers. We were treated courteously at all times and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Stay in”
Reviews.Author: ejdrum
Reviews.Content: Nice stay in a place that respects historic architecture. Great staff and solid breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly pristine downtown hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DisNuts
Reviews.Content: On my arrival I am always well received by the Magnolia staff. The Hotel is very quiet and is always very clean, no funny smells or stains. I have stayed on many different floors and each one is great. I enjoy staying there and I never worry about my business travel when I stay here, I know my room will be ready with everything I have requested. Staff is always attentive to my needs or requests. I love staying at The Magnolia Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, Great rooms, Great people”
Reviews.Author: moodyblue1968
Reviews.Content: I was only in town for a short visit and really didn't expect to spend much time at the hotel but I wish I had had more time to spend after the great service and wonderfully prepaired room, spacious and very comfortable. The staff made me feel at home and the little extra's were not expected but were really great. I plan to return and stay longer and take advantage of more of the ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “I Will Stay Here Again and Again!”
Reviews.Author: jackwalk
Reviews.Content: This being my first trip to Dallas I was unsure of where to stay. When I learned that there was a Magnolia Hotel in Dallas I figured if it were anything like the one in Houston I was going to be in good hands. Let me tell you, it was even better! The staff was very courteous and helpful and the place was amazing. For the size of the hotel it was very busy with two weddings taking place that weekend but that didn't stop or hinder any of our accommodations. The hotel also offers free rides to local attractions which was a definite plus and our driver, Moustapha, was amazing and very helpful with deciding where we should eat or hang out. It was as if we had our own personal city tour guide who knew all about the city and we didn't have to worry about anything. I had an amazing experience at this hotel and I suggest everyone give it at try, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic and Relaxing stay!”
Reviews.Author: dyenikki
Reviews.Content: We go to the Magnolia Hotel as a little getaway for my husband and myself. The staff is always friendly, the place is always clean and charming. We thought about staying other places and even looked at different sites- but we always end up staying at the Magnolia and we enjoy it everytime!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, Contemporary, Cool & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: E31_Owner
Reviews.Content: This place is the opposite of the Adolphus. Instead of a gigantic property with a Victorian vibe you'll find a boutique hotel that's oh-so-hip. I arrived after a $55 cab ride from DFW to be greeted by a genuinely friendly staff. The bellman explained have several SUVs available to take guests to nearby attractions for free. But I didn't need the service because so many restaurants were within easy walking distance. Checking in I admired the contemporary decor, which was heavy on reddish wood with clubby furniture upholstered in pastels and the occasional jewel tone. Very sleek and sophisticated. Drew room 1905, which overlooked Commerce Street. As you can see from the photos it featured the same modern look as the rest of the hotel. Road warriors will appreciate the spacious desk and work area, with good lighting and handy electrical outlets. The wi-fi connected quickly and was acceptably fast. The LCD TV had a good picture, and the channel lineup featured both Bloomberg and CNBC. (Margaret Brennan *and* Erin Burnett. Sigh.) The bathroom was fine, although I prefer a little more counter space. Towels, soaps, etc. were top rate. As you can see, the closet contained a comfy, thirsty, terrycloth robe. And in addition to the iron and ironing board there was a little bottle of spray starch. If you're a business traveler who hates to wear a wrinkled shirt (or blouse) this is a nice touch. The bed and linens were as you'd expect from a quality hotel. Clock radio was easy to set. The windows had shades vice draperies, and they were just perfect for keeping the room dark. Didn't spend a whole lot of time sampling the hotel's amenities. But I did find my way to the gym, where there was quite a bit of cardio equipment and lots of flat screen TVs to ease the workout boredom. Skipped the happy hour and cookie break on the second floor, but did make it down for breakfast. The self-serve buffet was top notch, with an excellent selection of hot and cold chow. FAR better than the lame breakfast offerings seen in many hotels. I'd say it was about 80 percent as good as the Embassy Suites spread. (Which as all business travelers know is the gold standard in breakfast buffets.) Business completed I had the bellman arrange for a car back to DFW. For the same price as a dilapidated taxi, he whistled up a shiny Lincoln Town Car driven by a polite young man who had thoughtfully stocked the back seat with the day's paper and some bottled water. Nice touch. All in all I was very pleased with the Hotel Magnolia. It's not quite a modern as the nearby Hotel Joule. But it's cool just the same and the second floor amenities are hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “For an elegant and stylish stay, try the Magnolia!”
Reviews.Author: sflime
Reviews.Content: From the greetings at the reception desk, to the gentlemen dealing with the coordination of taxis,the hotel staff of the Magnolia Hotel in Dallas were professional and friendly. Go see the Dallas Art Museum and new opera house. The hotel is terrifically situated for easy urban adventures.

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area!”
Reviews.Author: Dawnredwing
Reviews.Content: The value of this hotel is great! The hotel itself is beautiful and the staff is very friendly. The breakfast buffet is outstanding with a nice and a little different variety everyday. The cookies every evening were especially a treat. Lots of perks, with evening reception, free wifi and great workout room (plus a great steam room and hot tub). The room sizes are very generous and you can even get a great room with a complete kitchen! The location is great and very close to the convention center (and I forgot the free shuttle to everywhere downtown)! The price was very good and you will receive everything you pay for and more!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: travelman055
Reviews.Content: The weekend we stayed at the hotel a wedding party was staying there. This caused all other hotel guests to become second rate patrons. They had many common areas closed to non party members, such as second floor bar and resturant, valet and bell service, as well as some elevators. The hotrel is tiny and quaint, but way too small to accommodate such a large party. We have also stayed at the Omaha property and experienced the EXACT same treatment, due to a wedding party. The breakfast buffet was horrible and scarce, at best. However, The evening cookies were a nice treat. I would not recommend this hotel, but if you choose to stay, call and make sure they will not be busy with a larger party than they can handle.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations for family and friends to congregate”
Reviews.Author: ktherien
Reviews.Content: Wonder downtown hotel--not too big or too small. Double rooms are plenty spacious and one bedroom suites are incredibly large. The extras--cocktails in the late afternoon, milk and cookies in later evening and a breakfast buffet--make it an outstanding value. Close to many nice restaurants, bars, and Neimann Marcus is only about a block away!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: CRB0070
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable beds, central location close to Arts District in downtown Dallas, large tub, and a great night's sleep. The breakfast, happy hour and milk and cookies make it a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service with nice perks.”
Reviews.Author: cgilman
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia offers a great little getaway in the center of downtown Dallas. The hotel offers nice amenities such as an evening cockatil reception, milk and cookies at dinner and a complementary, full breakfast buffet. A great historic hotel for the business or leisure traveler to Dallas, TX. And, the price is always competetive.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly, probably the best hotel I ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: crowleysm
Reviews.Content: Excellent! The staff know all about the nightlife and the best restaurants to eat at. They are so friendly, so if you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Accommodating and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: PopARotZPris
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at the Magnolia and I would definitely stay again. The staff was very accommodating and polite. I never had to open a door myself. The breakfast was wonderful and my room had many different views. Although an old hotel it is nicely updated.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, awesome staff, excellent accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: bearnstar
Reviews.Content: We were there for my step-daughter's wedding. She had everything right there at the hotel and it was absolutely perfect! Beautiful setting and extremely accomodating staff. Elevators are very slow, but plan ahead and that is okay too.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel in every way that matters.”
Reviews.Author: toomuchfire
Reviews.Content: I usually only think to write a review if I had a bad experience, to warn others. But I liked my stay at the Magnolia so much that I decided to write a positive review. The place succeeded on every level for me. The hotel itself is classy but not pompous. The building is historic, but not cold and impersonal. The service was first-rate - every worker has a nice greeting for you. The rooms are nicely appointed, are very clean, and the beds were so comfortable. And the complimentary touches were great - a free deluxe continental breakfast awaits you when you get up - eggs, bacon, potatoes, cereal, bagels, and fruit - and you even get free drinks at happy hour and warm cookies and milk in the evening. The price was excellent. And the location was right in the heart of downtown, close to anything you'd need to get to. I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would stay here again. Great service, ambiance, and location.”
Reviews.Author: xichic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the weekend after the Warrior Dash event and had a comfortable night's stay. This hotel is in a great location in downtown Dallas and is next to many restaurants, bars and clubs. (Also there is a Starbucks next door). The ambiance is trendy and yet cozy. Our double room was well appointed to and I really enjoyed the decor. Bathroom was spacious and clean and beds were comfortable. Magnolia serves a complimentary breakfast and also milk and cookies in the evening. Definitely a nice touch. Room has a small fridge but I did not notice a mini bar (if that is important to you). We were on the 24th floor but were able to still hear some of the noise below. Parking is $22 a night, so be prepared. I recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: millerice3
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed in Dallas April 29 - Mar 2, 2010. My son had some of his photos on display and we wanted to see them plus we wanted to visit the town of Glen Rose where my great, great, grandparents were buried. My son picked the Magnolia Hotel from what he read in various online reviews and he could not have picked a better place. The rooms were great for the price. The breakfast was much more than I expected with scrambled eggs, sausage, ham, potatoes, etc. I had a good workout in the fitness center and spent some relaxing time in the steam room afterward. We found the service to be excellent and in fact could not really find any negatives. This is an old but very nicely restored (upgraded) hotel right downtown and I'd definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A 2 star hotel, would not stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: MargaritaTexas
Reviews.Content: Not very comfortable and breakfast food unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and relaxing! The Magnolia has beautiful historic charm w/modern decor--and the bed is heavenly!!”
Reviews.Author: Claire55711
Reviews.Content: THE hotel to stay in when in Dallas. The lobby is inviting and has a sweet fragrance. The front desk staff is kind and helpful and upgraded us to a suite with a fantastic view! The shower head is the best I've experienced in a hotel, almost spa like with the even pressure and seemingly endless hot water. The bed was so fluffy and luxiorious that we had a hard time leaving. Would reccommend this to all looking for a weekend "staycation" like we were or for out of town guests who want to experience the luxury of Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “An Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: happy493
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Magnolia Hotel in Dallas, TX from 4/27/2010 - 4/29/2010. I enjoyed the hot breakfast in the morning before going into my business meeting. They had nice breakfast choices for the morning and fresh fruits (pineapples, etc.). I enjoyed my suite. The suite - bathroom, kitchen, and room was nice and clean! I found the evening reception relaxing with live jazz. The live jazz was awesome! I enjoyed the cookies and night.......... I have stayed at many hotels in my travels and this one will be top of the list for Dallas, TX. You get a great value for the cost and what is offered by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: XclusiveTripz
Reviews.Content: We love our stays at the Magnolia. We stay there several times a year for business and pleasure. The staff is always helpful and friendly. The evening reception is a nice treat but can be busy and hectic if the hotel is full that evening. So be prepared to wait in line for your drink if its busy. The cookies and milk in the evening is a wonderful touch. When we stay with our kids they absolutely LOVE IT! The breakfast in the morning is incredible and changes from time to time when we stay. You can't beat the service and amenities you get for the price. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Architecture-”
Reviews.Author: pc94286
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia is a beautiful place. It appears to be an older hotel. The parking was inconvenient as you could not self park and it would take the valet about 20 minutes to get your car. The area of the city did not seem to be the best part of town. There were not many shops near by to browse at. Only two of the elevators were in working condition while four of them never worked during our stay. The rooms were nice, but overall we would have to get a great deal in order to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent world class service and accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: Frogtown43501
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Magnolia Dallas. I am now a devoted fan and will be booking the Magnolia for all my future trips to Dallas. I travel here at least 4 times per year for business. I have extensive travel experience both domestic and international and the Magnolia stands out at the top of my list for world class service- the staff are exceptionally professional and friendly and the rooms are well decorated, quiet and clean. A great value and fantastic downtown location. The extras put this hotel over the top with a nightly evening wine reception later followed by a cookie buffet. I love the convenience of the breakfast buffet each morning. Lots of options- eggs, bacon, ham, sausage, home fries, assortment of breads, fresh fruit, juices and yogurt and of course Starbucks Coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Staying at boutique hotels is awesome and Magnolia is a great example of why! Happy Hour! Breakfast! Cookies before bed!”
Reviews.Author: lnhaynes
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel as part of a wedding block - can not imagine a better place to be!

Reviews.Title: “Very hot and not in a good way”
Reviews.Author: CLFowler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magnolia for a wedding. The service was fantastic! Unfortunately the crazy elevators are one of the main reasons why we would not stay there. We requested a king size bed and they only have those available on the top floor. It would take a minimum of 10 -15 minutes to get a elevator for the 26th floor. And then the ride would make you a little sick to your stomach...fast then stop then rattle. Second was the temperature in out bedroom. We ended up having to sleep with no covers because the room would not cool off. Texas can be hot, but the weather was in the low 60"s so it shouldn't have been that warm in the room! Overall great service, but we wouldn't stay in the Magnolia in Downtown Dallas again.

Reviews.Title: “another good stay overall”
Reviews.Author: macoffin
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed at the Dallas Magnolia and once again I found the stay very comfortable and relaxing and enjoyed the location. Definitely like the breakfast again as well. Thanks Dallas Magnolia staff!

Reviews.Title: “Attractive Hotel, Friendly Staff, but Terribly Bad Service.”
Reviews.Author: Tracewell
Reviews.Content: I checked in on Friday evening. It was my wife, and my 2 children ages 3 1/2 and 21 months. At 9:30 pm after a very long day I requested that a roll-away bed be brought to my room. This bed was supposed to have been available when I checked in. At 10 PM the bed had not arrived and I called again to request it. The lady I spoke to on the phone was very polite and friendly. However, the bed did not arrive by 10:30. At that time I decided to sleep on the floor because my children were asleep and in my spot on the bed and there was no way I wanted to wake them. I put the do not disturb sign on the door. After 11 pm there was a knock on my door and it was the roll away bed. My children had been asleep for over an hour. On Saturday, I picked up my car from the valet and handed in my ticket. When I returned later that afternoon around 2 pm the guy parking my car took my keys and said that I didn't need a new ticked since there was still a ticket on my keys and on my review mirror. I was not given my ticket stub back. That evening at 8:30 I requested at they get my car. I explained why I did not have my ticket and the attendant asked what kind of car I drove and my name. In all fairness the valet guys were slammed, but they had not brought my car by 9 pm. I had to repeatedly remind them that I was waiting for my car. They were always friendly and explained that they were working on it and should have it shortly. At 10 pm I decided that my car and my keys must have been stolen since no one had been able to produce either one. I grabbed one of the valet guys and asked him to jog to the garage with me, in the rain, and then start at the top and run down until we found my car. It took less than 10 minuted to find my car. The valet attendant was able to read the number off of my review mirror ticket and then once back at the hotel, he found my keys immediately. That was super, except my evening plans with my family had been ruined. It was after 10 pm on Saturday and I had 2 toddlers who had been cooped up in the hotel all evening. While I sitting at the valet stand all evening, my wife and some family, who canceled their plans to wait at the hotel with us ate McDonalds in a small conference room generously offered by one of their wait staff who took pity on them. This was nice until another hotel employee ran them out of this room because he needed it the next morning, thus cutting short their controlled environment in which to allow the small children to play and not disturb the other guests in the bar. Overall the employees were very friendly, always smiling and apologetic when things went wrong, however they were completely unhelpful. Furthermore, they showed zero initiative save for the kind lady who opened a small room for our kids on Saturday night. Now that I think of it, I don't even think anyone offered to comp the valet parking after losing my car for an hour and a half. The Magnolia is an attractive hotel and is a very convenient location for us to stay as it is located within walking distance from my brother's loft and we travel to see him frequently. However, I will not be making the choice to stay there again and would not recommend it to anyone I know

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised with personal service and friendliness. Will stay again, definitely!!”
Reviews.Author: elammom
Reviews.Content: Elegantly spacious with exceptionally friendly staff. Within easy walking of good food, the West End in Dallas and other fun experiences. Valet parking needs work! Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional stay at Magnolia.”
Reviews.Author: Ginger_B_n_VCks
Reviews.Content: Bed could use a softer top for pressure point relief, but everything else was polished, warm and welcoming, clean, friendly, and quiet. A real inviting hotel with great staff. Careful where you walk outside the hotel--panhandlers everywhere. So many homeless that businesses there seem always on alert. We had the most expensive pizza ever: $15 for the pizza, $80 for the homeless/poor. Yes, our choice, but sadly there are no shelters and apparently no kitchens for the hungry there in Dallas. Never felt threatened. We would recommend the Magnolia to all our friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, wonderful breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: supremecourt25
Reviews.Content: convenient to several restaurants and shops in downtown, even though it is a little dead on the weekends (downtown, not the hotel). They do have a complimentary shuttle to drive you within a 3 mile radius, but it's not really practical because so many other people want to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Service”
Reviews.Author: t-macaroni
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a cheer competition and there were several children in the hotel. The staff did not seemed the least bit unnerved. They accomodated us without question and remained friendly the entire stay. Very historic building; a very nice change from the cookie cutter hotels.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: transpo1
Reviews.Content: Very nice modern and clean, Helpful staff, valet a little slow but ar'nt they all normally. Welcome recepton and milk and cookies later a nice treat. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service at a surprisingly low price”
Reviews.Author: amverd
Reviews.Content: Excellent, everything was truly wonderful. It might have been the best hotel I've ever stayed in and it certainly wasn't the most expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Always a Treat.”
Reviews.Author: FunTraveler68
Reviews.Content: Love the service and location. Can not go wrong with the complimentary breakfast, complimentary cookies & milk, and of course complementary evening drinks. For any occasion, this hotel is one to definitely try. This was our second Magnolia Hotel experience. Our first was in Houston with the kids and they just loved the cookies and milk.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: Argenton29
Reviews.Content: Courteous staff, breakfast buffet included, free wifi internet, shuttle for downtown destinations, comfortable bed, great location, all the ingredients for a memorable stay in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional customer service and brilliant milk and cookie buffet!”
Reviews.Author: musclekneader
Reviews.Content: We were up for my half marathon and decided to stay downtown so we would have easy access to the freeway to get to the race and have restaurants close by so we wouldn't have to do any driving. We experience exceptional customer service in all parts of the hotel, especially with the valet the guys were amazing and always had our vehicle ready for us quicker than the time given.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: AllOver_USATrae
Reviews.Content: The location was great for downtown activities. We went to a show at the House of Blues. The valet shuttle took us there and offered to pick us up, even after normal shuttle hours. The nightly mingle hour was great! 2 free drinks/person. Nice seating and views. The exercise room was nice since it had a jacuzzi, which was semi-open to the outside (3rd floor), with views/sounds of a nearby restaurant/bar. Not too loud, just nice to be somewhat connected to the outside while maintaining our own privacy. Room service was good. They were late w/our pre-arranged cheese/fruit platter, so they sent a complimentary bottle of wine. The food was pretty good. The room was small but cozy. Wish we had a better view, though. We opened our blinds only to see our neighbors across the way! ... INTERESTING! Overall, I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Extras make is Special”
Reviews.Author: TXworker
Reviews.Content: I have stayed for both business and pleasure and will do so again. The location is wonderful. Easy access to downtown businesses and clubs. The Evening Reception, Bedtime Cookie and Full Breakfast help make this lovely hotel and great deal too! I will and have recommended The Magnolia to friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: kmurioste
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrific. It is an older building that has been transformed into a hotel so it has the charm that the hotel chains do not have. With that comes a few of the little quirks that newer hotels don:t have but they were insignificant. The staff was wonderful and nice and room service was fast with great service. We walked around the area and soaked in the nightlife of downtown Dallas and found a quaint Italian resturant that was a perfect ending to the night. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mommaqueen
Reviews.Content: the rooms were HUGE. had full kitchen and living area. it was AWESOME

Reviews.Title: “The staff of the Magnolia Hotel are simply amazing!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelBrn37
Reviews.Content: I always feel like I am treated like a king with respect and dignity. Our stay this past weekend was relaxing and comfortable in many ways. THE OMELLETTES ARE THE BEST I HAVE EVER HAD! ROOM-SERVICE IS THE BEST...Just sayin! From the 1st moment we walked into the room and was pleasantly suprised with a plate full of various types of cheeses and fruits, along with a very nice bottle of wine; to the moment we started to check out, the staff was very helpful with all of our needs. I will return soon and will recomend this hotel to all of my friends! Thank you so much for allowing the Brown's to spend our 11th Aniversary at The Magnolia Hotel. V/R, Michael Brown

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in downtownn Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: CSL63
Reviews.Content: We needed one night's hotel stay in Dallas recently, so I took advantage of a weekend special that this hotel continually runs. I had never stayed there before, but remember the red Pegasus on top of the building from my childhood days. When you get to the hotel, you find the first thing that might bother some - parking is pretty much all valet. I'm sure there's some public parking nearby, but the best best is to use the valet. The special rate I got included free valet, though, so this was not a problem. The lobby is very nice - modern and stylish - sorta art deco-ish. Check-in was quick, courteous, and efficient. If you want the free wi-fi, they'll give you the code here, too. The elevators are a little creaky and obviously at least the interiors are original, but there's a sign in the elevator reassuring the passengers that even though the elevators have "character," they are inspected on a regular basis, and are actually quite safe. The room on the 23rd floor was roomy, and had very high ceilings so it seemed even more so. We requested and got two queen beds so there was room for the three of us. Beds were comfortable - that's the most important thing in a hotel room! The cookies and milk in the club were a nice touch before going to bed. Four different flavors of cookies, along with Starbucks coffee and both regular and chocolate milk. For the adults, the bar is open as well. The bathroom was nice and roomy, with a large tub/shower. The tub was not very high walled, but would probably have held two people. The breakfast in the morning was fine - not outstanding, but not bad for a free breakfast. It was set up in the same club as the cookies the night before. There were two choices of eggs - both scrambled, but one with onions and peppers - and two meats - sausage or ham. Potatoes and some breads rounded out the breakfast, along with coffee or juice to drink. Valet took a few minutes in the morning - don't know how far away the parking is. The attendants were very helpful and pleasant, though. The next time we're in Dallas, we will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would definately stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: slh930
Reviews.Content: Beautiful old hotel updated. We had a room with two queen beds that were very comfortable with 4 pillows. My daughter slept in the bed closest to the window and complained that the noise kept her awake at night but we were on the 4th floor. I had no trouble sleeping at all. The breakfast buffet was excellant hot eggs, pancakes, susage, bacon, juices, fruit, breads everything you would need. Happy Hour was a nice way to end my afternoon I had wine and was pleased with the selections. The milk and cookies were delicious a nice selection of cookies with regular and chocolate milk. The staff was friendly and helpful. Wireless internet in the room was easy to connect and the computers with printers on the second floor were perfect for me to print schedules for my daughters games. The only complaint I have was the elevators were very slow or not running. I actually walked up and down the stairs a few times. Convention Center is a nice walk and there are several nice resturants just outside the hotel. Beware of your surroundings at night lots of homeless people but lots of policemen on bikes riding around to protect us. If you stay at this hotel you will leave knowing you made a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place... Great Staff.... Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Caseykz
Reviews.Content: Staff was really friendly and helpful. They upgraded my room and it was amazing. I will stay here again !

Reviews.Title: “The Magnolia Hotel in Dallas provided exceptional services at an affordable price.”
Reviews.Author: jgjdess
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? The room was immaculate. I dropped a book behind the sofa and discovered upon pulling it out that the carpet there was very clean --just as clean as the carpet in the rest of the room. The milk and cookie snacks were awesome, but we really appreciated the shuttle service. The valet staff was fantastic. The guys drove us to dinner and came quickly to pick us up when called. The shuttle took us to the Sixth Floor Museum at Dealey Plaza, too. We only stayed one night and sighed in dismay over each of our hotels on the rest of our trip. Nothing measured up to the Magnolia.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff. Bathroom wasn't clean on arrival, elevator & hallway floors filthy.”
Reviews.Author: traveltech
Reviews.Content: The staff was very nice and helpful. However, upon arrival, there was hair all over the lid and seat of the toilet. They offered another room, which I turned down at first, but after a 30 minute wait for housekeeping, I decided to take the other room. They kindly upgraded me to a suite, which was nice. I was also surprised at how poorly maintained the elevator floors, and some of the hallway floors were. At first glance, this is a pretty hotel, but look a little further, and it's not living up to its potential.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Markbenjakov
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Magnolia. I've stated across the street at the Adolphus on previous trips, but local colleagues insisted I give the Magnolia a try. It was great. Service was excellent from the moment I arrived late in the evening and was immediately greeted by the parking valet and bellman. Every employee I encountered was friendly, polite, and eager to be of assistance. When I checked in, the desk clerk mentioned that cookies and milk were still being served (free) in the second floor lounge. She also advised the complimentary breakfast is served for three hours each morning and, later, a cocktail hour with two free drinks. Breakfast was generous and good. The lounge where breakfast, late-afternoon cocktails, and evening cookies are served is very large and attractive, with a full bar and plenty of seating options. There's even a pool table around the corner from the bar. I found my room to be quite large and well laid out. Like the rest of the hotel, it was nicely decorated and comfortably appointed. It had a large desk with its own chair, a queen sized bed with four pillows (and additional pillows and bedding in the closet), an arm chair, chest of drawers and flat screen TV. The big bathroom had a large soaking tub, good shower head and plenty of storage space under the counter. Interior lighting was good and there were three huge windows with effective light-blocking shades. Location is great if you need to be right in the middle of downtown Dallas. It's a two minute walk to the DART light rail trains. There are a number of restaurants in the immediate vicinity, though none in the hotel itself. As much as I enjoyed my stays at the Adolphus, I'm going to be a guest of the Magnolia on all future trips to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has lots of charm”
Reviews.Author: jmayes
Reviews.Content: It's an old office building that has been converted to a very modern hotel. I loved it and the cookies n milk in the evening were a special treat.

Reviews.Title: “The Magnolia Hotel Dallas offers such wonderful service and amenities that I would not consider staying anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: jlh027
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Magnolia Hotel Dallas for several weeks at different times in February, March, and April 2010. The staff was helpful and friendly. The food and wine were delicious! The rooms were spacious and comfortable. The location was within walking distance to the office. The transportation to and from the airport using MGM Transportation was convenient and friendly. I loved this hotel and several of my peers moved from other hotels to the Magnolia Hotel and they loved it as well. I will continue to stay at the Magnolia when I am in Dallas in the future.

Reviews.Title: “had problems”
Reviews.Author: colemancandl
Reviews.Content: wasa not happy stuff on ground room wasnt all that clean valet messed up

Reviews.Title: “Knows what their clients need and want and provides it :)”
Reviews.Author: Blessed281
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff who do their best to make you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel expreriences to date!! Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: tburnett
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia was fantastic!! There for the NIRSA Nationals!! To top off a great stay TEXAS A&M takes it all !! We could not have asked for more!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: bigj164019
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay at this hotel once to twice a year, and will continue to be a repeat customer. This older historic hotel has all the luxury and benefits of a brand new 5 star hotel, but maintains some of its history too. From valet, to the Front Desk staff, to the room. Then down to the bar for a complimentary drink from an "EXCELLENT" bar staff, then out for supper. Later the evening the Hotel provides milk and cookies! Complimentary breakfast, or room service, your call. Nice exercise room, with an comfortable spa. I stay at a lot of contemporary hotels for business, and I really enjoy the Magnolia Hotel in Dallas for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Magnolia - Dallas. Great customer service and "perks" like shuttle service around town and breakfast buffet.”
Reviews.Author: EmptyNesterFW
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to find. Everyone was friendly and helpful - valet, shuttle drivers, breakfast staff. The room was clean and comfortable. Definitely a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff; energetic, helpful, and so polite.”
Reviews.Author: BearForce
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic stay. Staff really made us feel right at home. And how can you beat the complimentary hot breakfast, cocktail happy hour, and cookies to die for with milk or coffee in the evening? Will stay there every opportunity we get!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: GIgurl3220Louisiana
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at The Magnolia 3 times now. It is a great location, right in the center of downtown Dallas. It's easy to get to most of the museums, close to the concert arena, and near a lot of great restaurants. It's always SUPER clean. There is no doubt that the sheets on the bed are fresh. I've left hotels before after check-in because I didn't think it was clean enough. I'm a little OCD about that. The Magnolia is spotless. It is beautiful also. It is a historic building and has a lot of character. The breakfast buffet is fresh and full of great choices--pancakes, bacon, eggs, cereal, fresh fruit, granola, cereal, juices, Starbucks coffee, and more. The evening cookies and milk are great for kids, but you see plenty of adults there too. They are fresh and soft, and there are usually 4 or 5 varieties to choose from. There is also a free evening bar with wine and beer. I haven't tried it, but everything they do they seem to really do well so I'm sure it is equally fantastic. I've never really had any complaints at this hotel. The price could be hefty, but they have discounts and deals on such a regular basis that really all you have to do is ask and you will get it for such a low price that you will probably even beat some of the lower level chain hotels in the area. We've never paid more than $110 for a night and for downtown Dallas that is a real steal. If I were to have any complaints to share, it would be that there is no parking so you have to drive down about 1/2 a block and park in a garage, or you could use the valet (we always self park). The other small annoyance is that we always have to go to the side door to get in until we've gotten our room key. The front door is always locked and you must scan your door key to unlock it. Hardly a complaint, but it's all I've got. It's a great place and we have stopped even looking at other hotels. It is our home when we're in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Change the room key locks!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ALRichardson
Reviews.Content: My stay was NOT what I expected at all. I was there for 11days & had 14 key cards. That's more than my total trip!!! Security was lax with room information on 1 of my colleagues.(her room number was left on a piece of paper in a chair in the lobby)Never knowing if I could get into my room daily was a guessing game & frustrating as EVERYtime this happened I had to go back to the lobby from the 22nd floor.(you have no courtesy phones on the floors)Needless to say some of the other colleagues experienced this same problem.Your hotel was recommended by a colleague who'd stayed earlier in the month. I changed my reservation from Embassy Suites because of her. It was a mistake.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Rooms available in Dallas!!”
Reviews.Author: keithdevers
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many Hotels across the country and The Magnolia, hands down, is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Good downtown location, freebies but noise from street traffic”
Reviews.Author: bikinibottomdweller
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 1325 with two double beds for two nights. The room could use some upgrade/maintenance (for example, AC vent looks like it's about to pop out, bath drips onto floor from right corner causing rust,etc) but overall it is clean. The beds were very comfortable but the hallway noise and traffic noise will definitely wake you. Each morning that I stayed, I can hear dump truck like noises coming from down the street below. It's very loud. The breakfast buffet (eggs, sausage or bacon, english muffin, potatoes, etc) was nice. Complimentary milk and cookies/coffee and mgr reception each evening was also enjoyable. But you'll most likely have to use valet parking, which is $22 per night. It was positive stay overall and we would stay there again. Maybe we'll see about a more quiet room next time.

Reviews.Title: “Magnolia Hotel Dallas is Tops in every Category!!”
Reviews.Author: callisonTaylorAr
Reviews.Content: All staff at the Magnolia Hotel Dallas was the best anyone could have asked for. The care, friendliness, and warmth was everywhere at all times! Our valet driver, Juan went over and beyond on one instance in particular. Our grandson had left his souvenier bag in the back seat of the car Juan drove us to the Amtrak station in...One call and Juan was back with the bag of souveneirs for my grandson. right before the train left...I have never been in any hotel as special as the Magnolia Hotel Dallas...

Reviews.Title: “Best Value Downtown ; Historic building with all the conveniences”
Reviews.Author: bertd418
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia Dallas is my first and only choice for downtown lodging. It is conveniently located, and has its own historic charm with all the services travelers are looking for. The Magnolia Dallas offers a great value , meaning what you pay compared to what you get . Hint: ask for a corner room, the views are fabulous! The staff is genuinely appreciative of its guests and go out of their way to ensure you are satisfied with every aspect of the services.

Reviews.Title: “Speedy services, great historic hotel, clean rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Double_DTexas_USA
Reviews.Content: Speedy check in and out, responsive valet and shuttle services in the downtown area. Suites are more like furnished apartments; not idea or cozy as a typical hotel suite should be for the rate applied.

Reviews.Title: “My kind of place”
Reviews.Author: thebigmoma
Reviews.Content: For my first trip to Dallas I definitely picked the right hotel for me. It was just what I was looking for in a hotel. I was impressed by charm of the building, the staff and accommodations. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I've ever stayed in... BY FAR!”
Reviews.Author: Tcalix1784
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 3rd anniversary. It was the best price for all the extra amenities offered, so we upgraded to a suite. The view was amazing, location was great, it was clean and comfortable, and we felt like we were in an apartment instead of a hotel. The staff was very helpful and courteous, and we were never bothered by housekeeping. Our room was just magically clean with the bed made up when we came back every evening. The most enjoyable trip we've been on in 3 years!

Reviews.Title: “Relax in Downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: young07
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this hotel. We received a free upgrade to a suite and it was great. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. All the amenities are great. This was our second stay and we will be back next time we are in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the BEST! All staff members at this hotel selflessly provide the best service to all guest. Thank you!”
Reviews.Author: mdsmit7
Reviews.Content: The best service ever. All staff members at The Magnolia Dallas were very accommodating. The best was the breakfast, cookies and milk reception and the happy hour. Thank you to the valet drivers who went above and beyond to help us. My group had a blast during our stay. We will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, love the shuttle service! Great rate!”
Reviews.Author: amcamp
Reviews.Content: Really nice decor. shuttle service will take you anywhere in style.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay--between the service, amenities, and old-world charm, I left pampered and feeling downright elegant!”
Reviews.Author: Jiggedy
Reviews.Content: This was truly an excellent hotel--I travel a lot and have never experienced anything like it! The way they have preserved the feel of an elegant grand hotel--from the service to the amenities to the creaky elevators--really is amazing and makes for a wonderful experience. In spite of being so old and elegant it felt haunted (but in a good way), the modern furniture, HUGE tub, amazing bed, comfy robes, excellent lounge area and bar, and free wireless will bring joy and refreshment to even the most jaded traveler. Much gratitude!

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: runner47
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms. Helpfull staff. Very comfortable beds. Enjoyed the compimentary drinks and bedtime cookies. Beautiful historic building.

Reviews.Title: “The Magnolia Hotel felt like a home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: SuziQNj
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel are very friendly and helpful. The second floor lounge provided live music some evenings, bar area, dining area and was a very comfortable place to relax with friends. The milk and cookies served every night, pool table and Wii were a great hit.The Magnolia atmosphere is very warm and inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel downtown Dallas !”
Reviews.Author: trylon2000
Reviews.Content: Good value - great staff - conveniently located - room is confortable and practicle - great for business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: angelwings1112
Reviews.Content: We were really impressed with the decor and historical beauty of the hotel. It was a great location for walking around downtown. We even got an upgrade for free for a bigger room on a top floor. However, parking is very expensive $22/night + tips for valet. Also you must call for you car at least 10-15 minutes before you need it.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: AleksandarD
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. The building is a bit old (after all it is a landmark), but service is great.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but horrible valet service.”
Reviews.Author: TexasLassie
Reviews.Content: All in all, this is great value for the money. Breakfast buffet was very good. We have stayed there before and as I remember, the hospitality hour was quite nice as is the extra treat of evening cookies. We were upgraded to a queen suite but the view was awful. It was a "U" shaped arrangement where we saw only the brick wall and windows of another part of the hotel. The rooms were clean, the amenities adequate but the lighting was not good except in the bathroom. The elevators were slow and the valet parking was terrible. It took almost an hour to get our car and when we called for a bellman we were told it would take 45 minutes for someone to help us. We finally toted everything ourselves. I would recommend this hotel to a friend but not before mentioning the glitches we encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly friendly hotel with free breakfast/drinks/cookies!”
Reviews.Author: cryinb
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, valet staff were very attentive and ran to open doors for us. Wonderful price for the room, plenty of space. The bathroom was spacious, although I never did soak in the huge tub. Wonderful location. The best part was waking up and knowing that FREE breakfast was waiting for us downstairs. Free beer and wine in the evening and free cookies and milk at night made this an EXCELLENT choice for a getaway. Going back in June and planning to stay at the Magnolia again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, outstanding location, parking service is ripoff”
Reviews.Author: surewould88
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great, staff is friendly, the location is unmatched, but parking is a ripoff, its 25 a day and its not covered parking, i can understand 25 for downtown parking but they could spend some more money to have a covered lot/garage

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: been_there_41
Reviews.Content: I chose the Magnolia based on the positive reviews that I saw here, and, fortunately, I find myself in complete agreement with these reviews. I was attending a conference at the Sheraton Dallas, which was also the official hotel for the conference, where most of my colleagues had stayed. At about half the official special conference-rate at Sheraton, and at the additional "cost" of a healthy 1Km morning & evening walk to / from the conference, the Magnolia offered so much more than the alternative(s): a rich breakfast buffet (almost none of the other hotels in the area has breakfast included), a daily wine & beer reception, and an outstanding complimentary "bedtime milk and cookies" bar, which I have never seen anywhere else (offering a rich collection of cookies, milk & chocolate-milk + Starbuck's coffee). My rooms was very spacious, clean and comfortable, and had a mini refrigerator, an iron and ironing-board - which all came in very handy. If you're traveling without your laptop, the small business-center with free, unlimited internet access and free printing is also greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Downtown Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: St_LouisPamela
Reviews.Content: The hotel was updated and very nice overall. The Business Center was small and offered no private workspace. Valet parking is the only parking option - for $24. It would have been nice if that had been highlighted on the website so that I knew that before we arrived. The staff was helpful, and was very upfront about the free car service that is available in the downtown area. The rooms were quiet, with a great view of downtown Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Milk and cookies were great and the beds were comfortable. It was great staying downtown.”
Reviews.Author: partlycloudy11
Reviews.Content: Milk and cookies in the evening were a great bonus. Breakfast was good and it was nice it was at the hotel. Starbucks had to close for a water leak and the hot tub was out of service. The valet parking was pricey and it took a long time to get the car back. Large bathroom and big tub! Beds were comfortable too. Overall, it was good for the price. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: branchranch
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at The Magnolia Hotel in Downtown Dallas. My college age daughter and I enjoy the restaurants nearby, as well as taking the train up to Northpark Mall. We have also taken in the JFK Museum and shopping in the West End area. The hotel is very comfortable, staff very friendly and helpful. The valet parking is very easy to access at any time. The breakfast buffet is very nice and the milk and cookie buffet each evening is a wonderful "homey" touch! I would recommend the Magnolia to everyone going to the Dallas area. We are already planning our 3rd annual Spring Break Trip for 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 40firemedic
Reviews.Content: Walking distance from eateries and entertainment, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Magnolia!”
Reviews.Author: hothusky23
Reviews.Content: The hotel's downtown location is key, rooms are cozy and comfortable, amenities are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “This is a GREAT hotel. The staff is great, has great amenties, and the rooms are always clean.”
Reviews.Author: baileysmom1971
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in downtown Dallas but very easy to get to. The hotel offers a nightly beer & wine reception, milk & cookies buffet, and then a breakfast buffet the next morning. The view of downtown is spectactular and hotel is located in a historical building. I live 45 minutes from this hotel and when I want to get out of town for the night, this is where I go. I always say that I am going to stay some where else but seem to end up right back at the Magnolia. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty towels, kitchen, and table.. dark room with uncomfortable bed & a view of a wall.”
Reviews.Author: WeGoSlow
Reviews.Content: Our initial impression of this hotel was that the lobby was beautiful, although not very inviting as the reception desk is behind large columns. It took several minutes to convince the woman behind the counter that we had confirmed a late checkout time of 4pm (for an extra $50 charge) by phone earlier in the week, she initially said she could accommodate 1pm, then 2pm, then finally agreed that 4pm would be available. Once we reached our room we were pleasantly surprised at the size, but after a few minutes several problems began to come to our attention. The dinning table had pink crusty spots (like dried sauce of some kind), the stove had a dead and cooked on bug, the carpet had cigarette burns (in a non-smoking room), and there was ash and part of a cigar in the *fake* potted plant. The thing that bothered us most however, was the towels had assorted brown stains. We requested new towels from the front desk and were sent another set of towels with yellow stains. We again requested fresh towels and received more with brown stains. It appeared that about 1/2 of the towels we received had some kind of staining, but we had accumulated enough for our use, so we did not complain further as we were hungry and wanted to go out to eat. Our room was cave-like and faced the other side of the building's courtyard, which allowed for minimal natural light even though the weather was clear and sunny. Street noise was still very disruptive with the courtyard room and we were serenaded by drunks and sirens all night long. Finally, the hotel seems to need overall general repairs and updates. The security latch on the door was loose and there was no in-room safe to use. The walls and doors were scuffed and there was a nail hammered into the linoleum floor in the kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “The Magnolia was fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: candrae
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. The location is great. There are so many great restaurants and activities within walking distance. We were in town for the Rock N Roll half marathon. The convention center and starting line were just a few blocks away. The staff was very friendly and always helpful. The rooms were very clean with large bathrooms. The complimentary happy hour and cookies were wonderful. I was also impressed by the affordability of the Magnolia given all the perks that are included. I will definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: kryslyn81
Reviews.Content: Very nice. I liked how they took an old building and made it new and modern. I enjoyed my stay and will stay again at a Magnolia Hotel. Although, the bed could have been more comfortable. The mattress was too firm.

Reviews.Title: “Nice downtown location.”
Reviews.Author: droopydave
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, affordable, convienent to the Akard station and all destinations on the rail line. My fav downtown hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel w/ lots of amenities”
Reviews.Author: freqflyer05
Reviews.Content: Large, modern rooms. Comfy bed. Free local transportation. Free breakfast. Free happy hour drinks. Free cookies and milk @ bedtime. Attentive service. Downtown location. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best ever Hotel Experience, and I travel a lot”
Reviews.Author: DFSR141
Reviews.Content: Great experience. Staff is very friendly. Good Breakfast and real good cookies and milk

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, but rooms need a little more attention from cleaning crew-time for a makeover!”
Reviews.Author: BigBusiness2010
Reviews.Content: The room was in need of a makeover. Comforters looked dirty and worn, closet door slats were askew, one window-blind was broken. The bathroom seemed dirty, specifically because the shower curtain was discolored and filthy looking. On the positive - check-in and check-out were fast, front desk staff was friendly. Room service was very good, fast and the server was friendly. The lobby is very nice and the complimentary breakfast was good. However, I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: DME62
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews I was very excited about staying at the Magnolia. Unfortunately, it was not as nice as I had envisioned. We had a 650 sq ft room that seemed very outdated. Some of the furniture was heavily damaged. The shower was the best thing about the room. I tried to contact the concierage three times and each time was put on hold for up to fifteen minutes before I hung up. We had to get new keys twice because they did not work. We were on the 14th floor and every morning were awaken by the noise outside of the hotel (even at 5:00 AM). On our departure day we called down 15 minutes before we were leaving for our car and then still needed to wait 30 more minutes for it. We were told it was not in the right spot. With so many other options for hotels in the area I would not return to the Magnolia. We certainly did not get our moneys worth.

Reviews.Title: “Such a beautiful hotel for an awesome price!”
Reviews.Author: axoaggie
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and your stay includes complimentary wine, beer, cookies, and breakfast. The hotel in conveniently located for downtown Dallas nightlife. I would love to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: Grizze30
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful trip from the free breakfast, free happy hour and cookies in the evening there couldnt be a better hotel for work trips.

Reviews.Title: “My boyfriend and I had so much fun during...”
Reviews.Author: AmandaWalker
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had so much fun during our stay at The Magnolia. We enjoyed walking around the hotel and viewing the very modern interior decoration - from beautiful sculptures and abstract artwork to comfy, stylish furniture. The Club Room is a great meeting place on the second floor where we sat at the bar and enjoyed the company of the friendly bartender and out of towners. We loved the added touches such as complimentary happy hour and free milk and cookies later in the evening. The room was wonderful - we loved the huge shower/tub and how clean and very modern everything was. We didn't make the complimentary breakfast early in the morning, but we ordered room service - the American breakfast and huge omelletes - and they was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Great value boutique/corporate hotel”
Reviews.Author: JLWDallasTX
Reviews.Content: Excelled in everything except make sure to call ahead when departing to get on the valet list. We had to wait 35 minutes for our car to be retrieved. But other than that, the room was a great stay for the cost, and it was truly a delight.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, classic, old Dallas charm with modern amenities.”
Reviews.Author: RMGingles
Reviews.Content: For a leisurely, downtown good night's sleep with the comfort of your own living room, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “an escape from the city”
Reviews.Author: spi1208
Reviews.Content: affordable for a college student and amazing for a young couple looking to grab some alone time in this busy city, in walking distance to the hot clubs bars and resturaunts and the to be able to return to a quite and intimate setting was pure bliss

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel...very nice!!”
Reviews.Author: alyson0510
Reviews.Content: I'd definately stay here again...very friendly service and they even offer their car up for short distance drives which saves you on the small taxi rides everywhere....Great service, nice rooms, happy hour breakfast in the morning and cookies at night...what more can you ask for??

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! COOKIES!”
Reviews.Author: ianvonhelderkoch
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful. The service was awesome, the staff was great. The cookies were a great treat. Breakfast was pretty good. The room was a bit small, but the tub was huge! The bathroom was super nice.

Reviews.Title: “Three Cs: Comfortable, convenient, cookies”
Reviews.Author: ChrisMobley
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located for downtown Dallas business needs. Small, a good small. Don't miss the cookies.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back next year!!!”
Reviews.Author: kirkinga
Reviews.Content: My family and I enjoyed our stay this past weekend. We will be back next year. A friend of ours stayed at a diffent hotel this week and when she came to the Magnolia she was impressed. She said she will be staying at the Magnolia the next time.

Reviews.Title: “There are no substitutes for excellent service with a smile.”
Reviews.Author: CLMAtl
Reviews.Content: The best location and friendly service is what The Magnolia is all about. From the moment you arrive until the day of your departure, the Magnolia staff will bend over backward to accommodate their guest. The staff has the perfect balance between professional and personable. I look forward to my trip to Dallas every year.

Reviews.Title: “Dallas here I come!”
Reviews.Author: Ody875
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay. Walking distance to the convention center, many restaurants, and drug store.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous ammenities and service, great location”
Reviews.Author: janycek
Reviews.Content: They had everything we needed for a comfortable stay

Reviews.Title: “stayed in one of the suites this past weekend.”
Reviews.Author: chrisison
Reviews.Content: room, view, and hotel were fantastic as usual. there was a cheerleading competition going on at the dallas convention center that weekend. the hotel was at 100 percent capacity and most of them were teenage girls. everything still went smooth. even with all that going on it was like the hotel was half empty. the staff kept up with everything so you didnt even notice all the kids. regardless of what is going on at this property you feel right at home. the breakfast buffet is included and is amazing. night time cookies and milk is a interesting addition. the fitness center is ok

Reviews.Title: “Lots of extras make this hotel a great value!”
Reviews.Author: Stephintexas
Reviews.Content: We had a "staycation" for the weekend at the Magnolia in Dallas. We reserved a regular room with a Queen sized bed. Upon checkin we were asked if we wanted a higher or lower floor. I asked for a higher floor & we were placed on the 24th of 26 floors. I did it partly for the quiet (which worked) and partly hoping for a view (which didn't, all we could see was another part of the hotel). The blackout curtains in our room were wonderful, we even had a mid afternoon nap & the room was darker than our room at home some nights! The bed was firm & comfortable. The bathroom was nice & the shower had plenty of room & light. The hot water was great & the water pressure was good as well. A lot of hotel showers end up being dark, small or slippery, but this one was just right! I am a fan of included breakfast buffets & they did a great job. Each morning there were scrambled eggs, breakfast potatoes, bacon, fruit, biscuits, bagels, etc. They also had orange juice, coffee, water & milk. There were also some items that changed, some kind of mexican dish (DH liked, I did not) & I also saw what looked like pancakes or waffles on other tables, but I never saw them at the buffet so I must have missed them. The evening cocktail hour was nice. We were too late for it the first night, but we each got 3 tickets for the 2nd night which could be used for beer, wine or soda. There was also a full bar, so if you don't want one of these you can order something else for a charge. We never made it for the milk & cookies, but they were advertised as being available from 8-10pm. The area around this hotel seemed safe, we walked it both evenings & nights & never felt a threat. We had a late dinner one night at the Iron Cactus, which was really good. There are certainly plenty of options for both regular dinners & late night eating & drinking! We also walked to the American Airlines Center, just a bit less than 1 mile away. This hotel does show some signs of wear & age (slow elevators as mentioned, less than pristine towels & bath mats) & the rooms were smaller than you will get at many newer hotels, but for the price & the "extras", this hotel was a great value!

Reviews.Title: “very upscale and interesting, valet could be better.”
Reviews.Author: blueveinFtWorthTx
Reviews.Content: hotel is magnificent in every way, architecture was so interesting as it is a very old building and quality of service was outstanding, valet leaving was the only problem we had.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was not clean, but the staff was very friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Banker2010
Reviews.Content: Bedspread and carpet in room looked dirty. Called housekeeping to come, and was told "the carpet is new, it just looks like that". Housekeeping did at least change bedspread. Breakfast buffet was overcrowded and there were dirty tables all around that guests had to clean themselves in order to sit down. However, the dining room staff was very help and friendly. The valet service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing and nice get away.”
Reviews.Author: Andrea114
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel with great amenities in a great location downtown. Around lots of bars and food but not much shopping only Nieman Marcus. Great breakfast buffet and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “just alright”
Reviews.Author: jamac1
Reviews.Content: Need better english speaking hotel staff! Not helpful for directions! should not charge breakfest ,waffels are free at must hotels you can make them yourself! the heat was not working in my friend room! for the money i spent for that weekend i expected better!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel might be nice if they replaced...”
Reviews.Author: amberrrj
Reviews.Content: The hotel might be nice if they replaced the beds and fired the maid. Both were subpar.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising treat in the middle of downtown Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: fasdallas
Reviews.Content: The hotel literally is at the backdoor of Iron Cactus (Main) and within a 3 minute walk to Campisi's (Elm). There are other spots in the general area as well, so it was nice to get out and walk with the kids. The suite room was nice, and the locker room in the fitness area has a steam room, which I definitely utilized. The bar area has a pool table and a Wii, so I imagine that can be fun. I'll definitely go back one night with some friends, as the atmosphere seemed pretty relaxed and cool. I wasn't there long, because we were taking the kids to eat nearby. It would have been nice to have a sofa bed in the adjacent room for the kids, but it worked out well. Breakfast the next morning with my family was pretty cool too. Everything was fresh (including the granola) and the food was good.

Reviews.Title: “Cookies and Milk”
Reviews.Author: SaralynneAustin_Tx
Reviews.Content: While on business, a comfortable welcoming hotel can make all the difference; cookies and milk too!

Reviews.Title: “Staff was nice and friendly would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Larbear1982
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice and clean. Staff was very helpful and knowledgeable about the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, suites were very nice and food was delicious. I recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Teacher2009
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my two week stay at the Magnolia Hotel in Dallas. The staff was GREAT, they were helpful with tips, directions, and answering questions. When I needed an appliance fixed in my room they were timely and attentive to resolving the issue. The food was delicious along with the evening wine and cookie bar receptions. I would recommend staying at this hotel to all colleagues and family members.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: cembry
Reviews.Content: Our room was small and not as well appointed as others we've stayed in, but functional and the location can't be beat. We were offered a rate too good to refuse, so it was fine. The valet parking guys are great, they go the extra mile and are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: PR4Fun
Reviews.Content: no room ervice during the day was disheartening after a long flight

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay while in Dallas, especially if you have business in downtown.”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkJeanie
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a two week business trip in the downtown area. I found this hotel by searching the internet and liked the features which did not dissappoint in person. My business destination was about a mile from the hotel and the hotel provided free shuttle service within a 3 mile radius, this included business and pleasure destinations so getting to restaurants was very convenient as well. The hotel is located only 2 blocks from train station which is similar to a subway line and this provides access to the mall and other area shopping and sights. It cost $4 for a day pass which was great for a weekend of checking out the area. There is a free breakfas buffet which includes full breakfast not just a continental breakfast. In addition, every night there is free wine and beer in the second floor bar area and a cookie and milk bar each evening. The bar serves food, but is not a full service restaurant per say (pub type of food) but there are many area restaurants and there is a Starbucks attached to the hotel for those who forgo the breakfast buffet in favor of a Latte on the go. Rates were reasonable and the bed was the most comfortable of any I've slept in at a hotel. I would definitely stay here again if I return to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Badly in need of an upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: Figarospeech
Reviews.Content: I've stayed more than 30 times at the Magnolia, having monthly business in Dallas. Frankly, I'd stay elsewhere if my employer didn't have a deal with the hotel. The good: thick walls, high ceilings, doors that don't slam loudly, short hallways (no kids running up and down them, fewer loud late-night conversations), free full breakfast. The bad: When the hotel is full (which is often, since they have a deal with the federal govt), you can wait more than 5 minutes for one of the slow, creaky, mildly scary elevators, half of which tend to be out of service at any one time. Beware of outdoor rock concerts on warm nights, even during the week. Staff are friendly but clueless, the exercise room is substandard, and the loud top 40s pop music in public spaces can make you want to throttle Lady Gaga. Overall: Not a horrible hotel, but not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Service and elegence never danced so gracefully as they do at the Magnolia.”
Reviews.Author: BryceNine
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia Hotel is as beautiful as its namesake. The staff was friendly and helpful, the room was clean and spacious. The gym was well-equiped and clean. The food was delicious and the cookie buffet was a unique and thoughtful touch. I had a few little problems with internet connectivity, but with as smootly as everything else runs at the Magnolia, I'm sure that it will be fixed soon if it isn't already (and it could've just been MY computer, anyway). The crowning jewel of the Magnolia is the valet and shuttle service. They were prompt, knowledgeable and very charismatic. It's a bit pricey, but the Magnolia is worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “I stayed at the Magnolia for my birthday weekend and I had a blast”
Reviews.Author: lindato2871
Reviews.Content: Magnolia was amazing! We checked in late and we got to enjoy some milk and cookies and sit by a fireplace! We then were walking distance from the Main street bars and clubs and danced the night away. We went back to the hotel and fell asleep instantly on their amazing bed! We also made sure we woke up early and enjoyed their hot continental breakfast buffett. It was an amazing experience and we'll be staying at the Magnolia time and time again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - just plan on staying up a bit!”
Reviews.Author: familyof8Dallas
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at the Magnolia Hotel in Dallas. We needed a quick in town getaway and chose this older, established hotel. It was beautiful, comfy and cozy and the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. The bathroom tub was big enough for the wife and I to sit and relax and enjoy a nice soak. The club room was elegant and we enjoyed a wonderful time of complimentary beer and wine at Happy Hour and then later that evening enjoyed a neat time of cookies and milk as a night time treat! Overall our stay was excellent. Being in the heart of downtown Dallas, however, the night life didn't die down until around 2:30, so sleep was a bit difficult until that point. We were on the 5th floor so it is possible if you were higher up it might not be heard so much. We would certainly consider staying at the Magnolia again, it was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed”
