Reviews.Author: Suzieleaguecity
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and well maintained. The breakfast buffet was very good. We were out to late so we didn't get to try the cookies in the evening. The only problem is parking. You have to valet park which is $22. If want to park yourself then you'll have to walk 2-3 blocks and yo don't have in and out priviledges which puts you back to valet parking. The valet guys are GREAT! You do feel comfortable letting these guys take your car. The location is excellent as well. Easy to get to and from the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: smwhite
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights there on the 12th floor corner room, the vews were awesome. The second floor offered comfort, warmth and excellent service. Thanks for making my first trip to Dallas a memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: dehender
Reviews.Content: I visited the Magnolia Hotel with my grandchildren. Everyone was very nice and we all had a great time. I loved the soaking tub and comfortable bed and pillows. My grandchildren loved everything. We are looking forward to going back again. This was my first experience with valet parking and really enjoyed this service. It was so nice not to worry about where to park my car - it just made things a lot easier. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, very beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: auntbocarter
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the service and quality of the Magnolia! Never have I stayed in a hotel with a guest reception and complimentary bedtime milk and cookies. We will definetely stay there again! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal locatiion and distinctive boutique property with excellent food and service.”
Reviews.Author: pmargolies
Reviews.Content: Excellent unique property with personality, great food.

Reviews.Title: “Personal”
Reviews.Author: TexasHarry
Reviews.Content: Front desk was very atune to needs and did everything to accomplish that......valet and front desk were first rate

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel-expected more”
Reviews.Author: cheermomTx
Reviews.Content: Good location. Room was small, but beds comfortable. Ease of check in was good. Internet difficult to access- had to get code from front desk. Restaurant has no hostess- had to go to the bar to get someone to wait on us for dinner. Food was good though. Breakfast buffet was free, but it was terrible - eggs like rubber. It was more like something you would get at motel 6. Very disappointed. Staff friendly. Vallet is come and go for $22.00. Valet staff very helpful and friendly. Stay at Adolphus often, so maybe I expected it to be same level since an older hotel. Cool architecture though.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in downtown”
Reviews.Author: Dfdhoward
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in the middle of downtown Dallas. Whenever we are catching a game at the AAC we stay at the Magnolia. The beds are amazing and the 10 o'clock milk and cookies are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BRTC
Reviews.Content: If you need to stay at a centrally located hotel in downtown Dallas, I would highly recommend the Magnolia. I would recommend a higher floor, away from the street noise however. The one bedroom corner room suites are absolutely outstanding and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Getaway weekend”
Reviews.Author: amanda2807
Reviews.Content: It's nice to just get away for the weekend. We live in Dallas but wanted something different. The cost of the hotel was reasonable. I loved the cocktail reception. Didn't stay in to get the cookies and milk but its sounds amazing. Than you can just go out on the town in downtown Dallas. It was fun.

Reviews.Title: “Class Act!!”
Reviews.Author: Denture-King
Reviews.Content: A beautiful Place to stay in downtown Dallas. One of the nicest hotels I have stayed in. I would recomend this hotel to anyone staying in the downtown area of dallas, no matter what their visit is for.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: recpnctrip
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay, but it seems to be a great hotel for the weekend with a wonderful location for downtown area Dallas event.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding value”
Reviews.Author: schmoov
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel with lots of character. Staff was friendly and all requests were accommodated quickly. The club floor available to all guests is very inviting and offers complementary breakfast, cocktails in the evening and a cookies and milk buffet at night. Great location, safe, walk to many restaurants/nightclubs, historic sites and museums. The parking is a bit pricey, but overall, a perfectly wonderful hotel. Be sure to note the architectural details in this fine building.

Reviews.Title: “Very central downtown and convenient to restaurants and many sights. One of the best Dallas hotel experiences I've had!”
Reviews.Author: h2osafe
Reviews.Content: A great hotel experience. Staff went out of way to help; amenities were some of the best I've ever experienced during business travel.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Dependability.”
Reviews.Author: BlancheTexas
Reviews.Content: You will enjoy everything about this hotel from the tastefully appointed lobby to the spacious guest rooms. I have been a repeat customer for the last 9 years and I have never been disappointed. If you have a downtown destination, the Magnolia should be the hotel you choose.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: aufzumsieg
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed here for a weekend getaway. It was my first time at the Magnolia and I was very impressed. We had an amazing view and the 300sqft. room felt alot bigger. The bed was comfortable, although the pillows were very hard. Other than that I had no complaints what so ever. I was very suprised during happy hour that the hotel actualy had a waiter walking around serving you drinks. Most times when there is complimentary drinks involved there is a line out the door and you only have time for one. Not my experience at all with the Magnoila. I will be recommending this hotel to my out of town guests for our wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Gremillion
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent Hotel and comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Better location!”
Reviews.Author: FilMart
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed here twice. Both times we stayed in the queen suite room. The main reason why we stay here is the location! Right in the middle of downtown! Within walking distance to several restaurants/bars/clubs! Check ins have always been a breeze! Elevators seem a little old and slow, not bad though. Complimentary beer and wine in the evenings, milk and cookies at night, and a cont. breakfast! Rooms have always been clean, and ready. Valet is always very fast and helpful! Very highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, noise level too high”
Reviews.Author: kate11razorback
Reviews.Content: This a a beautiful old hotel. It has been updated to feel modern but it still maintains it's old charm. The room was nicely appointed and the beds were very comfortable. The value for the money you spend is top notch. The Club Room was great, very nice ambience. The cookies and milk at night is an excellent touch. It was quite a hit with my ten year old daughter. My only complaint was the noise. Our 14th floor room overlooked a major downtown street and buses drove by every 2 minutes. There was also some sort of congregating spot just below us and people were screaming until at least 2 am. I don't know if this is an nightly occurence or we just happened to be lucky enough that some crazy people decided to scream for four hours while we were there. Next time, I would ask for a room on the other side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to get away, and good extra amenities!”
Reviews.Author: Happy1962
Reviews.Content: Yes the breakfast could have been better, but it was included, as well as the happy hour; however, the selection was Bud, Bud Light, and Miller Light, Cab, Merlot, Chardonay, and White Zinfindal - all cheap and poor taste, but if you are just there to get drunk I am sure you still can -yuk! Excellent cookies, nice room, and great location to good food.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ddot_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Magnolia Hotel when in Dallas on business. I was also visiting the FIG and the hotel was in close proximity to there and other places I would have to visit during my stay. From the time I arrived everyone was helpful. When I say everyone, I mean EVERYONE. From the valet attendants, the front desk personnel, to the bartender. The first night I arrived back to the hotel after the â€œbedtime snackâ€� (cookies) had been served, but I had this chocolate craving that would not stop. I was told by the guy at the front desk to just go upstairs to the bartender and heâ€™d be happy to get the cookies for me. Well I did, and he was! The bartender also took care of me the next night when I felt a little cold trying to come on, so I had a couple cups of hot tea. There was also a new Club Room manager, his name leaves me right now, but he is super friendly. The only "buyer beware" I'd have to share is that there are a few homeless folks in the area. However, I can say that I did not feel unsafe and I did a lot of walking in the area. All in all, this was a great place to stay and Iâ€™m sure Iâ€™ll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Dallas37
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel, but it absolutely fits into that "Classic" category. I was a little worried, I read some reviews complaining about the elevators. I stayed on the 20th floor and the elevators were quick and efficient. But note...there are plaques in each car that explain that the hotel is older, and the elevators sometimes are not the quickest, but they are maintained and safe! I had no issues with the elevators. The room was awesome, with a very clean bathroom, comfortable bed, and nice sitting area. You should def hit up the reception, the bar staff was great. The bedtime cookies were awesome. These are not packaged cookies...they were outstanding. (tip: if you have dinner nearby, skip the desert and head back to the hotel before 10p .... cookies and coffee are perfect!) I expected a very basic breakfast....I was wrong! Breakfast was full and enough for me to skip lunch! Overall a great hotel with perks that make it well worth the rates! (note: I stayed at the Adolphus, right next door, a few weeks prior and the Magnolia outshines the Adolphus without a doubt!)

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: traveler5059_10
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia is friendly and welcoming -- the not characterless boxes like other chain hotels. The historical details add charm, the staff is helpful and warm, the rooms are varied, and the suites have full kitchens and living rooms. I lived at the Magnolia twice for three months at a stretch. It was, and is, my home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Suites remind me of a Manhattan apartment, so I feel like I'm home.”
Reviews.Author: WestWind2010
Reviews.Content: Right in the center of all my business meetings. Courteous staff -- Valets were smiling & friendly even when the temperature dropped below 10. Club level was a fun setting for watching the bowl games and leisure space. Suites are generous space at great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with great amentities. I would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: kiran786
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel choice for my business trip. Everyone was very helpful and was able to accomadate me with all my needs! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wsschellhase
Reviews.Content: No cold water, fiugre that one!! Has to be a first...very loud, beds and pillows as hard as rocks! Very unfriendly staff. If staying downtown in this area the Adolfus is a much better value!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, moved me to a room with a great view upon my request!”
Reviews.Author: ljw123
Reviews.Content: Loved the Hotel, we got there on New Year's Eve, they was extremely busy. My room had no view, but the moved me the next day!

Reviews.Title: “Very classy, clean hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Maymay15
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! Prime location, lots of history inside the hotel. Very clean, beautiful interior, and the beds are so comfy!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a getaway weekend”
Reviews.Author: lizzyespy
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Dallas for the Cowboys/Eagles game, and wanted to do some sightseeing during the weekend so it made sense to stay downtown. The Magnolia was a very easy walk to a bunch of restaurants, and we visited the JFK memorial right down the street. One of the valet guys was really nice to us, he parked my car and made sure we got it fast when we checked out even though there was a ton of people there trying to get out as well. The hotel was PACKED with Ole' Miss fans but the staff, who were pretty friendly, made everything really smooth. The breakfast buffet was never out of food (and it wasn't half bad for being free), and they put out plenty of cookies at night and drinks for the happy hour. Our room was huge (just a queen bed) and the bed was really comfy. We'd definitely go back or stay with any of the other Magnolia hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and staff very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Saratexas
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. The staff was exceptionally nice. The only amenity that we had time to enjoy was the cookie buffet that was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, nice facilities, Cookie bar!”
Reviews.Author: RockportStar
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a family wedding -- large group, multiple rooms. Same weekend as the Cotton Bowl & another large wedding party, so the facilities and staff were stretched to their limit. Staff was friendly and helpful, but the crowds were noticeable (and annoying) in the elevators, evening reception and breakfast. Kind of felt like we were on a cruise ship in that "moving en masse" way that cruises are. Everyone wanted to be in the same place at the same time. The rooms (I saw several) were lovely -- restored older hotel with an art deco meets modernity vibe -- each with a little bit different lay out because of the age of the restored hotel. Our suite was long and narrow, a bit difficult to socialize in; but another suite in our party had a larger square layout, which was more fun for getting together. The suites have a full kitchen with stove, oven, microwave, full refrigerator (great!), and glasses, dishes & utensils. The kitchen was very clean. Our bedroom was very small - with just room for the queen bed (no kings) and end tables -- no closet or drawer space. The closet was like a hall closet in the entry area, so it made getting dressed a bit awkward when there were people in the room. Had to keep our clothes in the suitcases on the floor. The bedroom in our other suite was noticeably larger; however, our suite had much better light (5 window facing east with a nice city view) than the other suite, which essentially faced the other side of the building (kind of U shaped building). The queen & double queen rooms were equally nice -- and again just varied from room to room on shape & size & views. The bathroom was nice -- a large oval (no whirlpool) tub and shower -- a bit awkward to get into the tub/shower if you were older or less agile. Large vanity area, nice toiletries (but ours were mixed brands/types & incomplete -- I'm assuming because of the crowds?!?). Only one robe -- why? We would stay there again -- on a less crowded weeked

Reviews.Title: “Classy, Affordable & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: fatcatsrw1994
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia Hotel in downtown Dallas was very nice. While the valet parking was $22 overnight, they were super fast at retrieving our vehicle anytime we needed it and even delivered a bag to our room that we forgot in the car. If you don't use the valet, you have to park 2 blocks down in a parking garage and pay a fee each time you enter. The hotel offers complimentary hot breakfast which was great, cocktails and snacks at 5:30, which we missed, as well as cookies and milk later in the evening. The entire staff was very friendly and accomodating. Great hotel in an historic building. Because the hotel is a renovated office building, a few things were different from your average hotel. For example, the ice machine and soda machines were located on one floor so if you wanted anything you either went to the bar or the floor where the machines were. Not a big deal, but they could post a sign or add it to your room key sleeve to help you find them. The weekend we stayed, the Cotton bowl was playing at the new Cowboys stadium. The crowds from these two teams were very rowdy and loud. We only stayed Saturday night, but there was yelling and very loud singing in the streets from about midnight until 2:30 a.m. when the cops showed up. We could hear all of this from the 14th floor. Not sure if the hotel could have done anything to quiet the crowd before then. Several guests mentioned it was rowdy Friday night as well. This was certainly not the hotel's fault, the staff was always very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, spacious accomodations with lots of amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Ann4242
Reviews.Content: For the price the Magnolia offers clean, comfrotable, and spacious accomodations. In addition, there are lots of nice perks such as free breakfast buffet (including eggs, bacon, hashbrowns, etc). There is also a free cocktail hour and even cookies and milk at bedtime. The Magnolia is my hotel of choice in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “The Magnolia Dallas makes the perfect home away from Home when in Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: dsaintSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Thehotels freindly "Living Room" atmosphere of the common areas, great health club and awesome internet service are as close to home as one can get. The rooms are very comfy and have all the right stuff in the right places.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, But tricked by promotion”
Reviews.Author: blueswtdream
Reviews.Content: Be very careful with specials & deals. You only receive the treats/bonuses once. I booked the "champagne & chocolates" packaged for two days with the impression that I would receive the treats on both days (customary in other hotels/chain). However, Magnolia informed me on the second day that they only give out first night regardless of number of days booked. Otherwise great service. Clarification: Oversize tub at Magnolia does not mean width, but depth of the tub.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey for what you actually get”
Reviews.Author: KeeshaOhio
Reviews.Content: The rooms are 'compact' but not bad. Read the reviews before you go and you wont be surprised. Valet does take some time to get your car ($20 parking per day) but if you call 15 minutes before you need your car there is no problem. We had 3 rooms;a handicap accessable suite , a room with two queen beds and a room with one queen bed. The suite had a fully equiped kitchen, nice! The other rooms were nice, but not worth the $$$$. The bottles of water you find in your room will cost you $3.00 each and the little bottle of spray starch next to the iron is $2.49....I dont know what the charge was if you used the iron!! The elevators are slow...but not horrible. The staff at the hotel could not have been nicer! We had some special needs and they went out of their way to help us. I dont know what the other hotels in the area are like, but the wonderful staff at the Magnolia would make me return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Bane73
Reviews.Content: Went for New Years Eve and it was a great location and lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel_ easy to find _very safe and comfy!”
Reviews.Author: catloverRuston_LA
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel to others. It was easy to get to shopping areas and very easy to get on freeway to go home. The beds was very comfy and I really enjoyed the big tub. The staff was very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “My stay was comfortable and affordable and I was come back.”
Reviews.Author: PhotoBug41
Reviews.Content: We came to Dallas to go shopping for wedding dresses and the boutique we were visiting was downtown so that is how we came to stay at the Magnolia Hotel. It is affordable and it has complimentary breakfast and complimentary cookies and milk at night. The cookies/milk was neat and you could hang out in the CLUB room in front of a fireplace if you wanted to. Our rooms were comfortable and clean. The building is a historical landmark so the architecture was interesting. I was a little nervous about the elevators since they were so old, but they operated just fine. We didn't have a view out of our window, but that wasn't a big deal for us. The staff was nice and the valet parking was great! It was worth the money not to have to worry about parking. Since we didn't know our way around we ate at the mexican restaurant next door, The Iron Cactus, and it was good and reasonable. The only thing that was disappointing was the complimentary breakfast. It is served until 10:00 am, but when we came downstairs at 9:30 everything was gone and they were putting it away, which means we had to go down the street and pay to eat breakfast. The complimentary breakfast was one of the things that helped make our decision of where to stay. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very delightful and comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: aangelcute1
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiance stayed at the Magnolia for two nights as a Christmas getaway. Everyone was really nice and polite. We had a suite with a full kitchen that was so much more than I had expected. We had the ability to cook a dinner instead of going out. Everything was so close withing walking distance. The front desk put us on a floor that had a great view of downtown and the Mercantile clock. The happy hour was great and the hostess were nice. The club room had a pool table and WII console. This kept us entertained during the evening. The bedtime cookies and milk were such a delight, they were baked fresh and hot. I enjoyed our stay overall and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities (cookies, breakfast, club room, etc.) but the two-bed room was small and a bit run_down.”
Reviews.Author: OklahomaHotelhunter
Reviews.Content: Overall was very nice. I stayed there in a one-bed room a while back and it was a better experience than the two-bed room I had recently.

Reviews.Title: “Fun night for my wife and I.”
Reviews.Author: nathanchambliss
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia emails us specials. We received a free room upgrade to a suite and stayed for less than $100 (including tax) the day after Christmas. I know this was an especially low rate and would pay a little more to stay there again. Everything about the hotel was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: GO-MAVS!
Reviews.Content: For the price, you can't beat the Magnolia. The location is ideal. We had the queen suite on the 17th floor with a decent view. Beds are comfy. Kitchen was well stocked. Lots of nearby restaurants/bars. Neiman Marcus is very close in case you want to shop. Convenient to all major Dallas freeways.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service from a friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: joeboy44
Reviews.Content: From the DFW area on a get-a-way the day after Christmas. The staff were uniformly friendly and service oriented. Room was clean and well decorated. Only negative was we occupied a room on the Commerce Street side of the building and the 24-hour-a-day traffic noise took some getting used to. One of our favorite places to stay and we look forward to our retutn.

Reviews.Title: “Everthing seemed fine until Midnight”
Reviews.Author: PsmilesPsmiles
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, in Dallas Christmas Eve was a mess with all the ice. After I had been asleep, I that my daughter's finace had gotten stranded at DFW. I called the front desk to add a room. Even though the rate was the same and my ID and credit card had been reviewed and were on file, I had to get up, get dressed and go initial the rate of the room. WHY? policy...Then I got stuck in the lobby elevator! The worst part was yet to come. My daughter spent 4+ hrs on the roads covered in ice to retrieve him. The next morning I get a call from Maverick-for whatever reason, cars were being moved around and when the valet hit a ice in the garage, it slammed into the wall. He assured me it was drive-able and that the valet company accepted liability and called Enterprise Rental. Hours later we checked out and began to make our way to our relatives' Christmas celebration. The car overheated.Stranded on Christmas...by a hotel mistake. There were no cars available and no wreckers to come assist. On Saturday, wrecker said the underside of the car was damanged--no cooling fluid and a rip in the radiator. The car rental manager gave us a grim predication: we'd be liable since the hotel had a 3rd party vendor, the valet service. They said the hotel would probably not help and blame the valet service and visa versa. My daughter has stayed at Magnolia twice before and loved it. She has recommened it to her friends in DC (where she lives). I realized on Saturday that my future son in law got the parking fee on his room bill (although I requested it on mine at check-in). I called back...why? policy. I asked for a credit and hope it made it to the correct credit card. I remain cautiously optomist. Pam Lovell

Reviews.Title: “Was more than I expected”
Reviews.Author: ttowntravel
Reviews.Content: The rooms were more updated than I expected after reading reviews of similar-aged hotels in the downtown Dallas area. We had the queen Signature Suite. We looked at the architecture on the Adolphus hotel to one side and downtown to the other. Hospitality Hour was nice, and such a small thing as a cookie bar is something that we talk about to friends. The breakfast buffet is in the bar(which was the second floor), but that is fine. there was NO smell of smoke whatsoever. They did a good job of making the club a multi-purpose Club/breakfast area. As some mention, the Valet parking was a little high, but I also noticed they informed us of the price upon check-in, so it wasn't a surprise......they're not out to do that like others it appears. There really wasn't anything bad about the stay at all. Oh, some may gripe about elevator speed.....what the heck. It's a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: austinfrost
Reviews.Content: Great old building with beautiful new look. They offer great weekend rates with free breakfasts at all their hotels and the Suite was so nice we could have moved in!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Bliss”
Reviews.Author: techtraveler27
Reviews.Content: My daughter's wedding was a breeze and it was a magical night not only for the happy couple but for the parents of the bride and groom as well. The venue was ideal and our guests had a great weekend in Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “10th anniversary trip.”
Reviews.Author: tdnd
Reviews.Content: It's an old hotel and I thought the architecture and details were nice. Very friendly staff from the people at the desk down to the valets. We had a discounted rate. I'm not sure I'd pay full price but I tend to be a little cheap about some things. Overall, I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great evening cocktail reception, great cookie evening cookie reception, and great breakfast buffet.”
Reviews.Author: liza2377
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because we've stayed at the Magnolia in Houston and love it! This location was just as cozy. We had a little run in with the valet but we were told that they would be contracting a new company after the New Year.

Reviews.Title: “Nice romantic hotel with great value and historic character”
Reviews.Author: Longhorn_Lefty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Magnolia for one night to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We live in the Dallas area and wanted to get away and stay downtown. The location is great, its in walking distance of the DART, and some good restaurants: Fish Market is an excellent seafood restaurant and Iron Cactus is a casual indoor/outdoor Mexican restaurant with great food and a fun atmosphere. There are also a few dance clubs in walking distance as well. The hotel itself is a historical landmark so it has alot of character inside and out. The size of the rooms is generous, they were very clean and there is a flat screen TV. They even put us up in a room with 3 views of downtown Dallas. They serve cookies and milk each night from 8-10pm and there's a free continental breakfast (including sausage & eggs) every morning. The only thing we were unhappy about was the room temperature. We walked in and it was freezing cold, so we raised the thermostat and headed out to dinner. 2 hours later when we returned, the room was still very cold. We called the front desk and were told that a service man/engineer would be up to our room. No one ever came and we remained really uncomfortably cold. We ended up turning off the thermostat and eventually it warmed alittle, but not what we expected. We could have called the front desk back but didn't. We would return again since overall we had a pleasant stay. This was a great hotel for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Magnolia”
Reviews.Author: thecreativetype
Reviews.Content: In the centre of everything - we always try and pick a hotel that allows us to walk to everything - and this did the trick nicely. Good rooms, excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great friendly hotel right in the middle of downtown”
Reviews.Author: Gannic
Reviews.Content: From the moment we parked our car to the last minute we were very well taken care of of by the friendly staff. Our room had a great view and was clean and comfortable. The location is a great advantage and there are many restaurants and bars within walking distance. The complementary drinks only added to the nice athmosphere!

Reviews.Title: “Loved, Loved, Loved!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fitzmo
Reviews.Content: We checked into The Magnolia Hotel last weekend on Sat. and from check in to check out had a wonderful experience! The room was perfect-modern and clean-could not have been better. The staff was friendly and helpful. I highly recommend the hot breakfast and cookies and milk in the evening. While the weather was cold and rainy the Magnolia was warm and added sunshine to a dreary girls weekend. I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location, VERY Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: KClop
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got a good deal on a suite at The Magnolia so we figured we'd try it out. The location is in the heart of Downtown Dallas, very close to everything downtown and close to the major highways in Dallas. The Room was large and spacious. The bed was comfortable and the room service was actually good (Kobe Burger). I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling in Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in the US!”
Reviews.Author: PlatinumQueen
Reviews.Content: I travel every week around the country for work and therefore spend most of my time in hotels. I was so surprised and delighted with The Magnolia hotel in Dallas. It was a nice combination of comfort and luxury while throwing in all the extras. I was thrilled with the complimentary breakfast buffet along with the evening happy hours, not to mention milk and cookies before bed! It was so nice to have treats throughout the day. The location was good making it convenient to walk to restaurants etc. I would definitely recommend this hotel and look forward to staying there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “RUN”
Reviews.Author: texasaggie1
Reviews.Content: Old, dirty, smelly hotel in downtown Dallas. Hotel needs to be torn down. I have had Motel 6 do a better job in hotel management. One day, a housekeeper barged into the room while I was changing, without knocking. She aploogized profusely as she left, but I felt I had to call the manager to let hem know just in case the story was not the same from her. He offered nothing short of another apology; not even a note to follow-up or a follow-up after he talked to housekeeping. Decent free breakfast every day. Although it is every day, happy hour is only an hour and beverage choices are minimal.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: tripaholic06
Reviews.Content: I must first say that I am a VERY picky traveler. I travel to Dallas often because the headquarters for my job is located there. Although our company offers an allowance of $300 / night for hotel stays when we travel overnight, the Magnolia is the ONLY place I stay.....usually saving them @ $100/night....they really should pay me more :0). It is in a great place for downtown business travelers...within walking distance from Neiman Marcus(in case you forgot something or have to stay an extra day without notice), many downtown business towers, many restaurants, starbucks and CVS (business travelers will appreciate this). The complimentary breakfast is really great, and I love the cookies/milk. I have never tried the free happy hour, but many of my colleagues claim that it is really nice (and convenient). The rooms are always clean and comfortable, also. In all of my years staying here, I have never had a "nice" view....mostly just other buildings. However, for my purposes, this is fine. Although my office is only a few steps away (literally), I am not a big walk-to-work person, so I appreciate the fact that the hotel offers complimentary service downtown. I have been here many times, and never rented a car. Even for trips to the airport and other areas, there is always a car available right outside of the hotel (for a small fee...the airport is usually under $30 one way), and there are also taxis available. Also, the staff is very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I was Still There!”
Reviews.Author: Merry61
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia was a luxury gift from me to me, and I would go back in a heartbeat. We love staying downtown, but this was such a quiet and lovely place for a romantic getaway. We never heard a soul, despite the fact the place was bulging with people. No sounds from upstairs, next door, hallway, etc. I never saw any children. We upgraded to a suite, which made our bedroom small, but it was way cool to have the living room and kitchen available to us. We missed happy hour both nights, but the cookies were a plus. Breakfast was very hectic due to the Mary Kay convention going on, but it didn't effect the quality of the food. People were so friendly! I heartily recommend this hotel to anyone who deserves the best.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible! Never again!”
Reviews.Author: thextravelprincess
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here on a Saturday night for a birthday party.. we checked in at around 5 and were told we had no room.. that we would need to wait. We got to our room and they gave us ONE bed for four people.. we called and told them, they said they were sorry that the hotel was over-sold. They sent up an air mattress.. we never got our things sent to us from the bell service.. we had to wait FORRRRRREVER for an elevator and go get our own things. NO ice makers on any of the floors except the very top! And trust me after you wait literally 15 minutes for each elevator at least.. you don't even want ice anymore. When we were checking out.. we called for Bell service.. nothing.. they kept saying they were coming.. never did. We carried everything to the Valet ourselves.. they never brought our car! FINALLY after waiting in the lobby forever, we asked again and they told us our car was parked on a meter across the street and we could go get it..!! TWENTY dollar Valet for that?? Its sad because its a nice hotel.. just horribly run, and the elevators do need help.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC stay at the Magnolia”
Reviews.Author: rjkcpktrips
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Texas for some sightseeing as well as meeting up with some friends. While in Dallas we stayed at the Magnolia (this was our first trip to Texas). I booked the room from Expedia so I cannot remember the exact charge for the room since it was a package. The Magnolia definately goes the extra mile in making their guests feel welcome. Upon arrival which I was able to get into my room around 12:30 I was greeted by the manager and girl at the front desk. The manager made sure to let me know all the services the Magnolia had to offer as well as the times to utilize those. We were given a free upgrade to a queen suite. The suite had flat screens in the bedroom and living room. We had a full kitchen. The room was very clean, comfortable, and felt very homey. The bed was very comfortable. Overall I was very impressed with the accomodations. Amenities: well it started with the complimentary happy hour from 5:30-6:30. Jon the bartender (who was fantastic) served guests with free draft beer, and free wine during that hour. We did not stay after that hour so I am not sure of the prices after that. Jon was very helpful in sharing about local places to visit. From 8-10 each evening they have complimentary milk and cookies. They have about 3-4 different types of cookies for your pleasure. Finally each morning they have a breakfast which has eggs, potatoes, and a meat. The breakfast was excellent and a great way to start the day. We did walk into the weight room which looked nice, but the hot tub was TOO hot. They do have a business center with printers on the second and third floors. The people here are outstanding! Everyone from the manager to the valets were very friendly, helpful, and all around welcoming! The walk to some of the attractions range from 5-15 minutes. We did all the tourist stuff (JFK 6th Floor Museum, Southfork, Dealey Plaza, Fort Worth). Hofbrau Steaks is excellent (short walk), Sonny Bryans was very good too. I cannot say enough about this hotel. The only drawback could be the parking which is 22.00 per day plus tax. It does have in/out privledges and I was able to get my car very fast. Going to other large cities, that is a fair price, but downtown Dallas parking seems pretty cheap, and the cars are parked off-site. Thanks again Magnolia!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay-except for the parking”
Reviews.Author: PaulPittsburgh_PA
Reviews.Content: After reading so many reviews, we weren't sure what to expect. We felt the room was very satisfactory and the bathrooms were large with a nice shower. The evening cookies and the breakfast were enjoyable. The parking is really a problem--approaching $30/day with tips and the wait for your car can be long--even if you call ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: WeekendsOut
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, right downtown. It is close to everything! Public transportation is available to whatever they are not close to! They offer wonderful historic suites, a good breakfast every morning, social happy hour and cookies every night. The rooms are very clean and the beds are comfortable. There is a no smoking rule hotel-wide. The staff will do almost anything to keep the guests happy. However, the elevators (5) are taxed at peak use periods (breakfast and business rush hours) so if the 3 minute wait for the elevator is more important than the service from a dedicated staff, then you might look somewhere else. There is a fitness center and steam room, but no pool. Valet parking is expensive ($26/day), try a nearby garage if you drive here, I will recommend the hotel to all of my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jetsetmd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after checking out of the SpringHill Suites (horrible experience) and absolutely loved it! The rooms were clean and quiet. The breakfast was good and the cookies and milk at night were a plus! The staff was friendly and I will absolutely stay here again if I return to Dallas. I recommend this hotel to all of my coworkers!!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the Magnolia Dallas”
Reviews.Author: walshfam
Reviews.Content: This is the 4th time we have stayed at the downtown Dallas Magnolia and as always we had a great time. Room was clean and well appointed and we got an amazing easter holiday rate. We spent the evening at the bar watching the Masters, playing pool and playing Wii...yes they have a Wii...it was really fun. We had the same funny bartender as our last stay about six months ago. Its a great spot for couples who need a quick getaway for the weekend. Plenty of shopping and dining within walking distance including Neiman Marcus and Iron Cactus where we had lunch. Highly recommend the cookies and milk after an exhausting round of Wii bowling!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: swtchic
Reviews.Content: our stay at this hotel was superb. We got a great deal with their easter special (80.00 / night with a free suite upgrade). The suite (1302) was beautiful. Free wine or beer 5:30 to 6:30 and a cookie and milk bar before bedtime! Nice touch. Only negative (small one at that) is that there is no parking, you must use the valet... but, it's this way in most big cities if you stay downtown, so no suprise! Perfect downtown location! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “It is Aight!”
Reviews.Author: thegreatgetaway
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok, it is not worth the regualr price that the chain charges. I have only stayed at the one that is located in Dallas, i have stayed here twice now. The first time I was extremely disappinted, i expected soemthing so much more and better. Lots of the things in this hotel was not working, out of order, Room service was mediocore (THE FIRST AND THE SECOND TIME). THE SECOND EXPERIENCE HERE WAS PROBABLY 1/2 A NOTCH BETTER. This hotel is no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Comfortable, Casual”
Reviews.Author: Brian Thomas
Reviews.Content: Not just another convention center hotel, the Magnolia is in an older, interesting building that once housed an oil company. The rooms are quiet, comfortable and clean, with very spacious bathrooms. The furnishings aren't the newest and some of the paint needs updating, but in general it has a pleasant feel. Flat screen tv in the rooms and a decent breakfast buffet with hot foods help. I had no luck in getting a wireless signal in my room and so had to go out in the hall with my laptop to connect. The elevators are old, funky, and slow. Free beer and wine and cookies every night establishes a friendly feeling. There are ample free internet terminals available for guests. The gym facility is ok, although the spa was undergoing renovation when I was there. There is a nice steamroom, though.

Reviews.Title: “Okay - But Not Worth The Price”
Reviews.Author: Trixie186
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our one year anniversary and it was sub-par. Definitely not what we would expect for a high-end, highly regarded boutique hotel in the heart of upscale Dallas. We stayed for a romantic weekend getaway that ended up feeling like we were camping out in a cheap apartment rather than a nice hotel. We participated in the pay full in advance and receive 20% off and a suite upgrade special, but the walls of our room were paper thin and you could hear people flushing their toilets and coming in and out of their rooms. The view from our window looked at another window of a dingy building and the bed and sofa were as hard as bricks. Furniture was all cheap, IKEA particle board stuff that felt as if it would fall apart if you sneezed in the room. The shower had stains in it and the tile was not as nice as what you would find in a manufactured home. In addition, the water would not stay hot for the duration of a shower/bath. We experienced some not-so-pleasant lukewarm bathing. Breakfast buffet was simple eggs and fatty sausage served on plates the size of tea saucers and there werenâ€™t enough tables for everyone to sit at so you had to wait until someone got up secure a place to eat your food. We stayed two nights and decided to sleep in past breakfast the next day because it wasnâ€™t worth getting out of bed for. They give you drink coupons as you arrive but they are only good for their one hour daily happy hour so itâ€™s really not that big of a perk unless you are accustomed to using your three drink coupons per person within the 5:30 PM â€“ 6:30 PM time frameâ€¦how convenient, happy hourâ€™s over now so drinks are on you! To top things off, at the end of the trip we had to wait 35 minutes for the valet to return our car! We tried calling the valet from our room in advance but their line was busy for 30 minutes so we decided to just go down and get it. When we got to the lobby it was PACKED full of people waiting for their vehicles. Finally we walked further outside of the circle drive to see what the hold up was and saw our car locked up on the side of the building. We finally flagged down one of the many valets walking around like chickens with their heads cut off and asked if we could please get our keys and he shrugged and came back 10 minutes later with them in hand. All in all, our experience could have been worse but it was NOT what we expected to say the least. Iâ€™d rather stay in a medium-grade Marriot/Hampton Inn than this trendy, over-priced beehive. I still feel like we were ripped off but had we paid anything higher thank we did â€“ i.e. regular price we would be LIVID!

Reviews.Title: “1st Anniversary Getaway”
Reviews.Author: RLVogel
Reviews.Content: I guess that I cannot really complain too much because we were upgraded to a suite (special they were running), but a suite at the Holiday Inn would have been better. Valet is $20.00 per day, and there is no getting a hold of them on Sunday. The suite was anything but. Lights were blown out, furnature is not comfortable, and the bathrooms SUCK! It looks like the owners ran out of money and got the cheapest materials possible. The counters were formica (not stone), the tub was fiberglass (very thin), the shower head was barely attached to the spout. When I turned the shower on, the head blew off so that I had to screw it back on. The hot water ended half way though my shower. It looked like when the tile for the shower was being done, it mixed with the sealant for the tub to mix into a perminant gritty blob that looked like mold. The couches were vinyl. The bed was hard and unconfortable. Because were were in a suite, I assumed that the bedroom would be a little smaller, but it was barely large enough to put a full size bed (not queen). If you get a suite, make sure that you bring your own forks, knives, and spoons. They are not provided. There are no ammenities at the hotel. No spa or pool. The wireless internet had NO connection (and I was on the 6th floor).

Reviews.Title: “I cannot recommend due to AC problems and lack of overall cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: monunn
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate of 99.00 from the hotel's e-newsletter. Although the location was perfect for us to attend a play at the downtown theater, the hotel was less than 4 star. We stayed on the 23rd floor (rm 2321) where the ceiling was exposed we think for repairs on the heating and cooling system. There was a strong smell of paint also. Our room was a standard room, but it was really small. The bedding looked worn, the walls were stained, the furniture was dusty and the bathroom floor was not clean. There was hair on the blinds, the bathroom floor and in the bathtub. Our rooms thermostat we assume was broken because we were freezing the entire time. We asked for help with the thermostat and the front desk gave us instructions, but to no avail. The morning breakfast was sufficient, but being frozen and feeling like we were not clean left us feeling uncomfortable and dissatisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Downtown Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: Fortunatechild
Reviews.Content: We wanted some place special for our honeymoon but needed to stay close to home. We booked a suite at the Magnolia after looking at the property. The hotel is a great value for what you get. We had a large suite, free cocktail hour daily and a cookies and milk buffet at night. Oh, and I can't fail to mention the breakfast buffet! The staff made us feel more than welcome and took good care of us. This is a cool hotel in downtown. Matter of fact, I've booked a room for a romantic Valentine's Day with my husband. I look forward to another stay at the Magnolia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Friendly Staff. We would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: BigEh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on New Years Eve and we had an excellent time. The staff was friendly, the atmosphere was great and the service was awesome. Happy hour, milk and cookie bar and a hot breakfast in the morning are all pluses. The location was great too because we were on foot for the three days we were there.

Reviews.Title: “I want to love it, but...”
Reviews.Author: kufever
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Magnolia - several years apart. I remember it being very chic but comfortable with a warm and friendly staff. Well, I was quite a bit less impressed the second time around. Check-in was quick and informative, very friendly staff. Upon entering my room (26th floor corner) I noticed the carpet outside the bathroom was soaked. I called guest services who told me the previous guest had run the water over in the bathroom and the carpet had not dried. When I asked for a new room, they were unable to provide it because they were booked. They brought extra bathmats to put over the wet carpet. Not exactly a great fix, but it was better than nothing. Beyond that problem, there were two light bulbs out, a huge tear in the bed cover and the floor tile and bases were all dirty. It just doesn't seem that they are keeping this place clean. Everything feels really used and banged up. I was put into a suite for my second nights stay and the staff was very friendly and helpful about everything. It really is a shame they aren't keeping it clean and pristine, the way a hotel should be. Breakfast and cookies/milk are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “The Magnolia ROCKS!”
Reviews.Author: MississippiRenita
Reviews.Content: This was our second opportunity to stay at the Magnolia. As Ole Miss fans, this was a ballgame trip to the Cotton Bowl. We had three rooms, and we were all delighted. I love the free hot breakfast, the cookie bar, and the beds are so comfy. We had a suite, and I loved having a full size frig and microwave. Everyone here is so nice and accommodating. This is so different than staying in a big box hotel. They truly do try to make your stay special. Whenever we have an opportunity to stay in Dallas, this will be our home. Can't wait to go back! Hotty Toddy!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel with nice touches...”
Reviews.Author: Christian_London_UK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Magnolia with my girlfriend for three nights recently and we had a fantastic time. The location is excellent, within walking distance of everything that we wanted to see and do in Dallas. The rooms are spotlessly clean and the whole hotel is very well presented. I believe that the other reviews quoting slow elevators and old style TVs are unfair - even though the elevators are quite slow and the TVs are not flatscreens, that does not take away from the fact that everything works properly, the beds and couches are comfortable, the rooms large, the staff helpful and very friendly... we were treated like old friends and I'd never been there before! Not to mention the extra little nice touches such as complimentary drinks at the bar during happy hour, free fresh cookies and milk every evening from 8pm, complimentary breakfast in the mornings and free wireless internet. I would definitely stay at the Magnolia again.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Value”
Reviews.Author: Reddon14
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Magnolia and I was thoroughly impressed. I was a little hesitant after reading some of the previous reviews, but I have to say the Magnolia exceeded all my expectations. Check-in and Check-out were a breeze (only a few short minutes each time). The room, two double beds on the 22nd floor, was well kept with lots of character. The bed and duvet covers were quite comfortable and caused me to sleep in past breakfast several times. The layout was a little different than a typical room however it was still very practical. The only thing I would have liked to see different in my room was a newer TV. The TV's are a little older with only average picture quality and channel options. The free hot breakfast was better than most 'free' breakfasts. It was a little different every day but consisted mainly of eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, hashbrowns, toast, bagels, yogurts, milk, juice and starbucks coffee. There was more than enough to choose from and more than enough to go around. The second level lounge has great atmosphere and a great 'free' cocktail hour. It is well decorated and offers numerous couches/lounges, free pool table, free nintendo wii, and great company. The bar staff were quite friendly and one in particular 'Bishop' pours a great drink. The milk and cookie time is another great perk of the Magnolia. The assortment of fresh baked cookies were complimented with white milk, chocolate milk, or coffee. The valet service, which has been heavily criticized definitely seemed like a bit of a cluster. We rented a vehicle for our stay in Dallas but chose to self park instead of using the valet service. Valet is about $22 a day however for less than half the price (about $8/day) you can park your own car in the same parkade the valet uses. The parkade is about 1 block away but an easy safe walk from the hotel. It was quite comical to see the valet drivers sprinting back and forth from the parkade numerous times a day. Another critique of the hotel, the elevators, never seemed to be a problem for us. Although we stayed on the 22nd floor we never had to wait more than 2 minutes for a ride. A small price to pay for staying at such a beautiful hotel. The only pitfall of this hotel that I found was the food. There is no 'official' restaurant on site however a limited amount of food items can be purchased through room service or on the level 2 lounge. We did however become quite fond of the Iron Cactus Restaurant which is located right next to the hotel. Great food for great value. Although Downtown Nightlife seemed a little quiet, everything is a short cab ride away and there were always plenty of cab drivers willing to give you a ride.

Reviews.Title: “Oops! I used to LOVE this place!”
Reviews.Author: TimTheTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed Fri,and Sat. after Thanksgiving. This was our third or fourth visit to the Magnolia. We have always been impressed by the fact that front desk remembered us from previous visits. The woman at the front desk this time was having trouble remembering what year it was. She asked us if it was our first visit and if we would like a higher or lower floor. We had already expressed our preferences when we made our reservations. Our room was small,on the 23rd floor. It was right by the elevators,which proved to be a major problem. It was so loud,I kept dreaming I was at a train station all night. So,the major problem happened at the breakfast buffet on Saturday morning. There was no food! All these people are standing around the steam tables holding their plates. The restaurant was filthy,not a clean table anywhere. I called the desk from my cell told the same front desk woman there was a major problem in the restaurant and I needed to speak to the manager. She said the manager was at the restaurant and would call me back. The staff kept saying food was coming,but it showed one thing at a time,eggs showed,then potatoes,etc. These small dishes were shared by the 50 or so people waiting. If the manger was there,why was she not apologizing for this horrible breakfast? I was contacted by the manager who told me they were undergoing renovations and had no kitchen. They had to make breakfast in a room. They should have just cancelled it. I had to be somewhere and it was really frustrating. The manager acted like I was an [--] or something for demanding something I had paid for,like THEY were the ones inconvinienced. She sent some drink tickets to the room for the FREE happy hour. I used to really like this hotel,I was very disappointed this visit and may not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Extra Fees”
Reviews.Author: Chiefmizer
Reviews.Content: Room was nice and quiet but extra fees were high. Parking runs $22 a day + 1.23 tax. My room was $109, taxes and parking made it $149.50 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't wow me”
Reviews.Author: DallasSunGoddess
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1) Great location in downtown Dallas 2) Comfortable bed; great pillows Cons: 1) We had 3 people staying in our room. When I asked for an extra room key other than the one that was issued, the front desk clerk told me that they were all out of extra keys. 2) The elevators are incredibly slow. 3) The hotel room was tiny. 4) At the breakfast, there were breakfast potatoes and bacon but NO SCRAMBLED EGGS!!!!! 5) Dine-in room service took AN HOUR to come up. 6) Make sure you call ahead for your valet. Otherwise, you will wait a half hour for your car. 7) There is no pool at this hotel and the jacuzzi was out of order. 8) There was no HBO or premium movie channel. Bottom-line, this is a great hotel to stay if you plan on just sleeping here. But if the hotel-experience is important to you, then look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed with the Magnolia”
Reviews.Author: Saj1Houston
Reviews.Content: Maybe our expectations were too high, but we expected a top of the line, swanky downtown hotel. What we got was a hotel with carpet that really needs replacing, scratches all over the paint, a really small, old style t.v., cheap formica countertops and a room that was way too bright in the morning due to the lack of curtains (they had cheap blinds that you get at your corner Home Depot). The Magnolia really needs to invest in this property.

Reviews.Title: “Big Expectations - Mild Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: SLYCAST
Reviews.Content: I had a very good experience at the Denver Magnolia and since this hotel is a renovated National Register Landmark - the old Magnolia Oil Co. building, I was really excited about my stay. Securing a non-smoking room is a high priority for me and when my secretary booked my room, she was assured by the reservations desk that all Dallas hotels are totally non-smoking. When I arrived at the hotel, it took a while to find the front door because the hotel driveway is hidden off of the street. The lobby is small and tries to be chic but doesnâ€™t capture the grandeur or historic nature of the building. The original elevators, although charming, are small and slow. I carted my own luggage to my room and to my surprise, one of the maintenance men joined us on the elevator with a large cart loaded with equipment; it was really cramped in there. This class of hotel should have a separate elevator for the hotel maintenance staff. My assigned room was a huge suite with 12 foot ceilings, but the dÃ©cor was bland and there were obvious signs of wear. Almost immediately, I noticed a strong, disgusting cigarette smoke smell in the bathroom area. Unfortunately, my schedule was so tight that I didnâ€™t have time to run downstairs and try to secure another room. Also, since check-in took so long, I could not take advantage of the complimentary drinks that are served to guests (it closes at 6:30 pm). The bed was not comfortable (too hard) and even on the 11th floor, the shades must be drawn (over the blinds) to avoid the city lights and street noise from keeping you up all night. I did thoroughly enjoy the complimentary hot breakfast that is offered. The only other positive about my stay is that all members of the staff that I encountered were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!!! Great Service for a Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: bonnieserrano
Reviews.Content: When it comes to booking a hotel, I look for somethig really nice no matter the price. I needed to get away from Houston because of the situation with Gustav hurricane. My husband was out of town and I needed a safe place for myself and my three children (all under 13). I booked at Magnolia Hotel because the pics in the website of the room looked impressive and the price was above my expectation. Upon my arrival, we were all "wowed"!!. The view was so glamourous with the blue night lights and it had a wonderful view of a waterfall wall feature. I requested Valet because there is really no other option when you get a hotel in downtown. That's pretty self explainatory. The valet gentleman was very geneours and requested to send my luggage to my room. I checked in quickly and was impressed with the beautiful decor!! Wow.. I thought it was very unique. The elevators have this cool feeling of antique flavor that my kids loved it. Our room had a great view and the the layout of the room was definately something different I never saw before. The decor of the room and the colors were absolutely gorgeous. My kids loved it as well. Then, the breakfast, OMG, was the best I've ever had. I've stayed in other hotels allot more expensive, three times the price and I've never had such a glamrous breakfast. The area of the breakfast is more of a lounge area with fancy decor and top of the line modern furniture. Really unique and my kids loved it. The breakfast was complimentary and that really impressed me. You get eggs, ham and potatoes and starbucks coffee! yeh. Overall, what can I say, I told my husband we have to plan a trip to Dallas just to stay at the Magnolia Hotel. Keep up the good work. The price for the service, you can't get that anywhere else. IF you plan to go to San Antonio, you pay three times that price and you don't get the same. Trust me on this. :o)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: karenandkirby
Reviews.Content: We were in Dallas for a trade show which had negotiated rates with the Magnolia for delegates. The hotel is quite nice, upscale-ish lobby with marble touches. We stayed on the 11th floor and had no issues with the room whatsoever. We stayed from Thur to Sun nights and did not enounter any street noise however in the room there was the constant hum of the a/c which we were unable to adjust. It was noticable at first but over time we became used to it, and it did not interfere with getting a good night's rest. This may be because the king bed was extremely comfortable with oversized fluffy pillows. The bathroom was very nice also, large oval shaped tub (no jets) with shower, modern vanity and tile floor. The hotel offers complimentary drinks & appetizers but unfortunately we were unable to make it during the times offered. We did however visit the lounge on the 2nd floor several times and got to know one of the bartenders (John) who was great fun. There is no restaurant but you can food in the lounge or room service. Starbucks in the lobby if you miss the complimentary continental b'fast. Just out the door there is the Iron Cactus restaurant which is also pretty good. Its about a 10min walk to the convention centre so we would not hesitate to stay here again for the same type of trip. Unfortunately downtown Dallas does not have much to offer for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but probably won't go back”
Reviews.Author: spstarla
Reviews.Content: Overall I liked this place; however, there were some issues. I will list them below: Good stuff: * Great location, beautiful old hotel, wonderful views of Dallas * Service was very friendly, pretty helpful * Cookies and milk! Yessss! * Good (and free) breakfast * Starbucks downstairs * Free drinks between 5:30-6:30 - wish it were a bit longer though. * The room was very cute and clean (water stain on ceiling but it didn't bother me), loved the huge shower. The hallways were like something out of the 1920s, very detective mystery-ish. Negatives: * No free internet?!? I can get that at Holiday Inn Express! $9.95 charge.... :( * No ice machine on floor - had to go to the CREEPY 25th floor for ice - just one strange little room with exposed pipes, a coke machine, and some washing machines. So wierd. * Those elevators are cool & authentic - but very slow - and when you're running late to check out the last think you need is slowwwww elevators! Allow at least 20 minutes to get downstairs, no kidding - if it's close to checkout time those slow elevators are also FULL of other people trying to get down to check out. * No parking at all! And valet parking is $22 per night! Wow wish I'd been told about this before I got there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place...Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: superroadtripper
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Magnolia for 5 nights in August along with three other co-workers for a conference. As soon as you walk into the Magnolia, you're impressed. It has a small boutique type hotel feel, althought it is large with approximately 20 floors. It has a art-deco style decor. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. There is a shuttle service for guests that will drive you within a 3 mile radius of the hotel. It's best to book ahead, as sometimes the service was not available. They could use an extra shuttle. The staff also recommended several restaurants which was very helpful....just ask the front desk staff, they have sample menus. The rooms are cozy with high ceilings and the bed is wonderful with nice sheets. I could at times hear my neighbour flush the toilet, but other than that the hotel was very quiet. The room was very clean. There is a happy hour as previously mentioned, but we found there was a lack of variety when it came to the drinks that were included in the happy hour. There is also milk and cookies at night, which is a nice touch. The location of this hotel is in their "business district" however there is a homeless shelter nearby and there are alot of street people around the hotel. The security system for the hotel was card only access to avoid non-guests from entering. We did not feel comfortable walking in this area at night, so we often used the shuttle service. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not good but not bad”
Reviews.Author: MsLea
Reviews.Content: We booked online thru the hotel's website and printed the confirmation. But there was no record of it when we showed up. Fortunately there were other rooms available. There is a fee for the internet service. I had called and asked and was told it was free. With a little pushing they did give me a day for free. I was also told there was a shuttle service that would take us anywhere within a 2 mile radius of the hotel. What they didn't tell me over the phone was that it was only until 5pm. The elevators were slow and the stairs closed for a private party. And the valet took us 20 minutes to get our car. The room was spacious, clean and quiet. And the location convenient to our destintation in Dallas. Although not terrible, I would probably try a different hotel next time. I just felt that I had been lied to at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but lacking”
Reviews.Author: TXWV
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this hotel and had wanted to stay here for sometime. The lobby is beautifully decorated and the continential breakfast is better than others but- there is one thing you should know... The rooms are not sound proof. When your neighbor flushes the commode or takes a shower - you hear it! All night long!! The valet entry is a little odd to find- but we had no complaints and only circled the block once. There is an Iron Cactus within walking distance that has great food and drinks. The rooms were nice- but just very loud!

Reviews.Title: “Stuck in elevator”
Reviews.Author: j2jranch
Reviews.Content: My 70-year young mother and I stayed at Magnolia over Memorial Day weekend as a mother-daughter holiday. We were not informed that the club level was under construction and everything was moved to the rather bland 3rd floor. They need to do some decorating to make it warm and inviting. The area for breakfast, reception, and cookies is bare and cold. Also, I got stuck in elevator #2 for about 30 minutes. The response that I received when I pressed the emergency call button was "no answer"! I couldn't believe it. I pressed the alarm button that rings continuously and no response either. I resorted to banging on the elevator door with a flat hand and yelling at the top of my lungs for someone to get me out. It took 10 minutes before anyone finally found out that I was stuck. I also hurt my hand slapping on the elevator door so hard. They seriously need to make sure that the call system works properly so that no one else will have to experience this. It was awful and put a damper on our short vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: lacrema
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Magnolia for a Saturday night while we were in Dallas. Our experience was wonderful and I would definitely go back. The free continental breakfast is delicious and has quite a variety. The milk and cookies were just perfect. Our room was comfortable and clean. I think it is worth the price. Definitely call ahead for valet parking pick up, it can take a while. The hotel itself is cozy and in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Breakfast at the Magnolia!”
Reviews.Author: MugHarrington
Reviews.Content: The complimentary Contential Breakfast was one of the best ever. Plenty of food and a yummy variety were served. Also, I enjoyed the complimentary wine and beer service in the afternoon. The hotel is easy to spot from a distance (the Pegasus on top of the hotel) but in rush hour traffic, with all the distractions, it could use improved signage at street/eye level. The main entrance to the hotel lobby and valet parking is not that evident. Valet parking attendents were quick to retrieve my car and printed out directions to my destination so that I could aviod construction on the freeway. Other than needing better signage, it was great. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: conHoustonTx
Reviews.Content: Rooms looked very worn. First suite we were given the sofa was stained, the pillows on the sofa and bed were stained. There were black hand prints on the wall.The floors in the bathroom & kitchen looked filthy. We requested another suite, and the second one was better...........but still looked very worn..........The hotel needs some serious upgrading, especially for the price! We will not stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “If you need to be downtown”
Reviews.Author: bigbaldjohnny
Reviews.Content: I showed up early - like 8AM. They got my room and I stashed my rent-a-car with the valet and was off to the office by 8:30. Over the past several weeks I've stayed in a suite and a couple different rooms here. All were reasonably appointed ,clean and comforable. while the building was old, the plumbing worked great and the bath was larger than most for this class of hotel. On the bright side the place is decorated in modern natural tones. I found myself looking forward to cookie hour in the evening. I never got back early enough to enjoy cocktail hour. The downers include slow elevators at peak times, lower floors suffer from excessive street noise, TV's need to be updated to flat panels. Why is it the remote is always slow? If you are stuck without a car in downtown Dallas, the choices in the evening near the hotel are limited in walking distance. I've seen a lot of mixed review but, overall, for my needs these few weeks the Magnilia was a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Won't make that mistake again!”
Reviews.Author: auberjunois
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a room at the Magnolia Hotel in Downtown Dallas for one night with the intention of having a night of relaxation and peace and quiet away from the kids. When we got to our room which was right next to the elevator, you could actually hear the elevators moving up and down the shaft over the television. We waited for about an hour to see if it would get better and the noise only got worse. We decided to switch rooms and the front desk said they made a mistake and put us in the "ROAR" room. So we moved down to the 7th floor and stayed in a room right above the Iron Cactus restaurant. It was like New Orleans style partying outside until 2am when the bars finally closed! Apparently all the sound travels up when you are between the large skyscrapers and so we got ZERO sleep. Then about 3am some guy had some kind of drug induced fit out on the sidewalk below the hotel and we had to listen to him screaming, thrashing around, and fighting off demons for 30 minutes. This was the most entertaining part of our stay. No cops ever showed up. We finally drifted off to sleep around 4am and when we woke up at 9am, we quickly packed our things and got the HELL OUT OF THERE! I would have gotten more rest and relaxation at home with my screaming 2 yr old.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Alissa C
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business conference and it was wonderful!It's in the heart of downtown Dallas, although I didn't get a chance to get out and explore the area, I do know that it's right down the street from the Neiman Marcus flagship store. My room was on the 22nd floor, and was amazingly appointed, with 2 queen beds (very comfy!), a desk, and huge closet and bathroom! They have a great continental breakfast, complimentary happy hour and cookies and milk buffet in the evening. They were very helpful with holding luggage before and after check-in/out. The valets were so friendly and helpful in securing a cab and driver service. There is a self-service laundry area which was just great. The elevators are a bit erratic, but it's just part of the hotel's charm!

Reviews.Title: “No cookies, terrible service”
Reviews.Author: LaurenHouston_TX
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Magnolia two years ago and wasn't very impressed by the service, but this trip was forced to stay there due to no vacancies in the other convention hotels. The room was dirty especially the bathroom. The valet takes an hour to get your car. They have a "cookie hour" but ran out of cookies after ten minutes and didn't get any more. The Starbucks on site wasn't open at the time they state on the door. Overall, a terrible experience. I went home to find that I was charged $2.70 for laundry starch; when I called to say that I had no laundry done while there, I had to deal with a surly employee and am still waiting for my refund. I'll never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “So So”
Reviews.Author: Funciliscious
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of Dallas. It definitely has a lot of charm. We went for a weekend getaway, and it was great to actually see the place. The hotel architecture and structure is truly inspiring, but the decor is a little HD Expo. But it had coiffered ceilings, the Pegasus, and 5 working elevators from 1901. The bathrooms are minimalist with almost medium hot water, the drainstop did not work, so I had to rush through my bath while the water trickled out! And the phone was a pain and there was a charge to make local calls. But absolutely loved seeing the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: houstongv
Reviews.Content: I booked the Magnolia while attending a conference at a nearby hotel, but wanted to stay somewhere aside from the conference for a little more relaxation. The service at the Magnolia Dallas was the best I've ever received - we were always greeted pleasantly every time we left or entered the hotel. We were on a first name basis with some of the staff by the time we checked out (which is rare at most places). Everyone was so courteous and super helpful. They offered free shuttle service, which I took advantage of a few times. The nightly milk and cookies in the hotel bar were a cute touch, as was the complimentary happy hour for guests. The room was nice and comfortable. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value For Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Dallas2Raleigh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 nights in September and had a front facing room. The location was superb for visiting the art museum, the 6th floor museum and only a couple of blocks from Akard DART station to travel further afield. My room was generously sized, spotlessly clean and had a spacious and modern styled bathroom. I had read the reviews about the elevators, but never once did I have to wait for an elevator, nor did I find them slow - I did notice an apology inside though! The staff were friendly, if a little harrassed. On my last night I ordered room service as there's not a lot of restaurants in the locality that are open in the evening. The room service was fast and also good value. I also saw a convience store across the street if you forget anything. Each morning I went to Starbucks in the lobby, it was so handy to get a latte right there in the hotel in the morning. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you want to stay downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: BravesFan64
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Magnolia last week for two nights while in Dallas for an awards presentation. We checked in early and were given a room with 2 double beds - the room was not booked by us and we would have preferred a king bed. We then noticed a humming noise coming from the air conditioner and called the front desk about it. They offered to move us and we asked if we could have a room with a king bed. Before we even had time to re-pack, a maintenance worker arrived and was able to fix the noise very quickly. We still opted to move and the room must have been an upgrade. While the 1st room was nice, the 2nd one was much bigger and even had 2 showers and 2 sinks. The staff at the Magnolia was excellent. We were treated very well by everyone - the front desk, valet, and bar staff. One guest at the table next to us noted to a hotel staff member that she would like to have a crunchy snack with her complimentary drink during the hotel's hospitality hour and within minutes we all had snacks on our tables. We would definitely recommend the Magnolia.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Cardinals1970
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a couple of days and wanted to stay downtown. I chose the Magnolia Hotel. I was impressed with the hotel overall. It is an old historic building with lots of charm and has been renovated recently. The beds are comfortable and plush. The milk and cookies in the evening was a nice touch. Only thing I was not impressed with was the PM front desk staff. The two girls were fairly new and not fully trained. I enjoyed my stay and would stay again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet stay at the Magnolia”
Reviews.Author: amywnla
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and my six year old son in August. We were in town for the Great American Truck Show that was being held in the Dallas Convention Center. We could easily walk to ithe show in less than 15 minutes. Upon arrival, the kind lady at the front desk upgraded us to a suite when I requested a room higher than the original 12th floor option.
