I've stayed in downtown Dallas (at several different hotels) and many times during the weekend it can be quite noisy at night (ex: people on the streets and cars). We were more than pleased with our suite (with full kitchen and spacious interior) on the 21st floor. There was a huge, long wall with tall windows, so the view was amazing. The couch was not in the best condition, but everything else was fine. My son loved the blue liquid soap, so I requested more from the front desk. To his delight, they quickly sent up at least 12 bottles. There is a Starbucks in the hotel, but it closes by midafteroon on the weekends. The valet guys were very efficient and helpful. They gave us wonderful directions to the nearby Dallas Zoo and even asked us the next day if we had enjoyed our trip there. The area around the hotel seems safe at night. We felt comfortable enough to walk to a restaurant (The Dakota - you ride a glass elevator down to the dining area) at night. The original Neimen Marcus is next door to the hotel, so it was fun to just go and look. We all enjoyed the milk and yummy cookies that were served in the lounge each night. Overall, the staff and the hotel made for a sweet stay in downtown Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “The Magnolia wilted”
Reviews.Author: Brown_Cao
Reviews.Content: Particulars: * Second time to stay at hotel * Booked suite - separate living area and kitchen * Stay during TX-OU weekend (big college football game during the first weekend of October) - Friday thru Sunday * Received 14-day advanced booking promotional rate of about $260USD per night from hotel website Complaints: * Carpet stained, worn * Cleaniness lacking, especially in bathroom - floors appeared dirty, prior guest hair in bathtub drain and on floor * Thin pillows * Phone in living area didn't work correctly - intermittant dial tone * Room service order incorrect - ordered salad with dressing on side...received no dressing; ordered wrap with no onions...received onions Compliments: * Location, location, location! Very close to DART light-rail line which can take you to many locations. * Complimentary milk and cookie service - soft, chewy cookies, yum! * Complimentary continental breakfast - bagels, coffee, tea, juices, muffins...not bad! * Kitchen, although not used by me, appeared to be well equipped for preparing meals--pots, pans, dinnerware, full-size fridge, microwave, stovetop * Considering it was in the middle of downtown Dallas, my room was quiet Conclusion: Unless The Magnolia has a really great rate deal, I will not stay here again. The fact that some things were not clean leads me to the conclusion that their quality control may be a little too lax for my standards. Granted, most homes aren't the picture of cleanliness, but when you stay at a hotel, you expect a little more attention to detail. Next time I am in the Dallas area, I will look for another hotel to stay at. With the extension of the DART rail-line, it is possible to stay at hotels outside the Downtown area and still be able to get around without an automobile.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a positve exoerience”
Reviews.Author: churchmouse
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Magnolia Hotel. Check in went very smooth. Our room was extremely spacious, clean, and comfortable. The only negative we experienced was road noise. I could not believe we could hear it from 20 floors up! Take your earplugs and go experience a historic, yet modern hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Jury is still out regarding this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Destind40
Reviews.Content: We stayed here June29/30, 2007. At first we were offered a room on the 12th floor, but asked for a higher one. This was then 'bettered' by a room on the 14th floor. I asked the lady if it had a good view of the city and she said it should. Needless to say, we were looking straight at the side of the other hotel beside it... although it did have some impressive gargoyles on it's structure..lol Double bed room was quite small compared to others we've stayed in. The carpet (I couldn't help but notice) was quite worn and the a/c was loud. Luckily it was at the w/e, so there wasn't much traffic noise to deal with but you could still hear it (I used my earplugs this weekend). For $89, it was nothing to complain about and we aren't the type of travellers who spend the whole time in the room. Although we were in the downtown area (note: majority of stores, cafes, etc. within a short distance are closed), walking to the other tourist areas was easy, eg, 6th Floor Museum, JFK Memorial, Deep Ellum, Uptown (with its vast array of restaurants/cafes). Next time, we'll try a different location/hotel. Not too impressed with this Magnolia.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, elegant and quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: silverthief2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel August 9-11 for an event held at the hotel. The front desk allowed us to check in when we arrived at about 12:30 p.m. - probably because it was a very quiet weekend and there weren't too many guests in the hotel. Our room was on the 7th floor - 709, and it was beautiful! Great bed, a good desk where you could actually work, and everything was modern and in good condition. The best thing, though, was the view; we had six (!!!) windows on three sides of the room, so try to get a room like this if you like views and natural light. The wifi was somewhat spotty but we managed okay, had to go down to the second floor to use the business center (which is just one PC) a couple of times. The common areas of the hotel were nice and very quiet - again, probably because there weren't many guests around while we visited. Gym was way nice for a hotel gym: very big, well stocked with towels and water, and quiet both times that I went. The elevators were a bit slow but not too bad, at least for us as we only had to go up to the 7th floor. The surrounding area was completely dead by mid-afternoon and was very deserted on Saturday, so be advised that you will have to go elsewhere for restaurants, nightlife, etc. There is a Neiman Marcus just down the street, however. At least there is a big Starbucks right on the ground floor. I would stay there again if I return to Dallas, but would probably bring a car to get around more easily.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Service was Lacking”
Reviews.Author: dml0704
Reviews.Content: Earlier this year, I spend a week at the Magnolia for a conference and then tacking on a few days for fun. The hotel is beautiful and we enjoyed reading all about the history of the building. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite with a kitchen which was a corner room. The bed was very comfortable. The bedroom furniture and linens were great. The living couch and chair need to be replaced. The bathroom was large and well appointed. The kitchen had all the essentials and everything worked well. There were a ton of windows for great light and I found it very quiet. I do not think I saw anyone esle on my floor. The room service has a limited menu and is not available 24 hours -- and just an FYI -- most restaurants in the area close very early as you are in the downtown business district. The location of the hotel is great -- close to mass transit and alot of the tourist stuff as well. My family was able to walk most anywhere during the day. At night, this area is deserted (as it is the business district) not at all like downtown Chicago or DC. This area is also going through a lot of redevelopment of the high rises so there is a lot of construction which makes the area alittle disconcerting at night. My only disappoint was consistently with the service. We arrived late --after 11pm --due to flight delays and check in took over 45 minutes! The reason for the delay is that even though they took my ID to locate our reservation -- they proceeded to check me in as someone else! When I went to sign the paperwork I noticed that we did not have the right daily cost per night nor did I have a reservation for the right number of nights. Therefore, we had to start all over with the check-in process. Other issues were with customer service when we asked for extra towels it took 2 hours and 2 phone calls to receive them. This also happened with a request for an ironing board and even room service took much longer than we were told. The hotel does not have a conceirge regardless of what they say. We could not get reccomendations to restaurants nor could we even get directions to well known locations -- one theater was literally 2 blocks away and noboby could say how to get there! We also asked where a grocery store and laundry services were located and nobody could tell me. It turns out there are laundry room in the hotel but no one could tell me that. Overall I would say this is a beautiful hotel and as long as you dont need any guidance or questions answered would be a quiet and relaxing place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Allow extra time for the charming elevator rides”
Reviews.Author: Have_fun_will_travel
Reviews.Content: Built in the early 1900s, this boutique hotel will charm you immediately. But ... If you're in a hurry, you'll likely grow weary of the antiquated elevators. Upper-level guests may at first feel lucky (as I did) to actually GET an elevator -- after a lengthy wait -- in the morning. But, consider this typical scenario: an overly crowded elevator stops on every ... single ... floor. You watch as the doors open, and disappointed/disbelieving guests look on hopelessly. I heard a few people say they grew so tired they walked 10 or more flights of stairs ... WITH their luggage. All the charm and friendly service in the world can't surmount the inconvenience of these woefully outdated elevators. The strangers I befriended on one lengthy ride all said they planned to stay elsewhere next time they're in town. Me, too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and charming tower of terror!”
Reviews.Author: cougarBrent
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and elegant and the rooms are well appointed. The location was great, just a few blocks from the MARTA- mass transit train. Starbucks in the building on the ground floor is very conveinient for coffe fans. My only negative remark would be the fear of impending death on the elevators. They are slow and noisy and we got stuck between floors for five minutes and the sounds from the elevator shaft where chilling as we said our prayers hoping to make it off alive. Dont ride in the 3rd elevator cab unless you like to defy death.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy stay at Magnolia!”
Reviews.Author: funtravl
Reviews.Content: Great hotel recommendation for Downtown Dallas area! Hotel still seems newly renovated with modern styles & architecture. Cozy & spacious rooms with a very plush feeling. For those who want to be pampered at a moderate price, this hotel is for you. Didn't get to sample any foods, but the stay was memorable. Romantic feel! A++

Reviews.Title: “One of My Favorites”
Reviews.Author: askeddie
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a tradeshow and stayed here. This has to be one of my favorite places. It is a historic building, yet they have managed to renovate everything I layed eyes on. Upon entering, you are greeted by young and smiling bellhops and as you step into the stylish lobby you can smell a nice aroma. This scent follows you every where you go. Spectacular, clean, great scented, spacious rooms, roman tubs, and my room on the 23rd floor had an awesome view.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: TexasPlowboy
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on ratings and virtual tour. We asked for high room, when we got there at 4:00PM we were told all the rooms with good views were already filled. We were put in a room above the 15th floor but it was next to the elevators and the noise from them was intolerable. We requested a quiet room and were moved to a lower floor, away from the elevator. This was close enough to the street that the street noise could now be heard. Being too tired to move again we gave up and stayed where we were. The noise finally died down and we were able to get some sleep. The bed at least was comfortable, and the sheets, although the fitted sheet was inside out, were clean. The continental breakfast didn't look good, eggs appeared under cooked and the sausage over cooked. We checked out sooner than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Linzy757
Reviews.Content: My co-workers and I stayed at the Magnolia during a business trip. The hotel upgraded us free of charge. They put us on the 11th floor in beautiful and spacious suites. Very clean, convenient and comfortable. Suites are ideal for long visits.

Reviews.Title: “Nifty historic property!”
Reviews.Author: BootsCAT
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia was a convention hotel choice in March 2007. It's situated in downtown Dallas - lots of nifty Art Nouveau buildings nearby. This was the old Magnolia Oil building. The elevator lobby is gorgeous - old lamps and the flying Pegasus logos on the elevators. There is a little sign in each elevator (holds 8, but is roomy) to please be patient with their quirks. They were quite the modern conveyance when installed over 100 years ago! The Adolphus Hotel is just across the street - peek in and see the lobby! The original Neiman-Marcus store is just up the block (great lunch cafeteria), and the Urban Market is wonderful for snacks and water. Don't miss the Art Nouveau stained glass on the Joseph Banks store across the street - wonderful scene of Thor handing down electricity to the world. Thomas Edison is a gargoyle on that building! The Starbucks in the lobby is very handy. PROS: Hotel was basically full. I had a single queen room on the 19th floor. Elevator service was average to speedy. The halls were extremely quiet. Nice leather easy chair, wonderful big bathroom with drawers and a nice cabinet, large work desk, free fridge, lots of big windows and a nice view of the old Art Nouveau buildings. Staff was friendly and courteous - both front desk and bell staff. Room service was amazing. I ordered a wedge salad and a cheese BLT. It was $17 - with an additional tip!! The meal was huge. Homemade - warm! - cookies before bed in the lounge were a treat each night. Big closet - with a light inside - and the full length (large) mirror were a help. A light in the shower was also nice. CONS: The bedding wasn't at all what I expected. My sheets didn't quite fit the bed, and they had been washed so many times they felt threadbare. The top sheet had two small holes in it, in fact. The pillows were small and flat - I used three of them to sleep on. They were clean, but they were never changed in the three nights I was there. The bathtub is designed so that the water flows out freely onto the floor during a shower. Be prepared to mop up! The drawers are small and slim - no room for large items. The internet wireless was cranky, but it did work each day. Overall, I would definitely stay here again for a good price - but I would ask for different sheets. I had a relaxing few days!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice downtown property”
Reviews.Author: PrincessEthel
Reviews.Content: We spent a lovely, relaxing weekend at the Magnolia. Our room was on the 18th floor which gave a great view of the city. The room was nicely appointed and very comfortable. Don't miss the evening happy hour and milk and cookies! The staff were all very friendly and helpful. We had a great experience at the Magnolia and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown at your doorstep”
Reviews.Author: MrBunny
Reviews.Content: I went to Dallas on business, and stayed at the Magnolia to explore the downtown area. ROOMS: Comfortable, clean inside. The windows needed a good washing, however. (We stayed in the upper floors). LOCATION: Perfect for exploring. You are close to the JFK historical sites and within walking distance to the central attractions. PARKING: Not the greatest for public parking due to lack of space----you pretty much need to use the valets, but that was fine. CUSTOMER SERVICE: Easy check in, easy check out. The lobby seemed huge, so I imagine this hotel gets busy for weddings and business functions. RESTAURANTS: Behind the hotel is the Iron Cactus--Mexican and Southwest food. Excellent choice. This hotel is in the heart of downtown, but we felt pretty safe walking around at night. We observed a lot of nightlife for the younger crowd at some of the local clubs. If you want to experience metropolitan Dallas, this is a fine choice.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: pd20
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a convention because it was recommended by our convention coordinator. For a 4-star hotel, it did not quite meet my expectations. The rooms were small and amenties such as coffee, etc were sparse. There was a coffee maker with coffee but no creamer or sugar and we had to move it to find a place to plug it in. It was on a shelf in the closet. The small refrigerator in the closet was nice though. The shower made so much noice when you turned it on I thought the pipes would burst through the walls. Not quite what I expected for this level of hotel. The shuttle service that was promised was basicly non-existent, unless you wanted to walk 2-3 blocks to the Adolphus to be picked up. The front desk was nice and helpful. Overall, this hotel was nice and clean, but for the price, I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with the Magnolia”
Reviews.Author: KSLawDawg
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for my step-brother's wedding. I had never heard of this hotel and I'm glad I was introduced. The hotel is an older structure but tastefully updated. The rooms were average size but the bathrooms were much larger than average. The beds were very comfortable and the entire hotel was very clean. The hotel offers a very limited breakfast (mostly just breads) but offered made-from-scratch cookies and milk at night. Parking is extremely limited in downtown Dallas and the hotel provides valet parking ($20 daily) which is worth every penny. Staff was friendly and very helpful. There is a Starbucks attached to the hotel and access is easy. We had a wonderful stay and hope to vist the Magnolia again. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: Soccer24
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time staying at the Magnolia in downtown Dallas and I LOVE it! I have had GREAT service both times i've been. The bell hops and the shuttle driver were great and when we called housekeeping for extra blankets and pillows they brought them right up. My stay was in July of 05 and July of 06. I love the Iron Cactus restaurant right next door and also the Urban Market down the street. Our room had a kitchen in it so every day we cooked our breakfast there and just grabbed a yogurt from the continental breakfast at the hotel. One time we paid for an omelet breakfast which was good. The only thing I was bummed about is no pool, but they told us we can use the one at a place across the street. We went across the street and you have to walk through a restaurant to get to the pool so it wasn't ideal. I was impressed with the area around the hotel it was very clean and good walking distance to a couple of fabulous restaurants...tex mex and italian, a grocery store and the convention center and I LOVED having the starbucks downstairs. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “The Magnolia - Stylish, Classy, Comfy”
Reviews.Author: MusicalTravel
Reviews.Content: I was in Dallas for the Gospel Music Workshop of America convention which drew about 50K people to the Dallas area. I had a contract with the hotel through the sales office for a large quantity of rooms. The hotel was ALWAYS helpful with the changes that I made and the staff was more than willing to aid me at every turn. When I finally arrived at the hotel after a year of contact with the staff I was pleasantly surprised to find that the hotel pictures I'd seen online in multiple places were WELL REPRESENTED in reality. The hotel is very stylish and the decor is sweet! Upon check-in the staff were friendly, helpful, and prompt in getting me in my room and off my feet. The room was VERY nicely appointed with a full kitchen, separate living room area, large bathroom with over-sized garden tub, and private bedroom. The decor, paint, furniture, ammenities and service were all TOP NOTCH! I stayed in the hotel for a week and it was the most comfortable stay I've had in a while. The bed and its multiple layers of bedding were always sure to put me straight to sleep! I never saw anyone else on my floor until I had been there about 3 days. The floor was VERY quiet and I never had any problems with the downtown ambient noises. I stayed on the 17th floor and I rarely heard any noises below. The only bad thing (as minute as it is) was that the Continental Breakfast was VERY BASIC. They had 2 or 3 kinds of muffins, 2 kinds of fruit pastries, milk, 3 kinds of juice, cereal, and coffee. I somehow expected more for the price of a nightly stay. BIG TIP: There is an URBAN MARKET grocery store across the street. If you have a suite like I did...you'll save money by shopping and cooking your meals. The nightly Cookies and Milk service was a nice touch to the long evenings I had through the week. I was a little bothered by the $10/night INTERNET charge, especially when I kept loosing my wireless signal. They eventually worked out the kinks and I stopped getting booted offline. $20.00/night parking was a little outrageous. If you stay here HERE IS A BIG TIP on SAVING MONEY TO PARK: 1) DURING THE DAY Park your car in the SAME GARAGE that the VALET uses 1blk away. $1.00/hr. 2) After 6pm PARK ON THE STREET at the meters (FREE) Once the Parking Garage closes at 10pm you cant get your car out by self-service, which is what makes VALET look like a better choice. DONT FALL FOR IT! PARK ON THE STREET! I was in a very nice car and it was never bothered over the 7 nights I was there. With this method, the most I paid daily for parking was $6.00. I'd give this hotel a A++ All of the 40 rooms that I booked had raving reviews about this VERY nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My Stylish Stay”
Reviews.Author: traveldani
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at this hotel because I was attending a wedding that was downtown (actually right around the corner from the hotel). I saw pictures online before booking, and I have to say that I was impressed once I checked in. The decor is very stylish and fashion forward, the staff was very nice and the extras, such as the continental breakfast bar and milk and cookies at bedtime were a nice touch. The location was also good for those who like to shop, as the hotel shuttle (which takes you in a 1-2 mile radius for free) can take you to one shopping area, while a $10 dollar taxi ride takes you to bigger mall. My room was smaller than I anticipated, yet still nice. To me...the entrance was the only downfall, as it was always congested due to the mandatory valet parking, lingering taxi cabs and hotel shuttle. Overall I enjoyed my stay and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great views!”
Reviews.Author: marcy512
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at The Magnolia. I love the location, right in the middle of downtown, and the old building, but the best part is the view! Request a corner room, you get three walls of windows looking over downtown! There are a couple drawbacks to the hotel: the carpet needs to be replaced, the elevators are very slow. But the ambiance makes up for it. The staff are generally realy nice and helpful. I went down to the bar area to buy some OJ after breakfast had ended, and Jesus went to the kitchen and brought me two glasses of fresh squeezed for free! The shuttle is also great, they took us outside of the stated 5 mile radius. It was so convenient when we went out to dinner not to have to drive! There's also celebrities staying there almost constantly. The cast of Prison Break was staying there while we were there, as were the Black Crowes. You definitely can't beat the price for such a fantastic hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nuclear33
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Magnolia July 1 thru July 4. We enjoyed the hotel. The staff was great (free upgrade to King Suite). Romm was huge, great view and very quite. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Room was nice, service left much to be desired...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Magnolia on Sunday for our 6th anniversary, which my husband had planned as a surprise get-a-way. We arrived around 1:30 pm although check-in was at 3 pm and were assigned a room immediately. The room was a Signature Suite in the middle of the hotel with no view and there are no balconies at the Magnolia. The room was tastefully decorated, quiet and clean. My husband had booked the "Magical" package that was all but magical. We received our champagne and strawberries around 6 pm and went down to the front desk on our way out to dinner at 7 pm and inquired about the remaining items of our package (robes, cd, turndown service with cookies/milk). We were told that they would arrive between 8-9 pm and that it would be left in the room if we were not there. We returned a little after 9 pm to find no such items in our room. We called the front desk and requested the remaining items along with 2 additional washcloths. 30 minutes past and we called again. After this call we received a call from a porter who verified our request and said he would be up shortly. It was around 10:15 pm when he arrived and he had forgotten the washcloths, the CD that was a part of our package was unavailable because they were "out", and we never received the turn down service. The next morning I called again and we finally got the washcloths and our breakfast came on time, but was missing an entree and we had to call back to get condiments such as syrup for the pancakes we ordered. Lastly, we had a 2 pm check-out inluded with our package and yet the maid service knocked and entered the room at 9:30 am and again at 11:30 am while we were still trying to enjoy what little peace we could before leaving. Upon check-out we received 1/2 off the room after we explained our discontent and were informed that we received the wrong room which also should have had a view. Two days later an unauthorized charge for $10.83 was placed on my card. When I called to verify what the charge was for, it was explained that we were charged for 2 bottles of water that we never drank and had left in the bathroom and bedroom where we found them. I know that my husband was disappointed because his romantics efforts were thwarted by the Magnolia's service. The staff are nice and the hotel is nice, but we will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff members, nice stay”
Reviews.Author: fritkis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Magnolia with two associates for a four day conference. The rooms were nice but the service was outstanding. Jesus at the bar in the evening gave us wonderful restaurant recommendations. The bell staff drove us to restaurants and were willing to pick us up within minutes with just a phone call. We really appreciated the cool and quiet at the end of some very busy and hot days. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: heather_100
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Dallas for a weekend conference and initially was booked at a different hotel. This original hotel was not satisfactory so I searched for another place to stay. I found the Magnolia Hotel and after reading some of the previous reviews on this site was a little worried - but I could not have been more impressed with the hotel, service, and location. I stayed in a suite - very roomy, clean, and with its own kitchen - felt like an apartment! Just steps away from a lovely urban marketplace. Also within walking distance of the downtown conference hotels. I just cannot say enough nice things about this hotel. Further, I travel quite a bit have would have to say this is one of the top places I have stayed!

Reviews.Title: “Shoots Itself in the Foot”
Reviews.Author: Porpex
Reviews.Content: The Magnolia Hotel in Dallas could be a serviceable, mid-range hotel in the downtown area; an attractive option for business travelers. But--alas--the hotel undermines itself in a variety of foolish ways. The service at the front desk can be gracious or surly, depending upon the clerk. The rooms--though handsomely furnished in a faux "W" style---need routine maintenance and care. The throw-pillows on my sofa were torn, and the sheets on the bed were frayed. There's a convenient coffee maker available, but the maid service never replenished the supplies; no coffee, creamer, or sugar after the first night of my stay. Similarly, the room service menu was never replaced after I'd used it the first night. (For the hotel, that's lost revenue! I would've gladly ordered my room service breakfast all five mornings of my stay!) Regrettably--when I did place room service orders--the wait was long; over thirty minutes for a simple pot of coffee on one occasion! And the order was never correct; missing muffins, or the wrong side dish. My "same day" laundry wasn't returned until after mid-night two days after I sent it to be cleaned. The hotel seems to be trying; but--given the plethora of hotel options in "Big D"--- it comes across like a slightly hapless, confused teenager in a room-full of sophisticated adults.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly great”
Reviews.Author: AngelPeak
Reviews.Content: Liked:huge rooms,central location,great bed,wireless internet (in room,fee) Disliked:waiting 1 hour to check in after 7 hour red eye,paying for internet,lack of good restaurants nearby. Over all we really enjoyed our stay at the magnolia.The clean rooms are the largest I have ever seen and include a full kitchen,seperate living area,huge tub shower combo,modern decor.We had a very comfortable bed and the room was very quiet.Hotel is 15 min walk to JFK museum and other sites.Fort Worth 40 min drive away.Unless you have a car,it can be a bit of a ghost town after dark although there is a large bar/restaurant next door to Magnolia that looks good.Had no problem with valet service but it was not busy when we were there.Starbucks next to foyer in same building (love those pastries!)Definitely recommend Magnolia for your next stay in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice accomodations. Older hotel that has been updated. Good views of the city. Free shuttle service around town. Close poximity to center of city. Walt Garrison bar next to hotel. Approximately 5 blocks from Convention center and 5 blocks from local restraunts.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but service ...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good. Wi-Fi. Rooms are good. Bartender and restaurant service is the worst in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Chic”
Reviews.Author: scrateef
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Magnolia Dallas for 3 nights during December 2005. The Magnolia is a cute, boutique-ish hotel located in the heart of downtown Dallas. I lived in Dallas for 7 years and know the area well. I'd never stayed at the Magnolia, so on a recent visit, I booked a room there out of curiosity more than anything else. First off, the Magnolia is cheap! My room (with a King bed, love seat, tv, desk, fridge, coffee maker, wireless internet, etc.) was $85/night. The room was tastefully decorated and had a warm, inviting feel to it. The hotel was originally an office building from the early 1900s, and I was impressed that they were able to lose the loft/warehouse feel that so many old converted buildings have. The room was reasonably sized, on the 11th floor, and relatively quiet. The bathroom was larger than average, and the closet was large enough for me to hang all my clothes. The room had signs of wear â€“ small hole at the base of one wall, broken door on the armoire, dresser drawers difficult to pull out â€“ but it was clean, the bed was comfortable, and there were extra blankets in the closet (though I didnâ€™t need them). Overall, the room was cute. You can tell that Magnolia tried to make it stylish and accommodating, but the fit and finish were a little on the cheap side (pseudo tile in the bathroom, laminate surfaces for the counter, furniture that could have come from Ikea). Still, the general effect was thoughtful and stylish enough for me to overlook the minor drawbacks. And at $85/night, I really didnâ€™t feel like complaining about anything. The room served my needs just fine. House keeping was unobtrusive and good. The hotel boasts free happy hour daily (from 5:00 to 6:00, I believe) and complimentary breakfast for all guests. I didnâ€™t bother with happy hour, and Iâ€™d skip the breakfast if youâ€™re someone who likes a good meal in the morning. The spread consisted of semi-stale blueberry scones, blueberry muffins, mini cups of yogurt, some fruit, and standard juices and coffee. One visit to the breakfast buffet was enough. The other days I went down to the adjoining Starbucks. While downtown Dallas doesnâ€™t have much life on the weekend, the Magnolia is right in the middle of what is there. The original Neiman Marcus is 2 blocks away, and several restaurants/nightclubs are located on the same block as the hotel. So you can easily walk to dinner and drinks. If you wanted to get the West End, I suppose you could walk there as well, but Iâ€™d opt for a cab to go that distance. If you drive to the hotel, the parking situation is valet only. I think the fee is $20/day with unlimited in/out privileges â€“ reasonable for a downtown hotel. The valet operates 24 hours a day, and the gentlemen who work there are friendly and helpful. The rest of the staff was friendly and efficient as well. Iâ€™d caution against having drinks in the lounge. I stopped in for a nightcap one evening, and the bartenders were generally incompetent (10- to 15-minute wait for a drink) and had more than one customer sending them dirty looks â€“ and a few choice words. When I ordered a â€œtop-shelfâ€� martini, the bartender who made it, intentionally poured my drink Â¾ full, then (while I sat right there) turned to his co-worker and notified him that he needed to try what was left in the shaker because it was â€œthe good stuff.â€� I just laughed, but some of the people sitting at that bar would have taken those as fightinâ€™ words. So if youâ€™re in the mood for a drink, Iâ€™d recommend one of the nearby bars/restaurants. On the whole, I have no complaints for the Magnolia. Itâ€™s a full-service hotel with friendly staff who seem genuinely interested in making your stay pleasant. The location is great, and as Iâ€™ve said, the price is right on the money. I will caution that the price tends to draw a clientele thatâ€™s more on the rowdy side. While my room was quiet and peaceful, the lobby area (with a bar/lounge on the second floor) was pretty noisy â€“ especially late in the evening. But there are plenty of secluded places to sit, so you take in some good people watching if the mood strikes or just go up to your room for a cozy nightâ€™s sleep. For now, the Magnolia is probably the hippest hotel in the area. But in the coming months, the W and Ritz Carlton will be opening just a mile or so away â€“ though they will certainly be at a different price point. Until then, Iâ€™d recommend the Magnolia, and Iâ€™d stay there again the next time Iâ€™m in D town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-beware of housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the Magnolia Hotel in Dallas, TX November 11, 2005. Overall, this is a decent property. However, there were some issues. Valet parking is slow and at times unresponsive. The elevators seems to take a long time. I stayed in one of the signature suites which was nicely appointed. However, the pipes in the bathroom made a lot of noise whenever the shower was turned on. Unfortunately, I left two articles of clothing in my room which I did not notice until I had checked out of the hotel. I called the hotel immediately and was transferred to the lost and found department. I left a very detailed message but my call was never returned. After three attempts, I was eventually able to contact someone in housekeeping and was advised that nothing was found in my room. I know without question that these items were left in the room. Based on the integrity displayed by the housekeeping staff, I would advise you to safe guard your property and don't make the mistake of leaving anything behind.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: TurkeyTrotFinisher
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night before Thanksgiving (Turkey Trot promotion). Hotel was about 30% full. Paid $113/nite + tax. Complimentary cookies, cartons of skim milk, incredibly good brownies from 9-11 every nite. Complimentary continental bkfast that we didn't try. Nifty restaurant/bar/lounge in contemporary open area with an atrium looking over the lobby on the next floor. Would be a very comfy spot to bring your laptop and work if you were there for several days. Overall effect reminded us of Jetsons-style decor if it were simultaneously peaceful and elegant! Rooms had fresh, contemporary decor. We had a queen suite with a full kitchen, bath with oversized oval tub. Beautiful and restful. Decorated in attractive shades of butterscotch and gray. Very comfy bed w/ feather pillows w/ embroidered cases, foam pillow in closet. Furniture looked good but could be a little more comfy in some cases (minor quibble). Friendly & competent bell and reception service. Didn't try room service, but menu looked very promising (not alarmingly ambitious, and a couple of notches above typical room service in similar-class hotels). Only downside - we were on 16th floor but still got quite a bit of truck noise early TG morning around 5-6 a.m. Would definitely recommend if you're staying in downtown Dallas. The suite would be a great choice for an extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Anniejo
Reviews.Content: Terrific stay at the Magnolia recently. Lovely old office building, very sympathetically converted to a hotel. Staff and everyone very friendly. Large rooms and very comfy beds, they even changed the bed linen daily! Despite an unusual (for October)93 degrees the room remained cool without the need for the aircon. Hotel in a good position, you could walk to JFK sites, Reunion Tower and West End etc. easily. DART public transport was a joy - clean, efficient and very inexpensive (by UK standards). Comp. breakfast was a good selection, pastries, cereals, muffins, bagels, yogurt and fresh fruit but the real treat were the wonderful milk and cookies at night! I'd highly recommend both the Magnolia and Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: lllllll
Reviews.Content: We had the opportunity to stay at the Magnolia Hotel September 30 - October 3. I have mixed feelings about our stay: The Good: â–ª Beautiful boutique Hotel with good central downtown location. â–ª Outstanding staff (sans GM) that seems to really care and are very helpful. â–ª One hour free cocktails each evening from 5-6pm. â–ªLocal, free shuttle service. The Bad: â–ª Internet access is $9.95 daily â–ª Mixers not on the "gun" are $3-4 dollars â–ª Continental breakfast is very lame â–ª General Manager is non-existent Details: We were in town for a convention and had originally planned to stay at the Hyatt. We read the Magnolia website and decided for the latter. We were led to believe (website) that internet access was provided, wrong! When I called the GM (voicemail) upon check-in to express my disappointment, I never heard back. In my opinion, internet access is as basic as shampoo and a hair dryer, particularly at this price point. HI Express and Fairfield offer this service gratis for Peteâ€™s sake, not to mention a much better continental breakfast (read below). Secondly, we went to the cocktail hour one evening. I ordered vodka and cranberry and my wife order a vodka and tomato juice. We were charged $3.50 for the tomato juice, since it was not available on the "gun". Also, if you are not available between the narrow time period of 5-6pm; forget it, a mixed bar well drink is $6 and up. The continental breakfast was the biggest disappointment; very poor food quality and selection. Choices (and I am being kind) consist of small, recently thawed scones or muffins. However, if you arrive very early, you may be rewarded with a small container of yogurt. Oh, coffee and hot water are also provided. No fruit, juice, cereal, etc. Again, totally unacceptable for a hotel at this price point. Bottom Line: I would not stay at the Magnolia Hotel again. There are simply too many choices, to tolerate these basic lack of amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Suites are HUGE!”
Reviews.Author: tarheelgirl03
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at the Magnolia hotel for one night and we were incredibly impressed. If we weren't flying out the next day, we probably would have tried to extend our stay! ROOM: We booked a Signature Suite since we were traveling with our 7 and 10 year olds and wanted extra room to spread out. Boy, did we ever have that! The room was absolutely huge! In some previous reviews, the suites have been compared to a small apartment and that couldn't be any more true. As a matter of fact, I think I've lived in smaller apartments! The suite had three closets (not sure what we'd use all of them for but they were there if needed) and a nice view of downtown. The only thing in the room that I was a bit perplexed by was the fact there wasn't a door on the bedroom. Granted, the bedroom was located on the other side of the kitchen and, therefore, you couldn't see the bedroom from the living room, but, it still seemed weird. Plus, if the kids had to get up to use the bathroom in the middle of the night they could clearly see us in bed. BATHROOM: The bathroom was large and the products (shampoo, conditioner, bath gel & lotion) smelled yummy. There were two sinks and a very long counter area. The shower was also really neat since it was in a large oval tub. There was definitely space to move around and the terry cloth shower curtain was a nice touch. KITCHEN: The kitchen in the room is just as it looks on the website and it was totally stocked with pretty much anything you'd need if you were staying for a few days. The cupboards were even stocked with dishes, glassware, wine glasses, pots & pans and even measuring cups! There was a large refrigerator, stove, oven, microwave, and dishwasher! Since we only stayed one night, we didn't use the kitchen but it seems as if they thought of everything you'd need, and then some! FOOD: We ordered room service for dinner and it was very good. The service and presentation of the food was great. Since they offer complimentary cookies & milk from 9-11, we just had to partake (the kids couldn't wait!) While this was a nice touch, the cookies weren't quite as fresh as I thought they would be. The sugar cookies were ok but the peanut butter and chocolate chip cookies were pretty hard. Regardless, it was a nice touch and the kids loved it. We had the complimentary breakfast the next morning as we left for the airport and it was pretty good. They had a selection of scones and yogurt and provided just the right amount of food to get us out the door. Not sure if I'd like the selection if we had stayed more than one day but it worked out well for what we needed. It was also really nice to have a Starbucks right there for a big shot of caffeine to get our day started. SERVICE: All of the employees we encountered were very nice. The gentlemen at the front desk were pleasant and were proactive in offering information before we had to ask. All in all, we had a great night and the room was a bargain for how large it was. I can see my husband and I going back sometime without the kids to enjoy the downtown ambience and great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: vegastraveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several hotels in Dallas, but looked into the Magnolia after reading about it on Tripadvisor. It was perfect! I really loved everything about this hotel. I rarely stay in 3 star hotels, usually 4 or 5 star, so I was hesitant especially with the outrageously low rates, but I feel the Magnolia should be rated a true 4 star hotel. I had a queen room that was very nice... very large, the furnishings looked brand new, leather chair, lots of lamps, full length mirror, three windows, large bathroom with nice tub. The entire hotel, including the rooms is decorated a very chic, modern decor, and I actually got some ideas for my own home. A friend traveling with me had the deluxe room which is actually the size of an apartment with separate bedroom and living room and a full kitchen, and it was decorated just as nicely. We enjoyed our room service breakfast, but there is a complimentary continental breakfast set up everyday on the second floor which looked nice with a selection of pastries and muffins with juice and coffee. The hotel also offers room service for dinner. Everyone on staff was extremely gracious and helpful. We encountered no service problems whatsoever. They were very nice when we we forgot our shopping bags and cell phone on two separate occasions after our car had been valeted. The valet charge is high, but I expect that for any hotel and valet parking. The location is great too. There are several restaurants/bars within walking distance, and its a really short drive to uptown entertainment. I will definitely choose Magnolia for future stays in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel; Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotels in Dallas from The Mansion on down. We stayed at The Magnolia last night for the first time at the recommendation of family who stayed recently. The hotel is beautifully decorated, comfortable and convenient to Downtown and Uptown destinations. The rooms are not old, renovated hotel rooms. They are completely modern with wonderful linens, toiletries and furnishings. Beds aren't king, so be aware that you'll have a queen. Our only comment for improvement would be on staff. The valet guys were great, but other employees seemed less than warm. Some would pass us and not speak at all. The continental breakfast was nice, milk and cookies at bedtime on Club level a great touch and cocktail reception a little too brief (5-6 pm) but fine. Still the lovely hotel is a great value and we will return. There are many nice restaurants nearby and Neimans is a short walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Terrible valet service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, a great weekend and stay, until I valeted my car. Rude service from doorman and shuttle driver, then the worst happened. Young valet driver by the name of Mike did considerable damage to the clutch in my vehicle, and was apparent to all in the lobby who could smell the car when it pulled up. Now the hotel and valet company claim absolutely NO responsibility for the three thousand dollars of damage done to my car (Audi parts are NOT cheap).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Discerning Texas Traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel in downtown Dallas. The front desk staff gave us a great room and seemed genuinely interested in whether we had a good stay. The bellman was friendly and courteous, and the bartender was very helpful in suggesting some other places to go. The rooms were immaculate, spacious, and had a great view. We have stayed at the Mansion on Turtle Creek, the Adophus, the Crescent Court, and Anatole and this is by far the best value and the nicest staff. I would be careful walking after dark down towards the West End near the bus station. Lots of panhandlers there.

Reviews.Title: “Yes this is the only place to stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: John from sunny Cornwall
Reviews.Content: I have to ask. Is there anyother hotel worth staying at in Downtown Dallas? I think not, we spent six weeks reading hotel reviews at kept coming back to The Magnolia. Great rooms, staff and rates. Save your self six weeks searching and book it now.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: khyren
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 weekends ago. The decor was very trendy. The lady at the front desk was very friendly. Our 1-queen bedroom was reasonably priced ($100) and fairly large. The bathroom was huge as was the shower and tub. We had no problems getting a movie. Everything worked as intended. It's within easy walking distance to a lot of great restaurants and bars, if you don't mind the beggars (its downtown after all). I was very impressed with the free happy hour (bartender was awesome and a decent selection of booze for free), the free milk and cookies (GIGANTIC and delicious!), and the free continental breakfast. Really the only downside to the stay was the bed wasn't very comfortable. :)

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for our Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary at the Magnolia. Our night in all did not go the way we expected. Checking into the hotel, the lady at the front desk was rude and unwelcoming. We were untold of hidden charges when reserving a room and when I was confused she was even more rude. I was unhappy with the service at the Magnolia. Finally we get settled into our room and head out for dinner in the town. But we get stuck in the elevator. Not a pleasant feeling at all! After dinner we ordered and paid for a movie on the television and it started in the middle of the movie. It was a horrible night for our first year anniversary. However, rooms were beautiful and orderly. I probaby would never stay at the Magnolia again. Highlight of the night was certainly NOT in the Magnolia, but the Iron Cactus Restaurant behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: PartCel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for several nights around my stepdaughter's wedding on New Years Eve. The rooms were unbelievably spacious (the two bedroom suite was truly apartment size and comfort) and the service was friendly, courteous & attentive. The free cocktail hour is really a nice 'extra' if you are booking for a group, it allows you and your guests to snack, drink and visit, with no inconvenience. We booked several rooms and everything was as booked, Dawn was wonderful to work with and very accomodating. The hotel provided transportation to the wedding site and even arranged return transportation for all of the remaining decorations at the of the wedding and transferred them to the planners auto. They sent several vans, all of this I might add was the eve before the Texas A&M Cotton Bowl game, so things were crazy and extremely business in downtown and at the hotel. The hotel management and staff conducted themselves in a very professional manner during this 'stressful' time. This has to be one of the best values in Dallas and we are looking forward to staying at the Magnolia on our return visits to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Travelled on business, lovely room, very comfortable, excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Awwwesome! Relaxing, quiet, incredible!”
Reviews.Author: fitnessfreaks
Reviews.Content: We adored The Magnolia. We asked for a room w/a view & were placed in a corner room on the 24th floor, from which we could see Neiman Marcus below, the Cotton Bowl & the State Fairgrounds in the distance, and everything in between. Although not all standard rooms are decorated this way, our room had oak paneled walls, hardwood floors, & five windows w/ sills deep enough to curl up in. The public areas were amazing. The 2nd floor is dedicated to numerous small intimate seating areas for guests to sit & talk, read a book in front of the fireplace, have a drink w/friends, watch a ballgame, or even play billiards. No matter how many people were there, we always felt we had a "private" spot. The evening reception has "standard fare," - true -- but the cheese, veggies, crackers, chips, & salsa, along w/the free drinks -- were served w/a smile, and there was always someone quietly cleaning up any mess from the people before you. We were walking distance to the Convention Center, the West End, and the Kennedy Memorial. The public library is just a couple of blocks, & the newly opened & fantastic "Iron Cactus" is LITERALLY out the back door. We thoroughly enjoyed the hot tub on the 3rd floor. It is in a corner room off the gym w/ barred but open (meaning no glass) windows, so the crisp outside air is a factor, but... the tub was warm so the January chill air felt nice. It was a unique experience. We didn't get to use the fitness room, but were impressed w/its equipment & size (how many hotel gyms actually have racks of dumbbells?). There is almost nothing negative I can say about The Magnolia. We will definitely return.

HotelInfo.Name: The Magnolia Hotel Dallas
HotelInfo.Address: 1401 Commerce St., Dallas, TX 75201
